description:
After a long day at Alcatraz, I was glad I passed this place.  
I got the Red, White and Blue plate special which is a Mousetrap grilled cheese and a bowl of tomato soup. They also had shoestring fries and since I was in vacation I got those too! 
The grilled cheese was perfect! Lots of cheese and grilled to perfection. 
The soup was good but a little spicy. I have the wimpiest palate so most people probably don't notice. The soup tasted good but I don't like my mouth burning so I stopped eating it. 
The shoestring fries were wonderful! Crunchy and perfect. The weird ketchup leaves a lot to be desired. It just didn't taste like ketchup. 
The music in the restaurant was wonderful. Jason Mraz played and you can't go wrong with him! 
They also had plugs to charge your phone at the table which was a lifesaver since I had been walking around all morning!
author: Jenny P.

description:
Not a fan

Got the following:

Avocado toast with egg: 1 Star. It needed salt, flavor, and salt

Reuben: 3 stars. As average as average gets

One plus - outdoor seating so you can come with a dog. And beer on tap

Won't be back
author: Hazel J.

description:
Stumbled upon this place as I was walking through the city. It really is a cute spot, but the grilled cheese was just average. 

I got the biscuit and egg with avocado (which is a $2.50 upcharge!!!). When the cashier asked how I wanted my egg, I requested scrambled soft (I hate over fried eggs and that's what I received). He surely did not tell me that they are only able to fry eggs since they only have a flat top. Totally ok, I just would have ordered differently. 

Anyway, one of the guys noticed I was not into the fried egg situation and offered to make me something else. I opted for the bacon and egg grilled cheese. It wasn't bad by any means but it also wasn't something I had to go back for. It was just a standard breakfast sandwich. There also wasn't really that much cheese in it either. 

They definitely get 4/5 stars for customer service. He was nice and fixed my order.
author: Kyrsten S.

description:
2nd time visiting American Grilled Cheese. This spot is tasty and won't hurt your wallet.

Love that they have tables outside so we sat and enjoyed the lovely SF weather.

I ordered the salad and cubano sandwich. The salad dressing with the Cobb was good, and it was a good sized side salad. The cubano was cheesey, salty, toasty, and everything in between.

Food came out fairly fast, next time I will be trying the Korean samdwich. Yum!
author: Jerrica N.

description:
Trying to kill time before the Giants game, we went walking and yelping looking for a bite to eat. Then we came upon the American Grilled Cheese Company! How can one not stop by?!

The food was pretty good. We got the Mac n Cheese and Cubano sandwiches. Both had good flavor. I recommend you add bacon to ANY sandwich you order. 
The beer selection, although limited quantity, had good choices. 

I'd definitely come back again and try different things on the menu.
author: Donathon C.

description: Felt like treating myself after a full week, so I tried this place out for the first time for lunch today.  I got the Mac & Cheese grilled cheese + chicken and tomatoes, because who wouldn't want literal mac & cheese in a sandwich?  I can happily report that it did live up to the hype.  Will definitely come by here again to try out the other options.  Price is a little high but it is quite good.
author: Curren I.

description: This place is okay if you need a sandwich and are nearby. It's not terribly unique, affordable, or quick. However, the sandwich is really good and I enjoyed sitting outside at the patio tables. If the prices were a little better, I might even become a regular. $18 got me one cubano sandwich, a bag of BBQ chips, and I tipped 20%.   Overall, I wish the menu was a little bigger to provide more options. Also, I was the only person to order for a while and it took about 15 minutes. This place is a solid 3 Stars- which on Yelp means A-Okay!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Yes!! How often do you come across a business dedicated to grilled cheese sandwiches? Never!! Well, here you have it. American Grilled Cheese Kitchen has done everything you wished you had done to your grilled cheese sandwiches. 

I was early for work one day and decided to kill time by checking out the businesses in the area. I've passed by here a couple times but never had a chance to order.  Right before it was time to start my shift that day, I stumbled across this joint again and couldn't turn it down. I was immediately greeted by a gentleman as I entered. There was a party waiting in line ahead of me, so I had a few more minutes to read the menu and make my decision. I got the Moscone sandwich which was tomato, pesto and mozzarella with lavender basil, an olive tapenade, fontina and garlic butter on sour dough bread. 

Overall, the sandwich was very tasty and the cheese flavor wasn't too overwhelming. The bread was perfectly toasted just the way I like it. The sandwich was a bit pricey, but I don't think it can get any better than this.
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
I came here for a lunch Mealpal.

I've seen salads on their MealPal several times so I thought I'd give it a try. I'm not sure why a place that has grilled cheese in the title would only have salads on their MealPal, but after I ate it I'm guessing its because they are trying to get rid of them.

Stella's Cobb salad is super disappointing.   I don't know who's Stella's is, but her Cobb Salad sucks. Stella must not like to eat. There was a few tiny pieces of chicken a small egg and some scraps of bacon. When I'm thinking a Cobb salad I'm thinking a big meaty salad.

 I was still super hungry and ended up eating somewhere else after I ate the salad. Note to customers if you're eating here skip the salad and go straight to the grill cheese. 

Note management you should really offer the grilled cheese on MealPal so people can try out what your famous for. Oh and your salad is weaksauce.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
Grilled cheese sandwich? GOOOODDDDD

Mac N' Cheese? GOOODDDDD

Mix the two together into a cheesy perfection? AMAZINGGGGG!!!

Came here today for lunch based upon the recommendation of Yelp and was sure glad Yelp once again came through in the clutch. Cashiers were friendly, line went pretty fast, and food was served quickly after ordering. 

Only "complaint" is that $11 for a grilled cheese sandwich is pretty pricey. However it's to be expected for SOMA prices. 

Would I come here again? Heck yes!
author: Alex C.

description:
I'm typically skeptical of a place that focuses on something as simple as Grilled Cheese, but this place came through. I'll caveat that statement by saying I ordered the rueben grilled cheese, which was much more of a rueben than a grilled cheese. It was great though. Delicious rye, melted swiss and the right mix of pastrami and sauerkraut. Served hot with a house made pickle on the side. I'd highly recommend eating there and not letting your food cool by taking it somewhere else. 

The service is certainly not what I would call "fast" but not slow either. Expect to wait 5-10 minutes after you order at the counter. There was plenty of bench seating outside, so we had no trouble getting a table. 

Although this is a long 20 minute walk from my office, it is certainly worth the occasional trip. There were several other things that looked good on the menu that I can't wait to try.
author: John W.

description:
I love mac and cheese. I love grilled cheese. Put the two together and you get bliss. 

It's a pretty basic thing and they do it well. The two little strawberries add a nice drop of color. The sandwich is kind of small for what you pay, but it was still a gooey-cheese delicious sandwich.
author: Allyson L.

description:
This place is delicious. Nothing really else to say! Oh - I came here back to back with only a couple days left in SF so that says how awesome this spot is with so many options available :)

Kimcheesh and the classic egg and cheese!!!
author: Shiraz D.

description: This is my go-to place for grilled cheese cravings. I have had grilled cheese at some other places which are overly cheesy and rich where finishing a single serving is a challenge. The 2 of my favorites are mousetrap and mac-n-cheese grilled cheese. The mac and cheese grilled cheese has a nice contrast with the creamy filling and crispy exterior. Initially, they used to serve a fruit like an orange/apple with the grilled cheese which they don't anymore. They have a great patio seating suitable for sunny days.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
I have been coming here for years now. Ever since I moved to the area. I own both of Heidi's cookbooks and loved it. In fact every Sunday, my partner and I would get breakfast sandwiches.
While I am a chef and realize you need to keep up with demand and change menus. Once they decided to franchise out, they nuked the menu.
They took off everything that was good and left very boring sandwiches that literally anyone can make at home. 
I am so disappointed, you destroyed what was good about your restaurant. Now you're just a generic shop.
author: Krysten W.

description:
Went here on a Friday evening and we got a mac n cheese, a few melts, and a few of their triple brew beers. First off we ordered the pesto mac n cheese and got a mac and cheese with bacon that was cold... but wow once we brought to attention the mix up the cashier a kind gentleman in the front in his 30s blew us away wth his customer service. He came out and apologized decided to give us a refund on one sandwich and the mac n cheese (keep in mind the sandwich was great!) in addition he offered to make us anything else on the menu on the house and came out with a complimentary soup!
This type of customer service now a days is unparalleled and I applaud the staff and workers at "The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen."
author: John A.

description:
Okay, I didn't think much of American Grilled Cheese Kitchen honestly after I had one of their sandwiches for lunch.  But, their breakfast is what's making me write this review update!

Every pork eater loves bacon, but their veggie & egg grilled cheese breakfast sandwich is what's up!  Every time we've had them cater our breakfast that's what I go for.  I've had to have the egg over hard or scrambled due to pregnancy, but I'll miss out on the yolky egg goodness because it's still flavorful with the butter, caramelized onions, arugula, their seasonings and the cheddar and Monterey jack cheeses.  Don't get me wrong, Farmer's Breakfast sammie which has bacon, roasted potatoes, cheddar and chive butter in it is good too, but it's all about the veggie one!  Trust me, it'll make the biggest meat eater take a break from it for brekkie.
author: Cat C.

description:
It wasn't worth the price of $10.50 for the macaroni and cheese. It took about 15 minutes too when people that ordered after me already got their orders. 

It's good to try if you never had.
author: James H.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in the area looking for a little something to eat. Hopped on my yelp app to see what would entice me, and AGCK got my attention.

I was afraid there was going to be a long line because it was a Sunday afternoon right before a Giants game, but luckily we were the only ones in line. The cashier was ready to take our order, but we wanted to take a look over the menu since it was our first time. He came back to check on us twice, and then we finally made our decision.

We sat right along the "bar top." We were able to see all the workers and the kitchen. It was a very different experience. The lady who was working by us was very friendly. She started talking to us as soon as we sat down.

We ordered:

The jalapeno popper- It had the best description to me. I love cheese, bacon, and a kick. It turned out okay. I wanted to really love it, but there was just something about it that didn't grab me. 

The Cubano- Not bad, it was quite meaty with a good flavor. But again, we were not thrilled by it. 

Tomato Soup- It wasn't as thick and creamy as I usually like my tomato soup. It was also a little more tart then I'm use to. Not bad with the creme though.

I don't know of any other grilled cheese spots in the bay area, so I do not really have anything to compare it to around here. All in all our experience was okay.
author: Lily T.

description:
For our office lunch last Friday, May 19th, I decided to try American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. It arrived via Caviar around 12:30pm.

Mushroom Gruyère: Fontina, gruyere, roasted wild mushrooms, roasted potatoes, melted leeks and onions puree, and thyme butter on levain ($11)
*Add Grilled Chicken (+$2.94)
*Add Fresh Arugula (+$0.70)
*Add Organic Mixed Green Salad (+$3.50)
*Notes: Mixed Green Salad with Champagne Vinaigrette and No Croutons

The grilled cheese was good. I liked the mushrooms and my addition of chicken and arugula. I could have used without the potatoes though. I do think my sandwich suffered from the transit time as it was a little soggy. I still enjoyed the buttery bread, but for a grilled cheese, I wanted more cheese. It wasn't the ooey gooey grilled cheese I was imagining. The mixed green salad added a nice fresh contrast to my meal.

For a place called American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, I wanted more cheese. But overall, still a good sandwich.
author: Elena N.

description:
Located at 2nd street, I walked in here on a Tuesday morning in the mood for a quick bite. They had just what I needed, a grilled cheese sandwich and lemonade 
He sandwich was yum, but I was a bit disappointed with the lemonade which said 'pomegranate lemonade' but tasted very plain.

They had a lovely seating arrangement outside, which I really enjoy... sitting along the street while you enjoy a delicious sandwich.

Overall, it was a good experience, the lemonade could've been better
author: Saarthak C.

description:
Had to swing by the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen and see what all the hype is about!!  I must confess I was pretty skeptical going in - I am not exactly a grilled cheese enthusiast, and see it more as a lazy lunch I make for myself when I haven't gone grocery shopping in too long. While I can't fully understand the hype, I can see why this is a super popular lunch spot. 

FOOD: Really good! I have no idea what they put in this sandwich, but this does NOT taste like your run of the mill grilled cheese. The cheese is super smooth/buttery yet also not overpowering or cheesy. I ordered the mousetrap (their kind of "standard" grilled cheese for $7.50) and added avocado to it (+$2) as I'm one of those people who firmly believes avocado makes everything better. So good. I also got the seasonal lemonade (this month is Mango), and honestly probably could have skipped it.. kind of standard drank.  

AMBIANCE: Standard lunch spot! Nothing too fancy. The line was kind of long but moved quickly, and we sat on the benches outside since it was a nice day. However, next time I come I will probably take the sandwiches to go. 

OVERALL: A great grilled cheese sandwich and lunch spot if you work in SoMa!
author: Natalie F.

description:
This place is DELICIOUS! Being new to the area, I've been trying to try new places and I'm glad I made a stop here. I tried the Mac n cheese grilled cheese and it was amazing! Who doesn't love both things together?! 

The workers are very nice! The place itself is small but there's also seating outside, also very clean. Definitely recommend to everyone :)
author: Emelyn A.

description:
Oh Cheesus. I had the Mac and cheese grilled cheese and was in heaven. This sandwich paired well with their tomatoe soup which was so creamy and yummy. 

Loved the ambiance of this place. The only parking available is street parking ( I parked a few blocks away). It was worth the walk and I enjoyed every bite.
author: Ahlam T.

description:
Came here extremely hungover and brought back to life by the breakfast popper. The chèvre combo with the jalapeños and bacon was a really nice combo. Bread was nice and crisp. Eggs were scrambled but done to fill out the whole sando. It's a pet peeve when they don't have eggs on the whole sandwich so that was nice to have done right.

Overall liked the place and would return.
author: Jared M.

description:
I'm obsessed with this place. I've been frequenting San Fran for years and visit at least once a year, if not more. No trip is complete without a Jalapeño Popper Grilled Cheese from here! I also add chicken and bacon to it. So, so yummy! The apricot relish is the perfect complement to the jalapeños. I've been wanting to try other items on the menu as well but can never resist the temptation for the jalapeño popper one. 

Stop by here if you're in the area! You won't be disappointed
author: Sargam B.

description:
I've have never been so excited to try a grilled cheese sandwich before, or more specifically, the Mac n' Cheese Grilled Cheese Sandwich. Ive seen these sandwiches on Instagram I've wanted to try one ever since. I saw that this place had them so when I had the chance, me and my family went.

We went for a late lunch, around 2 pm on a Monday. There were only a few people, so we were able to order right away without waiting in a line. The employee was really nice and there were few seating indoors and lots of seating outside, the weather wasn't too cold so we sat outdoors. 

I got the half-sandwich and tomato soup special. I got half Mac n' Cheese which was as additional dollar, so it was $11.50. Others ordered the Mousetrap and Mushroom Gruyere.

The food came out pretty quickly and I was just dying to see what my sandwich would taste like. I never ever had actual GOOD mac n cheese before, so I was pretty hyped to see if this place would wow me. And...it did! I was drooling the whole time when I was trying to take pictures. 

The mac n' cheese was just perfect for a grilled cheese sandwich, the best macaroni and cheese I've ever had so far. Dip the sandwich in the tomato soup and omg it is just a perfect match in heaven. The portions of the half-sandwich and soup might be small for guys or others, but it was just he perfect amount for me. It left a small place in my stomach to go for ice cream right after :)

I would definitely come back again if I had time to visit SF again.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Delicious grilled cheese sandwiches! The place has a nice relaxing atmosphere with both indoor and outdoor seating and the service is nice.

I got the mac n cheese grilled sandwich ($11). The toasted bread was buttery and crispy. The mac n cheese was soft and gooey. I wish it had slightly stronger flavor but it was still amazing! My fiancé got the Reuben sandwich. It had thin slices of savory pastrami with an addicting dressing on the side. I actually liked his better! We also got the tomato soup which was good but nothing special.

Overall I would definitely be back to try their other menu items.
author: Linda X.

description: Good sandwiches, with cheese galore. I like that you can add meat or avocado to the cheesy goodness. And of course get a salad to make you feel a little bit better :)
author: Mike S.

description:
We were celebrating a fellow team members birthday and we knew she loved a really good grilled cheese sandwich, so I made the jaunt from our office to pick-up our breakfast sandwich order.  To my surprise, they didn't have our order, since they had accidentally written it down for the next day.  The staff went into hyperdrive and asked if we could give them 10 - 15 minutes and they'd get everything done as quickly as possible.  I liked that they didn't make any excuses and crushed it.  Our order was cooked very expeditiously and they gave us a box of pastries to apologize for their mistake.

We ordered a couple of breakfast grilled cheese sandwiches and each one was so good.  The Farmer's Breakfast Sandwich has cheddar cheese, applewood smoked bacon, roasted potatoes and chive butter that make your taste buds dance inside your mouth.  The Classic Egg and Cheese has both Tillamook cheddar and Monterey Jack, along with an egg.  We added Ham and Bacon on a couple sammies and they were awesome.  I ordered an Avocado Cheese Toast too, which was also a hit.  

The blueberry muffins and chocolate chip cookies they gave us were also very good.  They were a nice way to top off our meal.  This is definitely outside my typical walking radius for lunch, but the breakfast sandwiches were really good, so I might have to rethink my stance.
author: Lon H.

description: This grilled cheese is AMAZING!!!!!!!!! The service is very good, and I would come here  everyday if I could.  We had a Mousetrap with bacon, a mac and cheese grilled, and the mushroom gruyere grilled. The white bean soup was also great!  It's very small so if you don't want to sit outside, don't go during the main rushes. Overall I HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Melissa D.

description:
First time here...I'm debating on coming back...need to try one more sandwich before fully making up my mind so here are initial thoughts!

+ $16 for Mushroom sammie (plus jalapeños) and the tomato soup
+ Sammie is totally normal size, not overstuffed
+ Tomato soup is tasty
+ Cute decor inside and super homey feel

The sandwich was good but not for $11...mostly because of the size and amount of filling. Maybe what I ordered was boring, I want to go back and try the Jalapeño Popper one and update my review from there!
author: Heather H.

description:
A solid place to get a decent bite, whether for breakfast or lunch, or whether you live/work in the neighborhood or are visiting for a Giants game. 

There used to be a Melt outlet nearby, which I think enhanced AGCK's relative appeal considerably. While The Melt had a limited menu, much of it not terribly convincing taste-wise, AGCK has a large, good-quality variety of sandwich options, with ingredients as diverse as pulled pork, gruyere cheese, and pastrami. There's also a small breakfast menu, a selection of soups and salads, and some pretty good beer too.  

With The Melt now long gone, it's great to see AGCK still very much alive and kicking.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place after the Giants game yesterday. It looked really satisfying and quick to eat. 

I had the Mac N Cheese Grilled cheese, my dad got the Cubano and we did halfs on it. The Cubano was the best thing out of the two. It had great flavor and it didn't lack anything. On the other hand the Mac N Cheese was basic at most, it would of been better if there was bacon in it. 

Anytime I'm back in SF I will try to have more things on their menu as all of it seems pretty damn good.
author: Spencer G.

description:
I don't even know how to describe the joy that came to my life today when I tried a grilled cheese sandwich from this restaurant. I found this restaurant a few weeks ago while looking for some food places to try while traveling on a business trip. I read great reviews, and let me tell you, this place did not disappoint. 

I went around 12:30 on a Monday and expected it to be crowded, especially with all the great reviews, but surprisingly it was not crowded at all which was very nice. The gentleman at the counter took my order and gave me a number to place at my seat. I ordered their signature Mousetrap grilled cheese and Smoky Tomato Soup on the side. The sandwiches are made to order, so you do have to wait a bit, but I love my food fresh so this didn't bother me. 

When my food came out, it looked great! The grilled cheese was perfectly toasted and had a buttery outside with a deliciously gooey inside. The tomato soup was warm and nicely decorated with cream on top. 

The taste is out of this world. I enjoyed every single bite. The sandwich was buttery and crisp on the outside and the cheese blend complimented the sandwich so well. The tomato soup was also delicious. Usually tomato soup is too acidic for me, but this one was spot on. 

I wish I lived in the area because I would eat here every single day! Staff was also very kind and accommodating.
author: Victoria T.

description:
My wife and I both love going here. Ideal SOMA location by South Park. They have good outdoor seating and serve mimosas and beer. I would definitely recommend the Mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich. Sooo good. 

They are generally always busy, but great efficient service so you never feel like it your endlessly waiting. Would highly recommend.
author: Neil B.

description:
Grilled cheese and perfectly toasted bread that adds the crunch! Love! 

The Mushroom Gruyere was meltingly awesome!  I like the hot sauce that they had on the side.  It complimented well with the whole sha-bang.  

Comfort food at its finest. 

They have beer, side seating indoors and a pleasant outdoor patio lounge.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I walk by this place almost every day and finally was able to try it. Tbh, didnt really meet our expectations.

Got the jalapeno poppers grilled cheese and the sandwich had a good kick to it, but seemed to lack a bit in flavor. And cheese.

Then got the Mac and cheese... And that's a 3star max. Lacked flavor, barely tasted the bacon and worst part, it wasn't hot AT ALL. Pretty much room temperature. We thought about asking them to reheat it for us but you never want to send food back..... One good addition was the bread crumbs though. 

I'm mixed. I'd like to give this place another try and just stick with another grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Cal C.

description: Pretty expensive for a grilled cheese, but it's San Fran, what do you expect? Overall, not a bad grilled cheese, pretty good actually. However, in my mind I'm thinking that I could just make this at home myself, and that's what makes me give this above average grilled cheese 3 stars. Ordered the Jalapeno Popper. Big mistake. Did not like the cream cheese and the weird spicy taste. The other options weren't as bad though, and some people seem to like it. Only went here because it was close by.
author: Edward C.

description:
Just like the name implies, this place has a delicious assortment of grilled cheezeses for you to try.

I recommend: 
Cubano- pork
Mac N Cheese- Yup
Mushroom- !!!

Order ahead to avoid long waits. 
Also, you can order the mac n cheese on its own to eat less carbs... if you care about that stuff.
author: Mitzi G.

description: I stopped here at the Eat Real Fest 2017. This was my last stop and I don't regret it. They had such yummy Brussel sprouts and I have the grilled cheese with tomato and jalapeño. I had no idea a grilled cheese could be THIS good. Life changing in my grilled cheese world.
author: Kayla B.

description: One of our fav stops on our way to watch a Giants game.   Love the breakfast sandwiches but also love the Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese with an IPA!!!!    And who doesn't love the fresh strawberries?
author: Shannon D.

description: $5 mimosas whaaaaaat? A fun place for Friday evening pre-gaming, fast service, and great outdoor seating.
author: Sarah L.

description: I have been to a lot of places with grilled cheese. This is the only one with multiple types. I got the mac n' cheese grilled cheese. It is like a regular grilled cheese, but it has Mac n' cheese in it with the cheese. I also got the tomato soup and it came with croutons. It was very good and it very tasty when I dipped the sandwich in the soup. I also got the seasonal lemonade which, when I went, was mango. It was very good, not too sweet and not to sour. Overall, amazing food, soup, and drinks.! In my opinion, there aren't any bad things about this place. I would recommend going here.
author: Jared A.

description:
Grilled cheese sandwiches with tomato soup are just about as classic American as it gets. And when you place a killer grilled cheese shop in the middle of hip SoMa in San Francisco, you're certain to have an inventive, delicious refresh on this classic combo. My lunch here totally blew my mind.

Came here for lunch when I was staying with my sis in the city, and saw a huge line. It moved quickly, thank goodness, cuz I was starving. 

The restaurant is cute, young, modern. There's paraphernalia on the left wall as you enter, and the menus posted above the register. They've got breakfast, grilled cheese sandwiches, salads, beers/wine/mimosas and other drinks. 

I had the daily special sandwich, which was a Hawaiian with many cheeses, grilled sweet onions, and a grilled pineapple. I was going to add the smokehouse bacon and in the end didn't even need it. The sandwich alone was so rich and amazing. I got the 1/2 sandwich 1/2 salad for $12.50. I chose the little bamboo salad, which was so nice and fresh against the gooey, cheesy sandwich. It had edamame, cabbage, red peppers, and was so delicious. I of course also got the smokey tomato soup, which was just smokey enough and the perfect compliment to the gooey sandwich. 

Finally I topped it all off with a $5 mimosa, customized with my choice of pomegranate juice. Perfect, San Francisco lunch! Will definitely be back.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Came here yesterday before I left San Fran and was really happy with this being my last stop here!

I found it on yelp and had to go get me the mac and cheese grilled cheese! I added bacon which makes things way better! IT was amazing it combined two of my fav foods and was not disappointed.

The mac and cheese was great combined in a happy little to go container I was on my way to the airport and had a great time devouring the sandwich.

This is definitely worth your time to swing on by, I took it to go so I didn't get to sit and partake in any of the service but the food was on point!

When I come back I would definitely swing by again!
author: Michael Q.

description:
I ordered the jalapeño popper grilled cheese. They gave me an apple as well. Ok, that's cool, balance the butter, cheese, and bread with an apple a day. 

My taste buds didn't break. At most, they just woke up, then fell back asleep again. Good, just not epIc.
author: Gabriela W.

description: If you like grilled cheese this place is perfect for you! Such a great find! Get garlic butter Mac and cheese grilled cheese with bacon and a jalapeños. Very tasty. The down side is the parking is hard to find and limited. Also, with the bacon added it runs from an $11 grilled cheese to a $16 grilled cheese after tax. Still tasty though. Also, get a blue bottle coffee next door. Great pair.
author: Justin M.

description:
The good news is the food is great and the line is becoming more manageable.  
Don't order the ice coffee.  They list it on their menu, but what I got was ice cubes that melted instantly in their hot coffee.  It was served in a hot drink coffee cup with a coffee sleeve.  No need for a coffee sleeve on a room temperature drink.  Doesn't go with their green theme.  
The Butterscotch Brownies are amazing.
author: Mary T.

description: First time here. Very cool place with great food. Grilled Cheese selection was great.
author: Daniel M.

description: The grilled cheese with MAC is so amazing. And the lemonade taste squeeze Lee fresh. Everyone was super friendly and free refills.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Great food and super friendly staff! The avocado cheese toast is especially delicious
author: Pranav J.

description: It's okay. Not sure what I expected for an $8 sandwich, but then again it is S.F. However, I do expect my tomato soup to be hot and it was luke warm. Also, most people eat their tomato soup with their grilled cheese and the luke warm soup would have been quite cold if I waited on the grill cheese. Some of the other items on the menu looked quite good, however they are called The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen
author: Terry W.

description:
Grilled cheese and tomato soup hits the spot.

Came here a few months ago with my coworkers for lunch, we all got a combo - half a sandwich and soup. It's about $9-11 for the combo. The tomato soup is sooo good, you can taste the acidity, so if that's not your thing, don't get it. The half sandwich is a good portion since it can leave you feeling heavy afterwards.

Definitely coming back.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Came by this place because it was on the top of a lot of 'BEST gluten free' lists for the area. I got the turkey and assorted cheeses (I forget). It was delicious! The best part of the meal was definitely the french fries, however. Shoestring fries that were just so good. The only downside to this place was their 'low sugar/low sodium ketchup.' I'm not sure what brand it was but it was basically inedible, which was rough since the fries we so good and demanded Heinz ketchup! 

Otherwise, this place was amazing!
author: Josh L.

description:
I came here twice and didn't have time to review in between visits, but I love the Grilled Cheese Kitchen. I had the chance to try two of their sandwiches. I had the Mac n' Cheese Grilled Cheese Sandwich which as a connoisseur for mac n cheese was delightful and very filling before a baseball game at At&t park. 

The second time, I had the mushroom gruyere which was my personal favorite of the two. The cheese and mushroom combination was unparalleled. I would also like to compliment the Palo Alto Fire Fighter hot sauce they had to spice up sandwiches. I took a few packets home because it was that good. 

Overall, I don't know how many more times I can come here before I exhaust the menu, but I highly recommend coming here before catching a baseball game since the line is a lot shorter and the food less over priced than what you find inside At&t park. The proximity to the beer area at 21st Amendment across the street make it a great pitstop before the game. Overall, great sandwiches, probably some of the best grilled cheese I will ever have!
author: Vaibhav S.

description: Great food and service. The owner came out and talked to us to make sure our food was perfect and we were taken care of.  Love coming to AGCK
author: Ron S.

description: I had the Mousetrap like people on yelp recommended and it was deliciously good. I should have tried the tomato soup though. If you like spicy they have habanero sauce packets inside that taste really good.
author: Alex M.

description: The bread is really tasty.Options are amazing.Vegetarian options are really awesome.Its a small cute restaurant,hard to find such great sandwich places in sf.The mushroom sandwich is really tasty and so is the soup.Prices are great too.
author: Prerna M.

description:
This is a really cute place to grab lunch in the city, and the food is good, if a little pricey for a melt. I really enjoyed my sandwich, although I was surprised to find that every meal came with a full-sized orange. There wasn't much on the menu to please my rather picky boyfriend, but he enjoyed a plain grilled cheese. My only complaint is that we both could have done with slightly bigger portions, especially given the price. I assume that's why they provide the oranges, but after eating a sandwich that featured olives and balsamic, I didn't really want citrus. 

The decor is cute, with trendy touches and Giants memorabilia. They also sell some local brands, like T-We-Tea, which adds to the appeal. The patio is nice on warm days, and sometimes people bring their dogs.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Since I came to the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen twice, I give two thumbs up for its sandwich creation.  I know I have to come here and buy a grilled cheese sandwich to support the Pulse of the ARC, but I do so only if I have enough money.

The first time I've been coming to buy a better "Mousetrap", I've been going for a take out.  It wouldn't be fresh the next day, so I had to finish it.

Now comes a second visit which is never failed to cheese!  After I ordered the veggie-licious version of the original "Mousetrap", I decided to sit here and eat.  A first bite from the modified Mousetrap: it's fresher, just as tastier, salty enough to be delicious, and absolutely crunchy from both the toasty bread.  Oh, and the sliced avocadoes and potatoes are chunky.  After the last few bites from the strawberries, I managed to wolf the sandwich down in a total of a dozen minutes!  Nothing to be cheesy about, right!?  It's cheddar to strike while the iron is hot!
author: Jimmy C.

description: My best friend and I stopped by here on a Sunday night right before a Lady Gaga concert. The surrounding areas were extremely crowded and we randomly strolled in here, because who can deny a grilled cheese sandwich! We were lucky that we found 2 seats at the bar because it was pretty crowded. It did take awhile to order and receive our food, but you could tell the staff was working hard to try to accommodate so many people. Once our food came, I noticed that everyone gets a strawberry with their meal and I thought that was such a cute concept. Looking at other posts in the past it seems to be their thing with having the meal come with some type of fruit, which I really love. My sandwich was crispy as expected and I thought overall pretty alright. They had forgotten the extra bacon my friend purchased, but definitely made up for it when she mentioned it. I really wanted to love the grilled cheese, but I didn't feel like I was wowed by it. We also had some beers and the ambiance of mostly concert goers was really nice.
author: Christine N.

description: Didn't even get to try a grilled cheese because they refused to substitute the bread .. I am allergic to wheat and they couldn't even accommodate me .. really embarrassing for being a restaurant in San Francisco
author: Freddy A.

description:
American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is one of the amazing creations that blossomed out of the last financial crisis, and a great piece of SoMa. It's a simple sandwich cafe with a couple of tables outdoors and some eclectic decorations inside. I enjoyed watching the cooks prepare the food over the grill of their open kitchen. The grilled cheese here are made of ingredients from notable vendors, including Tillamook, Point Reyes, and Golden Gate Meats. 

$12.50 Cubano - Monterey jack, Jarlsberg, cocoa rubbed pulled pork, ham, mustard, bread n butter pickles, pickled red onions, chipotle butter on levain:
This might be one of the better Cubanos I have had. Maybe it's the rub they use, or the amount of cheese they put in the sandwich, but the pilled pork actually tastes juicy, and not dried out. The pickles and onions add some tartness to balance out the flavors. The buttery toasted levain is very good too. The sandwich came with an orange, but it was so dry that I couldn't eat it. Still, it was a great sandwich.

$12 Club Turkey w/ bacon - cheddar, creamy havarti, smoked turkey, tomatoes, mustard, arugula on artisan sourdough:
Clubs are another one of my favorite sandwiches and this one was pretty good. The melted cheese, smoked turkey and bacon on sourdough were great, but not quite as great as the Cubano, in my opinion.

$11 Jalapeno Popper w/ bacon - local chevre, Monterey jack, apricot-jalapeño relish on levain:
This is one fiery sandwich, and pretty sweet too. The creamy chevre has a sharp flavor. The gooey chevre and Monterey Jack didn't do much to quell the jalapeno spread on the levain. 

It's a bit of walk, but the Cubano is worth the trip. At least, it is to me. The service is very friendly too. It looks like the food is made to order, so it can take a while to receive your order. I'm not a fan of paying so much for a sandwich, but these days, sandwich businesses sure are doing well. It's getting harder to find a decent sandwich for under $8. 
Now I've always liked grilled cheese, but I didn't think I would be this fond of cheese & bread. Good stuff.
author: Joy W.

description: Super disappointing. Nothing like traveling across the city for a grilled cheese to discover there's almost no flavor. Skip this one.
author: Kayti B.

description: I freakin love this place, I usually like to drop by for lunch and order the Mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwich with jalapeños, it's so goooooodddd!!!
author: Zahra S.

description:
Mac and cheese squished between cheesy grilled cheese bread?! UM YAS.

Super close to AT&T Park, this spot is perfect for a quick meal and beer before games or even a convenient lunch spot for workers in the area. Came here during lunchtime on a Tuesday and was blessed with sunny weather and a packed patio for customers, first-come-first-serve. It was great for people-watching and to enjoy a beer and sandwich under Karl-free sun.

I had to get the mac and cheese grilled cheese. It was delicious, not too oily or cheesy, but my whole meal did cost a little more than my usual lunches out. I also had their red ale which was delicious. They had a kolsch and lighter beers (and wines) on tap, but I was feeling a little darker palette. Service is quick, as you order at the cashier and a food runner delivers your meal to you after finding your table number. Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches, Coke, and beers! We were sufficiently full and satisfied with scarfing down our meals. I would totally come back to this famous red-chair-scene because it is within walking distance to the park and around the corner from a mini Off the Grid! 

Beautiful spot, low-key, and no-frills vibes.
author: Jodi H.

description: Little bit expensive for grilled cheeses but definitely delicious. Service is a little slow because of how busy they get but it you're not in a rush or have time to call ahead definitely stop in. My breakfast egg was overcooked (supposed to be over easy) but it still tasted good.
author: Cin J.

description:
On a rainy cold morning in SF, this kind of comfort food is perhaps the best kind of food you'd want. What's better (or more nostalgic) than grilled cheese and tomato soup? 

I mean, that's at least what I was thinking in my head, but we actually came on a sunny warm afternoon, haha.

I opted for half sandwich, half salad (instead of soup...ugh, tough decision). Mushroom Gruyere grilled cheese (Fontina, gruyere, roasted mushrooms & potatoes, leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain) with the Bamboo Sesame Kale salad. While the grilled cheese indeed hit the mark, it was surprisingly the salad that was a bigger winner than the grilled cheese! Clean, delicious, and filling - Highly recommended! I might just come back for just that! I also really like how they give you a piece of fruit on the side - so cute, feels like a school lunch, I took my orange to-go.

Overall though, 3 stars. -1 star for the good, but average grilled cheese, which I'd expected to be BOMB... as it's the namesake of the restaurant after all... though I might still return to try another kind sometime.  Also -1 star for the service. It was our first time here, and the cashier girl was getting impatient with our questions. And there wasn't even a line behind us. One of the other girls behind the counter inside was also yelling at the top of her lungs the names of the people who were waiting for their orders sitting OUTSIDE. Incredibly annoying. Would it not be possible to walk a couple of steps outside to call their name? None of us patrons inside wanted our grilled cheeses with a side of, "Travis!... Travisss!!... TRAVVISSSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!"
author: Ashley S.

description:
Best damned grill cheese sandwich I've ever had. Crazy delicious.

Also the most expensive one I've ever had, but it was worth it.

Highly recommended for lunch!!!
author: Terry D.

description:
I thought no one could make Grilled Cheese like my mama .
   Can you say
" GRILLED CHEESE SANMICH 2.O!!!"
author: Nicolli B.

description:
The hype - its justified.

On my 1st foray i tried the jalapeno popper and soup.

It was very jalapeno-ey and very tasty, the soup was probably the best tomato soup i've ever had.

The staff had a mix up or maybe the order was taken wrong and i never got my salad, but its ok bc i got whole sandwich instead of half.

If you dont mind the line- i highly recommend this spot.
author: Oleg H.

description:
I came here expecting to be blown away by cheesy goodness but unfortunately the only thing that blew me away was the San Francisco wind.
I wanted to get the cheapest thing ($8 Mousetrap, basic grilled cheese sandwich), but I knew I could make the same thing at home for way less so I told my cheap ass to shell over a few more bucks for the Mac 'n' Cheese grilled cheese.
Worth $11? No. Mediocre taste, mediocre service, lackluster cheese, 20-min. wait despite that only one other customer was there. So what was I paying for? The free orange you got for less than a buck? The hipster decór? No thanks. For $11 I'd rather get 40 McDonald's chicken nuggets or 4 In N Out cheeseburgers.
author: Mimi T.

description: Absolutely delicious sandwiches but a surprisingly small venue.  There are very few places to sit inside, the patio actually has over double the space for patrons.  I wouldn't recommend coming here during a busy period such as the lunch hour as you may not find a place to sit.  However, at any other time, it's a cozy little place that truly does make delicious, unique sandwiches.  I would certainly recommend the mushroom and gruyere - it's a sandwich I dream about.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Talk about the BEST grilled cheese I have ever had :) We went in on a Sunday morning around 11:00 and they were not too busy. However there is not very much seating inside so we did have to sit outside in the cold :( But I promise you it was totally worth it! 

They have so many assortments of sandwiches from breakfast to lunch ones. They do not have french fries though!!!! I usually love having some french fries with my grilled cheese, but it was okay. As sides they offer a variety of chips and classic tomato soup! They even have alcoholic drinks such as beer and mimosas which I thought was pretty cool. We opted to get the mushroom grilled cheese and the jalapeño popper and we added avocado to both! Honestly the sandwiches were divine! They were tossed perfectly to get that crunch and the cheese just melted in my mouth! I wish I had tried the tomato soup, but now it's just an excuse to go back and get some amazing grilled cheese too! 

Can't wait to be back here next time I am in the SF area :) I definitely recommend this place, especially on a cold and gloomy day, it will be the best comfort food imaginable!!!!!
author: Anisha K.

description:
I've been dying to try the mac n cheese grilled cheese for quite a while now, and it definitely did not disappoint! The venue here is quite small with a few bar seats inside (good for if you're just eating alone) and there is a nice patio outside for larger groups of people. You order at the counter and then get a number so they can deliver the food to you.

Of course, I ordered the mac n cheese grilled cheese for $10. I was super excited when they gave me my food and was surprised to find it with an apple, which I thought was interesting since I've never been to a place that just served a whole apple with the meal. The sandwich was just oozing with cheese and I was glad that the grilled cheese wasn't as salty as most grilled cheeses are. It's impressive that they were able to put so much cheese into the sandwich while still maintaining a good balance between the bread and the cheese. I wish the mac n cheese inside were a little bit warmer but overall I was super satisfied with my meal! I am really glad I finally got to try this place!
author: Catherine S.

description:
I came here for lunch with a couple of friends. Even during the lunch rush (we got there around 12:15pm), the line wasn't bad and we got our food relatively quickly. We decided to eat there instead of take out. From my observations, people who are doing take out got their food even faster. 

I got the Reuben Adams grilled cheese sandwich. Next time, I'm definitely getting the tomato soup on the side. Seeing my friends dipping their sandwiches into this soup totally made me drool. I'm not a huge sandwich fan in general, so it is really hard to impress me with a sandwich, which is why I'm only putting 3 stars here. My friends will probably rate this with 4 or 5 stars without hesitation. I do love their rye bread and the quality of their meats.
author: Angel C.

description: My sister was in town from Oregon last Sunday, so we explored the city and ran in to this adorable place. We walked in with 4 adults, 3 tweens, and 2 littles. There were 5 people inside sitting down. The lady was so rude, made us feel like it was a huge burden for us to be there. Rolled her eyes and said "it's going to be at least 10 minutes before I can even take your order." I don't normally bother with bad reviews, but this lady just kept being rude. I was afraid to ask for another glass because I already felt like I shouldn't be there. The food was good, we had 2 Mac and cheese grilled cheeses and 1 jalapeño popper grilled cheese with a bowl of tomato soup and 2 garlic fries. I'm not sure what my sister and her family ordered, but they seemed to like it as well. I recommend leaving the relish off the popper grilled cheese. The fries are nice and crisp. The cook was very nice when he came out to drop off our food. For the service alone, I don't feel like it's worth a return.
author: cassandra s.

description: Small, quaint place. Been to both locations, prefer the one by the park over the other one. Grilled cheese is awesome and rich, the only downside, a little pricey. Their lemonade is great as well.
author: Priyam A.

description:
My bf and I came here for a quick meal. We split the mac n cheese grilled cheese ($10) and the club turkey with bacon ($11.5). The orders came out pretty quickly and I was pleased to see the sandwiches came with apples! 

I ate half of the mac n cheese sandwich first and I loved it! The bf said it could've been cheesier and I agree. I really liked the grilled sourdough because it added a good crunch to the sandwich. I liked the mac n cheese better than the club turkey. The club turkey seemed like a normal sandwich, just grilled... They could've made it cheesier or stuffed it with more items for the $11 price tag.

I'm glad I finally got to try this place! If i'm in the area again I would return just for the mac and cheese sammy!
author: Tara A.

description:
I had been wanting to try this place for the longest time and today was finally the day that I did.  Like a lot of people, I grew up eating grilled cheese sandwiches (among other things) and I like it when a restaurant/eatery can take a simple, classic meal and get creative with it.

Facts:

* You can order specialty sandwiches or build your own (depending upon their available ingredients).
* There is sparse indoor seating and extensive outdoor seating.
* You go inside, place your order with the cashier, give them your name, pay and then they'll call you when your order is ready.
* In addition to your order, they give you several napkins and a complimentary apple (if you wish).
* They serve breakfast and lunch.
* Aside from sandwiches, you can get soups, salads and baked goods.

Pros:

+ I ordered the club turkey.  That thing was f***ing delicious.  It was warm, filled with plenty of turkey and cheese and, ultimately, was very filling.
+ The prices that you see on the menu are the exact prices you pay.  As emphasized on their website, all taxes and miscellaneous fees are factored in and accounted for so that there are no unpleasant surprises.  I like honesty and transparency.
+ Both the cashier and the lady who handed me my order were friendly.
+ As also emphasized on what they have posted on their wall, they take good care of their employees.  San Francisco, as any sane person knows, is an expensive place to live.  The owners of this establishment are mindful of this and provide their employees with full benefits and a livable wage.  Hats off to them for that.

Cons:

- With the lunch crowd present, it took about 20 minutes for my sandwich to be prepared.  Wait times, even for a simple sandwich, will likely be long.
- For the price, I was expecting my sandwich to be a little larger than what I got.  It's not too big of deal though because it was still very filling.

Overall, I was impressed and I can definitely see myself returning.

4 stars
author: Michael F.

description: Nice little place (a bit limited on seating).  They have mastered the grilled cheese concept, very crisp with all the right textures.  Had the Ruben and the Cubano which were both delicious....skip the pickle.
author: Adam J.

description:
I actually really like the food, but oh my god, could the woman with the nose ring taking orders be any more rude. I walk in at 3:30 and the place is empty being quite after the lunch rush. I say Hi, how are you? .... nothing, not even asking what I'd like just waiting for me to order. No greeting, just a bitchy look. I place my order and grab a coke bottle; one of those vintage ones with a bottle cap. It was one of four drink items available. I ask if they have wifi... "No"... Okay, no problem... I hand her my card, sign and say thank you. Nothing, just the same nasty look. I hold up the bottle and ask if this is a twist off. "No" .... I ask if she can please open it. She does and I say thank you so much. Nothing. I grab my ticket and walk away. 

It was a really strange encounter and I felt very unwelcomed there. I ate my meal thinking about how awkward that was and talking myself into the possibility that she's just having a bad day, but the conclusion I arrived at is, suck it up and force a smile. Say hello. Say thank you and/or you're welcome. Do not pass your negative energy off to the people walking into your establishment... especially the ones who are trying to be friendly to you.
author: Michael D.

description: A solid 3.8 star grilled cheese not bad but not the best I've ever had. Ordered the Mac and cheese grilled cheese and added pulled pork. The Mac and cheese was a bit bland and the added pulled pork was not worth it. It was a small helping and wasn't evenly distributed throughout the sandwich. The bread was very good and toasted perfectly. If I try again I'd order something else.
author: Doug P.

description: I was really excited to come here as I saw great reviews, but upon arriving I was already slightly disappointed. I expected the place to be really crowded cause I thought it was extremely popular. But, I was wrong. I got the cubano, the wait was not too bad, but when the food came I was not impressed. The grilled cheese was extremely expensive and what I got was pathetic. There wasn't even enough cheese, it didn't pass the pull test at all. The only good part was the meat. I will say, however, that this grilled cheese wasn't super heavy so at least there's that. Overall, not worth it. Super expensive and not even satisfying.
author: Emily X.

description:
Katie S. introduced me to AGCK a few years ago and I can't thank her enough! I wish I could visit this place more often - what about expanding to the Pacific Northwest?

Anyway, you just can't go wrong with the Mousetrap. It is what an adult version of a childhood classic should be without going too crazy! Others that I've tried include the Mushroom Gruyere and Club Turkey. If you don't order the awesome smokey tomato soup, then you are wrong and should unfriend me immediately! I want to try the Mac N Cheese Grilled Cheese on my next visit! Their regular mac and cheese is awesome, but in a sandwich? Yeah, definitely got to check that out! Oh, you should definitely try the jalapeno poppers, too! 

As one would expect with popular Bay Area eateries, there is always a line to queue in. If you happen to be patient and wait for seating, you can't beat eating outside on a sunny day!

___
|    |        And there are twenty more waiting in line inside?
|    |                            / 
|    |  O    O   O   O    O        
|    | / | \  / | \ / | \ / | \ / | \ 
|__|  / \    /  \  / \   / \   / \
_____________________
GOOD THINGS COME TO 
    THOSE WHO WAIT
author: Ron M.

description:
The place is cute. The workers are super friendly. And even though I came after a Giants game, meaning lots of people and a long line, the service was still good and the food still came out pretty fast.

I got the mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwich which is presented very nicely on a little tray with strawberries (mostly for decoration). So delicious and would want again, but in my opinion, overpriced. I don't think it's worth $10 and maybe if it wasn't that expensive, I'd come back.

Overall, still a place I would recommend (just not if you're on a budget).
author: Christy L.

description: Love the grilled cheese options they have at this location but they do not have Brussels sprouts and fries made at this location. Which was quite disappointing however, I had the mac and cheese grilled cheese and my friend had the mouse trap. The cheeses that are made with these grilled cheeses are amazing and if you love grilled cheese this is the place. I gave three stars because i felt like my sandwich was cold but the bread was amazing!
author: Theresa H.

description: I love the mousetrap, tomatoe soup, mimosas and the choclate chip cookies! I make a day out in the city just so I can make a reason to go get my grilled cheese! It is always just the way I like it- cheesy and melty! The wait time is pretty short, I mean I am usually there when they open during the weekends. And they pair the grilled cheese with fruit/veggie that is in season. So it makes it "healthy". But definetly check it out if you have not! I have my siblings and SO hooked on coming here.
author: Christina G.

description:
I am no stranger to grilled cheese, having eaten the familiar sandwich since I was a child. This establishment, however, blew me away as I took my girlfriend here. We both ordered the Mac n Cheese grilled cheese and the Mousetrap respectively and these sandwiches taste pretty great. Great comfort food! 

The cranberry lemonade was blissful and even though I couldn't order the tomato soup since they didn't have it, the Deep River potato chips went just as well with the entire lunch. 

The seating wasn't that bad, so I can't say much there. 

All in all, great place to have lunch every once in a while. I recommend this place for a potential first date. Great spot for families that are craving the all time American meal.
author: Donovan C.

description: Good easy food, and incredibly sumptuous (I got the Cubans). Must recommend if you're in the area.
author: Taha H.

description: Overpriced, too novelty, and not worth it. The boyfriend and I got the farmer's breakfast breakfast sandwich and a turkey club grilled cheese + a side of the avocado toast. The avocado toast was nothing special at all, and the sandwiches were only marginally better. All our dishes came with fresh strawberries, which would have been a nice touch if they didn't have dirt all over them.
author: Patricia Y.

description: Great food and customer service. By far what I enjoy about San Francisco is finding hidden gems like this place.
author: Hasan K.

description:
I was never a huge fan of getting grilled cheese, but this place proved me wrong. I came here with a friend for a late lunch. 

I ordered the Breakfast Piglet and also a tomato soup. I loved it, it had a lot of flavor. My grilled cheese consist of cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter. When I took a bite, it was so cheesy, that's when you know its a good sandwich. The soup was good also, it can be a great compliment which the sandwich as well as a dip.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Food stand at outsidelands. 

Maple bacon brussel sprouts - 5/5 - Best brussel sprouts I've had in the city. Very crispy and delicious. 

Overall, brussel sprouts are "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Very great location close to ballpark, bridge entrance and area filled with lots of folks walking around. The atmosphere inside the shop was great and the service was ok.

Girlfriend order the Mushroom Gruyere and I probably should have too. It was grilled almost to perfection and the mushrooms were tasty. Her bread was buttered just right and tasted like it was fresh. I ordered the Bacon Egg and Cheese breakfast sandwich but wasn't too happy with it. The eggs were lifeless, flavorless and the bread seemed over toasted. I'd probably order the Reuben next time given all the reviews on Yelp. 

Bright side is they give you a nice sized fresh orange with your order :)
author: John M.

description: Gluten free options which is nice. The gf bread was a bit dense but had good flavor.  The overall flavor of the GF sandwich was okay, nothing spectacular. The atmosphere was fun and the fruit salad was nice touch. The ability to add bacon or jalapeños  was also a great mix up that was offered. Staff was polite and helpful. Service as fast as well.
author: Alyssa S.

description: I love everything about this place. Delicious eats that are quick, easy, and reasonably priced.  Nice people, awesome service.  Keep up the good work, American Grilled Cheese Kitchen!
author: John T.

description: Cool trendy place with great food. Nice atmosphere with outdoor seating.  Look up and order from menu restaurant. The Rueben is good.
author: James S.

description: Mushroom gruyère was what I ordered. I liked the mushrooms and cheese. I couldn't really taste the other ingredients and the bread was a bit hard. I was also given a few strawberries. It's a easy meal to take to go.
author: Helen H.

description:
I was absolutely STARVING when I finally made the trek over here with my boyfriend.  We ordered and shared the mushroom gruyere, the mac n cheese grilled cheese, and the tomato soup.  Between the two of us we could hardly finish all of it!

We both absolutely loved the mac n cheese grilled cheese.  Had so much flavor, and I really enjoyed the noodles.  Cheese was wonderfully melted, and bread was buttered and grilled to perfection.

The mushroom gruyere was good, but did not compare to the mac n cheese sandwich.  It somehow seemed to have less flavor, even though it had more ingredients.  Either way, it was still a great sandwich.

The soup was also wonderful - but I probably wouldn't order again.  I thought the sandwiches were good enough without the soup and I was too full to finish the bowl.

We both loved this place and would definitely come back.  We chose to sat inside on a Sunday just because it was so windy outside, but the little patio outside is very cute!
author: Kenna H.

description: Had lunch here with my husband on June 17th. We ordered our food using the menu that was next to the refrigerated sodas. I got the mushroom gruyere with a lavender lemon soda. He; the jalapeno popper with a coke. His eyes lit up when he saw that he could've gotten a beer instead of a coke. We were given a number and was told someone would serve us. It was a little crowded inside so we ate outside. The food was served in wire baskets lined with brown paper. Each sandwich was served with two strawberries. The bread was toasted and the cheese was not greesy. Parking was easy. The male cashier was friendly. Will be back.
author: Ana V.

description:
Part of me wants to give this place 5 stars for just existing.  And entire restaurant dedicated to inventive grilled cheese sandwiches is pretty epic.  But the creations themselves just tasted fairly ordinary. 

I had the Reuben and it was fine but more greasy than flavorful, it kind of sunk from its own weight.  The Jalapeño Popper was slightly better, with the apricot flavor making it more unique but overall; still just so-so.

Service was fine, you grab a number and they bring you out the food and you bus your dishes so not much room for themselves to distinguish themselves. 

Won't return but maybe worth trying, though I think what you make at home would probably be better.
author: Saminda W.

description:
I gave this two stars because it does not live up to the standards of San Fransisco cuisine. This restaurant may be acceptable in the American Mid West, or in the Central Valley, but SF is one of the Mecca's of cuisine. 

A grilled Sammy here will cost you about 8-12$. For that price. You get a single sandwich and two strawberries. The sandwiches are about the size of a piece of Wonder bread. 

The quality of the sandwich is mediocre. My mother, even my grandmother, have made me superior grilled cheese sandwiches, without using the finest ingredients. 

The worst of all is the organic hot sauce. It tastes like Taco Bell hot sauce. Unacceptable. The organic ketchup, however, is delicious. 

Lastly, the sandwich scratched up my gums because it was too hard and not fresh and hot like one expects from a decent eating establishment. 

In summation: do not go to this restaurant. Make your own grilled cheese.
author: Wes R.

description: Ordered a Jalapeño Popper with a egg to go. After waiting for about 15 min I was asked if I was waiting for something, I said yes my order. The girl asked for my name, and then asked if I wanted a cookie for the wait. I politely said no thank you. After another 10 min of waiting for my one sandwich, I decided to cancel my order. No explanation was giving as to why I was taking so long. And no it was not busy at all. Sucks, cause after reading the yelp reviews i really wanted to try it, but not if it means waiting almost 30 minuets for one simple order.
author: Genaro R.

description:
Not impressed. Glad my sandwich was free. 

Maybe it was because I didn't eat it IMMEDIATELY. I had to wait about 5-7 minutes to dig in. All in all, nothing special or something I could've done at home. 

I'd be happy to try again - if someone else is paying.
author: Kim C.

description: Love this place! My boyfriend took me here before the A's vs. Giant's game and it was amazing! The line was pretty short and I got the mac n' cheese inside the grilled cheese. It was so yummy, gooey on the inside and crunchy on the outside! All the sandwiches come with an orange, which I love! I'm definitely coming back to this place.
author: Katie P.

description:
This place - which used to be my fave - has gone SO downhill words can't even capture it. So I took pictures. I got my standard - the crunchy, melty, buttery, gooey Mushroom Gruyere - and nearly cried when I got back to the office. 

Unforgivable Sin #1: My grilled cheese wasn't grilled. Just folded over and pressed. N-O: NO.
Unforgivable Sin #2: No fontina. No gruyere. No cheese. In my grilled cheese. 
Unforgivable Sin #3: No artisanal sourdough. Just some whole wheat sandwich bread. 
Unforgivable Sin #4: No potatoes. No leeks. No onions. Just mushrooms.

So I paid $11 + $2 tip for dry Wonder Bread and 'shrooms that weren't even hallucinogens? Made the mistake of bringing my entire class here. N-O-N-A: No. Never. Again.
author: Faith A.

description: This is a great spot for lunch. They serve a nice soup and grilled cheese combo that always hits the spot. Probably not the best in between meetings or if you're wearing white ;)
author: Cris H.

description: This place is highly overrated. The grilled cheese is good but definitely not the best I've had. It's also pricey and the lunch crowd is ridiculous. We definitely waited at least one hour for our orders, even though the line seemed pretty short? Not sure why they're so slow - it's grilled cheese; I can get an order from a NYC grilled cheese food truck in 10 minutes tops...
author: Judy S.

description:
A little restaurant perfectly situated on your way (by foot) to a baseball game, if you're so inclined. A cute outdoor seating area for when Karl the Fog is absent. I got the reuben sandwich, which was practically perfection, with its thick Russian dressing on the side without me even asking. The tomato soup is strong and flavorful; goes perfectly with the cheesy croutons. 

The fiance's regular grilled cheese with bacon added did not include so much bacon. Plus, they should offer bloody marys if they're gonna offer mimosas (for the salty folk). I settled instead on their homemade grapefruit pink peppercorn soda, which was very bland and watered down. Like lots of water with some grapefruit squeezed in.
author: Christina S.

description:
Had lunch here with M and boy is my waistline in more trouble than it already is! 

The jalapeño popper is really good if you are a fan of chèvre. I love it so this was just the perfect rendition of a jalapeño popper sandwich. Some bites are spicer than others. My only comment on improvement is that I wish the bacon was more crispy. 

M got the Cubano without pickles, but they still added the pickles. I was instantly jelly when I took a bite of his. The pork was tender and packed with flavor. I couldn't taste the chipotle butter. I'd get this next time over the jalapeño popper. 

The strawberry soda was just meh. I have a sweet tooth so if you like things less sweet, this soda is for you.

Will definitely be back!
author: Lena H.

description:
One of my new favorite lunch spots! 
This place keeps it simple, and it works for them. They offer salads, soups, and of course, grilled cheese! 

My favorite is the Mushroom Gruyere. I highly recommend, it's rich and full of flavor. Last time I tried the Club Turkey, which I found to be more filling, and that was what I needed since I did not do the combo. (You can add a salad, soup, or do half a sandwich with soup/salad) 

The line can be intimidating at times, especially at 12 pm on a Friday, but they are efficient and fast. The beer selection is pretty yummy too! I like wash everything down with a Ballast Point- Kolsch.
author: Taylor M.

description:
I absolutely love The American Grilled Cheese on 2nd st. Within a 5 minute walk from AT&T park, we always stop here for lunch/dinner before a game.

They use really good cheeses and have my favorite Mac & Cheese in the city. They are also really well run.


 I accidentally left my keys in the city and then made my 2 hour trip home. After realizing I had forgotten them, I called the restaurant and they immediately offered to mail them to me the next day. 


I will absolutely return every time I come to the city.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Ate: Mouse-trap grilled cheese (many times...)

Super yummy if not a little expensive grilled cheese sandwich. Bonus - they will include sliced, raw jalapenos at no additional charge. Additional bonus - everyone gets a piece of fruit with their grilled cheese. 

Nice industrial feel to the place, good service, good range of drinks including 7-8 different types of tea plus a fridge full of different types of soda, plus some booze.
author: David J.

description: So good!!! Mushroom Gruyere grilled cheese is amazing. Mac n cheese grilled cheese is also great, if you feel like overloading on carbs.
author: Samantha C.

description:
So, we were looking for something within walking distance of the Ferry Building to have a good hearty breakfast on a Monday. We came across the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen and it was nothing but great reviews, so we decided to visit :) After a very pleasant walk along the Embarcadero - we arrived and it is such a cute restaurant with a great open air outside seating - across from the 21st Amendment Brewery. 

They have such a great menu - lost of selections of unique grilled cheese sandwiches, plus salads, soups and some amazing and refreshing drinks! The breakfast menu - is basically grilled cheeses with eggs in them - YUM.

I ordered the Jalapeno Popper grilled cheese, with an egg for breakfast, and added on their soup of the day - I think it was Chicken Pot PIe, and a YUMMY Mango Lemonade. Nothing disappointed, but I will say, my grilled cheese was SPICY - a bit more than expected so my taste buds were dancing at 8 in the morning lol. The only grip is the prices, but I should expect that in SF - the prices on the menu are what you pay - everything is already included, but for 1 breakfast sandwich, soup and a drink  - I was out the door just under $20 - which was a bit much considering it's kind of an upscale fast food establishment. 

The service was great though and truly an amazing memorable breakfast! We will be back :)
author: Vivian P.

description:
Struggled with rating this establishment as well but I had to rank it a little bit behind local competitors HRD and Garaje which I gave four stars. As other reviewers have mentioned:
1) expect a wait 
2) the sandwiches are not that big given the price point
Would be also nice if they had some other sides options and/or a smaller portion of the mac n cheese which I believe is $8 a pop. 

Given all that constructive criticism the sandwiches are pretty good but given the taste and the price point  and local competition , I feel comfortable giving it 3 stars.
author: Rod M.

description:
The ultimate place to go if you're looking for comfort food. Great sandwiches, great soup, and great salads. You can go traditional with their Mousetrap (basic grilled cheese) or get fancy with one of their other sandwiches. I tend to like spicy, so Jalapeño Popper is my go to, but you can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Breakfast is also a winner here.

For those who are gluten free, they do have a gluten free bread option.
author: Diana R.

description:
Finally got the chance to try this place out. Lots to choose from, I went with the jalapeño popper. Very tasty, though a bit greasy. 

Outside seating was really nice and there was free ice cream being sampled. Overall a good experience.
author: Shaun J.

description: Very good breakfast sandwiches! Maybe a little smaller portion- should get a side if you go.
author: Olivia R.

description:
This place is great for a late afternoon snack. We got the Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese and tomato soup to share. SO SATISFYING.

Simple, delicious ingredients done well. I like that they have counter seating with plenty of windows and plants around; really brightened up the place.

Will definitely be coming back anytime we're hungry and in the area.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Really good place! Definitely recommend if you are in the SF area. I ordered the Mac and Cheese grilled cheese which had a very good flavor. Would have given 5 stars but my soup was cold :( It was the soup of the day, split pea, but very good flavor.
author: Sonnette A.

description:
UPDATE:
Following our reply to the email the manager sent us, stating we were not happy with the explanation she gave us since it's very obvious that the staffs were obviously lying about the situation, the CEO Nate reached out to us personally, and I have to say the way he handled the whole situation was above and beyond. He not only called and left a voice mail, but also sent me a very sincere email to explain and apologized for his employees' mistakes. We truly appreciate his effort, and are willing to give this place another shot. Despite all that happened, we're glad Nate stepped in and took care of this, and now we feel a lot more comfortable going back, because this place sandwich is absolutely above 5 stars!

originally what happened..:
I would totally give this restaurant a 5 star in a heartbeat before today, but what happened today totally changed my mind. 
My boyfriend and I walked in the restaurant and got in line just like everyone else, but I couldn't help but noticed that several employees started staring at us and whispering. I know it right then right there, they're talking about my boyfriend wearing the Make America Great Again hat. ( with the Trump label on the back) let me tell you, the way they starred at us is like they're looking at some type of rare animal in the zoo. Like, I get it, we're in San Francisco. One the the most liberal cities in the United States, but I think even that, we still have the right to express our political points of views and also at least wear what we want to wear right? I mean as long as we aren't trying to start anything with anyone, we were just standing in line peacefully, trying to get a nice grilled cheese sandwich for lunch. Anyway, at this point we already felt very uncomfortable, not to mention the order process was even more awkward. So, after we ordered it, my boyfriend felt the need that he should just leave and have me wait for the order before things get worse. Nevertheless, him leaving did not make things better but even worse..the second he stepped his foot out of the restaurant, the girl working in the front that's been giving us dirty looks started telling everyone, even the guys working in the kitchen"ITS THAT GUY, the one with the Trump hat!" like hello? I'm still here? It's one of those situations that everyone's talking crap about you in front of you like your not even there. And of course at the end, we finally got our lunch..BUT we didn't get the apples that's suppose to included in our meals. 
Like, really? I mean I don't usually eat the apples included, but using this as a way to tell us your not happy with who we support, isn't it kind of immature and unprofessional? I do get everyone has their right to express their opinions, but I don't think work is the right place for you to do so, especially, the people who your dealing with are your customers. We have always loved this place, but being treated like this just because we have different opinions makes me sick. I heard the girl said that Trump is the most disgusting, racist, sexist man, but discriminating your customer due to people having different views than yours makes you any different then who you think Trump is? 
I honestly don't care who you support, Trump, Hillary, Obama...I believe everyone has their own reasons and I respect that. But no one should be treated the way this restaurant treated us today, and feel less of themselves just because ones beliefs don't align with another's. 

UPDATE: 
After contacting the company about our experience, here what we got. Apparently My boyfriend and I had a "disagreement" and he left angrily?  Just funny how even the management team would even buy that kind of story! If that was what really happened, maybe they can explain to me why the guy in the back of the kitchen along with the guy at the register and girl in the front would started pointing and kept looking out the window when my boyfriend left, then I would buy their story. Obviously they tried to ignore to fact that the whole thing started when we were in line, when we first walked on to the store! Not even going to mention about the apple part, when they were putting our boxes in the bag, the guy was just refilling apples with the big box in front of the girl. So that just make perfect sense they all the sudden forgot right? But it's okay I get that some customers just not suppose to get their part of the meal when the store is busy. What a disappointment. But whatever, we got no control over whatever they want to say or blame the whole situation on our part. I hate to say this but we certainly won't go back again.
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Eh. This place was just okay.

I read about gluten free grilled cheese, and those two things combined were irresistible for this grilled-cheese-loving celiac. In fact, I don't know of another place where I can get a gluten free grilled cheese, outside of my own kitchen. But in reality? It was sort of a letdown. The gluten free bread was too fluffy. The cheese inside just wasn't enough. It was okay, but not the mind-blowing take on the classic sandwich that I'd hoped. 

If you're nearby, it's a decent lunch. But I wouldn't drive 20 minutes out of the way on my two-day visit to the city again just to stop here for lunch.
author: Kate L.

description:
For lunch... I was not impressed: the food taste is ok, and the food portions are so small! Had to have another lunch once I got home.
