Anyway, the rest is fine including service (self-service), seating (inside u're like seated in a bar... without any alcoholic beverage). 

Next time, might try them for breakfast (there must be something they're good at do that the existing rating is 4 over 5!)
author: Gilbert B.

description:
American Grilled Cheese Kitchen should thank:

1. the PayPal app
2. me for being AZN

because those are the two reasons why I gave this place another chance. (Cause I mean, come on, who was I kidding when I said I would make my own grilled cheese sandwiches at home in my last review?)

Pro tip: If you have the PayPal app, you can get $5 off when you dine at American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. All you have to do is pay via the app! So simple!

- Mushroom Gruyere: If you're a fan of roasted mushrooms, this is the one for you!
- Jalapeno Popper: Get this if you want a little (or kind of big) kick of flavors in your mouth!
- Club Turkey: This has been my go-to. It's delicious and really flavorful! :)

Their toast-ing techniques have improved because the bread is toasted to perfection. For those who are on a gluten free diet, they have gluten free bread! 

The line for this place does get long during lunchtime and it takes about 10-15 minutes for them to make your order, so plan accordingly! If you're in a time crunch, you can order online and pick it up. 

Pretty glad this restaurant is just on the other side of South Park from my office. I'll be back for more cheesey goodness.
author: Christine S.

description: Nothing fancy here. Quick service and delicious grilled cheese. The tomato soup was good but the sandwiches were awesome. Quick service and friendly people.
author: Matt E.

description:
The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen catered our January 13th, 2017 wedding and we were THRILLED with the service we received, the quality of the food, and the cost to cater for ~45 people. The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen provided on site cooking (made to order sandwiches) and had a menu that we found to be really fun and flexible. On top of made to order grilled cheese sandwiches we added on salad, tomato soup, and mac and cheese. I can't even begin to tell you how thrilled our guests were that this was the food they got to eat at a wedding and not some tired chicken or lasagna dish. Also, our catering cost was one of the lowest prices tags of our entire wedding which is practically unheard of. 
If you're thinking about using The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen to cater a function for you, do it! They are so easy to work with and so affordable.
author: Rachel D.

description: Stopped here on the way out of San Francisco and I'm glad we did! The Huevos Rolanda was amazing, who knew that a Mexican breakfast grilled cheese would be so good! Super cool atmosphere, outdoor seating, and reasonable priced. They also had a great selection of teas that were different than usual. I will definitely come back!
author: Izi K.

description: Food was good. Service was okay. Not sure if it's a place you can't go without visiting ;)
author: D P.

description:
It was alright. I had the jalapeño grilled cheese and was surprised to discover there was apricot jam/jelly in it. I personally am not much a fan of the apricot; I think the sweetness took away from the spice of the jalapeño, which I was hoping for. It might've tasted different if it were hot (the grilled cheeses were ordered for a group function, and I arrived when they were already cooled down). I also tried the mushroom one, and I liked it enough.

I think I'd give it a 4 if I got it when it was hot off the griddle.
author: Jen A.

description: We were searching for a gluten free lunch & this delivered. You can customize your grilled cheese so I added tomatoes & avocado and it was delicious. My husband had bacon & avocado on his. The GF bread was delicious. It could have been toasted longer but the flavor was still great. We sat outside and truly enjoyed the meal.
author: Keely F.

description:
I am sure this place is a 5 star establishment but until I try one of their grilled cheese creations, I am left w/ cheese yearnings unfulfilled. 

Gavin and I were in the city to catch the Giants game. Our season is ending.. too soon as a matter of fact but you know, it's an odd year. Anyway. It was getting past 11AM and I wanted Gavin to have lunch prior to getting into the ballpark. I was hungry, too but nothing on the menu was friendly towards my macros settings. I ordered the special macaroni and cheese that day - Turkey Macaroni and Cheese. 

Not a side dish and definitely a decent portion to share if you are health conscious. Gavin ate half and I boxed the remaining half into the game. Eating half of that during the bottom of the 3rd inning didn't give me tons of guilt. 

The dish is creamy and rich. I must say that their macaroni and cheese wins best comfort food at an affordable price. Only one thing I did not like was their line/ordering system. If you need a box, a cup, or whatever.. you usually have to stand in line and wait you'd turn.

I know I am spoiled.
author: Tram N.

description:
Wanted to like this place. But I just couldn't ..

It's pretty hard to mess up a grilled cheese in my opinion, and pretty easy to make a good one.

First, while we were waiting for our food, we sat on a seat next to the kitchen where we could see in. I noticed a griddle full of sandwiches ( 30 or more ) prepping. It wasn't long before I noticed the short lady preparing it was not wearing gloves and touching the cheese with her bare hands. She was alternating putting cheese on the bread, breaking one piece in half, wiping her hand on a towel on her apron, then using the same hand to wipe her nose . Gross and super unsanitary. 

The other 2 kitchen workers thankfully were wearing gloves and one of them was making our food thank goodness.

The food came out and sigh, not really cheesy and barely any meat. We got 2 anorexic sandwiches for $10 each? Jalapeño popper substituted with turkey, and the hubby the Cubans. There was some apricot jalapeño mix which covered exactly the middle of the bread only, and that was meh. Not a yummy combo I'm sorry. I ate the side of the bread that had my scrawny turkey. And disposed of the side with apricot. The Cubano was better but still not good. Why was the pickle inside sweet too?

I don't mind paying for food, and I will spend for good food. But in this case $10 was a waste when you compare it to all the better and good sandwiches you can get. Vietnamese sandwiches, Ike's sandwiches, all put this place to shame.

When the bf says yeah we won't be back, for sure we will not be back. Waste of precious real estate in my tummy and not worth the calories.
author: Sharon N.

description: Stopped and had lunch!  Wonderful employees and food was delicious.  Definitely try this place if you are in the area! You won't be disappointed.
author: K K.

description:
This grilled cheese kitchen is simply divine! There aren't a whole lot of options on the menu, but they specialize in a couple of things that I tried.

1. Mousetrap: A cheesy ooey gooey melty sandwich of goodness!! The sourdough was locally made, and the "sour" in the dough didn't overwhelm the flavor of the cheese. The crispness of the grilled bread balanced the texture of the cheese. The two strawberries on the side cut through the saltiness of the sandwich, and cleaned my palette at the end of the meal.

2. The Tomato Basil Soup: A lucious  and warm delight that warmed my soul. The salty taste of their housemate croutons and acidic tomatoes were  made mild by the creme fraiche that was poured over the top. 

Overall: Excellent place to eat before a Giant's game, and definitely filled my stomach!
author: Madi B.

description:
got the gluten free sandwich 

bread wasn't grilled and no butter added

cheese tasted weird 

bread was huge, tasted bad

strawberries were added to box because of wait time was high, but that made the sandwich smell like strawberries

terrible grilled cheese. 

grab bread, cheese and butter and do it yourself! 


or gf bread, daiya and coconut oil :)
author: Pavan K.

description:
Woah. Gluten-free bread done LEGIT here, folks. Get it. 

I got the straight up Mouse Trap on the GF bread and it was simply stacked. Huge grainy slices of bread, that don't taste like sawdust, perhaps soaked in butter, just barely holding in a pile of cheese. I could only do half at a time because it was so big. 

Usually I don't even miss bread and tend to opt out of the GF substitutes, because most of the time they're garbage. Not here. So next time I'm fixin for some faux-glutens, I'm coming here. Oh yes I am.
author: Carol M.

description:
This is probably the BEST grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had!

I'm from LA and I've had plenty of grilled cheese sandwiches. But SF, you just convinced me!

I ordered the mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich. 
I LOVE my mac & cheese and I just had to try it for myself!! Price is ok ($10) but at least they already included tax & the mandatory city fee on the price. Decent portion. It comes with an apple, which I though it was nice and a different taste on your palate.

The mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich was AMAZING. Mac & cheese was rich and creamy!!! Definitely not your boring Kraft's mac and cheese smothered between 2 slices of bread. The bread was crisp to perfection in butter. I devoured it!

I can't wait to try more of their sandwiches when I come back to SF!
author: Alyssa S.

description: Four of us ate here before watching a Giants game. Who doesn't love grilled cheese?! Unless you're vegan and/or have a lactose allergy. ;) Anyway , the menu selection is pretty sweet (prices are a little high) and they sell $4 mimosas! I ordered the Mac & Cheese Grilled Cheese $10 and smoky tomato soup $5 -- sandwich was bland and the soup wasn't what I had expected, very watery. The female cashier seemed flustered by the line of customers and the male food runner seemed irritated when one of us asked him for a side of mustard. "I'll bring it this time, but we prefer you to order sauces in line." OK, buddy. Would I eat here again? Probably not, but the food filled us up and is conveniently located by AT&T Park.
author: Jennae H.

description:
What's there left to say? Trust the reviews and check this place out! Four stars because paying over $10 for a grilled cheese  is just not reasonable. But you can definitely taste the freshness of the ingredients. 

Ordered:
Cubano- A meaty and cheesy explosion in your mouth. Good meat to break ratio; they don't skimp! 
Moscone- Good balance of ingredients, but must say I liked the Cubano better. 
Kale salad- Fresh! A bit of tangy sweetness. 
Sandwiches come with an apple...much healthier than chips!
author: Michelle C.

description: This was a great place! Fast no wait  fresh local cheeses on the grilled cheese. We ordered the mousetrap & turkey club. My favorite was the club, the sandwich had a lot of flavor
author: Joanna P.

description:
Came here massively hungover. Just what the doctor ordered. Got the Farmer's Breakfast sandwich and the tomato soup. 
The sandwich: Toasted and hearty bread, thick cut bacon, an over easy egg, and those potatoes to hold it all together. Each sandwich comes with an apple! 
The soup was well seasoned and thick. Was a nice touch, but good enough on its own.
I was sweating by the end of meal, which is a good thing. You will need a nap after this meal.

Order at the register, take a number and wait. Service was nice and welcoming.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Smoky tomato soup and grilled cheese were yummy. The local Laughing Monk pale ale was at a cheap happy hour price. The service was really great, so friendly, and I was only bribed a little by the free blueberry muffin. ;)

Nice cozy environment to read and eat by a window while waiting for my next engagement.
author: Sarah A.

description:
It's a simple but incredibly effective concept: take what is essentially a beloved childhood meal and build the entire theme for a restaurant around it. Such is the case here, where the uncomplicated menu includes every classic variation of grilled cheese sandwich along with some new twists.  

I went all out and ordered the Club Turkey with a bowl of Smoky Tomato Soup. The club consists of tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatoes and arugula. The entire messy creation was held together by two toasted slices of sourdough. The soup has a much more subtle and creamy tomato flavor than the sickly sweet canned stuff I get at the store. The meal was served in a basket with a cute little apple for added nutritional value. 

A couple people warned me that this place would be very crowded and busy during lunchtime, but I visited slightly before the lunch rush on a Wednesday and was able to order almost as soon as I walked in the door.
author: Alex L.

description:
In the mood for something breakfasty, so got the Classic Breakfast grilled cheese. Now I regret not getting something more unique, but for a basic option, it was very good and satisfied the cheese cravings. The over easy egg was a great complement. I would actually prefer the bread to be a little less grilled, though.

So many other options I want to try - will be back if I have the time.

Not much seating available, but there are some tables outside as well.

Really random, when I was there, one of the light bulbs hanging down by the register area just fell by itself and broke.
author: Pamela S.

description:
A small hipster-ish spot in SoMa, this is a great lunch option. The space is small and has limited seating inside. There are a few tables outside. The grilled cheese itself (opted for the Jalapeño Popper) was tasty and delivered to my table quickly. Along the window, there sit half a dozen trophies from several years of the "Annual Grilled Cheese Invitational," which is cute.

The menu also offers breakfast options and handmade sodas. I'd recommend this place for anyone in the area.
author: Irina P.

description:
3.5/5, +.5 for service

I typed "crab cake sandwich" on Yelp and this place came up. I don't know how, but it did. I searched up the menu and saw pretty much nothing related to crab cakes, but the mushroom gruyere and the mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwiches did interest me. At the end, I decided to try this place out.

The restaurant has no A/C, so I highly suggest sitting outside, especially since SF usually has a nice cool breeze coming from the bay (at least it did when I was there). Although be careful of stuff blowing off the table and you'll be fine!

As mentioned I had the mushroom gruyere and mac/cheese sandwich. I also ordered the club turkey sandwich and a smoky tomato soup. Both the mushroom and mac/cheese sandwiches tasted very good, aside from the harder to eat than expected bread. The club turkey sandwich was also very good, and the bread was actually easier to eat compared to the other two. The smoky tomato soup tasted very good, not a lot of MSG at all! Although I didn't really feel the "smoky" aspect of the soup...

I was glad I tried this place and would definitely consider returning here next time I'm in SF. However since there were so many food places I missed out on during my time here it might be a long time before I would actually come back.
author: Calvin S.

description:
Very simply- great grilled cheese. It's really hard to go wrong with melted cheese of any kind. Had lunch here when I visited by sorority sister in the city after she heard so many great things about it. 

The lady who helped us was a little cold but polite none the less. We decided on splitting the moscone and the jalapeño popper. The moscone was AMAZING. The lavender basil dressing was perfection. We both were head over heels for that sandwich. The jalapeño popper was less dazzling. Both being Hispanic I think we have high expectations for all things spicy and the flavor in this sandwich was a more nontraditional approach than we were expecting. 

It's a nice little spot- nothing ground breaking but definitely just what you need on a cold day or when you're seeking some good old comfort food.
author: Stephanie P.

description: tomato soup + grilled cheese, need I say more? They have a half sandwich/half soup combo for $11.99 which is definitely enough food given how heavy both items are. Tastes wonderful, definitely terrible for your arteries.
author: Annie Z.

description: Very good sandwiches and soup. Highly recommend. A little expensive for what you get but it's great.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: Excellent food. Excellent service. Even the restrooms were immaculate! Definitely a new favorite :)
author: Scott H.

description: I stopped by this place to get some food on the way to work and it was the best decision ever! I immediately noticed how friendly everyone was. I was contemplating between two items on the menu and seriously didn't know what to get. The server gave me his honest opinion about how he prefers the Farmer's Breakfast over anything else, so I just went with that! It didn't disappoint at all! Loved how everything came together super quickly and how tasty it was. They also have a basket filled with strawberries in the front. If they don't ask you if you would like some, remind them!
author: Jenny H.

description: Woweeeee, the food here is delicious! They also have some great sauces to go with your food. I really enjoyed their tomato soup with my jalapeno popper sandwich!
author: Michael K.

description: I should really give them 5 stars.  Don't go at high noon, tables and chairs are hard to find.  Love the tomato soup with...
author: Sam B.

description:
I try to be understanding when I eat lunch in the city - I know establishments in SOMA pay outrageous rents and have to pay workers a small fortune, so I don't expect anything to be cheap.  That being said, $9 for a fried bacon, egg and cheese sandwich a la carte is pretty brutal.  Cost for me to make at home = $2.  And a sandwich with an orange is not exactly filling.  With a 1/2 pint of milk, tax and tip we are in the $15 range.  I just can't.  The sandwich is fine- no raves.  Good quality ingredients, not greasy like I feared.  A bit disappointed because to me, an over medium egg has no runny egg white and a liquid yolk.  What I got was a hard cooked egg, but it was still fine.  Parking wasn't terrible, but I think we got lucky.  I think in SOMA these days you have to pay so much attention to being locally sourced, environmentally conscious and socially responsible that sometimes the basics like service, value and quality suffer.  
Anyway, a pretty good sandwich, and I would have no problem returning.  Hard to justify a $15 lunch more than once or twice per week....Hell, the Gold Club is right around the corner and you can have a huge lunch and a beer for $15...
author: Ken P.

description: I don't usually crave grilled cheese sandwiches, but when I do this is my usual pick. They have a good selection, so you'll likely find your favorite cheese on the menu. I like the mushroom gruyère sandwich. The smoky tomato soup also pairs perfectly with the sandwich though they give you croutons already. To balance out the meal, they also give you a gala apple. They get fairly busy with online orders, so there may be a bit of a wait to get your food if you order there.
author: Diana C.

description:
Be careful if you try and talk over the music while in line they will freak the fuck out and ask you to leave . if you can make it past their "quiet game" line then their grilled cheese is above average.

Dont come for the booze (granted Mimosa was good and $5),come for the Pokémon, grilled cheese and beer across the street at 21st Ammendment. Staff is less the useless, snooty and can be very rude. 

I will say depending on when you go it'll be great (like in the past for me) or shit (like when I am writing the review, Saturday afternoon)
author: Tim M.

description:
Mac n cheese on a grilled cheese, nuff said. 

Some say a grilled cheese is just a grilled cheese and I say, they haven't had a really great grilled cheese. It's all about the bread, the cooking technique, the buttery crust, and most of all, the quality of ingredients. And ladies and gentleman, this place knows where it's at! 

My grilled cheese was buttery, crispy and grilled to perfection. I added bacon to my Mac grilled cheese and the bacon was thick cut and well season. My coworkers got the piglet which was essentially a hot ham and cheese and it looked incredible as well. 

I think the key here is that the quality of Ingredients here is unrivaled. The food is all locally sourced and very fresh. I would definitely recommend checking this place out if you area grilled cheese fan, or even for a nice salad on the patio. Super chill and relaxing. Easy 4 stars.
author: Cindy G.

description: Loved, loved the place! Great innovative reciped for grilled cheese sandwiches and they serve it with an apple! How smart and healthy!
author: Victoria G.

description:
Such a yummy grilled cheese sandwich as memories of childhood moments slid by as the cheese melted off my sandwich. 

Also the daily mac and cheese here is so great! 

I really have a tough time choosing between the mac/cheese and the sandwiches.

And a friend said the salads are good too although I don't go there for salad :)

enjoy
Steve
author: Steven W.

description: Not so great had a grilled veggie on gluten free bread.  The bread was thick like a brick and stodgy, not forgetting there was a tiny piece of hair in my sandwhich which put me off. No love in the food at all. Presentation I would give 1 star, attitude of the server no stars, cleanliness could improve. I will not be returning.
author: Mira N.

description:
Interesting place, with a special focus and  some intriguing takes on the grilled cheese sandwich.  I don't like the average grilled cheese, since I don't like Swiss, American, or cheddar cheese. My friends wanted to stop here on our way to a Giants game, and since I had brought my own snacks along and wasn't hungry, and I didn't mind stopping here. I was just going to have something to drink while they ate. But once inside, I saw the menu, with all of the innovative combos, and decided to try the Mushroom Gruyère.

I enjoyed it and ate the whole thing!

A few weeks later, I ordered delivery from them on Try Caviar. They have made me a grilled cheese fan!!!

Give 'em a shot--even if you don't normally like cheese sammies.
author: L.E. W.

description: Best Rubeun ever!  Instead of traditional coleslaw there's chopped up brussel sprouts and pickles in it. The Russian dressing is perfect.  Love the turkey and cheese scones too, can be a meal myself.
author: Chi Z.

description: Pretty good, great garlic butter. The place is  smaller than expected but it's still nice and cute not there. There's also seating outside.
author: Cali C.

description: Best grilled cheese and tomato soup (perfect for dipping) I've ever had. Very friendly staff, great vibe and nice outdoor area.
author: Padra M.

description:
Grilled cheese is the perfect comfort food!
Came with my sister for a Saturday lunch and the line does tend to get long. We got lucky with a table at their outside patio, but with their limited seatings and long line, I'm not too confident that everyone gets to dine in.

I ordered the Cubano while my sister got the mushroom. We went halfsies so I had the chance to try both. Both are delicious. You can never go wrong with mushrooms, it was good. The cubano one has pork and a bit saucy compare to the mushroom one. If you're looking for a more heavy meal, go with Cubano. But if you're looking a for something slightly lighter since it already has cheese, then the mushroom wouldn't disappoint.

Also, I prefer their carbonated lavender lemonade over their lemonade mix.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Very satisfying.  The strawberries (on the side) were a nice and unexpected jolt of flavor. I'd definitely visit again and try one of their more adventurous sandwiches.
author: Dierra L.

description: All I have to say is this place is HELLLLLLLLA GOOD. Their mac n cheese sandwich is my favorite.
author: Jasmine C.

description: This place has one of the best grilled cheese in San Francisco!! I like their mushrooms guyere one and the hawaiian with bacon one. They are so good!! There's also special discount for student. They also have fruits free on the sudr also.
author: Nuntanat R.

description:
This place takes your childhood grilled cheese and ups the ante many-many-many-manyfold. 

My favorite sandwich is the Jalapeño Popper featuring chèvre, Monterey jack, apricot-jalapeño relish, and applewood-smoked bacon. Every bite is an excellent mix of cheesy goodness, perfectly crispy bacon, and a little kick from the jalapeños. I usually get this as part of the The Red, White and Blue Plate Special which gives you a slightly smaller sandwich with a soup or salad. Their smoky tomato soup has been a hit-or-miss for me as sometimes it just seems too watered down. 

They also serve breakfast sandwiches until 11 AM on weekdays. The Smule team absolutely loves them. My favorite is the Breakfast Piglet which features sharp cheddar, ham, apple mustard, and rosemary butter on delicious levain bread. 

And just when you thought these guys were a one-trick-grilled-cheese-sandwich pony, you realize they also do baked goods amazingly well. Their muffins, especially the berry-infused ones, are great. My favorite is the blueberry and raspberry muffin, which is filled with whole berries. They bake them in the morning, but sometimes they have some left over that you can grab at lunchtime.

During lunch, the line extends out the door so avoid coming at exactly noon if you are in a rush. They have seating inside and outside. Although all the seating might be taken as you arrive, something usually frees up while you are waiting for your food to come out.
author: Mark C.

description: Had breakfast here while on a work trip.  The Classic Egg & Cheese with Bacon was excellent!  It was exactly what you would think an egg on a grilled cheese would be.  Service was good, however, I wish they would have made my egg over easy as I had asked.  Not a big deal but it would probably have been even better if the egg was cooked the way I had asked.  I can't wait for another business trip to eat here again.
author: MichaelAnthony C.

description:
I used to eat so many grilled cheese sandwiches in college. Melted cheese between two slices of bread, you just can't go wrong with that. It's about 2-3 blocks from the ball park so if you like your grilled cheese, and you aint trying to eat mediocre ball park food, this is the place for you! 
They have a half sandwich half soup option and because the soup of the day was french onion, and because I LOVE french onion soup, I went halfsies. I ordered the Mushroom with Gruyere Grilled Cheese. It was really good so I would definitely recommend this sandwich if you're a mushroom kind of person. The soup was just okay, but I should have expected that coming form a grilled cheese restaurant. Me and my girlies also shared an order of the Daily Mac n Cheese which was with ham that day, and that was pretty good too. And they also give you an apple with your meal, which I think is great because it balances out all the cheesiness.
The restaurant is also clean with cute decor. I remember seeing a chalkboard filled with funny cheese puns. The only one I remember is "Brie Willie." Hahaha I liked that one. 
Yes, I give this place my thumbs up!
author: Amy X.

description:
I loooooove grilled cheeses.

Luckily, we snuck in JUST in the nick of time after running across the street from 21st Amendment... right before they were closing (not on purpose, we honestly had no idea until they locked the doors after we ordered!).

I shared the jalapeno popper grilled cheese with the boyfriend, and it came with a cute little apple. It was tasty, and affordable at $9. 

I wouldn't hesitate to return if I was ever in the area again and wanted a delicious, comforting bite to eat.
author: Michelle H.

description: Best grilled cheese and tomato soup I have ever had. I only wish I lived closer so I could eat here all the time and try other menu items. If you are in the neighborhood, this is a must try establishment!
author: Ms Vixen V.

description:
Awesome! Best grilled cheese I've ever had in my life. -Emmy Sandis, Age 10

She had the Mac n cheese grilled cheese.
author: Stephanie S.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for ages. We decided to plan a day trip on BART to check it out.  I'm so glad we did.  I ordered the Mushroom Gruyere sandwich.  It was perfect in every way.  The flavor and texture was spot on.   It was incredible!!  Paired with tomato soup, which was good but not extraordinary, it was the perfect lunch for a cold day.  I'm giving it 5 stars for the sandwich and friendly staff alone.
author: Angie L.

description:
I have yet to try the grilled cheese here but I was really craving some mac and cheese so decided to stop by. I got the mac and cheese which had ham in it and bread crumbs on the top. It was good but by the end of it, I had to add some ketchup because the taste was getting redundant. I also got the smoky tomato soup and although it was good, it was a little bland. My soup also didn't come with croutons, which was a bummer. However, I was really blown away with the service here! Everyone who works here took really good care of us. 

I'll definitely come here again to try out the grilled cheese since that's what they are known for.
author: Hana K.

description: Not that impressed. Could've made better at home. Descriptions really sound great but in reality tasted bland . Friendly staff, nice outdoor patio area. Overpriced.
author: Chera T.

description: Yummy! Had the mousetrap with bacon and avocado with string fries. My bf had the turkey club. So good, it was pretty busy and a small spot. There was outdoor seating but too cold to eat outside. Everything was tasty. I had my sandwich with the Palo Alto firehouse hot sauce. I'll come back soon  I want to try the Mac and cheese and the salads.
author: jennifer p.

description:
I got the "Stella's Cobb' salad and it was really good, very fresh, with blue cheese, egg, tomatoes, red onions, chicken, bacon, croutons and buttermilk sauce. They say 'large salad' and it's really large, more than enough for 1 person.

I will come back for sure!
author: Koe S.

description:
The best grilled cheese sandwich I have EVER eaten.

I ordered the Mushroom Gruyère ($9) which is fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms, roasted potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain. I hate mushrooms but this was the only sandwich I saw with caramelized onions so I decided to hope that the fontina cheese masked the taste of the mushroom. To my surprise, it just did the opposite and really enhanced all the different flavors in the sandwich.. and I really didn't mind.  (I might actually start loving mushrooms!) The bread was so perfect but be careful eating it because i got a little too excited and cut the roof of my mouth! Ouch.

You really think when you first get it that this sandwich won't fill you up. I was actually pretty full after the first half. Trade halves with a buddy so you won't get tired of eating the same thing?

It's super cute how it comes with an orange. To cleanse your palette afterwords? A fruit a day keeps the doctor away?

I want to try the Foghorn Leghorn because I am obsessed with blue cheese and heard it's bursting with blue cheese yummy-ness.

There's not a whole lot of seating options inside (all bar-like seating) but outside has a good amount of tables so you can enjoy your delicious sandwich and soak in a beautiful day.
author: Lauren K.

description: Really goo and they know what they're doing, but definitely let me down a bit. The mac n cheese grilled cheese didn't rock my world like it should have. I'm almost sure it was just plain noodles on a grilled cheese. The cheese wasn't sharp enough for my preference and just left me with an overwhelming milky cheese taste. Also thought it should have had way more noodles. The bread was delicious and toasted to perfection. The Reuben had such little meat on it. They will give you more strawberries if you ask though!!! And those were honestly the best part lol.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
The Wife and I have now traveled down here for this place on more than one occasion. It has won our hearts(and stomachs) as the reason to come to SF. Obviously we do still try to make trips out of it(like a Giants game) but no lie the Jalapeño popper w/bacon is so worth the 3+ hour drive, and the price. 

The whole thing just melts in your mouth, add the nice crunch from the bread & bacon and its a masterpiece. The apricot-jalapeno relish alone is a must try but add the cheese and the bread its just a perfect connection.

The wife agrees that the mac n cheese grilled cheese is also worth the drive. The prices are pretty good as well consider after the sandwiches we are both typically pretty full, they also include fresh fruit with the order. 

We have never had any issues with the employees, always seem to be in a good mood.
We thankfully stay at the Marriott up the street so its a very easy walk and parking is not an issue for us. If we had to name a problem it might be the inside seating may be a bit crammed at times(Say during a rainy day and the outside seating isn't an option) but that doesn't stop us from enjoying one of our all time favorite places.
author: John C.

description:
Some of the best greasy cheesy grilled cheese is found here!
Top shelf ingredients, wonderful bread and cheese variants.  And long lines out the door for 1000 caloric    sandwich.  You only live 1ce
author: David H.

description: This isn't *just* a grilled cheese sandwich. This is the Stephen Curry of grilled cheese sandwiches. The Stradivarius of grilled cheese sandwiches. Gooey on the inside, crunchy on the inside. OMG, I'm fantasizing about one now. Love, love, love it!
author: Rob F.

description: Fantastic grilled cheese sandwiches to be had here. I had the cubano and my girlfriend had the turkey with bacon. The cubano had pulled pork and ham with thick cut pickles and the turkey with bacon had lettuce and tomato. Honestly can't decide which was better. You also get two strawberries for dessert. Service was quick. No complaints here. They get an extra star for having Palo Alto Fire Fighters pepper sauce on hand which elevated the sandwiches to the next level. Highly recommended. Would go again.
author: Greg K.

description: Everyone was offered an apple and croutons with soup today. I wasn't even given a fork for my salad. When I asked the person who rang me up and packed my food for a fork, she did not look happy. What's up with the attitude. I didn't order a sandwich so I don't expect an apple but I do expect a fork and croutons with my soup. Edited from 2 star to 1. I wasn't given any dressing for my salad. Again.
author: x x.

description:
Saw this place while at a brewery across the street. Was too full to try it that day but made a special trip on our last vacation in the city to try the Mac n cheese sandwich. Man glad we did because it was amazing!!

We ordered the Mac n Cheese sandwich with bacon. Total was around $12 and trust me it was enough to share. Came with a nice apple as well. I thought it was so good. It was basically man n cheese with bacon on a sourdough bread. A perfect combo. The only thing annoying is that it took a while for the sandwich to be made. I chalked it up to they must have made fresh Mac n Cheese and I'll take that trade off any day of the week. 

Overall The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is a perfect lunch spot in SF. I'd like to try more sandwiches in the future but the Mac n Cheese will stay in my me,or for a long time!
author: Aaron A.

description:
We got the jalapeño grilled cheese , it was good but nothing special. Also ordered the tomato soup, which was great, they mix creamer into it which it adds greatly to the taste. Also got a side salad which was healthy and good.  
The place however doesn't operate efficiently, there were a lot of people inside not doing anything and the food came out super sl
author: Hana F.

description:
Jalapeño popper sammy was off the hook! I tried that & the mac & cheese grilled sammy. I like the jalapeño one more :)
Nice outdoor and indoor seating area
5/5 overall experience 
5/5 food quality
5/5 fast & friendly service
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Went there because my colleague and I were at the Moscone Convention Center and wanted to grab a quick bite at a local casual restaurant that offers good food.

Got to the South Park location at around noon and already there's a long line forming. The interior is small with several individual seating. The exterior dining area is much bigger with plenty of small round tables that can probably seat roughly 35-40 people.

I wanted to try the American Dip but they ran out so I got the Club Turkey instead. The Club Turkey came with sharp cheddar, havarti, smoked turkey, roasted tomatoes, bacon, mustard, arugula on sourdough bread.  I also got a plum on the side. Based on the past photos posted, the place seems to throw in a piece of seasonal fruit.

The sandwich was absolutely delicious! It looked really tasty to begin with. The grilled sourdough bread that's slightly crisp on the outside with grease seeping through the surface, oozing melty creamy cheeses, hearty smoked turkey with bacon to boot!  The portion was not enormous but quite filling. Most of all, I wasn't expecting the plum to be so sweet and juicy. It was a great way to end the meal.

Looks like the shop delivers and also gets plenty of take outs.
It's no surprise to find the place thriving after tasting their sandwich. I will be back to sample others. Hopefully they will have the roast beef next time!
author: Sherry C.

description: Undeniably the best grilled cheese sandwich. Love the sauces they keep.
author: Namrata J.

description: Really like this place. I'd recommend Japaleno popper grilled cheese and the smoky tomato soup in particular
author: Arvind R.

description: Wish I could give this place more stars. I ordered the mushroom Gruyere. It was alright. I'm biased because they used a  type of mushroom that I dislike but the bread was also too hard. I appreciated the strawberries and the good service and friendly waiters. But in the end, I was left wishing I'd gone home instead and made my own grilled cheese. :/ Might've just ordered the wrong thing? I'll get the mousetrap next time, see how it goes, and update my review.
author: Najeemah W.

description: First experience and am not going back. Barely any cheese, way too much apricot in the jalapeño spread. Dont waste your money adding bacon. Extremely disappointed. I thought why not, its Friday. Lets get some bacon on the b!tch. Of course I got it to go and didnt realize until I sat at my desk, eager to chow into some melty cheese and grilled bread, those stingy folks down at the TGCK hooked me up with their ( not so finest ) half strip of bacon. Thanks guys, way to set the bar low.
author: Mason M.

description:
This isn't much of a review so I'll give them the stars I previously gave them.

I just wanted to mention that their Pink Grapefruit Peppercorn Soda is really good! It has a perfect balance of sweet and bitter from the grapefruit and then a perfect spice from the peppercorn. I would totally go back for more if I lived near there! That's it :)
author: Sophia Y.

description: This place is awesome. The food has been great.  I get the Ruben Adams Grilled Cheese (one of the more expensive items on the menu) and its amazing.  I do wish that the prices were a little bit cheaper so I could come here more frequently but the prices aren't too bad for the area.
author: Mark W.

description:
If you have grilled cheese sandwiches and love trying new and differen forms of grilled cheese sandwiches, then this is the spot for you! This place offers many different types of grilled cheese sandwiches that have the additions of veggies and meat to complement the type of cheese. 

One of my favorites include the Mushroom Gruyère: the addition of potatoes, thyme, and caramelized onions with the mushrooms and gruyere make it extremely bold in flavor. I normally hate onions but the caramelization of the onions makes it super yummy! It is definitely something different from your classic grilled cheese.

Some of my other favorites include the club turkey and foghorn leghorn, but honestly, you cannot go wrong with any of the grilled cheese sandwiches they have. Each sandwich also comes with creamy tomato soup and their fruit of the day. Grilled cheese + tomato soup = deadly combo that will have you wanting to come back for more. The place is on the smaller side so there is more seating outside. Parking can be somewhat difficult as it is located in a very busy neighborhood but DEFINITELY worth coming here to try! A great place to grab lunch with friends and enjoy memories of childhood with your "upgraded" grilled cheese sandwich :)
author: Wendy Z.

description: After not having carbs for over a week we decided to splurge and stop in here. Hubby got the mushroom and cheese and I ordered the jalapeño poppers sandwich. Both were super good I would love to go back and try some others.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Four star for food/value
Three star for on premise - ordering ahead or getting delivery next time

Yummy grilled cheese, but come on, who messes up melted cheese on buttered carbs, a bit pricey, and not quick

Looks like same kitchen does in person and online (pick up or delivery) orders so the shop might be empty but you still wait 15 min while bags of grilled cheeses go out the door 

Was told lunch line is long, so made it at 11:30 Fri with no one waiting to order, one or two seats left of their small counter space, line out door by 11:45 and got sandwich soon after.

$13 for mushroom grilled cheese ($11 + $2 for avocado), bit much imho
author: Aki N.

description:
This was our second stop on our SF Food Crawl. We literally grubbed on HRD Coffee Shop's deliciousness and walked up this alleyway to get to this spot that I had bookmarked. Only 0.3 miles of a walk, had to burn off some of that kimchee burrito I had. ;)

The place was pretty packed but there were few tables outside open and it was such a nice summery day in the city, we had to take advantage of sitting outside. :)

I ordered us the Piglet and the Jalapeño Popper grilled cheese sandwiches. The Piglet has Tillamook sharp cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter on Pinkie's levain. The Jalapeño Popper has chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish on levain bread as well.

We got our number and already had our gallon waters with us, so no need for drink orders, and sat down outside to wait for the sammiches to come out. 

The pricing of the sandwiches are A-OK to me I guess since they are considered "gourmet". 

They serve each sandwich with a nice fresh and juicy looking plum. But since we were being "healthy" that day, any fruit is just added sugar! So no thanks! Haha! We ended up giving away our plums to a bum who was knocked out in the alleyway. ;)

First bite into the Piglet, I thought, "Hmm, wow...very sweet. Ham is a bit salty. But cheese is uber yummy." The levain bread is extremely delicious. Great texture!

I gave 1/2 of my Piglet to our foodie friend and he gave me his 1/2 of the Popper sammich. When I took a bite of that other sandwich, I knew I should have ordered myself that one as well. It had a great spicy flavor to it and the cheesy goodness made it all worthwhile. I could have done without the bacon though.

I honestly would rate this place 3.5 stars because I feel we could make a better gourmet grilled cheese in our own kitchen. But the experience and the service here was top notch, so 4 stars it is baby!
author: Michelle V.

description:
Ordered a club turkey sandwich here for lunch. The sourdough bread was perfectly crisp / toasted and the turkey with bacon complimented their spreads completely ! 

Coming here again !
author: Neil S.

description: Love this place for a pre-game grilled cheese and beer.  You can sit out on the patio and watch all of the fans stream towards AT&T.  The mushroom + gruyere is my favorite sandwich.
author: Herb G.

description: The sandwiches at American Grilled Cheese are like nothing I have had before. Each one has something so unique about it that makes them so desirable. I have tried the jalapeño popper, the mac and cheese grilled cheese, and the cubano. They were all as good as I expected. For those of you who don't do spicy, the jalapeño popper wasn't too hot. It also has a nice sweet flavor to go along with the spice. The mac and cheese needs no introduction: It's mac and cheese in a grilled cheese sandwich, so of course it's awesome! As the food was delicious, it gets four stars because it didn't have a strong wow factor.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
It's too well-made to eat hurriedly but too tasty to eat slowly. 3 1/2.

Breakfast Piglet: A bigger, tastier, realer McDonald's Egg McMuffin.
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=SCFtNJcP7vBYOUMPLA0bHA&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

Foghorn Leghorn: Coldcut ah say coldcut chicken is alright too.
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=d9WG9gh8MmC6SdrZBaXuuQ&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese: Add meat for $1.5 coughbaconcough.
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ugXjSiymdSMkRPLuTVOCNg&userid=WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA

I may try the Cubano / Mexicano as they reappear on the specials board.

I probably won't try many others because they either have no meat, "just" bacon, or + $ to add meat. Vegetarian options aplenty. But I'm vegan... when I'm riding my fixed-gear bicycle. Or when I'm wearing plaid.
author: Dan B.

description:
Loved this place. It was my first time in SF and this was our first stop after getting our rental car. Staff was friendly and patient as we couldn't decide on what to get! So many delicious options. I chose the Mac and cheese sandwich option and my friend chose the mushroom and cheese sandwich option (don't remember the exact name)... but we both loved what we ordered! The bread is perfectly grilled and the cheese was perfectly melted. Really liked the variety of cheeses and breads used in the different sandwiches. The only reason I'm giving the place 4 stars is because I think $10 for a sandwich is kind of steep. The sandwiches were filling but I'm not sure if they were worth $10-12.

Definitely a place to visit at least once though if you're into cheese!!!
author: Megha S.

description:
This is a really good grilled cheese restaurant.  I don't think I would have believed that sentence a few years ago, but grilled cheese restaurants now seem to be a thing, with a VC-funded chain, several solid local restaurants (including this one), etc.

There's usually a special, the roasted tomato soup is great, but the mac and cheese grilled cheese is my favorite.  Bacon, too.

Surprisingly good pricing, too -- especially the soup and sandwich deal for around $9.  And really good service, too -- both the cashier and the guy who brought our meal to the table were friendly and efficient.
author: Ryan L.

description: Nibbled on the Mac and cheese sandwich as well as the Mouse. Both yummy and pull apart cheesy! I'm typically not into tomato soup but wow this soup was bomb. Not a lot of inside seating :/
author: Mariah R.

description: They had me at $4 mimosas. The food is pretty good, too. The sandwiches in particular are delicious - love the Cubano. The salads are fine. Nothing to write home about but they get the job done. The staff is super friendly/helpful and I love that I can bring my pooch and hang out on the patio on a sunny day.
author: Connie S.

description:
Update: my favorite was the Piglet but it's no longer on the menu.

This spot made USA Today's list of "10 great places to bite into a surprising sandwich."

I had thought grilled cheese was basic and anyone can make it, and that it cannot be improved that much before it becomes too fusiony, not to mention the rise in price. AGCK totally changed that thinking.

From the jalapeno popper to mushroom gruyere sandwiches to their tomato soup, all I can say this is my favorite place for grilled cheese sandwiches. Plus, the side of fruit like grapes or an apple is great!


The outdoor seating is nice on a sunny day, but does get chilly once the sun moves over the building, shading it. The inside seating is limited for large groups but perfect for single or double seating.
author: Peter L.

description:
Located on 2nd street, a few blocks up from AT&T Park. What i liked about this place was the sign that said "What you see is what you pay". Lots of sandwiches were between $8-$10 including all taxes. 

I got the Moscone which had pesto, tomato slice, and a kick of something else on whole wheat bread. I came at 2 pm so the lunch rush had died but I waited 10 mins for my sandwich while the girl in line after me got her order before me and she ordered something similar -_-. They also give you a small apple with your sandwich, warm but better than nothing.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Diane offered superb service. She gave us brilliant food recommendations as well as good expertise in the beer department. The sandwiches were amazing and the tomato soup is incredible.  I will absolutely be back again soon.
author: Alex E.

description:
This is my boyfriend's favourite place to eat, period. We had our first date here, and he gets sort of antsy when he doesn't eat here at least once every couple of weeks. (He'll deny it, but he knows I'm right!) The food here is a bit pricey for what you pay for (small-ish gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches) but they're delicious, so I'll give them that. There's a great special that they have that is half sandwich, half soup or salad combo that I'll normally get. 

I haven't gotten as many sandwiches as my boyfriend has, though he's tried every single one on the menu and has enjoyed all of them. :) I do love the fact that the grilled cheeses here are VERY grilled and crispy. The lemonades and sides here are also great and I love the smoked tomato soup :) Gives it a bit of a kick and twist on the regular tomato soup. The American Dip that I had the second time around seemed less like a grilled cheese and more like an actual sandwich, but it was delicious. I also enjoy their freshly made lemonades and drinks. 

The seating for this place probably isn't the best-- limited seating indoors and while it seems like there are a lot of tables outside, they quickly fill up.
author: Christa Lei S.

description:
I was a complete skeptic before trying American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.  My thought was, "How can I pay $9 for a simple grilled cheese sandwich that I can probably make at home?"  Well I took the plunge and had a pretty nice experience at AGCK.

I remember always driving by this place and seeing how the line went out the door.  As luck would have it, there was no line when I arrived there on a late Sunday morning.  Here's what I ordered:

Jalapeno Popper
( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=imIgZazYTgnVqB8n2gqboA)
This was really good!  It tasted just like actual jalapeno poppers plus BACON!  Kudos to the chef for pulling this off!  I might have to go back again for another one of these soon!

Smokey Tomato Soup
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=yYLJe-LvuiE29fKmPTbhpw)
Tomato Soup should always be must with any grilled cheese sandwich whatsoever.  The one at AGCK takes it up a notch and had nice flavor.  Not bland at all and definitely complimented the Jalapeno Popper.

I love how their location is located just a short walk from ballpark.  They probably get a lot of foot traffic before and after games.  And I love any spot that I has an outdoor patio dining area.  Makes for great people watching while you enjoy your Grilled Cheese Sandwich.

Okay, so for the overall experience, I give it a solid 4 stars.  Their sandwiches are pretty creative and tasty, the atmosphere is pretty mellow, and the location is pretty convenient.  They've made me an instant fan!
author: Rodney H.

description: Pretty good grilled cheese with pretty food salads and soso tomato soup. Their daily soup sepection is generally better than their tomato soup in my opinion.  Worth trying to see if you like it.
author: Max S.

description:
Cheese Gromit!!
Look at all the cheese.
If you can stand to wait a bit for your food, it's a great way to spend lunch,
Bit drafty outdoors, but you're in the city.
I try to go here once every few months. The line unfortunately makes it a no go for the locals I work with in the area. We needed 30+ minutes to accommodate the line and wait or risk having to take the food back to the office.
So again, if you have the time during lunch, why not eat at South Park and enjoy your sandwich.
author: Christopher B.

description:
My expectation of this place was way too high. My friend and I have planned to come here for a long time, but since it was clear across town, it didn't happen. We did come once, but it was closed. Finally, we had a chance to try this place out. We love cheese, we love bread, this place should be awesome!

My friend got a Foghorn and she said the cheese overpowered the meat. She said it was hard to distinguish any other flavor other than cheese. I had the Mac & Cheese Grill, it was pretty good. I liked it, I wish they gave you a spoon with the basket. There are spoons though, you just have to go get it yourself.

We also had a ginger peach homemade soda and a strawberry lemonade. I highly recommend their sodas, it's really flavorful and refreshing. The lemonade was good as well, but there wasn't much strawberry flavor (though the color is there), but it's definitely very sour.
author: Stacy C.

description: Loved it here! My sister says every time she comes to San Fran she has to have this grilled cheese. And damn is  it good! We got the mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwich and omg it's delicious. Not too greasy or dry. Had with some very tasty soup. Also they have their sodas in the cutest classic looking bottles. Wasn't too busy when we were their and also didn't have to wait long for the food either. The staff their were pretty nice too. And by staff I mean the one woman running the whole restaurant the whole time we were their. She was great. I also love the way the tables had little hooks on the corners for your bags. It's just a great place to go to!
author: Victoria P.

description:
GLUTEN FREE BREAD!!! Yes. 

I went way out of my way for this place because it is hard to find a decent GF grilled cheese in the city. The bread was very thick, most GF is cut thick, and was just okay tasting and texture. The cheese is great and melted just right, but overall not an amazing sando. I bet would be better on "real" bread for everyone else. Definitely try once.
author: Elisa D.

description: I love grilled cheese sandwiches so I had to stop by here on my visit in the city. It was kind of disappointing.. I ordered the mousetrap w/ roasted tomatoes, mushroom Gruyere, and the Mac and cheese of the day. By far, the Mac and cheese was one of the best I've ever had. Cheesey, some crunchies, mushrooms... I could have eaten so many orders but I snagged their last order of the day. And the grilled cheeses were not that good. They were both pretty dry even though they had melted cheese in between. I had to add a lot of hot sauce to soften it up. I would come back again for the Mac and cheese alone only.
author: Diana J.

description:
Had a mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwich. Great crunchy bread and came with an apple (which was a great finish to this very heavy meal). My friend loved the mushroom gruyere sandwich. I'd come here again to try other things.

Short walk from the ballpark and Caltrain
author: Jen G.

description:
The best grilled cheese place in the city. Just keep it simple and they will come. I love this place and generally everything on the menu is good. Prices are high considering you can make this at home for half the cost, but the place is nice and everything screams high quality. 

I will not that the last time i came there i ordered the jalopeno popper and the tomato soup. The jalopeno popper tasted like a jalopeno popper which I kinda found surprising - i dunno why. The tomato soup was real thing and tangy - i wish they added more cream to thicken the soup. 

Overall this place rocks - takes a while since there is normally a line, but its worth the wait.
author: Ryan R.

description:
GOT ANY CHEESEEEEEEEEE???

Oh yah baby...American Grilled Cheese Kitchen has enough hot, melted ooeeey goeeey cheese to steam up Steve Urkel's thick bifocals and cause continuous outbursts of  "DID I DOOOO THATTTT?"

After a year of losing a bet, my friend and I finally made it to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen on our holiday vacation last week so she can collect on all the cheesy goodness.

F O O D
Though there are several salads on the menu, your visit will be fruitless without trying one of their seven grilled cheese sandwiches. 

As Susy C. recommended, I ordered the Jalapeno Popper: Chèvre, Monterey jack, Applewood-smoked bacon, Apricot-jalapeño relish on Levain bread ($9). Tomato soup and a grilled cheese are like bread and butter. You can't have one without the other so I also ordered the Smokey Tomato Soup with Cream Fraiche ($4).
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=PWGtzvWV5r9J9RzhhzCbMA

The Jalapeno Popper Sandwich set off fireworks in my mouth with an explosion of different flavors and textures. As you sink your teeth into the crusty and buttery bread, you get a rich decadence from the mouth-watering salty cheese duo with a smoky crispness from the bacon and a sweet, tangy heat from the apricot-jalapeno relish. Each bite was ridiculously good and I couldn't help but devour the entire sandwich in one sitting. In the end, I was left licking off the remnants of butter on my fingers.

The tepid Smokey Tomato Soup was used more for dipping than slurping. Similar to Campbell's Tomato Soup, it was watery and lacked that quintessential sweet tangy flavor. 

Make sure to cap off  your meal with one their house-made sodas ($3). The Spiced Ginger Soda was light and refreshing with just enough of a subtle sweet spice to tingle your taste buds. 

S E R V I C E
The staff was friendly and worked as fast as they could to turn out each other. Do expect to wait at least 15 minutes for your sandwich during peak lunch hour. Even when we left at 2 PM on a Tuesday, there was still a crowd of people inside waiting in line to order. 

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R
As it namesake states, American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is exactly that, a "kitchen". The counter seating is like the chef's table where you get a direct view of the prepping and the kitchen area.

There's inside seating for about 12-14 people and about 6 tables in the outdoor patio. 

No seats? No problem. Take you sandwich over to South Park right behind the restaurant. http://www.yelp.com/biz/south-park-san-francisco Bask in the sun, take in Mother Nature, and watch all the cute doggies frolic around in the park while enjoying your delectable sandwich. 

P A R K I N G
Metered street parking all around the area and some 2-hour parking in South Park.

Did I mention that I'm lactose intolerant? YEUP, I DID THAT! OPPSIE. =X
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
(More like 3.5 stars but rounding up. )

So what happens when you cannot decide between Mac & Cheese and Grilled Cheese? You *combine* them! And while you are at it, add jalapeños!

I ordered a half Mac & Cheese Grilled Cheese sandwich and a bowl of soup (my all time favorite combo!!). The sandwich was delicious! Order was fast but their tomato soup left a lot to be desired. It felt like a tomato puree and did not have much flavor to it. 

To help you cut the guilt out, they give you an apple. I found mine to be rotten and I let them know but they did not offer to change it on their own. They might have if I asked but I did not bother to.
author: Neha M.

description:
Imagine if you went back in time. Back in the cave men era. You find a family huddled around a small pit attempting to make fire. Making no eye contact, you take out your Zippo lighter and proceed to give them warmth. The family looks at you, jaws open, with absolutely no idea how what you did was possible.

That's like the first visit to the American is like. You've never had grilled cheese this good. This place has taken so large of a quantum leap in grilled cheese engineering that you cannot even comprehend what it will taste like until you have tried it.

Which unfortunately ends my Yelp review. Words cannot give credit to how good this place is. Not even pictures. Come try this place out.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Finally got around to checking this place out and I am a happy girl. Seriously, mac & cheese grilled cheese?! COME TO MAMA. The friendly guy at the cashier also suggested that I add bacon which I (of course) did not turn down. For my drink I ordered the strawberry lemonade which was more on the sour side but totally up my alley. My friend ordered the American Dip which came w/ a horseradish sauce that he enjoyed as well. 

I also snagged the LAST bacon and cheese biscuit - YES. So I recommend going early if ya want one! Everything was so deliciously good... in total we spent around $13 each. 

Parking can be a hassle but I definitely did not mind walking my satisfied ass the two blocks back to the car.
author: Kriz K.

description:
This was my first time going to the highly touted AGCK. I couldn't wait to try one of those grilled cheese sandwiches that everyone has been raving about!

It was a nice day, so the outdoor seating was quite inviting : ) I was also lucky to get there early enough that there wasn't much of a line, so I found a seat quickly after ordering.

I thought that I'd get the most basic of their sandwich options -- The Mousetrap -- filled with Tillamook Cheddar Cheese, Creamy Havarti Cheese, and Monterey Jack Cheese all on Artisan Sourdough Bread.

Yum.

It was a pleasantly filling classic grilled cheese sandwich that was a perfect lunchtime option for just under $7. Now I can understand why everyone really likes this place.
author: Diana V.

description:
What's better than a grilled cheese on a rainy day?  A grilled cheese from the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen on a rainy day - boom.

This place is fantastic.  My husband and I live two block from here, which is dangerous.  I think in the past three weeks we've stopped in for dinner at least 4-5 times.  Each item we've tried is fantastic.  And we love that their fries are always good as well - often restaurants serve cold, limp fries - or their fries are at least unpredictable. Not the case with this place.  The limited number of tables means that you'll always ALWAYS receive piping hot fries and food. NUM!

Definitely a winner winner, grilled cheese dinner.  YUM!
author: Rachael S.

description: Stopped in here for breakfast and got the veggie breakfast sandwich, which was quite tasty!  They also threw in an apple for free.  Woot!  I'd definitely come back here again.
author: Chris L.

description:
I'm not one to crave grilled cheese sandwiches, but this place was GOOD. 

It was busy on a Saturday afternoon (also game day) with the line out the door and patio packed with folks. A friend and I placed our orders and were able to snag a table as people were standing up (you gotta be a little aggressive). It then took between 5-10 minutes to get our food. 

I ordered a Mousetrap w turkey, tomatoes, pickles, and jalapeños...yummmm. I figured since I don't make it out to the city too often, might as well get the works. To drink, I ordered their Strawberry Lemonade which was one of the drink specials of the day. And oh, the meal also comes with a cute little apple.

Great first visit to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen! I will be coming again to try the Mushroom Gruyere. 

Note: be prepared to pay those parking meters, it aint cheap!
author: Camille B.

description:
I've been here for lunch a few times and while it was good, it wasn't earth-shattering to me. However, I just went there for breakfast and I now realize what I've been missing out. 

What makes breakfast so good? The freshly baked muffins and cookies. There might be other pastries but I didn't see them. These are some of the best muffins I've had in months and I've already had two in a week. 

Oh to the grilled cheeses. They are very well done in the sense of good flavor and not too oily. They have it crispy with all the cheesy melts deliciously sandwiched inside. A must try!
author: Peter T.

description:
Disturbingly delicious! I'm a mac n cheese freak! I love cheese more then I love breathing air, almost...
The neighborhood is awesome. It doesn't get better, the hooting of giants fans from the bar/ restaurant across the street, friendly people everywhere, young old and all In between, plus they make their own soda and have different interesting favors that one wouldn't even think of. It's far away enough from downtown to where you can almost for a second forget your in the city, but rather maybe a smaller little wine country-ish town.. But not so much that you would feel that eerie heartbreaking panicked anxiety of actually venturing away from our beautiful city. 2Thumbs up!
author: Nicole A.

description:
American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is located in a really cute neighborhood in SOMA, right down the street from South Park (...no, not the TV show). The restaurant is small and there was a line out the door around 2pm on a Friday afternoon. A few bar seats inside the restaurant, and a nice patio with a few tables in the front. 

I wasn't sure how serious my friend was when she asked if I wanted to go to a grilled cheese restaurant, I was thinking are you really asking me to pay for a grilled cheese? 

I got the $9 Foghorn Leghorn -- Point Reyes blue cheese, creamy havarti, Zoe's Roasted Chicken, arugula, dill-dijon mustard on artisan whole wheat. I was expecting like whole roasted chicken, but it was actually slices of roasted chicken. Pretty good sandwich, definitely worth it. 

Next time I really want to try the Mac n' Cheese Grilled Cheese, that idea is brilliant!! Mac and cheese inside a grilled cheese, who would have thought? I also referred a friend to AGCK, she absolutely fell in love with the place. I'll definitely be back.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I LOVE cheese. So it would make sense this is where I would want to go when visiting San Francisco. Actually, I found this place from the cooking channel and since I was headed there for a short visit, wanted to find it. Heads up: it's at the corner of the street, connected to what looks like a residential building. It's easy to miss if you don't keep your eyes peeled. It's a small, but interesting and modern restaurant. Order your sandwich and then sit outside. 

I ordered the Jalapeno Popper sandwich, which was pretty good but the spiciness first brought out the flavor and then completely overpowered it. All the sandwiches come with a plum, which I thought was pretty unique.

My friend ordered the Foghorn Leghorn, which was amazing, and my other friend ordered the Mushroom Gruyère, another amazing sandwich. It was out first visit here and I feel like every sandwich would not disappoint. Try this place out if you LOVE cheese! I definitely want to come back next time I pass through the city.
author: Shar C.

description: It was just average, nothing to get your hopes up over.i wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again it was a bit boring and lacked flavor impaired to all of the other reviews that raved it was amazing.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I love this place!  I mean, who doesn't love a grilled cheese sandwich...but with a twist! 

The mushroom gruyere is my fav!
author: Jo Jo H.

description:
The lines can get pretty long here but the food is great every time I've been here.  I usually come here for breakfast as it's close to where I work and sometimes I end up skipping it because I'm running late.
The breakfast sandwiches are great and the runny yolk (optional) just makes it so much better.  
I rarely come here for lunch only because it's busy, but I do come if lunch ends up being later.
author: Ed G.

description: Had the mushroom gruyere and it was quite tasty! I really appreciated the complimentary bowl of tomato soup and the apple at the end to cleanse the palate before heading back to #TheOfficeLife. My only gripe would be that for a simple, medium-sized sandwich, paying over $10 just seems a bit much. Will be back to try the other cheese combos! I also thoroughly enjoyed the chalkboard with cheesy movie puns written on it - great comic relief.
author: Andy L.

description:
When the grilled cheese fad hit a few years back I tried, "Melt" which sucks and immediately judged this place but these Grilled Cheese are actually excellent.The mushroom Gruyère is wonderful. 

Do come in and enjoy. There is a 92% chance I'll return.
author: Justin S.

description:
Walked up to the register and ordered the Farmer's Breakfast: has cheddar, applewood-smoked bacon, roasted potatoes, chive butter, and an easy over egg on top. It looked amazing, but the egg had already run by the time it got to me, and tasted a bit bland until I added generous squirts of Tapatio. I'm never sure how much tip to leave for these types of places where you bus your own table, so I just rounded up to the next dollar.

The guy who gaves us our orders was nice, though he initially gave us someone else's order at first, couldn't tell us what it was, then came back 5 minutes later (after 2 people at our table already poked it with their fingers) and gave it to a table behind us. Lucky for that table, the 2 people are clean and illness-free, but that seems pretty unsanitary to me. And I imagine the sandwich had already cooled by then. I feel bad for that table.
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description:
Went early in the morning for the first time to try out the famous mac and cheese sandwich along with the turkey/bacon! What can I say? Very simple ingredients, yet so delicious in every bite. Also comes with an apple for your guilty pleasures. Complementary water on the side as well. Easily a ten dollar meal though. These sandwiches are leaning more on the expensive side to me. But if you can afford it, why not let it fly...shoot, I'll come here a couple times a week if I was always in the neighborhood. 

All in all, if you haven't tried this place out yet, you should! They definitely have a lot of varieties on their menu you can choose from.
author: Darrell N.

description: Oops posted my review for Harrison/20th location here...will have to come try this one some time and hopefully it's as drool inspiring. How can you go wrong with grilled cheese (oh wait, The Melt...they turn it into bland uselessness).
author: Donna L.

description:
I've been meaning to go here for months and I finally had the opportunity to make a pit stop on my way to the game. I love the atmosphere of this place. Kind of a homey feel to it. Cozy and warm and welcoming. Actually the atmosphere was probably my favorite part. A lot of giants fans stopping in before the game. 
I liked the variety of different grilled cheeses they had, but the main two on my list that I wanted to try, they were out of. Wtf! So I sucked it up and got the turkey club. It was good, but nothing special. It was something that I could definitely make from home. With that said, it's definitely not worth the price. I got the club turkey and a strawberry lemonade for $13.50 or something like that. Way too much for what you're getting. But I would still go back to try the ones I wanted to try in the first place, so hopefully next time around they will be available.
author: Gabby S.

description:
I have been dying to try the mac & cheese grilled cheese for quite a while now, and it definitely did not disappoint! 

My friends and I popped in for a quick breakfast one Sunday morning. We all ordered the Farmers breakfast and a coffee. The sandwiches were delicious and very tasty and we all enjoyed our food. We sat outside and watched the world go by whilst the sun shone. A nice way to start your Sunday in a fun informal atmosphere. Would I go back? Absolutely!
author: Pablo R.

description: Came here for the Grilled Mac & Cheese before heading to AT&T park. It's a short walk maybe half a mile to the Cafe'. The employees were very pleasant and upbeat and knowledgeable of the menu. We had viewed the menu online prior to visiting and decided to go with the Grilled Mac & Cheese and the Mushroom and Gruyere. They were both delicious, however the Mushroom was much more flavorful. The bread was fresh, perfectly grilled with a lil butter and the sandwiches came out hot! We also had a mixed green salad and the tomato soup which were both delicious. I did like how the prices included the tax so u knew exactly what you were paying! We would return for delicious food that was fun, tasty, and filling!
author: Calloway C.

description:
While the food at this cafe is ok with prices to match, the appearance and general cleanliness of the outdoor eating area, one of its apparent attractions, is definitely unappetizing.  This place just looks, well, - unhygienic.  

OK - I get its SOMA not Paris - but a little attention to cleanliness is not too much to expect for a cafe.  At lunch on Sunday there was considerable litter, plastic wrap and loose napkins blowing around in small circles in the eating area, there were crumbs, spots of ketchup and general debris on each table, the external patio area where they put the tables has very heavy grease stains ground into the concrete - this place is definitively suffering from an apparent lack of cleaning, and to put a cap on it all, the compost and trash cans located very close to the eating area had no lid or cover on them, adding a matching fragrance to the otherwise dingy ambience.  

Recommend a regular cleaning of tables, pick up of litter, and a scrub of the concrete in the outside eating area with hot water and disinfectant.
author: Maria W.

description:
This joint has a great vibe, partly because of the nice set-back from the freeway on ramp that is Second Street, partly because its close proximity to South Park, partly because it looks comfortable, and mainly because of its awesome service. I wish all restaurant service was like this place. The people who work here are just so attentive and appreciate a good pun about cheese. This is the kind of service where they call you by your first name and recognize that you are in the same party as the person who stood in line before you who they also remember and refer to by their first name.

The grilled cheese sandwiches are a bit much, I think. The bread is fried to a crisp and oil just on your whole hand even if you picked it up with two fingers. There is no avoiding it. Just know now that oil will get on your hand no matter what. I've tried the piglet, the farmer's breakfast, and the mushroom gruyere. All were good. The piglet and the farmer's breakfast were similar, though I liked the farmer's breakfast more. The eggs in these breakfast sandwiches are not consistent though. One was more overcooked than the other. The lunch sandwiches will come with a little side of fruit, which I am thankful for.

Obviously, you should get a grilled cheese sandwich here, but also get these things:

The crab mac n cheese ($5) was so decadent. I know some might only reserve this term for desserts, but this cheesy mac was quite so. There was plenty of crab meat, plenty of cheese, and plenty of macaroni. The whole thing fit in a little take out box because I think it's meant as a side, but the whole thing weighed like a really heavy brick. It felt like that in my stomach after I ate it too.

I am in love with the housemade sodas they have, which is served from their vintage tap. I've had the grapefruit pink peppercorn and the meyer lemon lavender. They are just as good soda flavors as they are ice cream flavors. They have some zing to them. The peach iced tea is delicious too. They have this during the late summer when peach is in season. Also served are a couple beers on tap, mimosas ($4), De La Paz coffee ($2), and some bottled/canned drinks in the fridge.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Are the grilled cheeses good? Do they take like 25 minutes to make? Yes and yes.

Great place to go to if you want a world class grilled cheese for $10 and have plenty of free time.

The Jalapeño popper sandwich (made with jalapeños, onions and a couple kinds of cheeses) is good with just the right amount of heat.

They have biscuits in the morning but they are a bit too exotic for my taste.
author: Tyler C.

description: Great food ! Had the mac n cheese grilled cheese wit avocado but only negative was the customer service !! Very rude & sarcastic.
author: Jessica B.

description: Came by here for lunch, the ordering process was efficient. The staff was helpful. Got our food and walked down to south park to eat there. The sandwich was very good, but quite costly for the size of it. The place itself wasn't very good to eat in, but the park is nice. I did get a half and half which wasn't very good.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Oh Cheese, my love...so tasty on so many things, especially when grilled between two crunchy tasty slices of bread! 

This place is awesome! They specialize in grilled cheese sandwiches (although they do have a variety of other things on their menu, such as soup, salad, and other sandwiches). We came here for lunch with a group of four yesterday and our friends had been before, it was my first time. I would highly recommend a bowl of their tomato soup for dipping purposes as well. yum yum! Ooey gooey three cheese goodness...I highly recommend trying it out!

I got the mousetrap grilled cheese sandwich with roasted tomatoes on it...cheesey deliciousness is surely what it was! You should totally try that! You can also add bacon on it if you wish. 

As much as I loved it, I will say that it would be best to avoid this place during lunch, unless you are getting your food to go. There aren't nearly enough places to sit inside or outside. A lot of people standing all over the place and there is construction right across the street. It was one windy and loud lunch, but we managed because we were so engulfed with our food.

Service was great, they prepared it relatively quickly with how busy it was, the staff was all smiling (which is always a plus!) and they brought our food to our table outside. Prices are appropriate for a nice lunch like that and I would highly recommend checking this place out. Next time I come though, if it's at a busy time, I will get it to to go, but if not, their outside area is nice to sit at.
author: Akvile D.

description:
This place is an Atkins nightmare.  But figuring I never cared for diets and low carb anyway, I love this place.  I took the kids today to try it out, which is really my secret way of checking out several sandwiches all at once.
