We ordered a Mousetrap http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=gtVomV7c0Yq9q8dFXPvIGg, a Club Turkey http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=AFCoUPN4JWDtSooRlwfuug, and a Mushroom Gruyére http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gxb1-SxUSEIskQg-nNcO-A?select=xc14XpNMUK86I-7Rgf3mpg and boy were they delicious!  They came out to us still melty hot that you could see steam coming out of them still.  The bread was nicely toasted and had a great crunch to it.  While the mushroom was my favorite, I did love the bacon flavor in the club turkey.  

Next time a cold rainy day comes, I'm heading down here for a grilled cheese and their tomato soup.  Does it get any better than that?
author: Maria S.

description:
Items selected:

Lemon Blueberry Muffin
Breakfast Piglet - sharp cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter

Hungry for a snack between sessions at the conference and having seen American Grilled Cheese Kitchen while waking past AT&T Field earlier that morning I decided to stop in for a quick bite largely because the location was convenient and the concept and sourcing seemed sound, but unfortunately the 'pros' of the restaurant only went that far as the signature grilled cheese was good but not terribly inventive or rave worthy when compared to the likes of Cleveland's MELT or other artisan grilled cheese shops.  Well priced at $5.50 for the sandwich and accompanied by a large lemon muffin chock-a-block full of fresh blueberries for another $2 one could certainly do worse for lunch or a snack near the ballpark, but then again in San Francisco one could also do much better.
author: Michael U.

description: Really good breakfast! Might go back for lunchI know it's just grilled cheese but you have to try it, you won't be disappointed promise.
author: Sean D.

description: Great little grilled cheese shop. Pretty good selection of different sandwiches. The staff was very friendly and courteous. I'll definitely go again when I'm dying for a grilled cheese. Very fast service too.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
2.5 STARS

I was pretty eager to give this place a try, so you can imagine the disappointment when the food did not live up to expectations. The beau and I came here and we shared the mushroom gruyere sandwich, which included fontina, gruyere, thin slices of potato, wild mushrooms, caramelized onions, leeks, and thyme butter. To say the very least, the sandwich was underwhelming and not very flavorful. There were plenty of tiny bits of wild mushroom and cheese, but the rest of the ingredients were little to almost absent in taste. The bread was extra crispy and great, but other than that...nothing to write home about.
author: Lien T.

description:
Wait what? There is a place that only serves grilled cheese?! My dreams came true on that fateful day in March when my friend told me this place existed and i had mission out on years of Cheesy goodness. As someone who grew up on a farm and actually milked freaking cows I have a deep love for it.

Also as someone not from California I had no idea this was a chain and there were more than one. I went to the one near the ball park and there are a lot of great places to check out in this area. AGCK is near 21st amendment and is a perfect complement before you go and grab a beer next door. 

There are surprisingly a lot of grilled cheese choices at this place and only one of them is just plain grilled cheese which when coming to a place like this there is no way you are going to get that! My grilled cheese had apricot and a little bit of spiciness. It was a great combination of spicy and sweet. The sides were equally good as I took in the SF staple kale salad. The service was really quick and the sandwich was great. You also get a free apple or orange with your sandwich as well. 

You know what you are getting when you come to a placed named after grilled cheese but it surprisingly a varied menu with a ton of options for grilled cheesy goodness. Prepare for some never before combinations and additions to your favorite staple from home and if you are in the area it will be one of your go to spots for a quick lunch on a sunny Saturday.
author: Nick R.

description:
Why 3 stars?  Because it was exactly A-OK.

   ---   ---   ---

I would like to visit TAGCK (do they really call it that?) again because I would much prefer to try the Mac-n-Cheese Grilled Cheese or the Club Turkey, but I was too early for lunch on the day that I checked it out.  I found my Farmer's Breakfast Sandwich to be fine, but just nothing that caused me to jump for cheesy joy.

It's probably my fault, really.  For some reason I had it in my head that this was less of a vegan-happy spot, and more about serving up meat and cheese in between grilled bread.  You know...like a good ole' southern style menu with ham and beef and brisket...and all kindsa grilled cheese?  Now, that....would be awesome.

But I can't fault the Cheese Kitchen (I like that nickname better) for their business plan, considering that 10 extra seconds of research would have corrected my false assumption about the menu being meat-heavy.  Maybe I should give myself a lower rating?

It's official, I'm now only a 4 until I can redeem myself.
author: Brett N.

description:
Still amazing. The piglet=heaven. 
The grilled sandwiches are super flavorful but not too greasy, which is great! My husband always gets the mousetrap which is Delish too! 
It came with a mini apple this time. Yummy.
author: Sooze E.

description: Grilled cheese - yum.  The Foghorn Leghorn was very tasty.  It had creamy havarti, Point Reyes blue cheese, Zoe's roasted chicken, arugula, dill dijon mustard on artisan whole wheat.  The mushroom gruyere was also very good with fontina, gruyere, roasted wild mushrooms, roasted potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain; also great to add bacon on this sandwich.  The smoky tomato soup was good too, being served warm with creme fraiche and croutons.
author: Jason G.

description:
We were on our way to AT&T park to watch the SF Giants game and I saw this place on our drive over. I'm a huge cheese fan so I was salivating as we drove by. 4 stars. Almost 1,200 reviews? DUH No brainier. After the game we walked up 2nd to The American. Mind you... I already ate a hot dog at the game and shared a crab sandwich. 

We went in and it wasn't that packed since the game wasn't entirely over. There was a lot of different choices on the menu so it made it hard to decide. I didn't want too much since I wasn't too hungry. My boyfriend and I decided to get the standard mousetrap and add roast beef. (I wanted to add bacon but I let him have this one). 

He also ordered a Pilsner which was on tap. I stood a few minutes for some stools to free up since it was super windy outside. We sat down and about 15 minutes after we ordered our melt arrived. 

It was good. I liked it. Maybe I didn't add enough ingredients? Maybe I should have pushed for the bacon? It would have been amazing to add avocado if they had it to make like a BLT-A. Either way it's a grilled cheese that I know I could make on my own. Also, I asked for a side of the horseradish dipping sauce. I hated it. Boyfriend loved it. I don't personally like horseradish. Great plus that they had hot sauce on every table and on the table tops. 

Overall: would I recommend? I wouldn't go out of my way to tell anyone to make sure and make a pit stop. Was it bad? Not at all. It was good but I think I just ordered the wrong thing or needed more flavor.
author: Ida A.

description: Yummy!  The food was so delicious we didn't even talk  much,busy eating. I had Turkey , My husband had pork and my daughter had the classic. The hand stirred soda is made just right, not too sweet. The  Staff was very welcoming and friendly.
author: T P.

description:
Their menu has many spins on the traditional grilled cheese and they all sound so intriguing. Me and my girlfriend ordered the Jalapeño Popper, the Mushroom Gruyére, and a bowl of the smokey tomato soup based off what other yelpers found good.

We both wanted to enjoy our orders, especially after waiting in a long line to order. My girlfriend LOVES grilled cheese, but overall we were both disappointed. In my opinion the tomato soup was the best thing.
The soup was sweet and sour, yet had a very smokey taste that was just right.
The Mushroom Gruyére was definitely better than the Jalapeño Popper, but both weren't mind-boggling delicious to rave about. They were okay, but I feel like I should have just sticked with my first choice in the Mac-n-Cheese.

This place is good to grab a snack with friends or just for a quick on-the-go meal. The pricing isn't too bad. If I were to go back, I'd be sure to order something different though. Cheers!
author: Alex N.

description:
The menu has something for everyone  . My roommate it is totally  addicted to cheese.   When ever I need to score some brownie points this is the perfect spot to pick up a ham and cheese sandwiches . Their soups are to die for as well. Yesterday I had a great Split Pea Soup that  hit the spot. If your in the mood for comfort food this is a great place in the soma.
*There are  some local  beer and wine chocies. 
*Outdoor seating is available. 
*There are quality salads on the menu.
author: nicole s.

description: Grilled mac and cheese delicious make sure to add bacon!! Tomato soup very zesty with a nice little kick to it. Also for a fresh strawberry which was very sweet. Customer service very solid and friendly. A great spot for any grilled cheese lover. Atmosphere is fun too
author: Wes J.

description:
Wow the quality has taken a nosedive.

I used to love this place and would rave it to all my coworkers as the best grilled cheese spot in the city. I can't say that with confidence anymore. I don't know when it happened, but the quality of the food has really gone downhill. 

The super thick crunchy bread was somehow replaced with regular ole sandwich slices that got soggy. The soup was a lot smoother and tasted less authentic than normal too. My previous experience a few months ago was totally fine - something must have happened between then.

It still tastes better than other places (ie. The Melt) but I can no longer waste my money on mediocre sandwiches. It's sad because this was one of the few places that kept its integrity as a good restaurant in the SOMA area but now it's degrading fast to "just another lunch spot."
author: Mira K.

description:
Glad we found time to make it over here! We stopped in for lunch on Monday, and it was definitely lunch hour, because they were very busy. I think we waited about 25 minutes for our sandwiches, but it was worth the wait. 

My friend had the Mousetrap -  cheddar, havarti, and monterey jack cheese. Plain, but really good. I enjoyed her sandwich a lot.

I had the Mushroom Gruyere - fontina, gruyere, mushrooms, potatoes, leeks, caramelized onions and thyme butter. Anything with leeks I am a huge fan of, and this sandwich was no exception. Heavenly, perfect, amazing...just an awesome grilled cheese sandwich.

Lunch for the two of us was less than $20. I'm sad that I don't live in San Francisco to eat here more often!
author: Randi B.

description: I have been here a couple of times and both times were equally great. I ordered the mouse trap and the tomato soup. Their gluten free is thick but really good. The Mac and cheese grilled cheese is like the ultimate in comfort foods and eating it feels like being a gourmet kid. The staff are also really friendly.
author: Paul D.

description:
We showed up here right as they were closing, yet they were happy to let us come in and eat while they did their clean up process.  +1 for you already.  

If I am going to pay $9 for a grilled cheese, I expect something I wouldn't (or couldn't) easily make at home.  If I'm eating out, I want it to be unique.  

I ordered the Jalapeno Popper (Local chevre, Monterey jack, apricot-jalapeno relish, Zoe's applewood-smoked bacon on levain).  

High end cheese, quality bacon, and a sweet / spicy blend that was spot on.  This was picture perfect to me.  I loved every bite, and could have easily put down another. 

Perfect.

5 Stars.
author: Drew M.

description:
When I was in college and attending the Public Safety Academy, I was poor and relied on Grilled Cheese Sandwiches as one of the few items to satisfy my hunger. I made the grilled sandwich with a creative mixture of ingredients including "nasty" government cheese. YUCK!

After a 17 year hiatus without eating a grilled cheese sandwich, I found a place in the downtown area that changed the way grilled cheese are made from what I suffered when I was younger. 

For my Friday lunch I ordered the Club Turkey sandwich. For $9.00, the sandwich comprised of Sharp Cheddar cheese, Havarti cheese, slices of smoked turkey, strips of bacon, specialty mustard, roasted tomatoes and leaves of arugula. My first grilled cheese sandwich in nearly two decades is worth the wait for this place and it never did tasted this good when I was younger. The entire key ingredients combine blended in well. 

I also added a cup of refreshing Ginger Lemonade for $3.00 and a bag of Dirty Kettle chips for $1.50 to complete my lunch.  

I took my lunch to go and ate my meal in South Park near my work car. 

My Visa was accepted. 

A grilled cheese sandwich never tasted so good. I'm glad I found this place.
author: Matt G.

description: Went here because it was listed on a gluten free website. They do offer 4 varieties of sandwiches but you can't change cheese or options. Ended up with the mushroom one, it was ok. We had two sandwiches, one beer and one rootbeer almost $34. Wasn't impressed enough to eat here again.
author: Sherrie W.

description: Little bit of everything - breakfast and lunch grilled cheese style. Soup. Salad. Beer. Coffee..... Grilled cheese options galore. Food is good. Service is a bit slow but the people here are super nice and work hard. Indoor / outdoor seating.
author: Ben C.

description:
Been dying to try this place. How can you go wrong with grilled cheese sandwiches? The space is awesome. Love plenty of outdoor seating for nice days like today. 

I ordered the Mousetrap (Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough $6) and Piglet (Tillamook sharp cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter $8).

See: http://media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_4Y2TRFemQ1oe6w7ogEn0A/l

It's a matter of personal taste. I enjoyed both but the Mousetrap is more traditional. The piglet has ham which I found to be better if you were hungry. 

I'd definitely go back for when I am craving something from my childhood. 

I love that they had real ginger ale and cola. 

Definitely a yuppy crowd, but that's SF and not necessarily a bad thing.
author: Carlos A.

description:
2 stars may seem harsh, because it was a decent sandwich, but the description "Meh. I've experienced better," sums up my experience perfectly. 

I just ordered the basic Mousetrap and was not blown away. I could tell the ingredients were fresh, but it was almost too fancy for my tastes. I prefer my grilled cheese with less bread (however good it is) and that fake googy melty American "cheese product." I can see why people like it, it has substance, it tastes real. I like that it comes with fruit (an apple) as a side. You have to really blow me away if you're competing with something I can make easily and cheaply, the way I like it, at home. Maybe I should have tried something more interesting than the Mousetrap, but I doubt I'll return to give a different sandwich a chance, there are too many other places to try first.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen has been on my mind since I started my job a few blocks down on 2nd and Townsend. It was on my mind when i got my free grilled cheese at the Melt. So when a coworker suggested we come here for lunch, I was so happy.

You should have seen me in line. My coworker was extremely annoyed with me because I kept musing aloud about how much I was looking forward to my mac and cheese grilled cheese. I would not stop talking about. On the way back, I wouldn't stop talking about how adorable the take out box was. It is adorable, by the way; it's the perfect size and shape for a grilled cheese and two strawberries. So cute!

My grilled cheese, however, was disappointing. It was something that I could have made myself, and I'm no chef. Easily not worth the $10 that I paid for the sandwich. The bread was tasty but nothing extraordinary, and the mac and cheese tasted like it came from a Kraft box.

Oh, and I had an enormous stomachache afterwards. I'm so disappointed! After looking forward to trying the Grilled Cheese Kitchen for so long, I won't be back.
author: Christina S.

description:
We came in for dinner right before a Giants game.  There was a decent sized line around 6:30 - it probably took us about 15 minutes to get to the front.  I had the jalapeno popper and my friend had the Club Turkey, both with tomatoe soup (of course).  Everything came out pretty quickly, in about 5 minutes, and tasted good.
However, considering that there was really nothing very memorable or special abou the grilled cheese, it was certainly overpriced at $9 a sandwich and not worth the wait.  
I am glad I tried it, but the next time I'm craving a grilled cheese, I think I'll make it at home .
author: Gloria N.

description: In the back of my mind, I'm thinking couldn't I make this at home?  But hey, the grilled cheese with mushroom and gruyere was super tasty, as was the smoky tomato soup with those ginormous croutons, and the housemade lemonade.  I had a bite of my friend's jalapeno popper and it was spicy!  I liked it all, even if it's something that I could probably make at home.  I'm coming for you, Piglet!
author: Peg S.

description: Grilled cheese is something you made as a kid as an after-school snack (for me, at least), so I was skeptical about patronizing for something that I can make. I'm pleasantly surprised how amazing their sandwiches are and yet so simple. Definitely get a tomato soup to use as dipping your sandwiches. Also service was great and I went back for three iced tea refills with no attitude from the staff. I'm definitely going back for more!
author: Michelle R.

description:
I was getting some work done in South Park and my friend called me up for some lunch in the area.  We decided to walk around the block from her work and check out the hip grilled cheese joint there.  Known for the long lines, I had high hopes for this concept ever seeing it on America's Next Great Restaurant and couldn't wait to give it a try.

I ordered the mushroom grilled cheese and my friend had the basic grilled cheese with tomato.  At $10 and $7 respectively, these were definitely not cheap eats.  The only "side" they offer is an orange cutie, but that definitely didn't make it a value meal.  One of the biggest concerns from the show were the turnaround times, and I can tell you that they were pretty long.  Even with tons of sandwiches pre-prepped (not sure how I feel about that), they still took forever to receive.  Once they arrived, the mushroom was delicious while the regular was kind of plain and boring.  Iono, I definitely don't think I could eat it every day and I felt a little bit unsatisfied after the whole thing.  Once you add sides and drinks, it gets downright expensive.

On the bright side, the patio is very pet-friendly and they welcome your dogs to join you any time.  The lines can get kind of ridiculous during lunch so it's best to come early.  Not my favorite lunch spot in the area, but at least the mushroom grilled cheese was tasty.

Food: 7/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Came by before a ballgame and we lucked out that there was almost no line! The cashier was really cheery and friendly. They had a so many mouth watering choices, but I was torn between the mac and cheese and mushroom gruyere. But mushroom always wins, and that's what I went with.

Food came out at a so-so pace, although there was no line there were a few orders in front of us. There was outdoor seating but it was all taken since it was gorgeous outside so we sat inside watching the guys prep our sandwiches.

The grilled cheese sandwich was the perfect combination of ooey-gooey and crunchy. I Don't like onions, but i didn't mind it at all in my sandwich. The roasted potato was an interesting but welcome addition. One of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've had! I highly recommend stopping by this place if you're in the area, and it's not too far from the ballpark.

My friends got the piglet and the jalapeno popper. THey really liked the piglet, but didn't care for the jalapeno popper too much. Don't forget to buy the pickles for $1.50, they are a must with your sandwich!
author: Teresa N.

description:
I love the story (and romance) of the childhood classic tale, Snow White.

But, here it is in review form.

The Prince came across a dead body in a forest, surrounded by dwarves and decided to make out with THE DEAD BODY... he made out so hard that an apple in the throat became dislodged (only one part of the male anatomy can do that and its not a tongue)... In short... The dude was a necrophiliac.

How does this relate to a grilled cheese sandwich? It's just a grilled cheese sandwich? Any human with two (or even one) hand can make one. So what's the big fucking deal?

American Grilled Cheese is a romantic tale and it's the best grilled cheese sandwich in the forrest, or yeah, the SOMA.
author: Jeri T.

description: Stopped in here on a cold day. I ordered the plain grilled cheese sandwich, which was tasty, though not anything particularly special. It was served with strawberries, which I really enjoyed.  Picked a spot at the counter, and it looks like all the sandwiches are pre-made and they just grill them when you order them. For a $7.50 piece of cheese between bread slices, I would hope for something a little more fresh.
author: Kendall S.

description: Love love love this place. The Cubano is to die for!  Had a bit of some other sandwiches and they were good but this is what I come for.
author: Sonny R.

description:
I am in LOVE!!! No lie! The mushroom gruyere was heaven in my mouth. I never had a grilled cheese like that. I ordered it and didn't eat it until I got to work in Walnut Creek and it was DELICIOUS. That only leads me to believe that if I had eaten it immediately it would have been THAT MUCH BETTER!

My review does have a sad story though, and it's unrelated to the establishment. I was so stressed at work I only had time to eat half my sandwich. I decided to save the other half for later (I could reheat it once I got home). To my demise, 30 minutes before I went home my office was attacked by ants!! They swarmed all over my sandwich! It was the most depressing thing ever! I must return and have full sandwich.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I really like this spot.  It's great for a casual meal with tasty food of course! I had the mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich, and I opted to add some bacon to it.  The bread was cooked well, and the mac & cheese/bacon combo was awesome.  I also had their roasted tomato soup. It's like combining the joys of being in elementary school all in one place!

My only tip would be.. have one friend search for a table as soon as you can.  Their outdoor seating is limited, so have them sit down and order for them if you can.
author: Tom N.

description: After a disappointing experience across the street we decided to head over here to grave a beer and something to eat.  Food was great, atmosphere was great, and the service was exceptional!  Thanks for the great experience!!!
author: Jenna S.

description: Great little sandwich spot. I went there for breakfast and the breakfast popper was delicious! Had a little kick to it which I enjoyed.
author: Gaurav K.

description: It was a tough choice between the jalapeño popper grilled cheese and the Mac & cheese grilled cheese. But we chose the Mac & cheese with pulled pork! It's delish nice and cheesy!
author: DeAjanae G.

description: I've tried other grilled cheese places but this one really takes the cake. A must in SF.
author: Ashley N.

description:
I got the mushroom gruyere while going to lunch at my internship. It tasted great, high quality everything, but to me it wasn't really anything too special. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again for this sandwich specifically, but maybe would to try one of their other creations. Would definitely recommend this to others!

I like how the theme of the place is grilled cheese too, imo America needs more places that only focus on making different variations of one food item really well.
author: JoAnn C.

description:
I know what you must be thinking.  "It's frickin' grilled cheese.  How difficult can it get."  Oh, I beg to differ.

I ordered the Mousetrap, which consisted of sharp cheddar, havarti and moneterey jack cheeses.  The boyfriend ordered the Jalepeno popper, which was goat cheese with Jalepeno-apricot jam.  Also ordered the tomato soup.  Everything was delicious.

According to my boyfriend (who's quite a chef himself), you can tell this place uses high-quality cheese because it's not dripping with grease.

BONUS POINTS for the free tangerines.  How cute is that?!
author: Christine A.

description:
Fast service, polite servers, and solid food.

Grilled Mac and Cheese Sandwich-Pretty good, although it could use a little more salt. The bread is toasted, the Mac and Cheese is gooey, and the sandwich is hot and fresh. 

Mixed Green Salad-Tasty! Delicious vinaigrette!
author: Yanni L.

description:
I'm a gal who loves her cheese! Been dying to try The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen for awhile now, and was ecstatic to find out that they're open on Saturdays! Woot!

I came here to try some fantabulous Cheesey goodness after getting a relaxing mid-morning pedi!
Cozy spot where the staffers are friendly, efficient, and hard at work cranking out soups and the cheesey sammies. BTW they also serve draft beer. Oh, and even some tasty breakfast sammies and pastries.

I ordered The Mousetrap with Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough and added applewood smoked bacon. Sounds delish, doesn't it? Pairing it with a cup of  piping hot tomato soup (and croutons) was absolutely divine. Oh Mylanta -  the crisp sourdough with the oooey gooey cheese and smoked bacon. I died and went to Grilled Cheese Heaven. Thank you Jesus!  
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA&select=zuSOe-DWZ-xpsdPuBMqc0g

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA

My mate ordered the Piglet Sammie with sharp cheddar and apple mustard and cured ham, and was most definitely satisfied. They were kind enough to give a dill pickle on the house.

Gotta love their Cheese Board, so come prepared with your best Cheesey sayings/puns - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA&select=AdaUpYrVXBai5DSZp27k-w

I'll be back to try some of the yummy baked breakkie goodies and of course more cheeserific goodness. Prices are a bit high, but it's comfort food at its finest, my friends! You must check out the digalicious AGCK!

Cheers to Cheese!
author: Gill C.

description:
Maybe the food is good, but I'll never know. They don't need any customers.
That was the message I got loud and clear from an employee.

Sure there's a line to order. Okay, might be worth it, I told myself. There were six of us still in line and they were very busy. Then a guy comes in the door, and grabs an employee telling him that he wants to place an order for 16 sandwiches. Asks if he can just give HIM the order instead of standing in line. 

The employee asks if the sandwiches are all the same or if there are "specials". The guy says that there are things to be "added" to many of the sandwiches.

The employee, a burly young man with curly hair says, "Sure, just step over here and I'll take your order."I watch the jaws drop of everyone in line. 

The man in front of me in line, asks the guy who wants 16 sandwiches, "Why can't you just get in line like all the rest of us!? We've been waiting here already."

Then the employee gets surly and says they're going to do the line orders and the 16 sandwiches all at once. 

We stare in disbelief. Then the employee adds...***** "And you can leave if you don't like it!"

I did. 

They obviously don't need your money, ....or the individual customers. They just need a lot of people ordering 16 sandwiches.

Shame on them.

Too bad there's not a way to give them NO STARS.
author: Coleen M.

description:
Roughly two years ago at WWDC I remember getting a grilled cheese sandwich at a stand and remembered it was from the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. I had gone back twice and fended off a sea of men waiting for the delicious bites. 

Flash ahead to last week, I was meeting a vegetarian friend for lunch and some light shopping and midway drive up, after swearing that they should pick the restaurant while I commute up, I thought about WWDC and grilled cheese. 

Luckily my friend was very happy to let me choose the restaurant and off we went. It was far too cold to sit outside and definitely something that is missing from this restaurant is heat lamps for their outdoor seating area and opted to sit inside.

For once I ordered a meatless sandwich because it just sounded better. Half sandwich order of the Mushroom Gruyere with a side of smokey tomato soup. Fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms, gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain bread. Soup was a sour tomato with a hint of smoke and the creme fraiche spelled out the word "Soup" in my bowl. Kind of amazing all around. The sandwich itself was super tasty, perfectly thin slices of gold potatoes and once dipped into the soup, heaven sent on a cold day. Also served with our lunches was a perfectly placed tangerine that still had a branch and leaves on it. 

Great small touches, and delicious bites made this carnivore almost thinking twice about needing to eat meat ever again, as the meatless options sounded even better than the ones with meat.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Whenever I pass by this place before Giants games, it is super packed with a huge line.  I was here the other day down the street from here and upon walking to the front, no line!  I had to take advantage of that.

I got the breakfast piglet, the only breakfast sandwich that offered meat inside the sandwich.  I could had gotten the farmer's breakfast sandwich but that one includes potatoes and bacon in there which was a bit too carb-heavy for me.  I got an iced coffee as well with my meal.  

Unlike a burrito, grilled cheese absolutely needs to be eaten ASAP and it was absolutely tasty!  The salty cheese and ham with the zesty mustard with the right amount of crunch from their bread was perfectly made.  The over easy egg made it a bit messy to eat and I usually am not a fan of over easy eggs...but the yolk really blended well with the cheese.  For any runny yolk haters, give the yolk a chance on the breakfast sandwiches.

The same sandwich is on the lunch menu for $3 more and it's without the egg so I'm most likely coming back here during breakfast hours again.
author: Ben H L.

description:
I think I just need to accept that mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwiches will never have enough cheese for me. (Hint hint: that's what I tried there.)
I really liked their tomato soup, a must with grilled cheese. It had a slightly smokey flavor to it, and the croutons were very seasoned. 
I was disappointed with my mac n cheese grilled cheese.
I'll probably come back for more, but with a simple grilled cheese next time. Their housemade lemonades looked delicious. 

There wasn't much seating inside. Decent amount of tables outside, but I don't like birds. Pigeons everywhere. San Francisco, place with bread, what a shocker.
author: Trang B.

description: Excellent sandwichesI had the a Reuben sandwich it was perfect. My friend had the turkey and both were grilled and just enough cheese and superb. The front counter girl was exceptionally nice and had a very friendly manner. The cooks were young and food was coming out of the kitchen in 8 minutes or less. I would highly recommend this establishment if you want a warm sandwich and a hot bowl of soup. Next time I am going to try a salad. Thumbs upprices were great.... Enjoy!!!
author: Janet M.

description:
It's a cute little spot to grab lunch. I got the mushroom gruyere and their chicken pot pie soup they had for the day. What's great is that they have an option of their red white and blue plate, where you can choose a small sandwich with a choice of soup or salad for a reasonable price and a nice portion. The soup came in a much larger bowl than I expected and was definitely full after finishing my meal. 

Just a warning sitting outside in the shade on a windy day can make even a nice sunny weather cold with napkins flying around.
author: Jane K.

description: On a weekday afternoon when I was craving for a grilled cheese sandwich this place was my savior. I had the Mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwich. The bread tasted so good but the sandwich wasn't that great for me. It did not have the gooey texture, Macaroni was kind of obstructing me from eating the grilled sandwich heart fully. I would definitely come back a try a different one.
author: Sailaja B.

description:
Ricotta be kidding me! 

My love for cheese has me on a quest for the holy grail = the perfect grilled cheese sando... 

4 days, 2 visits, 1 sammy...I'm a changed woman. 

The first trip was average (Friday night), didn't quite live up to the glory of its name or reputation. They have cajones for naming it TAGCK, people expect a lot, well at least I did. The highly anticipated Mousetrap with Bacon wasn't anything to rave about. It was good - bread was grilled nicely, the blend of the 3 cheeses was tasty, the bacon was average...I couldn't get excited about it, tho. Almost every sip of the homemade peach lemonade I ordered left me making bitter beer face :( 

I love the setup, quick, efficient, yet cute and alluring. The comfort level is on par with how a grilled cheese should make you feel, homey. By far, a group fave was the cheese puns they have listed on a chalk board. Seriously, we were saying them all night at the Giants game...and laughed harder as we kept saying them...no, we were not drunk either! 

Forward to Tuesday night - as a coworker and I were discussing our lack of happiness from our first visit to The AGCK, we stroll past the sign outside that says the special of the day: Mac-n-Cheese Grilled Cheese. We literally stopped in our tracks. We contemplated this for about 5 seconds...and immediately ordered one. The creamy mac-n-cheese was perfectly slathered between two perfectly grilled pieces of toast. The mac-n-cheese was creamy, gooey, and the perfect hint of comfort. 

Everyone deserves a second chance, right?!?
author: Steph G.

description: There's not too much you can complain about when it comes to some good 'ol American grilled cheese. I've tried a few different one's and on my last visit there, had the mac n cheese. You literally can't go wrong here. My only advice would be to maybe share. It can get a bit too much and a bit too cheesy if you go all out. Typically I'd rather have half a sandwich and one of the soups or bag of chips.
author: Leina K.

description:
I am a piglet.

So at the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, I got my namesake sandwich.  The "Piglet" was full of some of my favorite ingredients: carbs, butter (with herbalicious rosemary), and cheese (Tillamook sharp cheddar).  Throw some savory ham and subtly sweet apple mustard into the mix, add some heat, and voilà!  An oozy, toasty, and satisfying sandwich that squeals gourmet comfort food.  The Tomato Soup with homemade croutons is a deliciously simple way to get in some veggies.

Comfort food is best enjoyed in cozy environs and AGCK brings it.  The clever milk bottle light fixtures, the unique wall display of cute cheese related knick knacks, and blackboard of cheesy jokes made me want to linger long enough to grab something sweet from one of the glass jars on the counter.  Hmm Chocolate Chip Cookie or a Blondie Brownie?  Maybe both.

You know how we piglets do.
author: Amy C.

description: Yummy but unsanitary - they touch everything with their hands and are rude when you ask them to handle the food (like the strawberries) with utensils or gloves after handling the cash register and their phones.
author: Molly S.

description:
Went to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen on Sat 3/19/11 after walking around the SF Ferry Bldg Farmers' Mkt.  It feels like a long walk, but it was probably less then 2 miles.

Got there & since it was raining nobody was eating at the outdoor tables.  Indoor it's warm, but not much seating.  A bunch of counter seating on tall stools & one table near the door.  

I got the Mousetrap $6 w/ Smoked Applewood Bacon $1.5 + $4 tomato soup.  I liked it all.   Very yummy & comforting.  A Cutie fruit given too.

I charged it.
author: Ann L.

description: I accidentally checked into this place when I meant to check into the other location, but I can still say the grilled cheeses are AMAZING! So mouthwatering and the bread is toasted and buttered to absolute perfection. And this is coming from a person who thinks grilled cheeses are just "eh."
author: Hana B.

description: After a long weekend of shenanigans, my friends and I hit this spot for a cure and were incredibly pleased! The mac n cheese grilled cheese was perfect. The strawberries were a great touch. The waiter even gave me and my friend a bowl of tomato soup which was also super tasty. Although I got lectured by a cop for leaving my phone unattended, it was a good experience. Definitely coming back for more!!
author: Bharathi G.

description: This place is so overrated. I ordered the mac n cheese sandwich. The max was cold while the sandwich itself was overdone. I was so disappointed especially since we were really excited about visiting this spot after seeing the restaurant featured on Unique Eats. For two sandwiches & drinks, our total came up to $26. Ouch!
author: Menith S.

description: Dank af. Down to earth employees with a menu offering exactly what I'd want with (and on) a grilled cheese. 10/10 would come back.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Awesome!! What a simple yet ingenious concept. Take the most American lunch and blow it up! Find yourself standing in front of a menu with different variations of the grilled cheese sandwich and pair it with a soup and a salad. 

Ten bux for a sandwich with a soup or salad. Not bad for a SoMa lunch, and it's located right in the heart of the tech junkie part of SF - perfect for people like me who need something uncomplicated and quick to order. 

And it's utterly delicious - my mushroom and gruyere was such a great combo and my additional caramelized onions (really, a must) was a perfect add on. Dip it in tomato bisque and my stomach is all content.
author: Sally C.

description:
If I went vegetarian, this would be one of my #1 go-to places.
We order online and then show up for pick up.
The place is kept clean, with a very modern/industrial look. 

I've tried some of the sandwiches here, & here's my separate ratings for them:

Mushroom Guyere: 5 -- juicy sandwich overall, creamy sauce inside
Moscone: 3 -- tomato taste is strong
Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese: 4 --  mac n cheese is too filling so it's quite overwhelming

i'll continue to update this as i try out everything else on the menu :)
author: Rose L.

description: My company treated us to lunch today and u guessed it... American Grilled Cheese was our destination. After watching the movie "Chef" I was inspired to try my fist Cubano. It is a pretty tasty sandwich. I love food and will always give my honest opinion. The pulled pork is just right. Full of flavor. The bread is nice and Krispy on the edges... yummo!!!! Would I order again? Heck yes!!!!!
author: Devone W.

description:
This is where my American dreams come true for grilled cheese sandwiches! 

I've always rubbernecked this place every time I pass by it on my way to pick up Philz by the ballpark. "I'm going to try this place one day!" is what I say to myself EVERY time I pass by. 

Well, I made good of that recently and went to try this place out. 

I got the Jalapeno Popper with a side of smokey tomato soup. I can't even fathom the right words to tell you how delectable it was. The bread was toasted and flakey to its most perfect state. The cheese in holy matrimony with the jalapenos with the right amount of heat so you get the full enjoyment of the sandwich without having your taste buds seared off. 

This is now my favorite place for a grilled cheese sandwich. 

WORD OF ADVICE: If they have it on the menu, get the house-made ginger soda... My goodness this is good!!
author: Mike D.

description:
Went in to order to go order lunch at 12:15pm on a workday = crazy wait. Took approximately 40 minutes waiting and line and waiting for the order. Definitely ordering ahead for pick up next time!

Here's what I tried:

Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese -- take advantage of their hot sauces on deck!
Mushroom Gruyere -- tasty!
Kale slaw -- just okay

Grilled cheeses are always better when you eat 'em fresh off the grill. All and all, I wish there was more cheese on. They were tasty, but felt more like paninis.
author: Steffie H.

description:
2.5

"Could've been so beautiful.
Could've been so right...."

What the effervescent chanteuse aka Tiffany is trying to say is (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LzGss9QGAk) my experience TAGCK should have... could have... been so much better. As it was, it just... was. Everything sounded better than it tasted. 

I mean... a grilled cheese kitchen! How can that be anything but awesome? I'll tell you.

1.) A crowded, cramped and small dining room that leads customers to seek table refuge outside... only to find small, unclean tables is not a way in which I'd like to start a meal;
2.) The black currant drink was watered down and the fruit flavor was more of a hint than front and center. I get that black currant can be an overpowering flavor but I think it's fair to assume that if one orders it, one isn't concerned with the dominating nature of the fruit. If I'd wanted water with a hint of fruit, I would have hit the tap and grabbed a lime wedge;
3.) The turkey club (cheddar, havarti, smoked turkey, roasted tomatoes, bacon, stout mustard,  and arugula) sounded like it should have rocked my world and it did... not. My sandwich was more bread than anything else and the dominating flavor (is it wrong to expect cheese to be at the forefront) was dry turkey and mustard. The havarti was lost in the sandwich and the cheddar was more afterthought than star. When I heard my tablemates complain about the mac & cheese grilled cheese (mac & cheese stuffed into a grilled cheese sandwich; how can that be bad?), I knew it wasn't just me. 

I don't know whether it's the childhood memories or the line out the door... but the expectation level here is high and I found myself more in love with the names and descriptions than anything I actually ate. When you're at a restaurant, this is a problem. Bring it home, Tiffany...

"on a cold and lonely night..."
author: Johnny T.

description:
Great selection of grilled cheese options. I had the American dip which was the roast beef with horseradish sauce. I thought it was a bit too oily and salty for me but nothing to put me over the edge. The bread was had a bit of a hard texture to my liking BUT nonetheless my coworker had the tomato soup which he said was delicious. I'd like to try to the salads next time. 

Neat place, perfect type of food for chilly SF weather. Great decor and ambience.
author: Tammy K.

description:
Mushroom Gruyère and Tomato Soup = Awesomely delicious!

I love cheese and I love mushrooms....soooo mushroom grilled cheese! Although this place is a bit pricey, the grilled cheese and tomato soup were great for some mid-day comfort food.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
So good! Seriously woke up craving a grilled cheese, one of those hard mornings where nothing will satisfy but the perfect proportion of grilled bread and melty cheese, so my friend took me here. YUM.  Literally all you want on a plate after a long night.

Try: mousetrap with tomato and jalapeño. But be careful cause these jalapenos are supes hot.
author: Reyana F.

description: Great spot. Searched Yelp and went with this great spot. Glad we did. Food & Service A++
author: Frank M.

description: Get the Farmer's breakfast sandwich but  only sold till 10am. Take a seat in their outdoor seating and soak in the sun
author: Robin L.

description:
My favorite place for a grilled cheese and soup.
I love this place.  They've even got some wine or beer if you feel like it.  
Service is quite quick even if you have to wait in a bit of a line.  
Great place for lunch and stuff.
author: Laurel C.

description: Good. Friendly.  Lunch is probably best to experience their flavors, breakfast was OK though.
author: David M.

description:
My office ordered lunch for everybody from the AGCK and I had the Red, White and Blue Plate Special.

Jalapeño Popper: The sandwich obviously would have been best right after it was made, say if I was eating at the kitchen as the cheese would be all warm and melted. While my sandwich wasn't in the exact state I would have liked it to be after delivery to the office, I found that the sandwich was spicy and had jalapeño flavor in each bite. I got the sweetness from the apricot in the relish which was too much for me but the salty bacon helped a bit to balance this out. I definitely appreciated the creativeness of this sandwich. The sandwich is considered a "small" size as noted for red, white and blue plate special but I thought it was pretty sizable. Also, I got 1 strawberry with my sandwich which was a little sad. 2 or 3 pieces of fruit would have been nicer. 

Smoky Tomato Soup: I was scared to try this because my one and only experience with tomato soup was unpalatable. The smoky tomato soup was anything but my past experience, and was deliciously flavorful and just bomb with the croutons. 

I would definitely get the soup again and try another sandwich.
author: Maya S.

description: Great customer service super friendly. Outside seating is perfect for when it's sunny. Grilled cheeses come with an orange or you can add a side salad or soup.  This place doesn't have fries like the other locations, but on the bright side they serve mimosas :)
author: Angela M.

description: Looked like a good place to eat, I can make a better grilled cheese for ten bucks. I ordered the mac and cheese sandwich , horrible. The girl serving brought 3 out of 4 orders out, said she made a mistake, we had to get back in line to reorder, everyone was done eating by the time the 4th order came out. Don't waste your time & money here. IN n Out Burger has a better grilled cheese for the price. The people in San Francisco don't have a clue what a good grilled cheese taste like.
author: Frank P.

description: I love a good classic grilled cheese sandwhich..... nice and cheesy.   The homemade pickles were good.  Little spicy for me but good
author: Lanee B.

description: Ordered the mac and cheese and the reuben. I'd say the mac and cheese was a 4 star and the Reuben was a 3. I think the prices were a tad high for what we got. I really like grilled cheese so it'd be hard to fully disappoint me. I think if the reuben had more pastrami in it I'd give this place a 4 star rating. Would I come back? Maybe.
author: The Denius J.

description:
All of the other reviews are pretty accurate.  This is an entire restaurant dedicated to America's favorite sandwich, the Grilled Cheese.  

The menu is vast, there's daily specials and they are pretty inventive with the flavor combinations.  My personal favorites are anything that mixes sweet and salty, which they have a lot of.  We both enjoyed our sandwiches during an early lunch on our way to AT&T Park.  Each meal comes with a sandwich, chips and a drink.  There's a few soups on the menu, as well, and some other things I didn't really pay attention to.

Close to AT&T Park (awesome) as well as the Bay, so you can hang around and enjoy a sunny day by the water with a belly full of cheesy goodness.
author: Jenna S.

description: Extremely underwhelming, the only time my sandwich had any flavor was when I got some of the "stout mustard" which I guarantee was not spread evenly on the sandwich. And their handcrafted strawberry hibiscus soda was mostly soda water and very little strawberry hibiscus! Super disappointed
author: Katherine W.

description:
My 1400th review... EGAD! Fourteen hundred! I'm getting a hernia thinking about it... my 1400th review is a patriotic, pre-4th-of-July salute to a temple of melty goodness, an enclave of edible delight, a palace of palate-piercing pleasure. Sounds good, huh... Well, Grub Street referred to this newly opened South Park café as a "grilled fromagerie". Oh my. Grilled cheese sandwiches have come a long way since my day when it consisted of two slices of Mrs. Baird's white bread and a Kraft American single, all slathered with Bluebonnet butter.

I was fortunate to be invited to a Tillamook Love Loaf Tour party at the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen last Thursday and am happy to report that the classic grilled cheese sandwich has come into its own as a culinary sensation among erudite foodies and grab-and-go workers alike. Combining industrial-chic architecture with 1950s-style kitsch, the place is ideal for its highly mobile customer base with an expansive patio as well as seating indoors.

There are eight different specialty sandwiches, three of which were served that evening - the Classic with medium cheddar and jack as well as roasted tomato; a heartier sandwich called the Piglet with sharp cheddar, smoked ham, apple mustard and rosemary butter; and the most audacious, the Jalapeno Popper with jack, chevre, bacon and an apricot-jalapeno relish. They also served Bacon-Cheddar Brioche bites, Savory Bread Pudding with mushrooms, and in an ode to days of yore, Smoky Tomato Soup shooters (see photos).

Heidi Gibson, a record-holding Grilled Cheese Invitational winner, is the chief menu architect and owns the place with Nate Pollak. They serve specialty wines and beer, and also homemade sodas such as vanilla ginger mint and pomegranate lemonade. Try the self-proclaimed Killer Butterscotch Pecan Blondies. They're not kidding. Nowhere does the menu serve my mom's grilled cheese sandwich but give it time. Prices for the sandwiches range from $7 to $10, and it's open for weekday lunch but will expand to breakfast, evenings and weekends very shortly.

FOOD - 4 stars...artisan grilled cheese sandwiches...tasty despite the pedigree
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...slacker hipster or corporate climber would feel comfortable here
SERVICE - 4 stars...very nice and attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...I've graduated to gourmet grilled cheese
author: Ed U.

description:
* Club Turkey
Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos, arugula. $9
- great crisp to outside of bread, though it was a little oily. love interplay of flavors, from tangy tomatoes to slightly bitter arugula to crunchy bacon
author: Ziyan C.

description: We had been here several times and always thought good things. Both our breakfast sandwiches were not good. I wish I would've taken a picture. Both eggs were cooked over hard, zero runny yolk. Also, more importantly, neither sandwich was actually grilled. The bread was buttered and placed on a warm surface, but there were neither color or crunch to the sandwich. As we were inside, and had a view of the window where freshly prepared orders were placed, we saw all of the sandwiches were like ours. Very disappointed. The reason for 2 stars? Service, as usual, was friendly and the muffin was delicious.
author: Laura P.

description: I went here mid-week to take a meeting. I ordered water and a bag of chips - selection was ok and the teller was polite. My food was fine and this place seems like a comfortable cafe place to relax in SOMA. However, this is a 1 star review because one of their staff members took a very keen interest in our conversation - we looked over at him obviously hovering but he didn't get the message. Eventually, we said to each other "we'll move" and he was listening so intently he interjected with "You don't need to go". Overall, it was a very bad experience. I wouldn't recommend visiting this place.
author: Ash R.

description:
Date & Time:  Monday May 31, 2010 @ 11am
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Groups of Giants Fans & Urban Condo-Dwelling Couples in James Perse Tee's, Cashmere Hoodies, Hudson Jeans & Sneakers
Vibe:  Energetic
Music:  Rock
Decor:  Industrial Chic w/ Country Charm.  Blue & Brown Palette.  ChalkBoard Menu.  Wood & Matte Stainless Steel Counter-Seating.  Dining Al Fresco on Inox Tables for Quatre
Service:   Cute, Friendly WaitStaff
Imbibe:  HomeMade Soda Today's Libation:  Spiced Pomegranate.  All Cash Bar
Devour:   The Red, White & Blue:  Tomato Soup w/ Creme Fraiche of Salad w/ Choice of Grilled Cheese Sandwich, MouseTrap(3-Cheese), Reubenesque(Pastrami) & ButterScotch Brownie
Total:  $29.50
Note:  Happy Memorial Day, Everybody!
author: Genevieve Y.

description: We got the mushroom grilled cheese and the piglet. Even though i consider myself as a meat eater, i like the mushroom one much more. We got the strawberry lemonade and it was refreshing. The thing that i like about this place is that they gave you some fruit to your order so it is like a way to cleanse your pallet after the "cheesy" meal
author: Natalie L.

description: I got a Mac n cheese sandwich for $8/$10 and came with strawberries(odd thing with sandwich but nice). Awesome sandwich! First time trying a Mac n cheese and loved it. Staff amazing aswell, great place!!
author: Daniel M.

description:
The FOGHORN LEGHORN (Creamy havarti, Point Reyes blue cheese, roasted chicken, arugula, dill-dijon mustard on Artisan whole wheat) and the SMOKE TOMATO SOUP is the perfect symphony of grilled cheese and tomato soup. You can never go wrong with grilled cheese and tomato soup! 
It's located near the Giants stadium in SF, so I recommend coming here for lunch or grabbing food for to-go to eat inside the stadium!
author: Stefanie K.

description: This place is amazing! I never post yelp reviews but this place deserves it. The food was amazing, service was quick, and the entire staff was so nice. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone!
author: Sarah G.

description: Located in the SOMA district, The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is a great lunch spot. Indoor and outdoor seating is available at this small restaurant. I ordered the half mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwich and bowl of soup for $10.50. In my opinion, it was a little pricey for the amount of food I got but I was happy to not walk away with a to-go box. My friend only got a grilled cheese sandwich but enjoyed my tomato soup so much that she went back up to order one of her own. One thing I did not like, is that I could see into the kitchen and saw all the premade sandwiches sitting on the counter waiting to be grilled. Overall, a good experience and I would go back to the this grilled cheese factory.
author: Meredith R.

description: Pipin' hot grilled cheese sammy and warm tomato soup on a rainy SF day is PERFECTION. Just the regular grilled cheese is fine with me... no need for all the extra fancy additions. The tomato soup is creamy, yet light and smooth... oh so good. All orders come with a cute little clementine. You can order a full sammy and side of soup or get the red, white, and blue deal of 1/2 sammy and soup/salad. They aren't opened for dinner, so come during the day to get your comfort food fixing in.
author: Mindy D.

description:
Favorite favorite favorite place to get fat on grilled cheese sandwiches! I don't even care because I'm too busy nomming away happily. The sandwiches here are so much more interesting than those served at The Melt or other places. Too bad this location is a little out of the way from where I live or else I would eat here every day. My all-time favorite sandwich is the Mushroom Gruyere, but on my most recent visit, I decided to give the Jalapeno Popper a try since I like spicy food. There is bar stool type seating inside or they have tables and chairs outside. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have hooks under the counters to hold bags and jackets!

What I ordered:
- Jalapeno popper with mushrooms ($9): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-american-grilled-cheese-kitchen-san-francisco?select=PKT0Uc7NJqj1YWBKmsa0Tw#PKT0Uc7NJqj1YWBKmsa0Tw

I asked to substitute the bacon in the Jalapeno Popper for mushrooms (since I love the Mushroom Gruyere), and the woman at the register was very accommodating! She was a bit hesitant since she was wasn't sure that the mushrooms would mesh well with the jalapeno since they are already seasoned themselves, so she suggested that I get the mushrooms on the side and add them myself if I found that the combination was good. Very thoughtful advice! I actually did end up liking the mushrooms in the sandwich though! 

However, I was surprised to find that the grilled cheese had quite a potent spicy kick and subsequently drank a whole bottle of water and ate the tangerine on the side in a desperate attempt to cool down the fire on my tongue. Good thing they provide a little fruit on the side of the sandwiches! I thought I had a decent spicy tolerance, but I was defeated this time. I still enjoyed my meal though despite this hiccup because you can tell that they use quality ingredients and the cheese is sooo tasty. 

TIP: There's a secluded, quaint little park down the street on South Park, which would be perfect for having a grilled cheese picnic at!
author: Jessica C.

description: Awesome food. We had the Mac n cheese grilled cheese and tomato soup...DELICIOUS!! The strawberry lemonade was very tasty as well. Wish they had offered diet coke but I have no complaints!
author: Marlena H.

description:
I LOVE grilled cheese sandwiches but honestly, this place was a little overrated & overpriced. I tried the mushroom/gruyere sandwich, tomato soup, and bacon mac & cheese. All of that came out to about $20. 

Mushroom/gruyere: The sandwich had potatoes inside it. And they were mushy, so it made the texture a little weird. But the flavor was good. I wish they added some truffle oil or something - that would make it a little more worth it & more scrumptious. I also wish the sandwich came with a side, like fries or potatoes. Instead, it came with a tangerine. Interesting.

Tomato soup: Tasted like it came from a can! Campbell's tomato soup can! Def do not recommend!

Mac & cheese was prob my fav. However, the cheese hardened on the top making it hard to eat. So I just ended up eating the macaroni below it. 

Overall, I'm glad I finally got to go here & I think it's good to try once, but I probably won't be back. Plus, the wait for the food was kind of ridic - atleast 15 mins, with limited seating inside/outdoors.
author: Alysha K.

description: Had a great lunch here today. The strawberry lemonade was delicious. Ordered a jalapeño popper grilled cheese, nicely toasted and great flavor. Sandwich comes with an apple which is a nice addition. Would definitely come back to try the other types of sandwiches.
author: Josue V.

description: I tried my first ever mac and cheese sandwich here, and wow delicious! Yum! Yum! Iv'e been here twice and got the same thing, and the staff is always super friendly! Parking is difficult, but of course, considering their location. Recommend!
author: Hoku L.

description:
Absolutely adore this place!

My friend told me about this spot a while back and I finally got a chance to try it on our way to the SF Giant's game. WOOOOO GO GIANTS!! We wanted to grab some food before the game and grilled cheese was the way to go! When I walked in, I noticed cute cheese decorations all around. They even used spatchulas as door handles on their closets which I thought was such a unique touch to the ambiance. 

When I was looking at their menu, their grilled cheese all looked so delicious but, I decided to order the Club Turkey! It had Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos,  and arugula in it. YUM! When I took the first bite, this buttery goodness just melted in my mouth with all sorts of the vibrant flavors. It is definitely one of the best grilled cheese I have ever had! Guess what?! It also came with a fresh plum which was such a pleasant surprise! Super sweet and juicy too! I was really happy with my food and I am for sure coming back to try more!
author: Junie Y.

description:
Came here the other day for lunch.

Pros (+):
(+) Great location, right in South Park
(+) Indoor and outdoor seating, dog friendly
(+) Friendly staff
(+) Fairly good selection of grilled cheese sandwiches to select from, or you can make your own
(+) The little apples that you get - so cute, and so yummy

Cons (-): 
(-) I had the mushroom one. It was okay, but lacking in some sort of punch
(-) A bit pricey for what you get, but that's to be expected
author: Tiffany C.

description:
The highlight of this place was seeing David Lee of the Warriors trying out a local eatery.  The only reason I realized he was there was because his tall frame was blocking the hand written menu on the wall.

I was surprised that there were only 6 sandwich options to choose from, I guess I was expecting more variety.  I got the jalapeno sandwich which I did not care for because the cheese tasted like cream cheese spread, instead of slices of melted cheese.  My sister got the pesto sandwich, which I enjoyed but I though would have been even better with bacon.  My dad got the turkey melt, which I thought was the best.  Overall I was happy to try the place, but I would not come back and wait in a line for a sandwich.

Back to David Lee, he got a sandwich and tomato soup.  He was such a gentleman and gave an older couple his table and he was really polite.  I definitely got a new heartthrob!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I don't like cheese, but I like grilled cheese sandwiches, is that weird? 

Got the jalapeno popper sandwich here for lunch the other day, and it was tasty! Surprisingly spicy..very crunchy, hot and toasty. Nomsies.

But I still think the grilled cheese I had in New York was the best, the best I've ever had...
author: Yannie S.

description:
I had the disappointing mushroom gruyere grilled cheese with tomato soup. the bread on the sandwich was way too crunchy. I'm assuming they grill it with butter, but it didn't taste like butter to me. if they aren't grilling it with butter... why not?!?!?

in my opinion, they didn't have enough stuffing in the sandwich. minimal mushrooms, two thin slices of potato, and not enough cheese to create that great "stringy mess of goodness" when u pull the sandwich apart.

the tomato soup was on the sour side for me. watery and sad. I wanted to like this place... but couldn't.
author: S J.

description:
Yes! It is that good. Yes! It is worth it. Yes! I will be back.

Be prepared to clean your own table and sort your trash, compost, liquid and recyclables.
author: Nathan B.

description:
I went in yesterday to get lunch for some clients and coworkers. The cashier was wonderful and helped me interpret their order and she was very sweet. Everyone working seemed in high spirits! 
   I returned later that day after my boss spilled his tomato soup and requested another ("I've got to have my tomato soup!"). I went and ordered another soup. The woman who has previously helped me asked how the order had worked out. I told her thank you, it was great except my boss spilled his soup, which is why I returned. They were so sweet, they gave me the soup for free! So, now, I'm in love and excited to go in and get lunch from them today! Thank you for your kindness and excellent customer service, AGCK!!!!!
author: Ariel B.

description: Not too bad.  Can get a little pricey if you're not careful, but the quality was high. Had a chance to taste both the Turkey Club and the Rueben.  Both were unexpected in taste meaning they had twist to these classics original recipe's and so while they didn't remind me of either a Club or a Rueben, the unique flavors were pleasing.  I would definitely go again and I would definitely choose over the other SF grilled cheese restaurant that I'm not that big of a fan of.
author: David B.

description:
I'm kicking myself.

I got the Gruyére Mushroom, and almost everything about it was lacking.  The potatoes lacked flavor, there was no trace of the leeks or caramelized onions, and the cheese was just too mild. Adding a bit of salt helped bring out the flavors, but it was still mild overall.

On the plus side, the bread was toasty and the mushroom "spread" had a great mushroom-y flavor.

The reason I'm kicking myself is that I know I like strong cheese flavors, so I should have known the cheese would be mild in this sandwich.  But I didn't know the rest of it would be disappointing as well.

I'll have to try the Jalapeño Popper, minus the bacon. Next time, Gadget!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Definitely get the Mac and cheese grilled cheese and tomato bisque. Nothing better than enjoying a classic meal with a slight twist
author: Aaron C.

description:
Mushroom Gruyere - 4STARs, from the look, the smell, to the taste. All good.
Jalapeño Popper - 4STARs
Smoke Tomato Soup - 4STARs, smokey, tasty.

Really not much need to be said. Consistent across menu, GOOD.
author: SP Y.

description: Loved it! This place gets busy so it takes a while to get your food. I guess it was good for them, though. It caused me to order a beer while I waited.
author: Mark G.

description:
Dog friendly!! Always a plus!
Blackberry lemonade was awesome, smoked tomato soup was great, mac and cheese grilled cheese was tasty, the jalapeño popper was not our favorite. I definitely would go back and try other sandwiches or breakfast...mmm...gooey egg. 

But $30 for 2 grilled cheese sandwiches, soup, and a drink? eeep.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I wanted so much to like this place. I already tried The Melt in Burlingame and was disappointed, but I heard this place was better because it took the classic grilled cheese and added a gourmet twist.

I randomly thought I'd finally give this place a try for lunch and take a sandwich to-go on my off day. Walking in, I checked out the menu (and consulted Yelp), and walked up to order a Jalapeño Popper. The guy at the counter was running around taking orders and serving up food, so when he asked me to hold on one second, I totally understood. When he returned and took my order, he gave me service with a smile. 

It was mighty warm inside so I stood at the doorway to get a bit of a breeze. About 5-10 minutes later, my order was ready and the guy called out my name and my order (keep in mind, he said "Jalapeño Popper"). He presented my order one of their takeout boxes and I was on my way. Now, I just assumed it was correct and didn't open it up until I got back to my apartment, but now I wish I had.

Inside was a pretty good looking sandwich accompanied by a plump strawberry. When I picked it up, however, I was disappointed. My Jalapeño Popper that was supposed to include: local chèvre, Monterey jack, apricot-jalapeño relish, Zoe's applewood-smoked bacon on levain. The sandwich I had in my hand had what appeared to be roast beef and potatoes inside! After looking at the menu, it looks like it probably was the American Dip (sans the dipping sauce).

I was hungry and didn't feel like walking all the way back to get my order corrected. Skeptical, I took a bite and all my fears were realized. This was not something I was going to enjoy. The roast beef was merely decent, the cheese was cheese, and the potatoes... Well, let's just say they need to be left out of grilled cheese sandwiches. I mean, it already has enough carbs from the bread anyways. By the second half of the sandwich, I was really feeling like throwing in the towel. I hate to waste food that I paid a good $9+ for, but I was over the same 1-dimensional cheesy taste that was neither complimented or cut up by the roast beef and/or potatoes. I'd like to think that if I had gotten my correct order, I would have been satisfied by the buttery, cheesy, bacon taste, but alas, I may never know. I don't think I'll be back for quite some time. Sad, especially since the guy at the counter was just so genuinely nice.
author: Leana L.

description:
Yet another basic American staple made gourmet by a bunch of fancy and/or hipster restaurateurs.

After the "mac and cheese place" (Homeroom), the "grilled cheese place" (The Melt), the "bread pudding place" (Schulzie's Bread Pudding) comes the "another grilled cheese place" called American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.

If you're seeking a simple fare of  cheese+butter+bread, then this place will satisfy your every craving. They do take the sandwich to a whole new level, offering gems like (ranked by my pick):
- Mac 'N' Cheese Grilled Cheese: would you like some carbs between your carbs?
- American Dip: Garlic/chives, jack, roast beef, potatoes
- Jalapeno Popper: chevre, monterey jack

I will say though, that the meal left me wanting more. It is a simple little greasy sandwich with a fistful of greens which doesn't qualify for a full meal and slightly overshoots the snack category. Didn't know where to place it except for drunken comfort food, where it duly belongs.

---

Distinguishing factor: You'll get the basic grilled cheese sandwich glorified, infused, enhanced, married, and mutilated all in one menu. God bless the USA!
author: Nick A.

description:
I love cheese!  And who doesn't like the comfort of a grilled cheese sandwich?!?  So, of course, when I heard The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen was going to open, it was immediately bookmarked.  Took about three months after it's opening to actually make it, but like i said, it's comfort food!  I wasn't in need of said comfort when they first opened so it took a few months.  

Gorgeous sunny day and parking was easy to find...I have to admit, I didn't feed the meter, and thankfully, I didn't end up getting a ticket.  Not that I recommend that by any means but, I'm just saying, that was the fact for me this day.  

Great patio area but we chose to sit inside.  Walk up to the cash register to place our order and then take a seat and wait.  Didn't take that long actually.  The Piglet with a cup of Smoky Tomato Soup at the counter where a bowl of fresh strawberries taunted me as a sat over them.  As we sit we talk to the workers and find out the owner is a grilled cheese champion.  You can even see some of her trophies up in the restaurant.  Pretty cool!!  How can I become one of those judges??

Food and service were good.  I'd return if I was in the area and needed some comfort food but definitely wouldn't make a special trip as I know I may not receive the same parking luck I received on that day.
author: Ninja H.

description:
I remember when this place opened summer of 2010 - the lines were long and it was cold outside (in August), so I passed it by. Today the weather is fabulous and the aroma from this small shop smells delicious.

After walking over to a bench in South Park, I opened my white compost made container, with the anticipation a delightful something waiting to greet me. One of my party balloons deflated when I saw the small size of my sandwich. For $9.00 it should have filled up the container, or they should have added a side of salad or fries or something. They did include a petite apple.. but that's not going to cut it, sorry.

The sandwich itself was very good.  I ordered the Turkey something...buttery, crunchy, Sourdough bread. The bread reminded me of the cheese bread from Sizzler.. remember that? Yummy !!  Crisp bacon etc., It could have been a little warmer, but the cheese was nice and melted in abundance.

Btw the apple tasted like one of those red one's that came with your lunch in elementary school. Ughh!

Meh...It wasn't terrible, but I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
I walked here on a rainy day to try out this place. I ordered

Club Turkey
Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos, arugula ($9.00)

The roasted tomato and arugula you basically get one small slice of tomato in the center of the sandwich and like two leaves of arugula. UHHHHH ok....

Then I noticed that the bacon was burnt (trust me, I have seen enough bacon to know that if the bacon snaps, DARK DARK brown color and dry). I am very very disappointed in this place. 

I like how they do give you an apple to keep you healthy. "An apple a day, keeps the doctors away!"
author: Erica T.

description: Too much oil and cheese. Taste super blant. Would have given 2 star, but they give two strawberries--to compensate.
author: Rahul C.

description: I'm pretty hesitant to go to grilled cheese places. I can make a pretty damn good grilled cheese on my own, and paying 6 bucks for bread and cheese kind of bothers me. Which is why, unlike places like Melt, this place has tons of stuff *inside* the sandwich. You're really ordering a panini that's done on a flattop instead of a panini press. I got the veggie special. It was good. Service was quick. Free water. A good neighborhood option.
author: Samir K.

description:
What's better than an awesome grilled cheese sandwich? Not a whole lot. 

I came here at had the mushroom Gruyere. The wait in line was surprisingly long for this place which was kind of a bummer, but after I ordered and got my food, I was quite satisfied. 

I'm looking forward to coming back and having the jalapeno popper.
author: Cindy B.

description: Not bad overall. I went there for lunch today with my friends. I ordered the mac and cheese grilled cheese and a regular cheddar grilled cheese with a soda. My friends and I just thought the place was okay. I really liked the idea of a Mac n cheese grilled cheese, since I like them both. But the Mac n cheese was mediocre unfortunately. I feel like if they had better Mac n cheese, it would have hugely improved the taste. It genuinely tasted about the same as my regular cheddar grilled cheese. The service was fine, and stuff is priced meh. Like I said in the beginning, this place is just alright with lots of potential to improve. My friends agree as well, that we prob wouldn't go here again unless it's the only thing nearby. Since the food is legit mediocre and you can easily go to a lot better restaurants nearby or even try other places grilled cheese that might be better. 3 stars since alright
author: Theodore V.

description:
I've been here twice,
Once I had the tomato soup and cole slaw
And the second time I had the quinoa salad and the mushroom gruyere.

I'm generally not that picky with food but wasn't impressed by anything here. The salads were overloaded with dressing and had a gross bland taste.

The mushroom gruyere I was excited for because of all the reviews here but didn't find it that tasty.. The bread was too crunchy and it wasn't incredibly flavorful.

The tomato soup was subpar.

-EDITED-

Decided to try a third time.

The third time I ordered a breakfast sandwich that didn't have any cheese in it on the menu. I also specifically told him I was lactose-intolerant and didn't want cheese. I  added a lot of veggies to the sandwich. He confirmed with me to make sure he had the order right.

It wasn't until I was back in my office I realized the sandwich not only didn't have the add-ons I ordered, but also had cheese in the sandwich. 

Extremely disappointed.
author: Siri W.

description: This is the best grilled cheese sandwich ever. I ordered the turkey club with bacon and the house lemonade. Great combo. They also give you fresh strawberries with your sandwich which is kind of cool.
author: Sean G.

description:
I took my friend from Australia here.  It was too hilarious because she kept saying how she's so surprised how much food Americans eat and when she saw the size of this sandwich, which I thought was normal, SHE THOUGHT IT WAS HUGE!

Seriously made me realize that we Americans do like our food. Greasy and bad for you but damn good comfort food and this was what it was. 

If I was back up in the bay, I would mos def come back :)
author: Samantha N.

description:
Who knew that grilled cheese could be so damn good.  So, this is my guilty pleasure to hit up for breakfast once in a while.  The Breakfast Popper is one of the best damn things on the planet.  It's spicy, with just a touch of sweetness that makes it amazing.

If you want to hit this place up for lunch, do so!  The lunch is fantastic as well.  I'm not sure what they do to their sandwiches, but they have to put crack in them....just keeps you wanting more.  

Their muffins are meh, but the rest of their food is AMAZING.
author: James G.

description:
I just ate the mac-n-cheese grilled-cheese sandwich, and I feel like my heart is palpitating.  I suppose it's what I should expect, but the amount of grease is astonishing.

They give you a small apple, which is cool.  The tomato soup with croutons also tasted good.
author: Niniane W.

description:
I'm not really a fan of grilled cheese sandwiches.

That said, it was a cool day in the City and a good day to get a hot sandwich and warm soup.

I had the Mousetrap Grill Cheese sandwich for $6 and the Smokey Tomato Soup for $4.

For me, the Mousetrap tasted like your pretty typical mixed cheese (Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough) sandwich.  It was good; but, not worth a special trip.

When they serve the sandwich, they tilt the halves to make it look more attractive.  But, since the cheese is warm, a lot of it runs out of the sandwich.  Personally, I'd rather they just serve it flat so the cheese stays inside the bread.

The soup was OK and a nice compliment to the sandwich on a cool day.  The best part was the chef spelling out the name "SOUP" in cream on the top of the soup.  It was a nice creative touch that brought a smile to our faces.  Thanks!

I also liked reading the cheese puns on the chalkboard.

Overall, it's a solid place for lunch.

For me, the best (5 star) grilled cheese sandwhich I have ever had is at the Muir Woods Cafe http://www.yelp.com/biz/muir-woods-trading-company-cafe-mill-valley

And, the best (5 star) tomato soup is at Jasons in Greenbrae http://www.yelp.com/biz/jasons-restaurant-greenbrae
author: Roy C.

description:
I love the hipster vibe of this place even though I am the furthest thing from a hipster. The cheesy puns really won me over

All the beers we tried were great and I'm not even a big fan of beer.

Their macaroni and cheese in a sandwich is every cheeselover's dream. As if Mac and cheese were not already the  god of food's gift to mankind, then this taste of heaven sandwiched between perfectly toasted thick bread slices literally takes my breath away.
