A cool place to hang out and have a beer with a friend. Staff is super friendly!
author: Erin T.

description: It's across from street from my work, I always thought it was a sit down place but it's more of a express/cafe spot. a few grill cheese selections which were decent but...........it's grilled cheese. We also had a work event hosted by them nearby, again...grilled cheese sandwhich..............
author: Tiff W.

description:
I'm very critical when I leave restaurants reviews because customer service is everything to me. That being said, this place deserves 5 stars when rating the food and the employees. My friend ordered a turkey club and later realized that it had bacon in it. Since we don't eat bacon, we kindly asked Joseph to remake it and he was so sweet about it! A couple other male employees (who seemed higher up in management) offered for us to take it home to someone else so it didn't go to waste. Everyone is so kind and truly wants to make your meal me extraordinary.

Also before I forget, the food is hands down the bomb.com. You can't go wrong with a mousetrap with fresh jalapeños for a nice kick and a side of tomato soup! 

Overall, you can't go wrong eating at this place!
author: Sara P.

description:
First off - 5 stars is simply not enough!

Stopped by this place on my brothers recommendation before the Giants game last night.  Went in, looked around and asked what their most popular sandwiches were.  The guy behind the counter was friendly and helpful.  A+ for customer service!

My buddy and I split the Turkey grilled cheese and the Macaroni and cheese grilled cheese (with bacon at the counter guys recommendation - well, of course!!)  The food was brought out promptly and it was - in one word, AMAZING!

We hung out on the patio for an hour or so watching the 'scenery' walk by, and agreed that this is a must stop place before every Giants game.  

Do yourself a favor - walk the 2 blocks - it is well worth it.
author: Kurt A.

description:
I just tried The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.  It rocked.  For a few reasons...

1. The employees seemed happy.  Music was blaring, everyone was singing...AND the service was efficient.  NICE!

2. My Mousetrap Grilled Cheese was so yummy, so delightful, so crispy on the outside and melt-ey on the inside.  Just lovely.

Great little salad.

AND a cold sparkling water...Yay!  Not just sugary drinks.

I love this place. 

:-)
author: Kathryn K.

description:
This is what a trendy grilled cheese should be, delicious! Yes it's a $9 grilled cheese but it actually tastes great and walks the fine line between sophistication and nostalgia - a must if you want to charge more than $2 for a grilled cheese.    

The "jalapeño popper" is just right with its delicious but not overpowering jalapeño jam and bacon. Be sure to pair it with the smoked tomato soup - perfect for dipping! 

Presumably as a nod to childhood school lunches, you also get a small but tasty apple along with your order.

Seems like the line gets long at weekday lunch but moves fairly fast. Will be back at dinner time to pair my nostalgic cravings with some refreshing beer.
author: Ely L.

description: Awesome food, better service.....Love, Love, Love Emmy
author: Darchelle E.

description: Went Christmas shopping in Union Square and stopped by this place and much to my surprise, they have some amazing little bites! We absolutely loved the Cobbler salad. Everything is so fresh and I love the dressing. I had the American dip sandwich with roast beef. They have some horse radish dip to the side and that was surprisingly good also. My daughter had the grilled macaroni cheese sandwich and that was also really good. We'll definitely be back next time we're in SF!
author: Louie T.

description:
We had the Turkey Club, Mushroom gruyere, tomato soup, Mac n Cheese and the quinoa salad. The food was great. Their side portions are enormous. The sandwiches have a ton of flavor but are heavy on the  bread side. Quinoa salad was fresh, good texture but could use a little more flavor in the dressing. 

Overall food was great, service was awesome. The seating is definitely cramped. Would love to visit again.
author: Rohit D.

description: I've always been a fan of grilled cheese sandwiches so I was super excited to try this place. I got the piglet, which is basically a ham and grilled cheese sandwich. It was pretty great! However, the place was quite crowded on a weekday lunch and the food took a while to come. Also, as much as I love grilled cheese sandwiches, it was pricey (around $10 for a sandwich).
author: Aimee Z.

description: Do not go during Giants games. They gave the wrong sandwich to a guy in front of me and then they gave me my sandwich after 20minutes, which, as you can guess, was already cold. No Bueno
author: Marcelo D.

description:
Being suckers for comfort food, we recently decided to give this place a try.  We pulled up and there was a parking spot right in front..score!  We walked in and there was zero seats available...ouch.

After being tempted by various grilled cheesy menu options, I went with the Mushroom-Potato and a bowl of tomato soup.  In the time it took for our order to come up, I was able to stealthily hover around the counter area and snag a couple seats.  It was nice to successfully convert our forced to-go order back to a dine-in.

Overall, soup & sandwich were both good.  Spectacular though?...not really.  I probably would be inclined to enjoy this spot more if they actually offered different bread options.  If my sandwich was on grilled Texas toast instead of the TMJ-inducing Italian bread...then I could definitely see this becoming a 5-star spot :)
author: Justin L.

description:
You should know there are no tables inside.
It's a tiny, narrow restaurant with a few skinny counters and metal stools.
Unless you eat outside, this is not good for groups.

It's a great to-go place.

There are at least 7 small tables outside.

They do take credit cards.

They close at 5pm everyday. 
San Francisco: The City with Suburban Hours

There are no espresso drinks.
They have De La Paz coffee, organic tea and beer.

They also have a few hard to find sodas, like Faygo orange and grape, and Blenheim ginger ale.

This is not a gourmet version of American cheese on white; 
it's cheeses like Fontina, gruyere, bleu, etc., on hard-crusted sourdough-that kind of thing.

The vegetarian sandwiches sound just as good as the meat ones, which was nice.
I get jealous of bacon-eaters.
I wish animals were vicious assholes.

The employees are very nice.

On Sunday at 3 (no baseball game) there was lots of parking around the corner on Brannan.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description:
The verdict is in: grilled cheese is as good now as it was when I was 4. In fact, if my four year old self found out about this place, I'd be cutting class in kindergarten to make the mushroom gruyere happen just before nap time. 

And then, the cobb salad. The allure of two buttered slices of bread with cheese in between is a mighty siren call, but the cobb salad here is the great go between the regular all cheese diet and some sort of other diet that isn't as fun. Don't fear the line at 11:55. As long as the tables aren't full, you've beaten the rush and the prompt, kind staff will be right on it. 

Note: those housemade sodas are as delightful as "cranberry spice" and "hibiscus mint" sound. 

My next visit might just be a weekend morning for grilled cheese & mimosas.
author: Jon A.

description: The grilled cheese was amazing. Great selection of different variations, but if you are looking for the iconic bread, cheese, and butter this is not the place.
author: Amy T.

description:
perfect for mimosas and good sandwiches. I was there on a Sunday for lunch and sitting outside in the street enjoying a grilled cheese sandwich it's priceless. 

They have plenty of choices for vegetarians too ... and beers :)
author: Eleonora Z.

description: I remember when Melt was all the rage and really wanting to like them but being underwhelmed. After being a little apprehensive of trying another restaurant built around the grilled cheese sandwich, I am glad I did. I had the classic breakfast. It was pretty good. Probably not the healthiest meal based on how greasy my hands were after I ate but tasty for sure.
author: Sunil R.

description: I have a high hope because of high ratings. I have a mushroom with GRUYÉRE with tomato soup. My family have jalapeño popper and mousetrap and mousetrap with bacon. Mine and simple mousetrap were ok but jalapeño and mousetrap with bacon were better. I wanted to try Mac and cheese but today's choice did not sound good; Turkey and cranberries.
author: Hannah S.

description: First time here and I went for the Chicken, blue, arugula sandwich on wheat. Ridiculous...had about an inch of uncovered bread. No cheese, no ingredients, no nothing. I like the selection of salads and other sides. Service was fair, but the patio was a mess. I'm sure none of this is what the owners envisioned!
author: Joe M.

description: Great food for quite the bargain. Mimosas for $4 is one hell of a deal on Saturdays. This place is a perfect meal for a quick bite before heading to AT&T Park. I'm from Arizona so next time I'm out this way for a baseball game I'll be sure to stop by. Plus they have a decent draft beer selection.
author: Sonny H.

description:
I've been wanting to have an excuse to be in SF and try the AMERICAN GRILLED CHEESE KITCHEN. I love grilled cheese, and heard rave reviews. So after the last Giants game, we walked up there to try it out.

My wife and I shared the Jalapeño Popper Sandwich and a bowl of Tomato Soup. The soup was the bomb! We loved every spoonful of it. The Popper, on the other hand, was just ok. I loved the grilled levain bread it was on. But something about the "Apricot Jalapeño Chutney" just didn't agree with my taste buds. I ended up scraping the apricot chunks off and enjoying the cheeses and peppers.

I'd definitely go back to try something else. I just think I chose the wrong sandwich. Next time...

3.5 stars.
author: Joel V.

description:
Let's be honest: grilled cheese is amazing whether you make it at home or order it here...but they make it with cheeses you wouldnt necessarily have around the house. So yeah it is worth going here despite the prices to be absolutely ridiculous! Yeah ok, its 8 bucks, not a lot in general but in relative terms for a grilled cheese...umm woah. (also if you are not from SF/NYC, then the sticker shock alone might be enough to make you think twice)

Don't get me wrong- they do it well, but timing here is everything...if you go during the work-week for lunch...go early or late, otherwise you are waiting in absurdly long lines for a sandwhich which seems to take up to 30 minutes sometimes to turnaround. Kinda nuts...totally different experience at off times (which yes is a fairly obvious point but is extrememly true with this place and worth noting). Also if it is above 70 downtown, good luck since it has a great patio to sit on.

Food:
Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese - wow
Moustrap with Turkey is also very tasty
The Red, White and Blue plate special is also awesome for a foggy SF day
author: Derek S.

description:
They turn wifi off between 12-2. Of course I was half-way through sending something when it cuts out.

Any business that cares more about their customers than cash wouldn't do this. 

The food was also mediocre.
author: David V.

description:
Came here last week for lunch with a co-worker. We decided to order two different kinds of sandwiches and share so we could try more options.

I ordered the "jalapeño popper" it was served on sourdough with chèvre, bacon, jack cheese, and a delightfully spicy apricot and jalapeño spread. I also got a cup of the tomato soup, that was served with croutons. 

My co-worker ordered "the piglet" which was served on sourdough, and came with American cheese and ham, it was cooked in a rosemary butter.

I really enjoyed both sandwiches, but for different reasons. The jalapeño popper really tastes like it's name sake, the creamy chèvre really made the sandwich, it cooled off the spiciness of the apricot jalapeño jam. 

I liked the piglet mainly because of the rosemary butter. It added a nice flavor to an otherwise basic sandwich. 

Each sandwich also came with a bunch of delicious red grapes. 

Now onto the soup. This was my least favorite part of the meal. The soup was greasy and was just not very appetizing. The croutons it came with were rather delicious though. 

Would definitely come back here, but will skip the soup.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
One of the best food-related ideas I've heard all year came early this morning when craving eggs and cheese both. The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is open every day at 8am for a reason, right? Skip the lunch rush and head here for breakfast, when there isn't a line out the door and nourishment comes at half the price (and half the headache).

For $4.25 and until 11am you can have a Classic Breakfast grilled cheese - sharp cheddar and jack with a fried egg and roasted tomato. It's perfectly sized and a much better value than the lunchtime sandwiches. Don't get me wrong - I love spending $10 on a grilled cheese when I have a hardcore hankering, but I'd much rather spend $4.25 and be able to get one two days in a row, ya dig?

If you insist on coming at lunch, come early-ish and go for the Blue Pate Special (half sandwich and a soup) for better value. The Mouse Trap is always good but make sure you add tomato to make it even better. Even with smoky cream of tomato soup you can't overload on nightshades and the clementines or grapes as garnish are a charming touch. If you're dining as a group might I suggest placing your order as one so it comes out with some semblance of consistency as orders sometimes get lost.

Blackberry lemonade or one of the housemade sodas are a must if available. On your way out try to come up with some cheesy chalkboard puns to outwit and dethrone the ones contributed by Vivek & Damien S.
author: Kat F.

description:
I come here pretty often during my lunch breaks while I'm working. It's the best grilled cheese you'll find around--and relatively cheap in comparison to options nearby if you consider the quality of the food compared to the price of say, buying a drink and a grab and go item from SMALL FOODS down the street.

I really like the quinoa salad here. Most people don't even notice that it's on the menu but it's an excellent salad--and probably one of the healthier items on the menu.

Tip: Avoid the lunch time rush and come either at 11 AM or 1 PM to avoid painfully long lines. Just think, you might get stuck listening to the most inane techie conversations. Look around, you are in SOMA. You've been warned.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
My boyfriend took me here because he heard that it was good and it was a nice sunny day to go out for a walk.  He was also attracted to the photo of the Bacon-Cheese Brioche on yelp.... unfortunately they did not have it on the day that we went.

I ordered the piglet and he ordered the feta fetish. I do not like eggplants, zuchinni, and bell pepper.... so that sandwich was pretty much made out of my most hated vegetables. But my boyfriend got me to take a few bites, and it was actually pretty good. I couldn't really taste the vegetables, so that was probably why I liked it.

I really enjoyed my piglet sandwich. Very cheesy and the bread is amazing, It was a little bit oily, but other then that, i loved the flavor. I really like the side of grapes, it really compliments that sandwich.
author: Alicia W.

description:
I had the mushroom gruyere without onions and honestly, it didn't need the potatoes either. BUT DANG. THAT SANDWICH IS LEGIT. 

Their mousetrap was also really good and at 3 dollars cheaper you get something like 4x the amount of cheese. I don't see how that can be a bad thing... but then again after I ate it I couldn't see my feet until I woke up the next morning. WHATEVER being able to fit into one seat at ATT park is overrated!
author: Emily D.

description:
I've eaten at American Grilled Cheese Kitchen multiple times and this location on 3 occasions, the last being on 2/22/15. The food has gotten progressively worse each time. The first visit I would have rated 4 stars. The second, 3 stars, and this last visit, 2 stars. My rating above represents an average.

I'm usually with a partner or small group when eating at this restaurant, allowing us to order several different sandwiches each time, though all are variations of grilled cheese. This has allowed me to sample pretty much everything on their menu.

On this most recent visit, we ordered the Mushroom Gruyere ($10.50), Adam's Rueben ($12) and the Cubano ($11.50) along with tomato soup ($5). Grilled cheese with tomato soup is an American classic and hard to screw up, but somehow it happened.

The "smoky" tomato soup was served first. As always, it comes with a crème fraiche garnish. The soup was sour. You might be thinking, "well it's tomato soup, it's suppose to be sour." Not this sour. Good tomato soup is rich and creamy, and perhaps a bit tangy. This was just sour, much more so than on my previous 2 visits. 

The Mushroom Gruyere. The first time I had this sandwich it came on thick bread with a nice balance of cheese and mushroom. This time it was just on regular sandwich bread that you might find on sale at Safeway, and contained far more mushroom than cheese. Very strange. This was one of my favorites.

The Cubano was decent. But again, the balance between cheese and meat was off. I bit into big chunks of what was actually very good pulled pork, but tasted very little cheese. 

Adam's Rueben was a disaster. If this sandwich, served with "kraut" and pickles on rye, is suppose to evoke a New York deli, then it fails badly. I bit into a chunk of pickles and couldn't have been happier that we were splitting the sandwiches as it meant I didn't have to take another bite. 

The best part of the meal was actually the whole orange that came with each sandwich. It was juicy, sweet and helped wash the taste of this meal from my mouth.
author: N. C. L.

description: If you love grilled cheese, come here today! Totally out of the way location, which is why I never found it when I lived in the bay and worked downtown. It is VERY SOMA and kind of near that really cool thrift store, which I fail to remember the name of now too. Anyway, the grilled cheese here is phenomenal and of course they have any variety you want. The line gets pretty busy after 11:40 or so. Come when they open or after the rush.
author: Ronjini M.

description:
Shame on me for taking so long to eat lunch here, since I work two blocks away!

My Mushroom Gruyere sandwich was delicious, and a far better value than Merigan's sandwiches a couple blocks away. I also tried their kale slaw special, which was surprisingly complex in its flavors for a casual lunch place. 

The complimentary apple is a nice touch--a crisp and sweet way to end the meal :)

Will be back soon!
author: David Z.

description:
Bummer! I was so excited to come check out American Grilled Cheese Kitchen since everyone seems to only have good things to say but my experience didn't quite live up to my expectations. It's definitely not that the food is bad... Just isn't my taste. I can see why people rave about AGCK but I guess I just prefer my grilled cheese plain and simple.

Between the cuzzo and I, we ordered the Mushroom Gruyere, the Piglet, two tomato soups and two lemon ginger sodas.

Mushroom Gruyere-- had me at carmelized onions but didn't quite deliver like I had expected. I didn't care for the taste of the mushrooms together with the cheese.

Piglet-- of the two sandwiches we ordered, we both agreed that we liked this one better. But still didn't quite knock us off our socks.

Tomato soup-- while I love love love tomato soup, I would just say this is average. 

Lemon ginger soda-- this was the best part of my meal! No overly sugary taste. The soda was light and bubbly; exactly how I like my sodas!

I wouldn't say AGCK was bad but I probably wouldn't be rushing back anytime soon. Seating is super limited but it didn't look like it was an inconvenience to anyone. I guess the turn over time is quick so most people were able to grab a seat before their food came out!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Came to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen during lunch to find it quite busy.  Much of its outdoor seats taken by people on their lunch breaks.  There is some seating inside though, but there's something to sitting outside, good thing I came to have my order to go, as there's plenty seating in the South Park area.  As with their full seating, there was a bit of a line, but I got through it in less than 10 minutes.

There's a good variety of grilled cheese to choose from, as well as soups, I've gotta try the smokey tomato soup next time. I just ordered the Jalapeno Popper, since I like it spicy.  But I didn't read the menu too carefully as that sandwich includes an apricot-jalapeno relish.  But that didn't ruin the sandwich at all, it was more of a nice surprise.  And each sandwich comes with a small apple. Cute.  

I think there's a good amount of variety to warrant another visit, definitely with it being a block away from where I work.  Although a bit pricey. Or maybe that's just me. I wouldn't be surprised.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Grilled cheese can only be fancied up so much (or maybe I just haven't come across anything amazing yet). With only an hour before I had to take my sister to SFO, we drop by and get an order of their mushroom gruyere and tomato soup to go, paying ~$14, and waiting about ten minutes for our food to come out, luckily avoiding the usual lunch rush.

The mushroom gruyere was tasty, but didn't blow my mind any more than a regular grilled cheese sandwich would have. And I've certainly had tastier tomato soup, though theirs is in no way bad, with more emphasis on the natural tomato flavors and less on the herbs, which come off as a more subtle afterthought than anything.
author: Johnny W.

description:
A tad pricey but well worth it, especially if you choose the Club Turkey. Super tasty! I like that they include seasonal fruit with each sandwich like an apple or a couple plump strawberries -- they provide a healthy palette cleanser. 

Get the restaurant's iOS app and order ahead if you want to avoid the lunch line, then go straight to the pickup counter.
author: Mark B.

description: Been here a few times before SF Giant games. Nothing like your typical grilled cheese and soup. They have good choices. I would recommend coming here especially on a cold day for some comfort food.
author: Veronica F.

description:
Last night I was in absolutely no mood to cook. I wasn't even thrilled about the idea of ordering out but I didn't want to starve either. My son recommended this restaurant. My expectations of take out food are generally pretty low to begin with. I ordered the spicy tomato soup with house made croutons and the Mushroom Cheese sandwich on levain bread.

I have to say that I was BLOWN AWAY by the flavor and quality of the meal. Both dishes were sheer perfection. The soup was still hot as was the sandwich. I honestly liked it so much that I wanted a repeat for lunch today. Alas, they are closed. But I will most definitely be ordering from them again. 

If I could give more than 5 stars I would. And I am by nature pretty fussy.

Good job guys !!!!!
author: TC D.

description:
I've discovered the key to this place - BREAKFAST!

Been here a few times for lunch and it's a solid grilled cheese (if a little pricey - $8 or $9 is a bit much for a grilled cheese sandwich in my opinion) but the key is getting here before 11am and getting one of their breakfast sandwiches.

The menu is very similar to the lunch menu (I had the piglet) but $3-4 less per sandwich, *significantly* smaller crowd/line/wait, and OMG it comes with an egg. (Standing by my "put an egg on it" philosophy)

I'd give it five stars for this single dish experience, but since I think it's important to note all aspects of AGC, they lose one star for speed of service at lunch (we've had one or more people's food significantly delayed several times I've been there) and lunchtime price/value level.

But, will I be returning for another breakfast sandwich? Uh, maybe tomorrow!
author: Stephanie T.

description: So many vegetarian options! Love it when "I" have to think for a vegetarian option due to too many choices. I tried the Feta Cheese grill with roasted tomatoes & eggplant. It was good sized, well made & tasted awesome (would grilled cheese ever not taste awesome (shrug))! Did feel the price was a lil steep at $11 for a grilled cheese, but the portion and its content made up for it. They also provided me a Apple togo, a nice health gesture after eating a very high calorie tasty grilled cheese!
author: Shreyas P.

description:
I've been here twice now, hoping that the first time was just a fluke, especially because my co-worker loves them and recommends them to everyone.

On my most recent visit, my friend ordered the American Dip, while I ordered their quinoa salad. 

American Dip: the TINIEST dip ever, for starters. If you're going to make a "Dip" sandwich, I'm pretty sure you're obligated to throw down on the dip front. Instead, it was one of those tiny 1-oz plastic containers. Dismal. The sandwich itself wasn't great, and my non-picky eater of a friend didn't bother finishing it. 

Quinoa salad: described as "Quinoa, white beans, fresh herbs and vegetables marinated in lemon-garlic vinaigrette on organic greens". Which, to be fair, is technically true. The marinated vegetables were minced just shy of a puree, soupy with marinade, and comprised mostly of celery, as far as I could tell. Everything else was impossible to taste, except for the bitter flavour of the quinoa that they clearly haven't learned how to prepare properly. 

I won't be back until it's the only option in the area, eat24 (et. al) shut down, and my fridge breaks, preventing me from eating anywhere else. 

The two stars are because the people who work the counter don't suck.
author: Michi K.

description: Good place, good food, good flavors, great service, but a little overpriced for what it is. Was expecting a mind blowing grilled cheese sandwich for $20
author: Dan L.

description:
Came here around 1:30PM on Sunday and waited ~20 minutes for 2 orders of grilled cheese sandwiches.  Good thing I had a light snack prior to coming here!

We ordered the Mushroom Gruyère and Mousetrap (with bacon and tomatoes) and their seasonal blackberry lemonade.  I have to say that I deducted one star for the lemonade itself.  It was DISGUSTING.  So happy that it is only a seasonal and not a staple of AGCK.  It tasted really awful...I know lemonade is supposed to be sour, but this was something else.  It was sour to the point of bitterness and left my mouth pretty dry.  I couldn't finish it.

Good thing they had really good grilled cheese sandwiches to save their butts.  Everything came out really hot and fresh.  You can tell their really put some thought into their sandwiches.  The bread was toasted to perfection and the cheese was the right ooey-gooey texture.  My mushroom grilled cheese was really good and I loved the aroma of it.  However, the entire thing was a bit too heavy for me that day so I only ate half.  The other half was devoured by the big eater I was with.  Phew!  

AGCK is a pretty small establishment with a few counter top seatings indoors and maybe 10 tables outdoors.  The staff are all pretty friendly and hard working.  However, nothing on their menu really makes me want to go back except for the mushroom sandwich, which by the way, is $9.
author: May W.

description: Everyone remembers having grilled cheese sandwiches as a kid. The crispy, buttery toast sandwiching melted American cheese. This place takes that memory and kicks  up the creativity a notch or two. I love mushrooms so I couldn't turn down getting the mushroom gruyère. The mushrooms and cheese were great, but the biggest surprise were the potatoes. I also enjoyed the jalapeño popper and the club turkey. Don't worry about being fat because every meal comes with a healthy piece of fruit. It's close enough to the ballpark to grab a bite to eat that is more affordable than the park.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
I ordered the mushroom gruyere, and am still thinking about it four days later. The tomato soup is pretty tasty, but is a bit too rich for my taste. Not the fastest service, but the sandwiches are so darn tasty, I gotta give them four stars. 

PS: Yay for homemade pickles.
author: Nora G.

description:
Another great weather, light meetings Friday meant another trip to a long ago bookmarked spot for lunch.... American Grilled Cheese Kitchen 

Total round trip walk (excluding wait time for to-go order) - 55 min 

Worth it?   yes. 

As everyone knows I'm a now & later kind of girl, so as usual, I got a bunch of stuff to try... which is also a great opportunity to determine what's good to eat now & what stands the test of fridge / reheating 

Mousetrap (plain - comes w/ tomato, bacon or other stuff if you want but I just wanted plain) - excellent ratio of melty cheese to bread. No cheese overpowered the other but blended together so very nicely! Crust was super crunchy & tore up my mouth a bit.....but all crusty breads do this as I usually don't partake, so no foul here.  Didn't reheat up so great - eat this now 

Mushroom & Gruyere - mushroom / onion / thyme layer was much bigger than cheese layer & almost didn't taste the gruyere. Funny enough, wasn't too impressed upon 1st taste but it was delish, reheated the next day & the gruyere stood out much more - eat this later 

Gluten-Free Mac N Cheese - pasta was overcooked (which is easy to do w/ the GF stuff) but nice peppery savory flavor. Cheese was nicely distributed throughout but no stringy pulls - stayed the same even after fridge / microwave.  Prob wouldn't get this again 

Last note:  each sandwich half required an entire napkin to mop up greasy fingers & mouth. Wonder if I can ask them not to fry the sandwich in butter next time? 

There most def will be a next time & I already know what's on the menu.... the Moscone! (& will ask for no butter)
author: Adrienne G.

description: Loved it! I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time and I wasn't disappointed. As an added bonus, 21st Amendment Brewery is across the street!
author: Cheryl N.

description:
Why do grilled cheese sandwiches smell so damn good?

FINALLY I made my way over here which is kinda sad since I work only 4 or 5 blocks away.  I was teetering between giving 3 or 4 stars.  I think 3 is more accurate for me.

Not wanting to be all lactosey-intolerant gassy for the rest of the day, I stayed away from the items with just cheese in it and went with the Club Turkey:  cheddar, havarti, smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos, arugula--all for 9 bones. I stopped in here on my way back to work after going to the gym, so the lunch hour rush was completely gone and I was in and out of there in about 10 minutes.

As for the sandwich, it was okay.  Nice, nice, not thrilling but nice.  Good parts were the taste and crunchiness of the bread, melted cheddar, and the bacon of course.  I mean who doesn't love buttered, crunchy bread and crispy bacon?  But the rest was so-so.  The havarti mixed with the cheddar was kinda mushy and eventually made everything soggy.  Keep in mind I ate it back at work which probably added to the sogginess as well.  But yeah, I'd defintely recommend eating it there.

They have limited seating, both inside and out.  On a day where the weather is good, expect a line out the door during lunch hour.  If you happen to drive, bring meter money (although you could use your ATM/Visa like I did).  I want to go back to try the Piglet (ham and cheese) cuz it looks pretty damn good in the picture.  We'll see...
author: Joe M.

description:
Grilled cheese and tomato soup? Yes, please!

You really can't go wrong with anything on their breakfast or lunch menu, so just pick whatever strikes your fancy and enjoy!

Don't forget to try to get here early since this place gets so packed that they may run out of your favorite before you have a chance to order.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Grilled cheese, that's as American comfort as you can get! And on a brisk San Francisco morning, that's all you need to give you the warm fuzzies. 

Been here only on weekend mornings/afternoons and if there's ever a wait, let me tell you, it's well worth it (Tip: go on a Sunday when you don't have to worry about metered parking). To finally get to take that first bite into that crunchy, buttery, toasty bread only to hit that warm, gooey middle - yea, I'd say that's heaven right there. 

The Mushroom Gruyere especially will have that affect on you. Talk about pairings, perfect in every way. If mushrooms aren't your steez, get yourself the Jalapeno Popper, it's got the right amount of kick to wake you up and get your day started.

Get yourself a bowl of the Smokey Tomato Soup because well, to be straight, that comfort meal just ain't comfortable without the whole ordeal. 

Imagine dipping your perfect sandwich into that creamy tangy hot soup, I think I just jizzed. Better yet, have a few spoonfuls of the soup alone, throwing in those garlic'y croutons in to soak makes for that "eyes rolled back, lip smacking, mmmmm" feeling. 

Oh and the breakfast, don't get me started. Farmer's Breakfast is on a whole 'nother level. All those wonderful breakfast foods you're used to eating thrown into a sandwich - bacon, potatoes, cheese and an egg that oozes that magical golden yolk. Make sure you maneuver it around to cover every centimeter of your sandwich and don't forget to lick your fingers cause that's the best part.
author: Anh P.

description: Best gluten free bread I've had! My husband even said it was better than his regular one. The jalapeño with bacon sandwich was delicious!
author: Mariana V.

description:
I LOVE cheese, and The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen makes a decent grilled cheese sandwich - I got the jalapeno one because I am a huge fan of spice, and I added hot sauce to it.  Told ya, I like spice.  I wasn't blown away by their tomato soup though.  

Also, they have house-made pickles that you can purchase by the dozen - soooo good!
author: Sumeena B.

description:
This is the kind of establishment that has let the "fame" get to its head.  Given, the Mousetrap grilled cheese sandwich was tasty but the service was a bit rude, slow, and unapologetic.  

Girlfriends and I ordered ONE sandwich to split (had a filling brunch at Butler but felt the urge to check this place out...see what all the hype and long lunch lines were all about)  We waited outside and watched several customers after us get their food, eat, and eventually leave.  After a good 40 min or so, homegirl went inside to see wtf was going on with our order.  

It was ball-busting not only because they forgot our order, but also cause it wasn't busy at all and the cook was irritated with my friend just for asking.  We were going to cancel the order and just bounce but the cashier said she'd make it on the house.  But that offer came after much unnecessary debate and the final 'I don't really feel like eating here anymore' confession.  

The ingredient that makes the sandwich tasty is butter.  Butter makes everything taste fantastic.  No secret; just all hype.  

Check yo self before you reck yo self.
author: Kat C.

description: Stopped here before heading to the Giants game one evening and the prices for a sandwich are much more reasonable then eating in the ballpark.  I had a roasted turkey sandwich which was decent.  I love that all their sandwiches come w/ an orange.
author: Meredith K.

description:
Normally, I'd give them a 4-5 stars, but today they got my order wrong.  It was the first time out of dozens, but I'd gone there, because I was going to get a better sandwich, even though it violated my budget for the day.

I wanted a grilled cheese with turkey, gruyere, fontina, carmelized onions and creme fraiche.  After a long discussion whereby it was basically ascertained they couldn't cook it with the creme fraiche in it (danger of getting on other orders), I said, ok, then I want the mushroom gruyere minus the mushrooms plus the turkey.

I ended up with just cheese and potatoes.  No turkey, no leeks, no onions.  That turkey cost extra.  The black currant house soda was a really great flavor of the day house soda.

 I'm too hungry and my lunch break is over, so it is too late to do anything about it, but I regret not going with plan A or C.  Add to that, they've gotten in the habit where the crust isn't just really toasted, but into burnt territory.

Ignoring the cost, they're still the best grilled cheese in the area.  They really do make extra effort in customer service with a positive attitude.  They have some of the best tasting wheat-free bread, I've eaten (though I think the butter\cheese, helps a lot).  Their free fruit always seems a bit discount eat it today, but otherwise more natural and certainly perfectly edible and a lovely side.  They also have the best gluten free potato chips in the area.  I've never seen Deep River snack chips any where else (grocery store, etc.).

I like their salads.  As a gluten intolerant person, I don't have a problem eating here, but if you're celiac, this is wheat-free bread; not a gluten free kitchen.  I like their selection of glass bottle cane sugar or natural fruit sugar.  They don't have any of my personal favorites (Virgil's, Dr. Pepper, Ramune)

When I go back and have a good experience, I'll bump this back up.
author: Denae W.

description: After hearing rave reviews, we stopped here to grab some grilled cheeses to take into the Giants game! Loved the look of the place. The menu has a lot of of options...something for every one really. The mac and cheese grilled cheese was amazing with crispy bread and a creamy inside! Mousetrap with bacon also had good flavor but the bread was a little on the dry side. Only downside was a fairly long waittime for 2 simple sandwiches but know they were busy on a gameday.
author: Courtney O.

description:
The people were great, the mac'n'cheese grilled cheese was heavenly and best of all, it came with a complementary pluot! So unexpected but good! 

We had our dogs with us and there was outdoor seating that would accommodate us.  There can be a big line and get quite busy, but we were lucky enough to find outdoor seating after we ordered our food. 

I'll definitely comeback here again when craving for grilled cheese sammiches. :)
author: Mei C.

description:
SO GOOD!!  I enjoyed this place so much I ate here twice in the span of 5 days. I ordered the basic mousetrap, but added bacon. Definite plus.

The second visit I opted for the special combo, smaller sandwich with a little salad on the side. Still delicious. From the bread to the cheese, just absolutely divine.

Place gets pretty busy at the lunch hour, but the line goes quick. The average wait is about 10-15 minutes or so once you order. Best part, when you order just a sandwich, they throw in a little cutie tangerine to go along with your meal. Classy!

Nice outdoor seating and yummy lemonade. Meals are about $8-9.
author: Theresa N.

description:
I've recently become a huge fan of grilled cheese sandwiches so when my roommate suggested we try this place I was all ears.

REALLY GLAD SHE PICKED IT.  We split the mac and cheese and mushroom gruyere.  They were both great.  The bread was toasted to perfection and worked well with both the mac and cheese and mushroom and gruyere.  I've had a mac and cheese sandwich before and I thought it was super heavy (though good), but this one didn't feel as filling.  The mushroom and gruyere paired really well together also, though mushroom and cheese are two of my favorite foods. The only regret I had was not ordering the tomato bisque with the sandwich because I think that would've paired heavenly with the sandwich.

It was also really cute that they include an apple with your meal -- it's like their attempt to make the meal healthy.

There is a bit of a line, but it moves fast enough.  There's also outdoor seating so on a good day, you can grab food and eat outside.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Am I the only one? Probably... I'm torn between giving a 3-star or 4-star rating for this place. Food is probably 4-star but it has 1 huge downside in my opinion that gets a deduction of 1-star. 

Location is perfect right next to South Park but on the street side of 2nd street. It's pushed back from the sidewalk to accommodate an outdoor seating, which is great since the inside is super tiny. 

I've been here twice since it opened and I think both times I've gotten the Piglet since it's one of the only ones that has meat in it. I love my cheese and sandwiches but I need some meat in there as well. It's pricey for a sandwich that doesn't come with anything else. Well it does come with 1 tiny, organic apple. But it's about $9 for the sandwich and everything else like chips, drink or soup is an additional cost of course. 

One thing I can't deny is this place's popularity within the SOMA area. It's always has a line out the door reaching to the sidewalk. A "short" like is to the door or just right outside the door. So one day I was deciding what to eat and was walking by and it was almost 2pm, so the line was super short. The line was maybe 2-3 people ahead of me, so I decided to go there. Even with only 2-3 people in front of me, I still waited 20-25 min for my food! Omg reeally?? Rumor has it that they have only like one grill or something nuts like that. So pumping out the grilled sandwiches takes a looong time. Your whole restaurant concept is based around GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES. Dude c'monn get another grill, I know your kitchen is super duper tiny, but I feel like this place wasn't thought out and it definitely did not think it would have to accommodate the entire SOMA area for lunch. 

If you order a salad or soup, your food comes out super quick. So that's a nice perk if you don't want that, you just have to suffer the lines but can come out quicker than those waiting wayy before you. The cobb salad is also pretty good. However it's not the typical cobb salad. But it's still pretty good. 

My other favorite is the Tomato Bisque soup... mhmm so delicious! So hearty and creamy. Yummm.. 

Sorry I had to give it the 3-star despite the food behing 4-star.
author: Grace L.

description: I've been a fan of their grilled cheese sandwiches for several years and would still give those 4 to 5 stars, but this review is for the daily mac & cheese special. My order was nearly unedible; a dry overcooked mess of elbow macaroni and (theoretical) pesto and chicken, 'cuz I didn't actually find any. The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen should drop the extraneous food items and stick with what they do best - grilled cheese!
author: K B.

description: Had the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese, with the tomato soup. Really hit the spot! Highly recommend the place for a quick but satisfying meal.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Post-burn and you're still decompressing, but hanging with good peeps in the city by the bay.  What better way to enjoy your last few hours but having a grilled cheese and IPA and doing a little people watching too.  

Chowing down on my Mushroom Gruyere with fontina, gruyere, roasted wild mushrooms, potatoes, melted leeks onionos and little bit of butter we ruminated about adventures on the playa.  Who we met, what we did, what we remember...  Sure I'll regret the butter later, but mmmmm...  The beer really hit me too.  I don't think I've had a beverage in a few weeks, the desert living will do that to you!
author: Sean S.

description: I was a little hesitant to go to a "grilled cheese kitchen" for breakfast, but turned out to be really good! I had the oatmeal with maple syrup - again, probably an unusual choice for a grilled cheese place, but I was happy with it. This is an awesome place to hang out on a nice day at the outdoor tables.
author: Bianca C.

description:
We were looking for a place to eat while visiting SF for a business meeting.  We ended up here and I had the Mac n cheese grilled cheese with bacon.  Wholly crap was it so go! 

I can't wait to go back!
author: Tripp M.

description:
I found my new best friend today!

It should be understood that cheese should be everyones best friend.  A cheesy best friend should always offer nothing but warm gooey comfort.  This particular best friend offered me ooey gooey comfort between two delicious pieces of bread!  

I agree with Alex L., the concept is incredibly simple, but in reality, who doesn't like a perfect grilled cheese sandwich?  And really, there's so many ways to offer it up.  

I choose the Mousetrap grilled cheese.  The first thing (and only thing) I needed to see in the ingredients was cheddar.  It had a nice balance added with the havarti and monterey jack cheese friends.  I also ordered an added roasted tomato and pickle, two fantastic cohorts.  Nothing completes a grilled cheese quite like it's favorite companion, tomato soup.  The tomato soup offered was a spicy version, so that was a no brainer addition to my meal!  

Surprise!  There's a bonus of specialty drink options as well!  I saw that they offered homemade soda's so I had to inquire as to what kinds.  As soon as the cashier said coconut, he sold me.  Say no more, me and coconut have also become very dear friends as of late!  

The grilled cheese was really fantastic.  Not too little and not too much cheese, perfect amount of tomatoes and pickles on toasted sourdough bread.  The soup came out lukewarm and I expected a little more of a spicy kick, but it was still a solid B grade.  The soda was beyond amazing....to the point that I would have bought a lifetime supply if it was bottled!  Bonus points for the little clementine served on the side.  Made me feel not so guilty about all the cheesy goodness I devoured!  

So thank you best friend, for showing me what true cheesy companionship is really like.
author: Rachel C.

description: It's fine but their tomato soup lacks. Although the sandwich is decent to good I can't help but knock them since I don't find their tomato soup that great. Grilled cheese and Tomato Soup is awesome and there's is just kinda meh...
author: Matt G.

description:
They raised the bar for grilled cheese. I'm not longer satisfied with just cheese and bread slapped together and thrown in a skillet. The lunch options are delicious but the breakfast sandwiches are out of this world. Wish you could get those all day. 

Thumbs up on the all-inclusive pricing. I wish more restaurants did that.

Minus one star because I've paid extra for add-ons only to discover they weren't included when I get back to work. If you're a vegetarian I suggest checking your order before you leave. I've found bacon in my sandwich more than once :-(
author: Holly E.

description:
Ok- I saw the great reviews and thought ill try the jalapeno popper grilled cheese. 

The jalapenos with the apricot relish was great, BUT whatever the cheese was, chevre I think it was, has the weirdest taste I couldn't even finish my sandwich. It was literally disgusting. I like most cheese but it was too funky. Waste of 10$. 

The blackberry lemonade was good, though. THe rosemary olive oil chips were good too.

Maybe ill try a different one next time so Ill spare the 2 star rating this time. 

Restaurant style of ordering at counter, and they bring it to your table with a number.  Small inside, only bar seats. Big outside seating area.
author: Sarra E.

description:
Macaroni and cheese sandwich??? Yes please. Unfortunately the real sandwich I received for $9 didn't even come close to the fatty mcfatty sandwich that I fantasized. So you think macaroni and cheese and you expect a good heaping of macaroni and cheese. Spilling out in a steamy hot romance. And yet, you find a timid layer of macaroni napping in between two slices of bread.

So you're trying to piece together how this entire thing balances out to $9. Bread, two cents. Cheese, one dollar. Profits, big time. Yes you do get an apple with the cheese sandwich. But how about some pickles, side salad, and/or dessert? I must admit that the macaroni and cheese sandwich was good. But I can go to The Melt and get a grilled cheese sandwich with short ribs for less than $9. Or I can build my own macaroni and cheese sandwich at home for the low cost of one man's dignity.
author: Michael H.

description:
I think I went in with too high of an expectation.  That always leads to failure.

Luckily it wasn't a total failure, The sandwich was good, just not spectacular.  I mean who doesn't love a grilled cheese (really its more of a panini rather than grilled cheese, but same concept).  I had the moscone  It was warm and toasty, but a little less gooey than I would have thought though.  A note: everyone I was with who had the jalapeno popper was raving about it.

The wait is pretty long.  The seating is very limited.  The parking is very expensive.  Is it worth all that?  Not really sure...
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Never had grilled sandwiches before this place due to preconceived notions about them.
But awed by how delicious they could taste especially from this place. A good pre-ball game destination
author: Mali S.

description:
Very convenient spot to grab a bite before or after a Giant's game. We stopped in for brunch before a 1 pm game on a Sunday. The line moved pretty quickly and the four of us found seats at the counter inside. I had a breakfast Farmer's grilled cheese (crunchy grilled bread, bacon, thinly sliced potatoes, fried egg and sharp cheddar) which was very flavorful and filling. The $4 mimosa was very tasty (they use Odwalla orange juice.) Two of my friends enjoyed their grilled cheeses, but I seriously wanted to steal my one friend's bacon jalapeno mac and cheese. Since it's kept in a warming pot, her food came out way before ours. I'm definitely checking that out next time. 

Food and mimosa for $10 in the City? Yes please!
author: Diane A.

description:
First time here, and they do a great spin on the classic grill cheese sandwich! 

I'm a huge bacon fan so I chose the one with turkey and extra bacon. 

Also, their chocolate chip cookies are awesome. Very gooey, mmm.
author: Colin G.

description: This place is great to get a quick eat if you are in a rush or even dine in. Stopped by here to get a quick sandwich and got the Cubano sandwich! It was so worth ordering...everything about the sandwich was really good. The people that work there are so friendly and informative on which sandwich to choose. The menu is pretty simple and they even have beer on tap.
author: Marjorie F.

description:
We split the Mushroom Gruyere (fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, thyme butter) and the Jalapeno Popper (chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish). We also had a side of the... Smokey Tomato soup and housemade soda (vanilla gingermint).

Mushroom Gruyere: UH-MAZE-ING! the mushroom flavor is so savory and the mixture of sauteed vegetables made the sandwich taste moist and soft even after the it had already cooled. 

Jalapeno Popper: good, but felt that the separate elements lacked enough flavor to make it memorable. the "jalapeno"-ness was tame, the relish wasn't as sweet as I thought it'd be, and the bacon...didn't even notice it was there. 

Smokey Tomato soup: YUUUUUUM. not too acidic and the roasted flavor was really nice on an overcast SF day. It came with a side of garlic croutons...perfect for dipping! 

Housemade soda: oooooooh soo refreshing and great compliment to the heaviness of our meal. the vanilla gingermint is refreshing and a perfect palate cleanser.

It's definitely a bit pricey for lunch ($29 for 2 sandwiches, soup, and 2 drinks). I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but definitely worth a stop if you're in the area and craving cheese.
author: Monelle A.

description:
I had to up them a star...
I haven't been here in awhile but i woke up hungry, craving a quick breakfast to go so we decided to try this place out again. I had previously commented about their prices but was pleasantly surprised at their breakfast menu. $5 for a substantially sized breakfast sandwich- that's one hell of a deal! At a Panera Bread (the one across from the Caltrain) you can only get a smashed down egg/cheese bagel for that same $5.

I had the veggie breakfast which consisted of jack and cheddar cheese, egg, roasted tomatoes, caramelized onions and bell peppers. I polished that thing up in no time! They had a great buttery crust and cheese melted to the perfect consistency. Very tasty and it was exactly what Im looking for in a breakfast sandwich.
author: Esther A.

description:
Knock your socks off deliciousness! I'm so happy I finally was able to try this uber famous grilled cheese sandwiches I have been hearing about.

Although it is kind of greasy, the Piglet sandwich was good. And I liked the tomato soup. Wasn't overloaded with cream or sugar and it tasted like real tomatoes! 

Service was great and friendly too!
author: Natalie S.

description:
A place that only serves grilled cheese sandwiches is something I can definitely get behind.  This is something you think would be provided by a specialized food truck but no they have a whole restaurant for this in SF.

I went for the Foghorn Leghorn: Point Reyes blue cheese, creamy havarti, Zoe's Roasted Chicken, arugula, dill-dijon mustard on artisan whole wheat.  So good.  

I also tried the jalapeno popper, which as the name says, is like eating a giant jalapeno popper.  Good stuff if you like a little kick to your sandwich!
author: Chad T.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of cheese. I'll eat it but i don't really love it. but i ordered the mac and cheese grilled cheese which is a grilled cheese sandwich but instead of putting just plain ole cheese in between, they stuff it filled with macaroni and cheese!!!! and its macaroni and cheese done right. not some super fancy cheese or dried out noodles. this is the real deal.

i also got the club turkey. this sandwich was a hot sandwich but the bread is what makes all the sandwiches so delish. was great to dip in some tomato soup

the sandwiches cost about $8-9 and don't include any sides or drinks. its a bit steep for what it is but for the area i would say that price is a reasonable request. they have indoor seating and outdoor seating which is nice if you have a pet you want to bring out to enjoy the weather. 

i wanted to try the homemade soda but they were all out when i went. a little bummed. the staff were not as friendly as they could be. they were really straight to the business type servers. what do you want. thanks for your money. go sit with your number. here's your food. bye bye.

next time i visit i'd like to try the mushroom gruyere. it sounded so yummyy.... will be back soon!
author: Amanda K.

description: Quick and simple but with a ton of flavor. Ordered a jalapeño popper grilled cheese and a Cubano. We both agreed my wife's Cubano was better than the popper. Nice quick bite before crossing the st to hit the brewery. $24 for two Sammy's and 2 iced teas. Will return to try more of the menu.
author: Vince S.

description:
Seeing the "cheese" episode of "Unique Eats" always makes me homesick for this awesome place. I only get to SF once a year and when I get to go, It's here. 

I hope I'm not being too cheesy in saying it is worth getting up early and starting my day off and having none less than the Commander in Cheese make your breakfast piglet. You truly know its going to be a great day for America and for you.

I'm already counting down the days until I get back. French Toast Grilled Cheese sammich? hmmm.
author: Tom M.

description:
Took the Wifey before the Giants game on May 28th.

I ordered the Jalapeno Popper and She had the Mouse Trap (added pickles and bacon) along with a side of Tomato soup.

The service was great and we were both satisfied with our meals.

We will return.
author: Shaun Y.

description:
The quintessential San Francisco experience:

-Brian Sabean sighting.  Seriously, we were driving by and just saw the guy walking  out in front of AT&T Park.  We didn't honk or roll down the window and yell out or anything.  We were just dorks in the car going, "Look!  It's Brian Sabean!"

-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream at Humphrey Slocombe

-Walking to Dynamo Donuts only to find it was closed.  Dammit.

-On said walk, being yelled at by a homeless guy.  Specifically, "Go F*** yourself and burn in hell!"

-The Jalapeno Popper is not as eventful as being verbally accosted by the homeless guy but that's the way it should be.  It's comforting, it warms my belly with cheesy, piggy goodness.  Grilled cheese sandwiches remind me of home; actually, it's an upgrade of home because Mom usually made Grilled Cheese Whiz sandwiches.  Don't judge.  

Thank you TAGCK for capping off my quintesesential SF experience and for reminding me about a little bit of home.
author: Joc V.

description:
Wait, have I really not written a review for this place yet? Their mushroom gruyer sandwich is awesome. The gruyer and the mushroom really go well together, and the truffle oil (or truffle butter?) they use on this one makes it all the more tasty. I've also tried the jalapeno popper, which was a good combination of sweet and savory.

Their smoky tomato soup is also a must try!
author: Kazu O.

description:
If anybody tells you this is like the franchise "The Melt..." you need to get new friends or never ask them where you should eat again.    This place shouldn't even be spoken in the same breath because it's a 1000x better.

So many favorites but the best part is the bread that it is made with.   Perfectly crunchy and soft at the same time.   Not sure how they manage to cook the bread and it's never greasy or soggy from the melted cheese.   Their sandwiches always hold up nicely even if I get it to go.   Priced great for the quality of cheese and the variety of toppings on the sandwich, not to mention the fantastic bread.

Very popular and can get crowded so it's best to go on off hours if you want to sit inside but outside is a great alternative, it's in a good spot for people watching.

Favorites: Jalepano Popper, Piglet and the Mushroom Gruyere...you can't go wrong with any one of these or all of them!

This is a fun place to do a grill cheese tasting with some friends.   Came in with a couple friends one day and got one of each sandwich, wine and had a solid fun meal.
author: Deena B.

description: Best grilled cheese in the Bay Area! I have tried just about every sandwich they offer & every one of them is great! Personally, I like the mushroom one the best! The service here is always friendly & fast! It's the perfect place to grab a bite before taking an adventure in the city!
author: Alycia M.

description:
Best and most guilt-free grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had in the world. In fact in the SOLAR SYSTEM! This place is so delicious and perfection in every way, shape, and form!

I got the Moscone sandwich with fresh mozzarella, fontina, roasted tomatoes, basil-lavender pesto, kalamata olive tapenade and it was TO DIE FOR. So fragrant, yet light and filling.  I also got their seasonal soup which was the Armenian chick pea and it was so yummy and flavorful.  Got the organic green salad and the pomegranate lemonade! An amazing lunch! I am obsessed!
author: Aditi G.

description:
Oh man oh man oh man!

HELLO wonderful buttery, cheesy, artisan bread with wonderful flavors and a perfect blend of ingredient ratios and textures and temperatures!!!!!

1. The Piglet - rosemary butter, ham, and droooooooooollll!!!!

2. Mushroom gruyere - with gruyere and mushrooms and OMMYGOOAWSSSHH

3. Tomato soup w/ croutons, the perfect comfort food and with a little swirly of white on top.

4. Cranberry lemonade that was both the cranberriest and the lemoniest but without being overwhlemingly either and a perfect blend of both. WOWSAH!!!

And everything came with and orange with a cute little stem on it.  YAY!

That last 'YAY!' was sarcastic.
author: Timothy C.

description:
I was so excited to try this place but left completely underwhelmed.  The sandwiches are small and tasty but come with no sides unless you get the lunch special.  Of course you do receive a delectable tangerine with your meal.  They come in a cute little dish that makes it look like your mother packed your lunch (all you need is a brown paper bag).  

All in all, this is a tasty lunch spot, but don't expect to be blown away by the sandwiches.  They are on the greasy side and not what I was hoping to find in the perfect grilled cheese.  I am glad I tried this place though and would definitely come back to try some of their other sandwiches.
author: Brittany A.

description: Food is solid and service is quick. I liked the special, a cuban sanwhich, more than the Mushroom Gruyere, but she was actually the opposite. We shared a couple sandwiches and a tomato soup which was just the right amount of food. Oh yeah you have to get the soup! I hade the jalepeno popper a long long while ago and thought it was tasty, but pretty intense. I wish the sandwiches had a more luxurous distinct cheese flavor, but overall the food was good.
author: Huey N.

description:
This is the best grilled cheese I've ever had.  It was the right balance of crunchy bread and luscious cheese without being greasy.

I ordered the Mousetrap with bacon and pickle chips and it was divine.  With the Red, White & Blue plate special it was well complimented with a  simple green salad.  I would have ordered the tomato soup but it was quite hot outside.

The menu is simple.  There are a few sandwiches for lunch or breakfast, a few soups and salads.  The quality here is amazing and should not be missed.

I will definitely return whenever I have a chance.
author: Ryan L.

description:
WARNING: They DO NOT grill the sandwiches here, they put them on a tray then put them in some sort of very hot convection oven yielding a dry, tasteless sandwich. 

My sandwich was the roast beef one with potatoes and garlic cheese. The main ingredient. other than bread,  was potatoes. The meat was 2 ounces at most. The sandwich was BURNT on the edges, dry and hard. The cheese has spilled out and burnt on the edges. There was no grease on the outside at all but only dry bread.  These are not grilled cheese sandwiches (or else the cheese would have gooed out the sides not burnt to a crisp), they are over roasted sandwiches. I watch while it was being cooked, and obviously forgot about it. This was a 2:40 today, they had maybe one other order. 

This is not the first time I have had a sandwich from this place that was not worth the $10.50 I spent on it. Do not go here if you want a good grilled cheese sandwich or quality controlled food. It varies way too much. Out of five times, I had an amazing sandwich once and it was the same kind I am eating today. Today it was worthless and I have to throw away the crust (to me, the best part of a well made grilled sand).

Save your money and head to Crossroads Cafe on Delancey. For $5.50 you can actually have a sandwich which has seen a griddle, has more meat, more flavor and actually is cooked amazingly.  

Darn, I am kicking myself for actually going to this place again. Must tell my parents not to bother with it again.
author: Theresa S.

description:
Personally, a grilled cheese sandwich for ~$10 is pretty steep... yes, the mushroom gruyere was delicious but not $10 worth. I'd rather come here for breakfast -- they have yummy breakfast dishes for half the price!

I'm still glad I tried The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen... I've seriously waited about a year to try this place out. I also wish I didn't engulf my sandwich so quickly, so I'll definitely be back for the jalapeno popper! Otherwise, I loved the cheesy, hot, gooeyness... such a nice comfort food. Also, I was a bit peeved that lunch wasn't served til 12 pm on Sundays so I had to wait a bit over 10 mins to order... generally, I have mixed feelings about this place... more like a 3.5 star.

Oh, and my fav quote on the chalkboard: "A grilled cheese is like sex; when it's bad, it's still gouda. When it's good, it's grate!"
 --Amen to that. American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is grate!
author: Janet H.

description: Went here a couple of days ago with a group of friends for dinner. The atmosphere was phenomenal, lively and engrossing. After reading a couple of reviews before about what to try, I ended up going with the Mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwich. I also got a tomato soup to go along because nothing else goes better with grilled cheese than tomato soup. The soup was absolutely delicious, getting better and better with each bite. The grilled cheese was perhaps the best grilled cheese I have ever had. The Mac and cheese went perfectly with the buttery toasted bread creating a perfectly salted and perfectly crunchy with the smoothness aspect experience. The other guys that I went with also loved what they ordered. One of them ordered the mushroom and Gruyere. He thought it was perfectly cheesy with the right amount of everything. This place is awesome. Coming back here soon!
author: Kiran K.

description: Five stars for the idea + three stars for the food = a four star rating.  I really really was looking forward to this place.  The idea seems shear genius, and the descriptions sounded incredibly delicious.  However, at the end of the day, a grilled ham and cheese is still a grilled ham and cheese.  My wife's gruyere and shrooms was a little more interesting, but still not gourmet.  Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, it just didn't blow me away.  You can't go wrong with grilled cheese really, and i'll definitely come back when I have a hankering.
author: Fernando A.

description:
My classmate suggested this place so we all went for a nice lunch at the park. It was a friday afternoon. The line was coming out the door! It was about a 15min wait before we got to the front.

They had some daily specials so I ordered the Crab Melt Sandwich (which had mac and cheese and shredded crab inside a grilled cheese). When I got it, I thought they might have given me the wrong one or something cuz I didn't see or taste any crab. I wish it had big chunks of crab or something. But it was still delicious! I also ordered a Kiwi Lemonade, which was a tasty and cool drink, esp on such a nice and warm day. ($11 total).

I decided that since my kids like grilled cheese, I took them here the next day. There was no line when we got there at 12:30 but it took only a few mins for a line to start coming out the door. My kids ordered the Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese and Mousetrap (which is just a bunch of cheeses but you can add stuff for an additional cost). I ordered the Mushroom Gruyere (mushroom, potatoes, leeks, caramelized onions) and the Smoky Tomato Soup. I really liked the Mushroom Gruyere with the tomato soup ( I wish it was thicker but still yummy). 

The service was nice. The cashier was really nice and even gave my kids a free cookie to share. :)

There isn't much seating inside and there are like 8 or 9 tables outside. But you can always take your food to-go and go to South Park and sit in the sun. :)
author: Jean T.

description:
After consuming a 8.1%-er from 21st Amendment, I needed food....


We came across this place because YELP, The American Grill Cheese Kitchen was heavily Yelped, so we needed to try. The lines are a little long for lunch time. It is located in a very convenient walkable area...

They sandwiches are gourmet for the most part. I ordered the Jalapeño Popper (chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeno, relish)  which was $9 & the blackberry lemonade..

. It took about 20 mins, and I pondered to myself I just paid a lot for some grilled cheese...

The Jalapeño Popper carries a lingering heat which is awesome, I loved the heat. The cheese was good, and they used a very good quality sweet bacon. 

My only knock on this place is the bread. When the sandwich came out, you can definitely see they used a lot of butter for the grillin', and they grilled the sh!t out of mine. 

After finishing, I had two constant feelings.. 
One... The roof of my mouth is in pain.. The bread is extremely hard, and scrape the sh!t out of mouth

TWO... God DAMN that was a hardly ass sandwich. I felt a instant FOOD coma before the last few bites of this load of the grilled cheese
author: kent c.

description: This place ain't bad.  It's not a whole lot of food to fill you up, but the cheese and bread are good and the strawberries would have been a nice touch, if the guy who put them on the plate had washed his hands.  He was the busser.  C'mon man...
author: Buddy D.

description: I love this place! Their sandwiches are great and they always have daily specials. I really like their Jalapeno Popper sandwich. It has some heat to it, but is also a little sweet. The service is great. It can get busy here and seating is limited inside, but they do have outdoor seating.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Went with the jalapeno popper and the wild mushroom gruyere sandwiches. Loved the mushroom sandwich- great umami flavor, melted in my mouth! (was that the butter?) the popper had a good kick: the tang from the apricot relish went perfectly with the smooth goat cheese and salty bacon. 

Located in a cute neighborhood just a block from the ballpark. Would def stop by again on a weekend if nearby!
author: Lina C.

description:
I should probably open this review by making it clear that it will be a long while before I go back to this restaurant.  That doesn't mean that my entire concept of what a grilled cheese sandwich can and should be hasn't been revolutionized.  Oh, it has.

I had the special where they offer a smaller sandwich and a bowl of soup for the same price as the large sandwich.  I got the mushroom gruyere sandwich and the smoky tomato soup.  They give you homemade croutons to put in the soup, and ohh my gosh, that soup was amazing.  And the sandwich was perfectly crisp and cheesy and earthy tasting on its own, but when I dipped it into that soup, it was the most amazing blend of salty and savory and sweet, complex flavors that were familiar but reinvented and overall, just wonderful.

Capping it off with a fresh mandarin and a homemade diet cola (which tasted unusually sweet and equally familiar-but-different) was the perfect way to round out the meal.  Also tried their lemonade (tart and refreshing) and eye-nommed someone's salad at a nearby table (will have to get one next time!)

Working backwards, however, we waited in a 20-minute line, then waited about 30-45 minutes after we ordered for our food.  Isn't the point of a grilled cheese sandwich to be fast???  Brutal to wait that long, even with all the great people-watching around.  Or really dog-watching.  But even that gets old... really old... after over a half-hour in the shade in San Franciscan December.
author: Allison M.

description:
Wonderfully everything I'd expect a place that specializes in grilled cheese to offer, beer, tomato soup, and a nice spot outside to enjoy the sun. Grilled cheese, wonderful and lathered in butter and mushrooms. 

[Side notes]
There is a little park around the corner if you want to sit in the grass. 
I'm shocked there wasn't anything from 21st amendment on tap seeing as how it's across the street, but whatever.
author: Justin T.

description:
Highly recommend the Mushroom gruyere, tomato soup, and homemade pomogranate lemonade!!! 

Cute establishment at my favorite area in SF! Some bar seating is available inside but majority of their tables were situated outdoors. On a windy day like today, we were ecstatic to have snagged some barstools inside to enjoy our meal. 

Albeit pricey, I will most likely return to try some of their other items. But that just might be my inner child who loveees grilled cheese talking.
author: Vivian D.

description: There is something for everyone here. As long as everyone likes melted cheese. It's all made here and it all taste delicious.
author: Monica A.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for years. What's crazy is that a couple of my guy friends live a block away, and thus go here regularly, but I went here for the first time recently.

I realize that there's lots of hype about this place and it should be for a reason, but I went into it expecting it to be just ok. After all, I make really damn good grilled cheese sandwiches at home. But I've never put mac n cheese on mine. They really succeeded at getting the texture right. I thought it would just fall apart, but the cheese gave the mac structure.

The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the apple served with the sandwich. Not that I don't like apples, but a whole apple is not something you want to try eating while out to lunch at a restaurant with friends. Some chips or a pickle would be better I think.

Oh, and the blackberry lemonade was delicious and super tart.
author: Amanda S.

description: Delicious grilled cheese sandwiches. I had the Mushroom Gruyere (so good) and my bf had the Piglet (ham & cheese) which was also very tasty. Order the house pickles for only $1.50...so crunchy and good. Fresh lemonade was a disappointment. It tasted like it came from a bottle! We'll be back to try their other food. Great prices!
author: Mimi C.

description: Only my favorite stop on my way to work! You would think of this as a lunch spot but have you tried their breakfast!? Great oatmeal with fruit and their breakfast piglet is my fav! Coffee is brewed to perfection. Ask for Jay he's a rockstar!
author: Guadalupe P.

description:
Grilled cheese sandwiches...

This place brought back memories of my childhood. It's grilled cheese sandwiches with for grown-ups & kids! You can order an original grilled cheese sandwiches or one of their grilled cheese concoctions. They are all yummy!

They have indoor and outdoor seating (both are limited) but there is a park around the corner! You can enjoy grilled cheese sandwiches while your pet and children play (or enjoy the grilled cheese sandwiches with them)! 

Each grilled cheese sandwich comes with a cutie (tangerine) :)
author: Melanie L.

description: Awesome sandwiches!!! A bit pricey but understandably so. They put much love and yumminess into everything they serve. I am particularly fond of the Cubano and the Reuben personally. If you are on your way to a game or just find yourself nearby in the SOMA district do yourself a favor and drop in for a ooey-gooey sandwich. You won't regret it.
author: Manny V.

description:
Cool little place with small counter and chairs on the inside, and they put out some tables/chairs on nice days for lunch.

I got the mushroom greyere ($8) and it was delicious.  Be sure to add soup or a salad for $1 more. (I had the moroccan butternut squash soup which tasted like it had a hint of cloves in it.  it was pretty good).  All sandwiches come with a fruit pairing, either grapes or an orange.

Their cookies are also good (the chocolate chip tasted very similar to the ones at Speciality's)
author: Logan C.

description:
I floated here after my pedicure.  See prior review.  It does feel a bit funny typing that.  In a way, the funny feeling reassures me that the world remains in its proper orbit (for me, of course).

I ate a piglet.  I shaved a few years off my expectency.  Though having already I think exceeded it I perspose it don't much matter no more anyhow.

All I can say is if you're going to invite a heart attack you may as well do it in delicious fashion.  The piglet stuffed me with sharp cheddar and apple mustard and cured ham, delivered by way of the perfectly toasted levain sandwich vehicle.  Seriously, Mr. Death, you may take me but let me bring one piglet along for the journey.

The tomato soup and little bagette of croutons perfectly accompanied my small procine.  They threw in the freshly made dill pickel for gratis for as they had none ready upon arrival.  Gratis.  I like that.

Breakfast service was recently added.  As I was getting my toes did I missed the eggs this time.  Next time will be different.  Gonna meet my maker with egg on my face.
author: Markus N.

description:
When this place opened up, it was like a breath of fresh air... in SoMa. This is cause there are sandwich places on every block; the Sentinel, Specialtys, Toaster Oven, Quiznos, Subways, Lee's, and Snack Depot. Muffins, Muffins also makes vietnamese sandwiches. Even Starbucks carries sandwiches. So The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen was a nice twist to the options in the area.

I eat late breakfasts and late lunches, so I was always able to avoid the long lines when they first opened. The brown sugar bourbon oatmeal is my absolute fave for a "healthy breakfast!" If I've eaten an even healthier breakfast and craving a mid-day dessert,  the bread pudding with the brown sugar bourbon sauce definitely hits the spot! 

I've tried the Red, White and Blue Special. Half a sandwich of your choice with tomato soup or salad. I cannot stand the tomato soup, it's too smokey and the smell and taste just lingers. Yuck. The tomato soup at Trader Joe's is so much better. I opt for the salad when I get this meal.

I don't come here too often for lunch, but I can vouch for the Don Gondola; provolone cheese with salami, pesto and tomatoes- yuuum! For just something plain and simple, The Mousetrap- sandwiches come with an apple!

There's seating outside, so on a nice day, my co-worker and I take our time here avoiding work.
author: S Y.

description:
If you want to eat meal that really makes you feel naughty, then this is the place to be!  Yes, it's fatty, buttery, carby, cheesy and oh so good!!!  I had the basic breakfast sandwich with ham and it was heaven!  I was craving a basic grill cheese sandwich and for them to incorporate breakfast elements (over easy egg and ham) was amazing.  I love eating breakfast sandwiches that has the egg yolk burst all over the sandwich and the break soaking up the yolk. Delicious!!! 

Warning: do not drive after eating this sandwich. Sandwich may cause major food coma:). Enjoy!
author: Ying F.

description: They have some great grilled cheese sandwiches.  The tomato soup is a little acidic for my taste, but it is great for dipping your grilled cheese into.
author: Hillery G.

description:
GRILLED CHEESE!!!

The moment I walked by this place, I knew I had to try it. My co-workers and I finally were able to finagle an hour or so before our company Giants game, and I'm SO glad we did!

I got the mouse trap and added pickles and bacon (of course). Grilled cheese at its finest. Crispy but chewy bread, melty cheese and tasty toppings. I tried the tomato soup and thought it was okay. Maybe the sandwich just out-shined the soup so much :)

Oh, and I forgot the best part. Cheesy (figuratively and literal) puns on the wall! "Ricotta be kidding me!" Hahaha who can resist a cheesy pun? :P
author: Becky K.

description: They have the best grilled cheese sandwiches you'll ever have, and good drinks too. However, the cashier who took me and my friend's orders was very rude.
author: Jason C.

description:
