If there's anything that will get me to try your restaurant out of the thousands to choose from in a new city, it's offering a menu full of a meal based entirely around cheese - in this case, the lunch-time and comfort food classic, the Grilled Cheese. And we're not talking about a processed slice on white here, folks. When it comes to cheese, I don't mess around.

Before heading over for lunch, we were warned of a long walk (from Howard and 3rd) and a long wait time but neither were enough to keep me from what I was sure would be my next great love affair. The walk was only about ten minutes and while the line was already out the door when we had arrived, we were already committed. And by that I mean my manic need for dairy had already reached a fever pitch.

The long line turned out to be misleading as we were eating within 15 minutes of stepping inside the small and eclectic venue. With both an industrial and traveler café feel, the Grilled Cheese Kitchen was vibrant, welcoming and dynamic from the second we arrived. Or maybe I was just delirious with the promise of sharp cheddar, havarti and jack all on a single sandwich for just $6. The sourdough bread was incredible and made up for the fact that the cheese itself wasn't all that flavourful so much as just gooey - not that I'm complaining. Served in a basket with a fresh and juicy apple on the side so that you can pretend to be having a balanced meal, all the frills were saved for the gourmet grilled cheese concoctions themselves rather than frivolous presentation. I mean, I came for cheese, people, not art...

The fresh soups looked wonderful and a wide beverage menu was ready and waiting. The actual sandwich menu seems to change regularly from what I've seen in other reviews and photos which would be really dangerous if I actually lived here. Instead, I'll save it as a special treat whenever I'm on the west coast - or maybe even as a reason to come. No wait...that would be crazy.

...or would it?

P.S. OHMYGODILOVECHEESE.
author: Ben B.

description:
I think I ordered wrong...

I wanted to love this place but was feeling guilty about an all out grilled cheese so I got one with chicken and it was disappointing.  It was deli sliced chicken which is always a little disappointing...

Had lemonade and that was good.  Next time I'm just having cheese on my grilled cheese.  I'll try it again and try to order better.
author: Kristin G.

description: Excellent service and food. Way better than the melt. They're jalapeño popper sandwich is fantastic, and they always add a fruit with your sandwich.
author: Scott G.

description:
First of all, if you are not an American, the American Grilled Cheese means a bread grilled with cheese.

The selection is great. The food is very tasty. I found the salads a little bit dry but you don't go here for a salad, do you?

The service is great. They are very friendly and very fast. It took them less than 5 minutes to serve my order.
author: Rasty T.

description:
A few weeks ago i was watching Eye on the Bay on channel 5 and they were broadcasting The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.  And yes, I'm a big sucker when it comes to food and viewing something that I actually like.

So, the other day we stopped by to give it a try.  We got there just in time.  Soon after we ordered our food, the line just grew within minutes.  But be aware, there isn't that much space to dine inside the restaurant.  They have a few tables outside their restaurant to dine.

Parking can get effie at times, so be patient!

I ordered the Jalapeno popper, my daughter ordered the club turkey and my boyfriend ordered the mousetrap.

All in all, great experience with the food and service.
author: Shana W.

description:
Gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches are a pretty interesting concept. I stopped by for lunch and had the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese with fontina, wild mushrooms, roasted gold potatoes, leek, and thyme butter with a cup of tomato soup.  

4.5 stars for the grilled cheese sandwich -never thought a grilled cheese sandwich could taste so good!! ...and so buttery. Was it worth $10? Maybe. 2 stars for the tomato soup - The Safeway brand tomato basil soup beats this one by 999x... I'm not sure if it's the flavor or texture that's off, or both, but I wouldn't get this one again.  

I'll be back again soon to try out some of their other gourmet grilled cheese sandwich options, though (perhaps the jalapeno one). Tip: Try to come during non-peak hours... the line was out the door when I came by during lunch!

Bonus points for having a white board of cheese-related puns!
author: Sarah T.

description:
If you're looking for a great place for a soup and sandwich for lunch on a sunny day, you've found your place!  Limited indoor seating makes the outside patio and (even better) nearby South Park necessary, so don't go when it's raining or cold.  The sandwiches are great - I had the Moscone which was delicious.  I don't recommend the half-sandwich/half-soup special as you end up with a tiny sandwich and not much soup - better to just buy both and spend the extra few dollars.  The soup is quite good, though.  Limited selection though, so check out the menu online first if you are a picky eater!  I'm not a fan of goat cheese which limited my options significantly (maybe they can customize, I didn't ask).

Pros
+ Great location near South Park
+ Delicious sandwiches and soup
+ Reasonable prices (until you realize you're having a grilled cheese)
+ Reasonably quick service

Cons
- Limited indoor seating (and outdoor seating is usually shaded)
- Limited selection
- Not your usual healthy sandwich 
- Doesn't take AmEx :(
author: Greg B.

description:
When I heard they made mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwiches, I dropped everything and immediately made plans to come here for lunch.

The mac n cheese grilled cheese was everything I ever wanted and more. We also had the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese and smoked tomato soup. The grilled cheeses were filled with perfectly melted and gooey cheese and the soup was a perfect complement. I'm usually not a fan of tomato soup because it always seems like it tastes like it comes out of a can but this is definitely the exception.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I saw this place on the way to a noon Giants game but had just eaten so didn't stop.  Then I was really disappointed the next night on my way to AT&T Park when I thought they'd be closed for dinner...SURPRISE, they stay open late on game nights!

A grilled cheese restaurant.  I believe I've died and gone to a wonderful paradise full of fresh ingredients, soft breads,and perfectly selected cheeses.

I had the foghorn leghorn.  Yum.  I admit the nostalgia of the name got me since it reminded me of my childhood as much as a grilled cheese did.  But the sandwich was awesome.  Decent beer selection with some unheard of local brews.  The inside was hot and pretty small, but why sit inside when you've got perfect weather outside all the time?

I plan to frequent this on every trip to SF.  Then probably head across the street to 21st Amendment...
author: Nick G.

description:
You can never go wrong with a lunch at this spot. The mac n cheese grilled cheese is very dangerous because of how amazing it is. Paired with the yummy tomato soup, it's great for a cold SF (summer) day. And I love that they add fresh strawberries to every order, it's a great touch! Very friendly staff and can even be a great place to stop in before a Giants game for a pitcher of beer and grilled cheese dinner.

My only complaint is how long the line gets at lunchtime. They should definitely have an order ahead/takeout window for efficiency sake.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I ate here with some co-workers a while ago.

-Food was delicious (I had the Club Turkey grilled Cheese Sandwich and the mac n'c cheese special of the day) Very good.
-Lots of seating

One thing that I didn't like and it was it took a long time for the food to come. This was something my co-workers and I wondered - it's grilled cheese sandwich it shouldn't take that long. This isn't worth deducting a star though.

Definitely will be back.
author: Kathryn Y.

description:
This place cranks out some hefty grilled cheese sandwiches! Opting for the 1/2 soup and 1/2 sandwich combo is probably ideal, since I unknowingly ordered a monstrous whole sandwich that seemed like it was clearly designed to be shared.

I had high hopes for this place since hearing about it, but unfortunately, I'm torn with several likes/dislikes.

Likes:
- Large portion size to share 1 sandwich among 2 people
- Great combinations of ingredients
- Flavorful!!

Dislikes:
- Too large of a sandwich for a single person
- Very tough/coarse bread
- High prices ($9 for my mushroom gruyere sandwich)
- A tad overly cheesy (I know, I know...it IS a grilled cheese)

Ideally, this place could shrink the size of the sandwiches (and hence adjust the pricing) making it a tad more affordable. I think everyone ultimately does a double-take when they realize they're forking over $10 for a grilled cheese sandwich for lunch.

Despite everything, my mushroom gruyere sandwich was quite flavorful and robust. I liked the inclusion of potato slices, which added a different twist to the average grilled cheese.

I also must say that I had the mushroom sandwich over at the competitor down the street (namely The Melt), and while The Melt's sandwich was lighter and more portion-controlled (yet equal in pricing), the flavor of The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen's sandwich was far superior. 

P.S. Be prepared to WAIT. Despite a steadily-moving line, the backup comes in waiting for the sandwiches to be prepared. I waited a good 20 mins (and that was pre-noontime rush).
author: Mansi A.

description:
Cheese + Beer = Happiness.   

Stopped in and had the jalapeno popper sandwich with a beer.   Whoa!  I like spicy food but this bad boy did have some kick to it! Apricots were paired with it and added a nice sweet balance to the spice.     Also, I want to comment that there wasn't too much cheese on this sandwich.  Eat sammich comes with an apple.
author: Megan M.

description: This has become one of my once a week lunch spots! and that is high praise for grilled cheese.
author: Kevin K.

description:
How can you go wrong with bread and cheese? You really can't, it's just simple ingredients and done perfectly!  I wanted to try this place and what better time to try it before a Giants home game.  I ordered the Mushroom Gruyere (Fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms, roasted potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain) was delicious.

The bread was toasted to perfection, the cheese was tasty, and the mushrooms had a concentrated flavor.  The flavors of the sandwich was balanced and I could taste each ingredient.

I would definately come again.
author: Allen C.

description:
FOOD SEX! Yes I said it. ORGASMIC, I am wet just thinking about it FOOD SEX. There I said it again.

Comfort food sex really. I grew up on grill cheese. And let me just say if my mom made grill cheese like this I would still be living at home. Well maybe not that would be too weird. But you get the idea. I work across the street. I have been here more than a few times. I can safely proclaim myself a consumer espert on gourmet grill cheese. 

OMG you have to try the biscuits they are making now.

Breakfast or Lunch.. it is ALL good. Greasy, cheesy food sex fantasies are what it is all about here. The soups are just as fantastic. And the service is excellent even when the line is clear out the door. And yes I feel like a very special girl when I go in and they remember my name with 20 other people in line. I will be back time and again. Now if only you guys would open one in NOE Valley. Oh wouldn't that be a great stocking stuffer.

Everything is better with cheddar.
author: Nichole S.

description:
I know all the vegetarians must be excited about this grilled cheese sandwich joint, but I'm all over their club turkey sandwich, or their mousetrap with bacon. Carnivores, come here too!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: its okay.. honestly pretty overrated and overpriced. Every time I go I'm underwhelmed. I do though think the staff is really great and work really hard and I always have a good experience ordering there
author: Mandy M.

description:
Cheese makes me happy. So imagine my delight when I came across an establishment that specializes in a classic grilled cheese but with a twist. Now imagine my dismay when my expectations were left unmet. This was a sad day. 

I ordered the Mushroom and Gruyere which also contained caramelized onions and thinly sliced yellow potatoes. The potatoes were strange in the sandwich. I did not care for their presence at all. I actually picked them off on the 2nd half of my sandwich. The mushrooms had a strange taste as well, a floral note was present which was odd. 

Now the service...oh boy. The girl at the register will not be winning the Miss Congeniality title any time soon. I think Miss I Want to Murder You In Your Sleep better suits her. I got my sandwich to go, which took 24 minutes! For a grilled freakin' cheese. Rarely will I ever wait that long for something to go. No apologies for the wait time either. I still love cheese, but I will certainly not be coming back here to indulge my cheesy cravings.
author: Kim S.

description: I'd give this place 4.5 stars.  One of my favorite grilled cheese places, but even more so one of my top breakfast sandwich spots in SF.  I typically order the breakfast popper, which I order with gluten free bread, an extra over easy egg - it comes with Monterey Jack cheese, local chèvre, apricot-jalapeño relish, and bacon. Sooo good.
author: Richard N.

description:
Can a place really have "American" in its name when they serve a pricey piece of comfort food that doesn't leave you feeling disgustingly full?  

The Mushroom Gruyère was more rich, but the Jalapeño Popper definitely had more flavor.  I was a little disappointed however that their blondie had pecans in it (I'm allergic), and that "served with seasonal fruit" literally meant just that: one little strawberry per sandwich.  

I'm not sure how mind blowing a grilled cheese sandwich can get (more pronounced buttery-ness perhaps?), but I like the concept and the location, and will try something from their drink menu next time.

3.5, rounded up.
author: Jenn C.

description: We tried the crab mac n cheese and the flavor and oil of the cheese was strong so we couldn't taste much of the crab.  We split the club turkey sandwich and it was amazing!!!  I must say this is the best sandwich I have ever eaten in my life.
author: Ash P.

description:
I'd maybe give it slightly over 3 stars and here's why.

Cool concept for a grilled cheese restaurant - an American staple! Had the Jalapeno Popper. Although the sandwich itself was pretty damn good (though slightly overcooked), I found it kind of ridiculous to be waiting 15+ minutes for a grilled cheese.. I could make it faster myself at home. On top of that, if I made it at home, I could get a lot more for the same amount. $6-$7 for a grilled cheese... okay. Maybe. But at $9 I'd expect a little more and snappier service! The workers were all really friendly though, so nothing against them personally.

I'd definitely be back if I'm absolutely craving a grilled cheese, there's some sort of special (Scout Mob, Groupon, Living Social, etc), and/or an online ordering service so I don't waste my time standing around waiting 15 minutes for something I can consume in 5.
author: Brad Y.

description:
Good food right on the way to a Giants game, as we walked down 2nd St. from Market. That's worth 4 stars alone. Normally a lunch place, they are open until the first pitch of Giants night games. 

The jalapeno popper with goat cheese and bacon sandwich is appropriately hot and flavorful. Definitely wash it down with a draft beer. My wife had the cobb salad, also good. I also had the smokey tomato soup, which hits the spot as a cold wind blows over you at the outdoor seating. 

No complaints. Life is good. Play ball.
author: Stephen H.

description:
I came here before a Cal football game at nearby AT&T Park. BIG MISTAKE. 

I'd been wanting to try this place for awhile, since I'd heard decent things about it. It's a little past 1pm on a Saturday, shouldn't be too bad right? Get there, find a nice parking spot right next to the restaurant. As I get out, I notice there seems to be a preponderance of Cal-related apparel that's unusual outside of Berkeley. The horror slowly dawns on me. While Cal is renovating that relic of a stadium they have over there by the campus, the football team is playing their home games at AT&T park. @#%@!

Ok, can't be too bad right? The menu is fairly small, so the kitchen must have it all down pat, right? Wrong-o friend-o. Placed our order, walk outside to fight the crowd for a table, wait 40 minutes for two grilled cheese sandwiches and a salad. I think the staff was managing as well as they could, but they clearly weren't particularly well-equipped to handle the volume. 

The food is pretty decent. Like I said, the menu is pretty small. You're getting exactly what you expect: something with melted cheese pressed between two slices of buttered bread. The turkey club came with sliced roast turkey and bacon. Overall not bad. The Tilly's Veggie salad was generous in its greens, topped with kalamata olives, capers, and feta cheese. Pretty good. The tomato soup had good flavor, although I thought it was a little watery, but it made for good grilled cheese dipping. The cranberry lemonade was very tart. 

Pretty reasonable pricing, decent food if you're in the area and wanting some grilled cheese.
author: Saunders C.

description:
Just started at a new job in SoMa, and this place was around the block according to Yelp. And I was starving so I decided to stop by! 

I went around lunchtime and it wasn't too busy. Paid $8.50+tax for the Piglett. The wait felt a while, but maybe only because I was starving. When I finally got to eat my sandwich, I was very satisfied! Melted cheese, a bunch of ham on toasted bread. Also came with an apple on the side! Nothing to complain about. I definitely want to try the mushroom sandwich if I stop by again here soon for another lunch.

If you're a fan of sandwiches, I would definitely stop by for one.
author: Victor X.

description:
I'd give it a strong 3 / mild 4 stars...but for some reason I feel closer to three.  I'll definitely consider coming back if I'm in the area, but I won't make a special trip back just to eat here.

I like the concept of taking something all of us can make and hyping it up so much that we tend to forget that we're paying $9 for a g. dm.  grilled cheese sandwich.  I'm one who fell for the novelty.  

I can't fault them too much for the line as it's a relatively new place and people are obviously excited about them.  They're friendly and efficient, so that's good enough for me.  They do need additional outdoor seating, especially around lunchtime.  Actually, I hate people who "reserve" seats while the rest of the group stand in line - until I found myself doing it today, then it's fair game.   

The mousetrap was delicious.  Three kinds of melted cheese  (cheddar, havarti, monterey jack) oozing out of a heavily buttered toasted bread.  Fantastic for the most part, but outer part of the bread was really hard, I thought I was going to lose another tooth (yes, another, I inexplicably lost one recently, lol).  The size, moreover, left me wanting.  Seriously, a place that features solely grilled cheese should do more to keep people from being reminded that all they're getting is a grilled cheese sandwich.  Wait, I did get one strawberry on the side...woot.

I also tried the sweet bread pudding...and loved it...so so creamy, not too sweet, and they gave a fairly big scoop.  That's probably one of the better values here. 

Yes, three stars is too low.  I don't feel good about it.  But I think I'll be bothered more if give four at this point.  I guess I'll just have to agree to disagree with some of my favorite yelp reviewers who clearly like this place much more than I do.
author: Angel S.

description:
We waited out coming here for the hype to die down. Everyone says there is still a crazy line at lunch time during the week so we decided to hit it on Saturday afternoon. The sun was shining and I was able to grab a table outdoors while my bf ran in to order. I ordered the mouse trap with a NY deli pickle on the side; he got the jalapeno popper. The line to order was a bit long, but they pulled staff from the kitchen to help move orders. Unfortunately my bf ordered from someone who usually works in the kitchen and I mistakenly got pickles IN my sandwich instead of a side pickle. 

Our sandwiches arrived 10 minutes later on cute metal trays lined with kraft paper. The sandwiches were accompanied by complimentary apples which was a nice surprise. I read in many other reviews that the portions were small but we thought it was perfect. The bread was soft and well toasted and the pickles complimented my pick nicely. We washed out sandwiches down with 3$ mimosas which was perfect. Will be back again, but not sure I want to tackle the weekday lunch line.
author: Seema M.

description:
How to put this politely?  Please don't come here.  Thank you.

The food sucks.  Let me qualify that to be fair: the Mousetrap ("regular" grilled cheese) & tomato soup here sucks.  A dear friend always says just get the basics right.  ***Eh!  Wrong.***

On the plus side, the staff is very friendly so I'll give stars for their pleasant demeanor. Regardless, I won't be back. 

Waited 40 mins in line just to get to order. NP and actually, I'm oddly thrilled by that in a macabre way. "Just step over here, ma'am, your food will be up in 10 minutes." 20 mins later - and after seeing 4 parties that ordered after me march out w/ their orders - I'm perturbed. 

So I ask the nice gal filling the to-go orders what gives. "Oh, I see you ordered it w/ gluten-free bread. I'm sorry, those orders take longer. They should've told you when you ordered." (Uh, they didn't.) Oh, my... here I thought the add'l charge was just for the g/f bread, but it apparently includes a royal time suck punch in the face, too. 

Nevertheless, after a decade or two passes, I finally get my to-go order & I'm stoked...till I tasted it 5 mins later. Blah, bleck and barf. So disappointed in a barely-grilled sammy w/ cold cheese & thin, really ordinary soup. 

Not sure if I'm sadder that I spent over an hour and $15 to just toss out my let-down lunch, or more so that grilled cheeses around the world weep on such horrid misrepresentations of themselves.

Came here over a month ago but am only now Yelping about it b/c it took me a while to get over such taste bud devastation. Humpf.
author: Jen H.

description:
Mac & cheese grilled cheese! Soo bomb! 

I enjoyed this during my visit to SF last time. I will be coming back whenever I'm around this area!
author: Chiho K.

description:
I was eyeing the mac and cheese sandwich, but when I saw what was in the American Dip, I had to have it: roast beef, cheese, AND potatoes? Yes, please! It was every bit as good as it sounds, and I am ashamed to say I polished off the whole thing , and food coma has set in. 

Friendly staff, very fun atmosphere (looooved hearing 80s one hit wonders. They keep it cheesy in every way here!).  Love the kitsch on the walls and the cheesy puns,too. I think the sandwiches are worth every penny. They're massive- definitely two meals in one! I will definitely, definitely be back.
author: Molly M.

description:
Can it be true?! A whole entire restaurant dedicated to making the simply scrumptious grilled cheese sandwich even tastier and fancier? After hearing many tales about the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen I decided I'd have to see it for myself so I cruised over one afternoon for lunch.

The line was looooooong, but that just means they are doing something right. I only mention it because this is not a place you want to go when you're in a hurry. While I waited patiently I perused the menu and decided I'd order the red, white, and blue plate special, which is half a sandwich with either mixed greens or tomato soup. I chose the Jalapeno Popper sandwich and mixed greens. 

The salad comes with homemade croutons and a champagne vinaigrette dressing. It's decent. The sandwich is quite nice - not a lot of kick truthfully, but I hear they are working on it. I ordered an iced tea, but 2 people at my table were smart enough to order the homemade sodas and nice enough to share with me so I'd offer you a word of advice - don't make the same mistake I did, get the sodas. They are so interesting in flavor and quite refreshing.

There isn't a ton of seating, but on nice days there is a patio to enjoy. And they have a "happy hour" special in the afternoon on milk and cookies. How cute is that?
author: Tiffany N.

description: This place totally satisfied my grilled cheese sourdough craving. We had the Veggie Breakfast, mushroom Gruyere and Mousetrap. Amazing! Love the strawberry treat on the side for each order :)
author: Lillian S.

description:
I had the Veggie Breakfast and it was very good! Breakfast prices are also best bang for your buck. Lunch is $3-4 more and don't come with anything more, so go for breakfast.

Delish, cute decor but agreed it's a grilled cheese sandwich or egg and cheesewich, pretty easy to make yourself which is the reason for 3 stars.
author: Alison B.

description:
If the melted savory cheese with fresh smoked turkey, sweet and tangy ancho chili jam in between two perfectly toasted house made, gluten-free bread doesn't do it for you, I don't know what will. Each sandwhich is made with love and served with a large fresh strawberry on the side (nice touch guys).

I ventured over there around 12:15 today and walked right up to the counter without a single person in line....20 minutes later there was a massive line out the door so I'd recommend getting there earlier. Or don't, either way it's worth the wait. Not only are their sandwhich's delectable their service is what sets them apart from all other lunch spots in SOMA. Every order was handed to you with a huge smile and a sincere "thank you so much for coming in, hope to see you back again soon!" 

There's not a ton of room to sit inside but if you happen to come on one of those (seemingly rare these days) sunny afternoons they have seating outside as well. 

I dig it!
author: Kristy M.

description:
WOW! That was the best sandwich I have had in a LONG time!

The Jalapeno Popper sammich was delish. I ordered on the mobile app (which has a few flaws but it is still in beta testing), walked down the street, stood in line for about 2 minutes and BAM ! My sammich was ready for me.

Yes, it is crowded and disorganized with limited seating. I am an office manager and I plan lots of lunch meetings. Out of all the lunch places in the area, I can safely say this is NOT your best option for a sit down lunch if you are in a hurry or need a quiet space. But, if you're content with getting something to go, this place is great. 

I would suggest, if possible, improving the way those who order via the mobile app can pick up their food. There is just a tiny sign that's hidden that you can't see at all if there is a crowd. Other than that, I am really impressed. I will be back. :)
author: Stacy S.

description:
Yes, I will agree that this is the best grilled cheese I've ever had.
BUT ... it's still just a grilled cheese.
Sh*t ain't hard to make at home if you have high quality bread and cheese.  Not worth the money, but yes, it's really good.
Their tomato soup however, was crappy.
author: Michele S.

description:
I made the mistake of ordering only the Classic.  Don't get me wrong, it's a good breakfast sandwich.  However, I saw my colleagues getting ones with ham.  Get that instead!  

I am looking forward to come back again for something else.
author: Steven M.

description: Conveniently close to AT&T Park, and the food is surprisingly filling. The place gets awfully busy, though, and it was difficult to find a table. The Red, White & Blue special is really quite filling -- I had a mac & cheese grilled cheese with the tomato soup, and both were pretty good!
author: Kelly R.

description:
After months of waiting I squealed with glee when I realized that they were finally open!  My coworker and I blocked off a long lunch and walked over to South Park to get a taste of yummy grilled cheese.

Since we were there a week after opening, it was insanely crazy with a long line.  It took about 40 mins to get through that line.  I knew we were going to wait so I was prepared for it - I hear there is a ticketing system now.  To their credit, one of the owners came to apologize to those of us waiting and offered us samples of the house pickle.  I don't normally like pickles by themselves but it was really good!  Spicy, yet sweet.

I ordered the Mousetrap and added in the tomato and the bacon.  It was DELISH.  It came with a little mandarin orange.  I got one of the chips they had but I didn't need to eat it as the sandwich kept me full.  I am definitely, definitely coming back here.  I love a good grilled cheese and they did not disappoint me.
author: Sonya T.

description:
I love the concept.
I really like the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese.
Is it worth $10 bucks a sandwich?  Maybe.
Is it worth standing in that long-ass line?  I don't think so.

Sorry.  I'm low maintenance in so many ways.  But I DON'T do lines.  And guess what... I DON'T do unnecessary hoopla.  Sorry everyone, this place ain't 5-star great.  

Now that I've slammed them (LOL), I will justify the 4-star rating :)
I really dig the outdoor seating, the convenience, and....***drum roll pleezzeeee***....the CREATIVE, yummy, gooey, melted grilled cheese sandwiches.

Well done!
author: Angella S.

description: So unbelievably delicious. Had the mac and cheese grilled cheese and it was perfect. They also make great lemonades and sodas, and the meals come with oranges. Lots of great takes on an American classic - can't go wrong.
author: Chris P.

description: Came here for lunch because I saw they had gluten free bread and had seen some friends check in with great reviews on Facebook. It was good- nothing special, not quite what I was expecting, pretty pricey: $25 for 2 sandwiches a beer. I had the mousetrap and my husband had the jalepeno popper. I'd come back again to try something different.
author: Diana G.

description: Nothing screams heartwarming home food than grilled cheese and tomato soup.  We got the mushroom gruyer sandwich with the smoky tomato soup.  Both are good, but wish the sandwich has more of the cheese flavor.  But seriously it's sort of hard to screw up grilled cheese and tomato soup, the real difficulty is making it amazing.  This place was good, but nothing really special.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I kind of love this place.  Simply grilled cheese perfection.  It's reasonably priced as well - the mousetrap sandwich is only $6!  And it comes with fresh seasonal fruit - apple, orange, strawberries, plums :)

You'll savor and enjoy every single bite of cheesy greasy deliciousness.  And then you'll feel guilty for the rest of the day for eating so much cheesy greasy deliciousness (but hey, that's not their fault!)

Be prepared for a (long!) wait if you go during lunch.  Better yet, plan ahead and order using their mobile app!
author: Gowri R.

description:
Love this place. I've only been here once but the sandwiches are great. A little bit expensive (cuz it's a simple grilled cheese, you know?) but they use good quality ingredients. The service was friendly but nothing outstanding. 

The last time I went there, I got a Don Gondola sandwich (which isn't there anymore) and my friend got the mushroom gruyere. Both were insanely good and came with chips and an organic apple as side snacks. 

If you're not a big fan of grilled cheese, I wouldn't go there. Overall, I think it's a nice little place with very comforting food.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I brought my parents here for one of their semi-annual trips to visit me in the city.  We went around 11am, and there was no line.  Thirty minutes later, the line was out the door!  I had heard good things going in, but I was still pleasantly surprised.

Ambiance:  It's like any typical sandwich shop, but it has a little something extra.  I can't put my finger on it, but it's ... trendy.  Yes, trendy.  It's got a good thing going for it that makes you enjoy sitting on the patio.  To see and to be seen.  Now if they'd only get heat lamps...

Service:  You order and that's that.  Aside from ordering and them bringing you the food, you don't interact with the staff much.  However, if you ask them for help in clearing a table or when asking them about the menu, they're likely to be nice and accommodating. 

Food:  I ended up getting a sandwich called the Jalapeno Popper.  It was beyond good.  It was spicy, yet cheesy; subtle yet intense; calming yet exciting (grin).  I also liked that for a change-of-pace default, the sandwich came with a side of fruit instead of chips (in my case grapes).  

For a drink option, today was the first day that they had some sort of strawberry/grapefruit/lemonade blend.  My mom said it was sweet, my dad said it was tart.  I ended up getting a grapefruit-infused homemade soda that was REALLY good.  I suggest you look for it if you ever go, but from what I can tell the soda options change daily.

In the end, it was a place that I'd like to visit again.  I only gave it four stars because of the seating restriction.  I realize that most of the seating has to be outside, and in San Francisco that's to be expected, but it'd be nice if there was more indoor seating as well.
author: Bryan H.

description:
I love, love, love cheese and therefore also have a strong love for grilled cheese sandwiches.

After hearing about this place, I was ecstatic!  With all of the excitement that I built up, I was utterly disappointed when I realized that my expectations were not met.

I went with The Red, White and Blue Plate Special - which consists of half a sandwich and soup or salad.  I chose the Piglet (made with Tillamook sharp cheddar, ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter) and Smoky Tomato Soup.

THE PIGLET - Yeah, it was delightfully cheesy - and yeah, it was tasty.  But how hard was it really to make this?  For $8 for a whole sandwich, that is a bit steep in my opinion.  I was anticipating more shock and magic, I suppose.

SMOKY TOMATO SOUP - The only soup I really enjoy is tomato.  However, what I don't like is tart tomato soup.  Sadly, I prefer the Soup Co's Tomato Bisque over this "smoky" rendition. 

Lastly, I made the mistake of ordering their homemade Blackberry Lemonade.  Boy was this acidic!  It definitely did not compliment my soup.

Overall, The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is great for someone who lacks time to make their own grilled cheese sandwiches and doesn't mind throwing down more money for it.
author: Judy C.

description:
Refreshing Arnould Palmer.

I had the Mouse Trap. It really hit the spot.. and despite it's name it was still pretty big for me. I could only finish half of it.
author: Winny F.

description: Now that's how a grilled cheese should be made. I like this place better than the melt because they have better variety and quality in their sandwiches and side dishes. I go there when it's lunch time because their grilled cheese sandwiches are the bomb!  They're pretty pricy but the sandwiches just melts in  your mouth.
author: Ahrmon R.

description:
Grilled cheese is a solidly mediocre upscale specialty restaurant. The grilled cheeses, to give credit where it's due, are very good. The cheese pun chalkboard by the register will inspire a chuckle. But for between 9 and 13 dollars, you're going to get a pretty damn small grilled cheese sandwich and some fruit. I have no issue with the quality of the food, but I've never filled up here, and for the price I definitely expected to. 

The thing that really puts this place solidly in two-star territory is the service. If you get there outside of peak times, with maybe two or three other people waiting, you can still expect to wait 15-20 minutes. Maybe they have a six inch by six inch grill that can only cook one sandwich at a time, I really have no idea how they can stretch the wait out this long. As some other folks have said the employees really couldn't care less, which is fine for a sandwich shop, but again, not one that charges this much. If you're thinking of going to Grilled Cheese I would recommend you buy some fancy cheese and whatever else you're into, and just make it yourself.
author: Jesse M.

description:
Yummm! 

I came here on a Saturday afternoon. I came with 3 kids and another adult. The wait was out the door and there  was a fight for a table. I had ordered the Piglet, hot crusty bread on the out side and melted cheese on the inside. I also got to try the tomato soup it was ok. I also got to try the house made soda; it was sweet, cold and refreshing.

I will have to come back soon.
author: Kathryn W.

description:
I should mention first of all that my first trip here was during a bit of a rush before a Giants game since they are a few blocks away from the stadium. That being said, the line was out the door but we went through it very quickly as the counter staff were very efficient.

The wait for the sandwiches was pretty long though, seeing as though we only got two basic sandwiches and nothing fancy. We found some seats (after a few minutes of waiting) right in front of the window into the kitchen. My boyfriend noticed that at least one person handling food was not wearing gloves, which isn't the hugest deal if they keep their hands clean and don't touch anything else, but it was so fast paced I had trouble seeing what was going on. They also seem to pre-make their sandwiches and just grill them once ordered, so maybe the gloves things isn't so bad when you consider they're not actually handling all the ingredients, but rather just plopping sandwiches onto a tray? I don't know.

The sandwich itself was good. Not extraordinary... but good. I'd still be willing to come back and try a different kind, but it didn't totally blow me away.

The sandwiches come with strawberries on the side. That gave them a bonus point for me.
author: Rachel I.

description:
I came here after a little shopping spree. There's nothing better after shopping than a good ole American grilled cheese. I got here early like 10am but wanted a lunch sandwich the cashier wasn't sure they made lunch sandwich until later but then she asked and they would. I got one with mushrooms that came along with a bag of chips and an apple. 

I liked the sandwich but all the ingredients being mushrooms and caramelized onions were right in the middle and only in the middle which was a bit disappointing. I would have liked the guts a little more dispersed, so I only ate the middle cause the rest was empty and the crust was kinda hard.

They do have a really nice patio to sit on to enjoy your meal and provide free water cups.
author: Cris F.

description:
I'm torn.  I love grilled cheese.  I love sandwiches.  I don't love paying for something I make just as well at home.  Le sigh.  

I had been wanting to check out TAGCK (is acronyming the name a thing? it should be) since it first opened many years ago, but never made it to the area during business hours.  So when 2 friends from LA were in town for the day and said they wanted to check this place out I was so excited that now was finally my chance!

Well, I clearly picked the wrong people to go with because between the 3 of us it was decided we'd split two sandwiches and a bowl of the tomato soup.  We went with the classics: Moustrap and the mac and cheese sandwich.  Both sounded great, but I really should've ventured lower on the menu to try something more unique and worth the extra cost of having someone else grill your cheese for you.  

So the sandwiches were tasty, no doubt, but not necessarily phenomenal grilled cheese.  I've made larger grilled cheeses at home, with the same great cheesy taste, for way less money so it's not something I could justify ordering ever again (not just from a cost standpoint, but from a unique standpoint).  I would've thrown some bacon in the mix, but my two accompanists eat kosher, so that would not have flown.  In all, while quite tasty, I would never order either of these two again because I can make them just as well in my home kitchen.  

On another note, we asked if our 2 sandwiches could be cut in thirds, the woman behind the register replied "sure, no problem", but alas, they came out only cut in halves.  While I don't feel the need to fault them for something like this, it'd be nice if she had said they couldn't do that or if they could've honored our request.  

I'm a fan of what this place does and serves, but it's so out of my way now that I don't think the novelty of a grilled cheese restaurant makes up for the lack of originality and affordability of these sandwiches.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Ignore those early one-line reviews by seemingly self-important bored folks. Worthless review is worthless.

TAGCK is another great dining alternative in the South Park area. It's opening day, and we shared three sandwiches: the $6 Mousetrap (Tillanook and white cheddar), the $9 Mushroom Gruyére (Fontina, grilled wild mushrooms, thyme butter), and the $10 Rubenesque (Gruyére, Jarlsberg, local 'kraut and pastrami).

Each was worthwhile, with the Rubenesque being the only really filling choice. Add the traditional Thousand Island dressing and you would have something of a challenge to NY delis.

We skipped the bread pudding with creme fraiche, but will certainly return for it, even if we have to bring our own coffee from near-by Cento.

The staff were excited, friendly, and knew the menu. With deliveries of free pickles (good, but not exceptional) and home-made soda (the vanilla ginger-mint was fabulous) our opening day celebration was made perfect.

Visit; you won't be sorry you did.
author: Michael S.

description:
Put an adult flair to a childhood favorite and bam!  You now have a money maker.

They even pair the sandwiches with tomato soup; how much more perfect can it get?  But it could.  The sandwiches for some reason didn't astound me in the same way that Hog Island's much simpler, one-version grilled cheese did.

I tried the Mushroom Gruyere, Black & Blue, and Jalapeño Popper.  Mushroom Gruyere was creamy.  Black & Blue was balanced the best.  Jalapeno Popper's relish was too fruity.  If you're in the mood for a lighter lunch, then these sandwiches would be perfect but I would recommend getting one with meat because more likely than not you will get hungry within the hour of your last bite.  Remember that the tomato soup is soup and not bisque so it isn't as creamy.  In fact, it is pleasantly tart and comes with homemade croutons that are good enough to eat on its own.

With such a hefty crowd at lunch time, you can say you want your food to be eaten here but whether you get a seat or not is still a gamble.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Finally got to enjoy the glory that is The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen! Danny and I drove all the way from Burlingame today. Best advice I can give someone wanting to try TAGCK is GET THERE EARLY! The line gets long quick and gets longer as time goes by. Untill they extend the hours getting to TAGCK is the way to go.

The Mousetrap is one of the best grilled cheese I have ever had. So crips and full of cheese. Danny had the Reubenesque. The only down side to his was that the rye bread doesn't stand up to the grilling so well. As for the Smoky Tomato soup, it is your standard tomato soup. 
Oh and we got a sample of the house made pickles and they are super dill with a slight kick.

We both can't wait to go back for more.
author: Danny and Christina M.

description:
Had a late lunch here on a Friday around 03pm -  so easy to get a table!

After having disappointing grilled cheese at The Melt, I was really skeptical to go to another Grilled Cheese restaurant. I am so glad I did try though because this place was DELICIOUUUUS. 
I got the mouse trap, while my friend got the mushroom guyere. I really enjoyed mine: it was nice and crispy and cheesy and rich and yum. The mushroom guyere was also very tasty. You really cannot go wrong with mushrooms and caramelized onions. We both agreed that our sandwiches were prob one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches eveeer. They also came with sweet berries!

Portion wise, we thought it was perfect for a lunch!  
Next time I would like to try their mac and cheese grilled sandwich. 
I can imagine this is a good place to grab a bite before/after a baseball game because it is so close to AT&T park!
author: Ashley N.

description:
Went back recently and got the jalapeno popper sandwich with smoked bacon. Not as good as the Mousetrap. The popper sandwich lacked the oozing cheese of the Mousetrap due to the apricot spread and the bacon.  I'd stick with the standard if you're a grilled cheese sandwich purist.

This time we were able to grab three stools facing 2nd St, and it was a nice sunny day so lots of folks ate at tables outside.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Came here on a sunday around noon before the giants game. The line wasn't too long, and we got an outdoor table with ease.

I ordered a mimosa, a side of macaroni and cheese, and a mousetrap with bacon in it. Everything I had was top notch -- the mimosa was perfect taste and strength. The macaroni and cheese was delicious, with crispy bread crumb topping and the right amount of cheesiness. The grilled cheese was really good. The bread had a perfect cook on it, and they made the bacon fresh so it was crispy and delicious. 

If I worked closed to here, I would definitely make this a go-to lunch spot... instead I will have to try to frequent it before afternoon giants games!
author: Erica W.

description:
Oh god.
It hurts to breathe.

But in a good way. Like I just ate the most delicious grilled cheese and now my pants are cutting into my circulation sort of full.

My sammich partner in crime and I were at a loss today for our next excursion. We made the mistake of trying to go to Orson last week but were denied as they are closed Mondays. (Take note fellow duck fat fries seeker).

In any case, TAGCK had come up in conversation with some old coworkers over the weekend who  had been there recently, and armed with this info and my love of cheese and sammiches, M and I headed out to see if this place was SF magazine list worthy.

                                                     It was.

I had the "Piglet" and the smoked tomato soup and swooned as the gooey cheese oozed out one end when I took a bite. 

I get it. So yeah, it is $8 for a grilled cheese with ham. But COME ON!?!  Are you going to tell me you have rosemary butter , gruyere,  and fresh bread loaves sitting around your kitchen aching to be sliced, slathered and grilled? (If so, I want to be your BFF). I make plenty of tasty grilled cheese options when I'm home, but it is a treat to have some nonstandard options thrown in, and clever takes on an old favorite comfort food.

The sammich was well made and hot when I got it, and the soup was warm and homemade croutons were a nice touch.

They had great root beer from Lousiana called Abita and my taste of their daily special soda made me wish I was thirstier.

We ordered the bread pudding and butterscotch pecan brownie and in the end had to waddle our ways out of there.

The seating is limited inside, and the outdoor seats were full and cold so beware, you may need a coat! The staff were super friendly and fast!

Definitely a good addition to the area, and I can't wait to try to hit them up for a breakfast sammich soon.
author: Kathy K.

description: We always pass by this place on our way to the ballpark. So one morning before the game we finally decided to try it. I had their breakfast piglet $5.50 and my husband had their Farmer's Breakfast $6. We also tried their raspberry lemonade which was pretty sour. Their sandwiches were yummy!! They were crunchy on the outside and oooeey goooey inside. I would like to try their other sandwiches the next time we head out to a game before the season is over.
author: Chrissie G.

description: My go to Grilled cheese place. I love that I can use their app to order and then go pick it up, it's so convenient. The food it so yummy, its completely customizable so I can add what ever I want to my "mousetrap" grilled cheese.
author: Martha M.

description: Really tasty grilled cheese with an apple to go with it - a nice touch. I went for the Mushroom Gruyére at the suggestion of other reviews and wasn't disappointed. Going slightly later than lunchtime meant that it wasn't busy at all. I would say it's definitely worth a visit, but for me the price ($10) felt a bit high for what I got. The quality is probably worth it though - I'll be back.
author: Joe B.

description:
This is by far, the single greatest grilled cheese place I've been to.  Compares extremely favorably to the Grilled Cheese Truck and The Melt, both in flavors, textures, and quality ingredients.  

Had great service, enjoyed a beer while waiting for the grilled cheeses to come, then took them to the Stadium without any trouble, where the sandwiches were devoured. Left quite the impression on us!
author: David S.

description:
I counted down to the opening of this place mostly cuz it's super close to where I live and right across the street from where my husband works.  However, I would not have been brave enough to wait in the line (or patient enough) without my sandwich buddy, Justin, who was determined (and had a lazy enough work day ahead of him) to be ok with a 2 hour wait.  

I am sure that the wait was an aberration -- these guys didn't even do a soft opening, so this was literally their first day open.

Anyhoo, met some good people in line, Justin and I shared life stories ... again ... and eventually I was privileged enough to receive a mushroom gruyere sandwich coupled with a cup of roasted tomato soup.  They were lovely, perfect size (I got the 1/2 and 1/2) for lunch, and I devoured a raspberry cupcake as well that was delish!! Additionally, during the wait in line we were kept happy by little treats from the kitchen -- a free pomegranate spice soda (really nice!!) and some baked goods.  The pecan caramel brownie was great, as were the cookies. 

So.  Food's amazing.  Yay!
author: Tasha D.

description:
kinda pricey, but if you have the money go for it! Love all the gourmet ingredients slapped into a grilled cheese. you can't go wrong with any of them, but up to date i love the mushroom gruyere.

for breakfast try the muffins- amazing! they post which they have on their facebook daily.
author: Veronica E.

description:
MELTING CHEESY GOOD GRILLED CHEESE!

I had the mouse trap with bacon (regular GOOD grilled cheese with bacon)... probably the best grilled cheese I ever had! Cheese is melted to its perfection!
I also tried the Mushroom Gruyere... now I'm not a fan of mushroom but, it hit the spot! Definitely add the tomato! 

I went in late afternoon.. it was pretty crowded so, I suggest coming before lunch or after to avoid the lines!
author: Lianne D.

description:
This place is Awesome! In so many ways!

They have amazing lemonade to start, not to sweet, not to sour- perfect! So refreshing!

The mushroom gruyere is my favorite! Such a wonderful set of flavors. It's the perfect amount of bite! I love that the sandwiches come with fruit on the side- it makes a heavy sandwich not such a heavy lunch. 

I love to people watch and they provide the most perfect outdoor seating. 

I love coming here, and I can't wait for my next visit!
author: Taryn R.

description:
Greasy sandwiches. Greasy soup.  Greasy croutons.  The not-so-secret ingredient in everything at "American Grilled Cheese Kitchen" is an over-abundance of butter, yielding an oil slick on each dish.

At lunch on weekdays lines form out the door and around the corner.  After sampling the fare, one wonders why.

Served on overly toasted levain, a French country-style wheat bread, the $9 mushroom Gruyère sandwich features Fontina, Gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms, gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, and (of course) oodles of thyme butter.  The sandwich is presented in a basket, as the grease-bomb would surely slide off any plate.  Just as disappointing was the smoky tomato soup with house-made with crème fraîche, and (greasy) croutons.  Thin and (no surprise) a bit oily, it was a disappointment.  

The only thing that wasn't dripping in some form of oil or butter was the little organic green salad.  However, the tender, fresh greens were overpowered by a Champagne "vinaigrette," which rather than being light and delicate was the consistency of mayonnaise.

Co-owner Heidi Gibson may be a seven-time Grilled Cheese Invitational winner, but AGCK misses the mark.  If AGCK were judged on goodness (Heidi, that's "goodness," not "greasiness") to price ratio, it would certainly not come out on top.  

Perhaps it would be better to rename AGCK "American Greasy Cheese Kitchen." Then SOMA dwellers would a priori know what they were getting.
author: CJ G.

description:
Great grilled cheese!! You cannot go wrong with any of the grilled cheeses they offer!!! Another great part about The American is that they give you a piece of fruit that's in season, paired with your grilled cheese if you eat at the restaurant. 

But, MAKE SURE you don't underestimate the other items on the menu. 

The American has daily mac n cheese specials. Make sure you check on their daily specials, you don't want to miss their cajun bacon mac n cheese. Dear lord', a bite of that got me so wet. Almost needed to change trousers at work.
author: Maxwell C.

description: After taking a train for an hour to check out this place, and walking as fast as we could to make it before they closed at 5, they treated us badly. We got there at 4:40 and they refused to allow my fiend to get a glass of wine for me as well as her, as they said "no because then you might be here till 5:30". Wow. For all effort we went through to get here, and visiting from Arizona and Hawaii, this was sad. So it doesn't even matter how good the food tastes when the establishment doesn't even want you there.
author: Sally P.

description:
It's aiite.

The grilled cheese (good lord, so tempted to say grilled cheezus....) was... a grilled cheese.  It wasn't bad.  It was oily and heavy and laden with fatty goodness.  It was tasty, yes.  But somehow I don't really want to spend $8-10 on something that I can probably make at home for $2.

Got the combo with a soup-- It's kind of nice to have the cheese and tomato soup complementing one another.  Tomato soup was a little more sour than I'd prefer.

My coworkers and I made a trip out of it, and it was crowded, cold (outside), and greasy.  It was tasty, for sure.  Just a little pricey for what they'll give you.
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
I am rounding up 3.5 stars.

We were visiting the city for 49 square mile sample sale on Bryant street.  The hunger hit us after driving 2 hrs from Sacramento.  We wanted a quick bite to eat so we wouldn't miss out on the great deals.

We saw a crazy line at the American Grilled Cheese kitchen.  I thought, this place must be GOOD!!! (of course, I thought that, the longer the line, the better the food right?)

The line was super long but the guy working there brought us flavored soda and cookie samples on the house so that made me feel better.  The staff was pretty friendly.

Cons:
Long line... for grilled cheese... 


Pro:
The gruyere grilled cheese ewieth mushroom was amazing but very small piece of grilled cheese (even for a dieter like me).

Really lovely and delicious sodas!


Bottom line.. I don't believe you should have to stand in line for a grilled cheese but it gave me great ideas to spice up my grilled cheese at home.

Fun experience but too pricey.
author: Joanne L.

description:
Made the trip over for opening day.  They're open M-F 11:30-3pm for now so I went over at 2pm thinking the wait wouldn't be as bad.  It took 30 minutes to get to the counter and another 15 minutes for my sandwich but I hear the line was longer earlier on.  Except they ran out of everything except 3 sandwiches.  I got the feta tomato and it was a little greasy and didn't come with a side salad like pictured on their Yelp page.  It also had some olive tapenade on it which I wasn't crazy about.  So $7 for a toasted cheese sandwich and nothin' else for 45 minutes?  Geez, at least throw in a pickle.  

Oh yeah, a guy came out with drinks asking, "Sorry about the wait, do you want to try our housemade sodas?"  which was cool and then after people grabbed 'em said, "Just make sure to tell them at the cashier so they can ring you up for the drink."  Not cool.  

Staff was pretty upbeat considering the madness.  Nice concept, but not a good value considering that I paid OVER SEVEN DOLLARS for some tomato and cheese.  I can get a huge sandwich, fixings AND a lollipop at *other* sandwich shops for a similar price.  But I welcome the additional mid-week lunch option.
author: kiwi l.

description: The jalapeño popper is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had in my life.  Whenever I go to San Francisco I stop here and get one.
author: Mike D.

description:
I showed up at the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen towards the end of the lunch hour today and, to my surprise, barely had to wait in line. I got the Red, White & Blue special with macaroni & cheese grilled cheese and a side of tossed greens. It totaled $8.70 after tax + $1 tip, which is not too shabby. The special gives you half a sandwich and keeps you from feeling guilty about eating buttery carbs inside of more buttery carbs (CARBCEPTION!). Also, they add fresh fruit to all their meals. Pretend you're eating healthy.

Take your order to-go and sit in South Park. 

Praise cheezus.
author: K M.

description: The mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwich was really good, but the bread on the jalapeño popper was eh. If you like tough bread then you'll prob enjoy it. Otherwise great place to go.
author: Thane F.

description:
A restaurant dedicated to grilled cheese. Add mimosas and some eye candy in the kitchen (I'm looking at you, cute grilled cheese chef) and I'm in complete and total paradise here.

I tried the Mouse Trap with and without bacon, Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese, and the Piglet. They were all good, but the Piglet grilled cheese won the award for breakthrough performance. The combination of the apple mustard, cheddar, ham, and rosemary butter gave it a unique bite that justified the reason I paid for a grilled cheese in one of the best culinary cities in the first place.
author: Vanessa M.

description: Veggie breakfast sandwich is kick ass.  My new go-to in the hood.
author: Matthew B.

description: Amazing grilled cheese sandwiches with great add-ins. I think I had turkey, cheese and mustard. They offer gluten free bread so I was in heaven. There is seating outside. It gets very busy weekday lunch times so be prepared to wait. Wish there was one in LA.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Bought the Mushroom Gruyere Grilled Cheese Sandwich and it was so delicious.  These guys seriously know how to perfect the grilled cheese sandwich.  The bread was so buttery and crisped to perfection.  The mushrooms were chopped so finely that it looked like a beef patty.  I believe it also came with some slices of potatoes and grilled onions.  Looking at the sandwich when it arrives, it doesn't look appealing.  But once you take that first bite, you're like WOW!!!  This meal also comes with a couple of strawberries that are so sweet.

The only downside to this place is that it closes at 5pm.  Other than that, 5 stars FTW!
author: Timothy D.

description:
Dammit, this place is a stupendous indulgence!  It feeeeeels soooo goooood, soooo creamy...I ooze as I eat.  Oozing is underrated.  The mind is soothed, comfort is the overwhelming sensation, I have an inner smile with cheese stuck in my teeth.  It's a great feeling.

Ordered the Mushroom Gruyere with Bacon.  And it came with two lovely strawberries.  The bread was cruuuusty, but sooooo gooooood.  Except for the crust.  Which was so crispy that the roof of my mouth has little tears in it.  That's the wrong kind of oozing.

But this place is kick ass.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Jalapeño Popper is the only way to go! Club Turkey or the american dip is also super tasty. To get the most value you can get the red white and blue special. This gives you a small version of any sandwich PLUS a soup, which is usually smokey tomato with croutons (YUM).

Other things: 
Get a blondie (butterscotch walnut brownie)
or a biscuit (jalapeño and cheese) when you can.  
HOME made pickles! 3 for $1.50 super tasty.
Ice coffee is great $2
and house made sodas are also worth a try.


I got here whenever I get a chance or when friends come in town. Most of the time there is a line. Durring baseball season they open 'til 6pm when there is a home game. 

This will literally be the best grilled cheese you will ever eat. Really.
author: Kevin K.

description:
As I fully expected, after returning to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen several weeks after the opening, I can confidently say that they have gotten their act together and hit their stride. The line is under control, the menu has stabilized and, perhaps it's my imagination, but today's sandwich seemed a lot bigger than the one I had last time. Today I saw the "Red, White and Blue Plate Special" on the menu, which gives you a side salad but a smaller sandwich for the same price as a regular sandwich; perhaps I inadvertently ordered that last time.

The feta and tomato sandwich is unfortunately no longer on the menu, but I loved the gruyère, roasted mushroom, and potato sandwich with caramelized onions and thyme butter that I had today. Like last time, the bread was lathered in butter and toasted to perfection, and the cheese was deliciously gooey. The the onions and mushrooms added a lot of saltiy flavor to the dish.

I have no choice but to up my rating to 5 stars because the minor hiccups they had when opening are fully resolved and there is nothing I would change about today's dining experience.
author: Adam B.

description:
Ya gotta love the grilled cheese sandwich. It can virtually do no wrong. That said, there are varying degrees of right, and this place is definitely doing a lot of things right.

For starters, their tomato soup, a must with GC, is killer. Has a nice sharp cheddar in it to give it some kick. And I loves me some kick.

And the shroom and Gruyere sammy goes perfect with the soup. However, my one nit is that it doesn't stand alone. It needs the soup with it to truly shine.

But then the jalapeño popper sammy came along and... NAILED IT! This thing is like a grilled dream come true. Assuming you like spicy and you're not on a diet. But then again, if you're on a diet you really shouldn't be going to a grilled cheese restaurant, now should you?
author: Ari H.

description:
Oh how I heart grilled cheese sandwiches! This restaurant is like a dream come true - affordable, generous portions, drool-worthy grilled cheese sandwiches, fresh salads, & amazing tomato soup.

Red, white & blue plate special - At $8, it's a steal. Comes with half sandwich, half soup/salad. Note that their halves are more like fulls. 

Mushroom-gruyere sandwich is absolutely delish. Only warning is that the sandwiches are really oily and heavy - it sits in my stomach pretty much all day. 

Outdoor seating - There is limited indoor seating so be prepared to sit outdoors. On the rare sunny day in SF, it's awesome. Otherwise, bring layers. Or take it to go.
author: Connie C.

description:
This has become one of my Giants Pre-game go-to's. The sandwiches are delicious and there's a small selection of quality beers available at a fair (less than ballpark, of course) price. They also offer a very good tomato soup. It does tend to get crowded, but it's a small price to pay.
     Of course, as good as the sandwiches are, the breakfast sandwiches are better, but are only available during breakfast hours. If you can make it though, it's worth it.
author: Jesse S.

description: The grilled classic with tomato soup was amazing. I have to go back to try the Mac n cheese on the grilled cheese next time. Delicious place for a lunch!!
author: Z W.

description:
You know how cold, foggy San Francisco days makes you crave something warm, toasty and comforting? That's what AGCK is here to satisfy. 

The Husband and I headed over to SOMA on our bikes on a beautiful, crisp Saturday afternoon around 1PM. Parking looked ok, especially if you headed down South Park and parked near Townsend. There's limited inside seating but a decent number of tables outside. 

I wanted a nice and easy grilled cheese sandwich so opted for The Mousetrap which is a bunch of different sharp cheeses and added some bacon. The Husband ordered the Mushroom Gruyere. The Mousetrap was cheesy and sharp and the bread was perfectly buttered and toasted. I can imagine it being fantastic with some tomato soup (which I unfortunately didn't order, although they had it). The Mushroom Gruyere was extremely hearty and filling because of the potatoes they put in. It was great with some hot sauce.

Red Delicious apples (I don't know why they're called delicious when they're the worst-tasting apples in the world, probably) came with our sandwiches. It was kind of weird because Red Delicious apples are the types of apples one would expect to be served in a school cafeteria...

Anyway, I enjoyed my sandwich and my sugary strawberry lemonade (still nice and tart) and sitting in SOMA on a sunny Saturday. In the immortal words of my favorite cyborg assassin: I'll be back.
author: Christine P.

description:
I have walked by this place a million times on the way to the ballpark but have ignored it for fear that it was just a "themed" restaurant with no hook other than different grilled cheeses (which admittedly is enough for most). But when my out of town friend wanted to try it, I went along for the ride. 

I came on an early Saturday afternoon and the place was buzzing but not too busy.  It was a really nice day outside so there were a couple of people waiting for tables but the turnover seemed pretty quick. 

The inside was pretty small but had counters for additional seating or colder days. I ordered the half Jalapeno Popper sandwich and the Smoky Tomato soup. I was a little weirded out by the description which listed apricot-jalapeno relish but in the end, the "bacon" listing won me over. 

The food was served pretty quickly and was AMAZING. The soup had a little creme fraiche to break up the smokiness of the soup and the portion was hearty. The sandwich was the best part though - the BREAD. The levain bread is not a joke - it's crispy but soft and tastes delicious. The combination of the bacon, cheeses, and spiciness of the relish was perfection. The relish was SO amazing. 

I also had their homemade raspberry lemonade which was pretty good. 

One of the best grilled cheeses of my life. Will definitely be back.
author: Carmen K.

description:
No complaints here. Great place for quick lunch, tasty and healthy! I love how they include an apple with your meal. Cute touch.

I decide to get the 1/2 grilled cheese 1/2 tomato soup combo. The  Mushroom Gruyère was creamy and delicious. The bread was toasted perfectly ..mm love that crunch sound! The croutons that came with the soup were waaaaaaaaaaaayyyy too salty. 

I didn't have to wait long maybe 5min max? Quick service and decent price. I would recommend this place to a friend. 

There's decent amount of parking spaces around S Park Ave.
author: Karen P.

description:
Figuring that I would be the only one working on MLK day, and my other 2 lunch buddies had the day off (apparently, my company doesn't like black people - i kid, i kid), we decided to go here.  I actually didn't realize most people had the day off, so it was nice and crowded.

3 of us split:
jalapeno popper, american dip (smoked pepper cheddar + roast beef etc), and the piglet.  also throw in a tomato soup and gluten free mac & cheese.

the wait was a while.  sure, it's a holiday (for most, not me), and it was sunny (60F in Jan?  what??). 

what i really liked:  the jalapeno popper and the piglet.  
what i enjoyed, but wouldn't necessarily order again: tomato soup, mac & cheese, american dip.

the popper had a little bit of heat, i wish it had a little more.  the piglet was nice and cheesey, and the ham adds just the right texture.

the american dip, was like a glorified roast beef sandwich.  nice touch with the horseradish sauce on the side.  but not really one i'd get again, especially at a grilled cheese joint.  the tomato soup was just average, and the mac & cheese - definitely was gluten free.  nothing wrong with that, and i should have thought more about it before i got that (so that's my fault).

For $39 out the door, it's not a cheap lunch.  it's a little pricey, but then again this is SF - where many things are organic, sustainable, and harvested using only bamboo chopsticks.  for that, i give it a 3.  i still want a joint that serves a damn good, damn cheap, non organic-ey type grilled cheese sandwich.  you know, the kind you used to eat as a kid.  that is whats gonna win my heart.  

all in all, i would come back.  i still love grilled cheese.

don't miss: the wall of butter along the window, facing south park.
author: Jason J.

description: Really yummy! Stuffed grilled cheese with Mac n cheese n bacon. Good thing we rode to the game.
author: Maureen G.

description:
In this cheesy competition, we find out which eatery has the most grit. Or not. That's probably not what you want at all in a cheese sandwich. Much less a mac and cheese sandwich! 

Thankfully, all the grit is provided by this horrible earth, as you sit outside on the patio and allow the wind to blow through the hoboland that is South Park and it kicks up all the sand, dirt, and foliage right into your once delicious grilled chicken mac and cheese sandwich. 

It's okay, I probably needed more raw foods in my diet anyway.
author: Ben T.

description: Nice sandwich menu plus decent selection of beer. Got coffee too. Minus a star for no espresso. Good prices and great location near soccer field. Family vibe.
author: Al S.

description:
An eatery that only sells grilled cheese sandwiches. Brilliant concept. Why didn't I think of that? Food & Wine calls AGCK one of the Best U.S. Restaurant Openings of 2010 and I agree!

We ordered: 
Moscone sandwich & tomato soup
Mousetrap sandwich with bacon & tomato soup

Everything was wonderful and comes with an apple so you can feel like you ate something healthy when you really didn't.

Tip: Don't attempt to eat the croutons on their own like I did. They are super peppery.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Ya know...It was good.  But how hard is it to F up a grilled cheese?  

I enjoyed the experience, but I prefer the Grilled Cheese Truck in LA's grilled cheese renditions AND their tomato bisque over AGCK.  

Plus, $15 for a sammy and some soup?  That's poor management of  finances on my part :-(
author: Alex T.

description:
My weakness is CHEEESSSEEE!  I finally got to go to this place and I was like a little mouse in a cheese factory!  The place isn't that big, just a few tables inside and tables outside.  The menu board wasn't too overwhelming, which I personally like so I don't have to contemplate too long on what to have.  All the menu selections, of course consist of hot... gooey... melted cheese... yum!

The service is good.  You line up.... place our order... take a seat (or have to go)... not too long of a wait... (of course, how long does it take to grill up some bread with melted cheese)... nothing fancy... quick & easy!

Overall:  YUM YUM YUM!  Get there early for lunch, the line usually goes out the door onto the sidewalk by noon. And if there is a ballgame at AT&T... expect to wait awhile, but all WORTH IT FOR THE CHEESE!

Enjoy!
author: Miriam O.

description:
delicious grilled cheese sandwiches, delicious! i had the mousetrap by the way. 
they even give you a free small apple for a "balanced" meal, haha
and i tried their strawberry lemonade and it was refreshing and yummy.
author: Diana P.

description:
If you like cheese and you like bread, then you must come here. They take old-fashioned grilled cheese sandwiches, add a few various ingredients, and create something amazing. I've been here about three times and haven't deviated from the Jalapeno Popper (minus bacon) sandwich. It is so good, especially if you're a fan of spicy food. Add a little bit of tabasco sauce and you've got yourself a delicious sandwich. I also tried their blackberry mint soda and it was decent. I tasted more blackberry than mint but its not necessarily a bad thing. My friend got their kiwi lemonade and it was way too sour, more so than regular lemonade.  

Also, this place can get pretty crowded around noon or one on the weekends so a group of more than 4 or 5  may have some trouble finding a table.
author: Krishna S.

description:
This place is so over-rated.  Greasy is one word to describe it.  I mean, grilled cheese itself is greasy but this place adds like another gallon on top of what you'd normally get.

At $9.00 for a sandwich, its a rip.  The quality isn't there, and just a massively disappointing experience.  

In fact, its so greasy none of the guys in the office even want to go there.  Now that's saying something.

First and last time there.  Even if someone else pays.
author: Free B.

description: Finally had a chance to try this place out. I'm a big fan of grilled cheese so it's been on my mind for a while. Went with my pops and we had the jalapeño popper and American sandwiches. The American was better but both were eehhh. I was disappointed. Guess I'll have to keep searching for that perfect grilled cheese.
author: Minh H.

description:
This place makes gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches. I've only been in here once, but I work down the street so we order lunch with them all the time. The grilled mac and cheese is great. I've also had other various sandwiches and have enjoyed them all! 

It's also in a cute location (down the street from AT&T Park) and has outdoor seating. Great for a nice day!
author: Mimi V.

description:
You must love and appreciate good cheese + bread to like this place.  
The sandwiches are about $8 but it's good cheese on good bread, not Kraft Singles.

Waited 15 min in windy cold SF weather for my grilled cheese and it well worth the wait.

I ordered the Piglet sandwich (Tillamook sharp cheddar, cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter) on a crunchy warm wheat and added smoky tomato soup to complete my meal.  Gluten free bread available upon request.  All sandwiches come with a fruit of the day.  I My order came with a juicy plum.

Would have given it 5 stars if there was more seating indoors.  Have your friend save some seats inside while you order.  Lots of chairs/tables outdoors but WAY too cold/windy.
author: J B.

description:
This place was probably only 3 stars in my book until this morning.  And now not only has it been upgraded to 4, but I've been so inclined as to write a review on Yelp.  

The lunch can be a long wait, which has gotten better since some of the hype died down, but that's where the 3 stars comes in.  Don't get me wrong, the two sandwiches I've had were good - but I don't know if they were $10 good - and that's without a drink or side.  

I upgraded that piece to 4 stars this morning when I had their breakfast sandwich.  Just a simple ham, egg and cheese on buttery wheat toasted amazing bread.  And the yoke exploded.  NO that's not a euphemism - literally happened to the egg on the sandwich.  Amazing.  It was $5 and change - which is strange because it was about the same size as their lunch sandwich... I don't know, maybe better/more ingredients.  

So summing it up: 3 stars for the lunch, upgraded to 4 stars for one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had.
author: Matt L.

description:
2.5 maybe 
and all 2.5 stars come from the brussel sprouts. Good god those things haunt my dreams--the best I've ever tasted and I'm a Brussel sprouts expert if I do say so myself. 

The rest of the food is forgettable AT BEST. Stay away from the tomato soup which is thin and bland. Stay even farther from the quinoa salad which is soggy and too spicy and bitter.

The grilled cheeses are never bad but they are bread with greasy cheese--pretty difficult to screw up right? I love the concept for the restaurant and I'll go back (since I can't live without those sprouts) but I'll be mildly pouty about it when I do.
author: Meg M.

description: Came here after 11:00am on a Saturday and was so excited to try their many different grilled cheese sandwiches BUT their lunch menu did not start until NOON. Big bummer so I ordered their grilled cheese with Egg. It was tasty and delicious but was so looking forward to the lunch menu. Darn next time then
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
yes. I like to come here for breakfast sometimes. Who doesn't like grilled cheese? I like the farmers breakfast with ham, and when they put that runny egg inside, and you take a bite and the yolk gets all over the sandwich, that my friends is a good flippen morning. 

For lunch, if time permits, I like to have a seat at the bar, order a tomato soup, and any of the grilled cheese. The atmosphere is welcoming, and I like the smell inside. 

My coworker has insisted I try the jalapeño popper one, and I can't wait. 

Service is cool, sometimes takes a while, but worth the wait. Then again, each grilled is made to order. 

When I feel like melted cheese, yeah, I'll hit up this place all day any day.
author: Nye T.

description: I became addicted to these super high quality ingredient grilling sensations and started frequenting the place regularly. Highly recommend the app since the line is grueling and production then takes ~10 mins, which seems long for an order at the front kind of place. Staff is super friendly always. Seating always good. Wish I could order breakfast there on the app also, otherwise it sadly takes too long.
author: J D.

description: I go here for lunch regularly. Pretty much everything is awesome. Tried the "Jalapeño Popper" grilled cheese and it just hit the spot. Love it. SOMA is full of hipsters but this place is so casual I forget I am in SOMA.
author: Edgar M.

description:
If I could, this would be 5 stars. I docked a whole star cause of the price. I know SF is expensive, but man I felt guilty spending $9 on half a sandwich and bowl of tomato soup. I came here with my boyfriend, and we got half a mac and cheese sandwich with tomato soup and the half mushroom Guyere sandwich and tomato soup. delicious! We were totally stuffed afterwards. Came with a small apple which made a yummy crunchiness with our food. The service was nice, and the seating was nice too (they have awesome outdoor seating). The flavors were strong and delicious! I would totally go again..but the price is killing me...(I know it is SF...but still so expensive!) 

P.S their wine was crazy crazy expensive...more than at a club!
