author: Maryam R.

description:
Around the corner from my office.

Who knew a grilled cheese place has effing fresh delicious warm homemade muffins?

I owe my muffin-top to American G.Cheese Kitchen muffins.

Lemon poppyseed, blueberry, mixed berry, peanut butter cup...you name it, flavor changes daily.
author: Angelica M.

description: I was really looking forward to trying this place and had been yelping it for the past few months since I do love me a gooey grilled cheese sandwich :) However, I was disappointed by this place. I tried both the Jalapeno Popper & the Mushroom Gruyere. Both were okay...nothing special and honestly not really worth the calories...
author: Asha S.

description:
And now for my 100th review...I'd like to showcase a place that I keep coming back every time I am in San Francisco.

If cheesy puns, tangerines, melting cheese and hurt-the-top-of-your-mouth bread are your kinds of things, you have to check out The American. The variety of different flavors of grilled cheese is pretty impressive, ranging from stinky cheese to old classics. All comes with an elegant tangerine, ready to cleanse your palate once you get your dose of dairy goodness.

The cheesy puns are well documented on this here site, but my personal favorite this time was "brie-will, brie-will, rock you".

This place makes you glad Wisconsin laid the groundwork for the wide acceptance of cheese in this country.
author: Andre L.

description:
i wish i had not come here when i was hungover!!  

i ordered a foghorn leghorn, which looked and smelled good, but i could barely hold it down :(  i ended up eating half of the grilled cheese, nibbling on the apple that came with the order, and finishing my entire kiwi lemonade.

it's not super cheap, but it is definitely worth trying especially if you love grilled cheeses!!  my friend got a half grilled cheese half soup combo for 8 dollars, which i would recommend!  the "half" grilled cheese was still a sizable portion, especially since it looked bigger than half of my grilled cheese.  who knows, though! 

i have definitely had better grilled cheeses, but i think the whole set up, the great service / the interior / outdoor seating / sunny day really sold me.  service is fast because grilled cheeses obviously do not take long to make :)
author: Jennifer L.

description: Gluten free bread is amazing! The staff is extremely knowledgable of their menu and all the ingredients! great location near Jeremy's too! I would come back all the time if i could!
author: Ariele L.

description:
One of the things I really enjoyed about SF was randomly stumbling upon cool looking eateries on every street. A restaurant dedicated to just  grilled cheese? Say What? Time for a pit stop! =P

This place is located on a quiet street. Away from the hustle and bustle of Market street. The interior is small, very clean and industrial with limited seating because they only have stools and bars. For more leg room, you can sit at the patio seating outside. 

Menu consists of....of course grilled cheese sammies! With a few soups and salads. They also have some baked goods too. At the time we arrived it was brunch so we ordered the Farmer's Breakfast ($5.50), which is a sammie with sharp cheddar, roasted potatoes, bacon, egg and chive butter.  Was really good! And the sandwich was pretty sizable. I  had split it, but would have been very full if I ate the whole thing. The bread was grilled wonderfully and was crunchy. Love the potatoes too. Also had a ham and chive biscuit ($2.50)! Delish. Ham pieces were generous.  

Regular grilled cheese sandwiches range from $8 to $9. And there are a variety of different options to try. A neat place to stop by if you are in the area!
author: Julie L.

description: Grilled cheese was amazing but the tomato soup had a funky after taste.  Service was good and the guys friendly.  Would go back if I'm in the San Fran area again.
author: Julie Z.

description:
I got the mousetrap with tomato, and it was great--grilled just right, cheese melting everywhere, oozing out of the bread, yum.  The tomato soup tasted homemade, and a little tabasco kicked the flavor right up.  

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars, because it's really hard to screw up grilled cheese, right?  I'm going with 4 stars, mainly because we showed up at 11:20 and didn't have to wait in a line (note to potential diners: the line seemed to appear out of thin air at 11:45).  

So while I admit it was damn good, I did feel a little silly about paying $10 for a meal my gramma would make me for free.  And I would have felt really silly about waiting 45 minutes for it.

PS:  AGCK wins brownie points for making everything reuseable or compostable.
author: Dana S.

description:
Delicious fancy Grilled Cheese restaurant delivers on everything you'd hope from it. The place has a pretty simple business model... jump in line, order your food to go or grab a number and a table, and wait a few moments until they deliver you some joy. 

I ordered their Club Turkey, with Sharp Cheddar and Creamy Havarti, Smoked Turkey, Bacon, Arugula, Tomatoes, and tangy Sierra Nevada Mustard served on Sourdough (because there should be no other bread options when you visit the Bay Area). I also ordered a cup of their delicious Tomato Soup and a steaming cup of Coffee. My brother ordered the Mushroom Gruyere Sandwich, which was also delicious. 

The charming little restaurant has a chalkboard covered in Cheese puns and also serves up a small yet good selection of Craft Brews. I love me some fancy Grilled Cheese, and this restaurant delivers some of the best high-end versions of the childhood staple that I've ever tasted.
author: Seth G.

description: Whenever I work in San Francisco, I make it a point to visit the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen! Mimosas and a macaroni and cheese grilled cheese sandwich?! Heaven!! The serving size is perfect (fills me up without feeling too stuffed) and it comes with a little apple on the side. Prices are on the expensive side ($9 for the sandwich, $4 mimosas) but I think it is worth it.
author: Crystal B.

description: Mhmmmmm, mhmmmmm, mhmmmmm!!! LoL I love this place! The service was so friendly and the selections on the menu for what kind of grilled cheese sandwich you want is delicious! What better to pair a grilled cheese sandwich than some delicious soup, right?!? LoL Plus, the soups come with their own bag of giant croutons!!! This place is absolutely a great place to chill and chat for lunch. =)
author: Anji W.

description:
Nice employees. Sandwich-nothing special. Sharp cheddar was really just a small amount of AMERICAN cheese! Salad was only mixed greens with a nice dressing.
Honestly don't see what the big fuss is about.
author: Noel K.

description: Ahem..let me just start of by saying that this is not you just 'avarage' grilled cheese sandwich. I mean good lawrd this bad boy was on steroids.  This is a  queso masterpiece, so if you are lactose intolerant,you best eat some beano before you go, foo shoo. I had the foghorn leghorn sandwich and it was absolutely scrumptious. and the smoked tomato basil soup,whewhoo, de-lish!
author: Ladybird G.

description:
I first got to try the American Grlled Cheese Kitchen at Outsidelands and loved their Jalapeno Grilled Cheese sandwich.  When I finally got to pay a visit to their real location on 2nd Street, I tried the Mushroom Gruyere Grilled Cheese Sandwich.  The Sandwich comes with a little piece of fruit and you can get a side of their smoked tomato soup on the side or as a dipping accompaniment.  

It can be crowded at times and you may have to wait for a table inside or out.  If you go early enough, you can try their assortment of egg grilled cheese sandwiches.
author: Carli F.

description:
Quality breakfast place that sorted my hangover right out. Functional and tasty, and then headed to Candlestick feeling like a new man

If you're in the area definitely try out this place
author: Ben C.

description:
I thought i was overpaying for a mousetrap on gluten free bread plus lemonade, but no.
trust me.
try this place. the foods good, the place is amazing, and the staff is super friendly!
author: Angie M.

description:
Grilled cheese for adults. It's basically all kinds of grilled cheeses packed with all kinds of good stuff. I got the foghorn leghorn (it had blue cheese, chicken, arugula, whole wheat bread). A little salty, but as expected...it's cheese. Overall, nice combination... Well done!

It has nice outdoor seating. Can get really windy though, so make sure your sandwich doesn't fly away. They serve beer and wine, but might as well go across the street to 21st amendment brewery!
author: Ann P.

description:
If you like this place, I'm guessing were wasted at 21 Amendment Brewing, you were high, you are rich, and/or you have zero ability to cook at home.  $26 for 2 sandwiches, a bowl of tomato soup that tasted like Campbells, and a lemonade.  You must be joking (just an FYI, if you wanna pay for a real sandwich just go to Ike's).  

I'll do you a huge favor, make this grilled cheese and tomato soup recipe at home, and see if you'll pay for this novelty again...

http://www.bonappetit.com/recipes/quick-recipes/2011/04/grilled_cheese_and_fried_egg_sandwiches

http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/sunny-anderson/roasted-tomato-soup-recipe/index.html

you are welcome, I just saved you about $15.
author: A A.

description:
I work next door to the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, which many of my friends look upon with envy. Suffice it to say I've been to this place enough times to have formulated an opinion about it.

The grilled cheese is good, there's no doubt about that. But does it live up to the hype? I don't think so.

The best things? Staff is pretty friendly, the mushroom gruyere is delicious, the lunch special that comes with soup, the piece of fruit is a nice touch. The breakfast sandwiches are yummy with the egg.

The things I'm not a huge fan of: The price is a bit expensive for what it actually is. The place is pretty small and the patio gets really overrun. The line is super long (not their fault, but still) at lunchtime and perhaps the worst parts for me: They take fifteen years (ok, 20 minutes) to make a grilled cheese sometimes. I can make one while drunk in 5 minutes. What's the deal? Also, this is not a place for the health conscious. Of course grilled cheese is never healthy, but you can leave one of these on a stack of napkins one inch thick and let it sit for a little and those napkins will be soaked through with grease. Don't get me started on the muffins either. Delicious, but somewhat excessive. If that's possible.
author: Courtney A.

description:
While the food is decent, I now avoid this place for lunch as it's often a wait of 30-40 minutes or more for a to go order.
I might recommend the option to order online to avoid what ends up being a pretty disappointing experience.
If you value your time try something else in the neighborhood
author: Rory N.

description: Been here a few times now, and it's always been fantastic! Eclectic vibe, always busy, friendly and hard-working employees make it a great dining experience. The Mac N Cheese grilled cheese is pretty darn amazing, too.
author: Erin T.

description:
We came here on a Friday night before a Giants game. It was very busy - most of of the tables outside were packed but we found some room inside. 

We all got the mushroom, potato and gruyere sandwich - with arugula added. This is one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches that you will ever have. The bread is crispy and buttery. The gruyere is to die for. 

They stay open late for games, but close when the game starts, so if you want to grab a bite before the game, make sure you plan accordingly.
author: Alden Q.

description:
The space is a fun and fast-paced little lunch spot.  There is plenty of outside seating but the crowd is always large so be prepared to wait a little while.  

If you want a classic grilled cheese sandwich with a culinary twist that only a city like San Francisco can do then this is the place to check out.  I frequently get the Club Turkey but the Mushroom Gruyère is tasty too.
author: Kevin J.

description:
(review for 2/28/2011)

Get. It. Together. 

25 min wait :( Lost order. Attitude. 
Comped meal. Too little, too late. 

Classic grilled cheese is lackluster, but concept is genius. Hopeful that this place cleaned up their act since the beginning of the year!

$6 ish for plain grilled cheese
Cramped on inside when busy, patio too cold on cold SF days.
author: Jane L.

description:
on our way to lunch at another spot down the street we walked right past this place and my eyes lit up! with a name like the american grilled cheese kitchen i couldn't help but detrour off my original path right through the front doors. i'm pretty sure i had some dumb smile and drool running down the side of my mouth while staring at the menu. 

i decided to go with the club turkey and a cup of the smokey tomato soup. the sandwich was delicious with fresh ingredients and a good smokey flavor from the turkey. from the bacon to the sierra nevada stout mustard the ingredients blended well and tasted great. the soup was decent with some smokey flavor and homemade croutons on the side. 

the only thing that would hinder me from going back is the price. the soup and sandwich came out to a whopping $14 dollars and some odd change. that was a bit steep for me...otherwise i would recommend.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Everyone must go here at least once in their life!!! This place is full of glorious, cheesey, unhealthy goodness!!!!! Came here at around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon and it was quite busy. Mind you, this place is right next to AT&T park, so if there's a giants game be sure to plan ahead.

The location is amazing, we got the mushroom guyere and jalapeno popper sandwiches...both delilsh, but I definitely preferred the mushroom guyere. 

We also, each got a side of tomato soup-definitely recommend. Your sandwich also comes with a crisp apple. After my boyfriend and I stuffed our faces we walked it off at the local consignment shop (I think it was called "Jeremy's") and park. Great way to spend the afternoon in SOMA!!
author: B B.

description: Perfect place to satisfy your cheese craving! Many options to choose from so there's something for everyone. If you don't want a sandwich(really?) they've got you covered with soups and salads. Don't forget to end the meal with a yummy chocolate chip cookie!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Who doesnt LOVE a grilled cheese? This place is on point. There's some creativity in the menu, soup for dipping, salads if you're not into the amazing Grilled Cheese thing they have going on....they've got all the bases covered. There's desserts, house lemonade and a great little selection of beer. Maybe wine too, I think.

They are doing everything right. The sandos are amazing, the location is cool and the service is solid. 

Cut to the food. I order a Breakfast Piglet and a Squid Ink (Black IPA). The sandwich is delicious and the local beer is amazing. The lady orders a Jalapeno Popper and their house lemonade. She offers a bite and I gladly accept. Its freeking delicious! I realize I may have ordered the wrong sandwich although, I still stand by my earlier comment about the Breakfast Piglet! Both sandwiches were amazing but the Jalapeno Popper has this perfect bacon on it and is dressed with an Apricot/Jalapeno relish that just puts it over the top!

Gourmet Grilled Cheese, a Local IPA and patio seating near Giant's stadium. Give me a beautiful day and my girl and I'm there!
author: Matt T.

description:
i know that anyone and everyone's first thought when thinking grilled cheese is "greasy", "oily", "bloating to the max". however... THINK AGAIN.

i ended up ordering the mushroom gruyere, which consisted of fontina, gruyere, mushrooms, potatoes, leeks, and caramelized onions. the bf ordered the foghorn leghorn, which has havarti, blue cheese, chicken, and dill-dijon mustard. if that right there makes your mouth start to water, wait till you read all the other sandwich options (i posted a pic of part of the menu). 

we both ordered our sandwiches as "red, white, and blue specials", which consists of a half sandwich, a bowl of tomato soup or salad, and a fruit. we also copped a lemonade on the side. the sandwiches were not greasy or heavy-feeling at all. the tomato soup was perfect, with a little smoky flavor to it. all i can say is that they used so much cheese that the cheese was oozing out of the holes in my bread! 

the outside seating area was peaceful, and the area wasn't too loud or noisy. the seating area was enclosed in ropes made of spatulas that were tied together. i thought that was pretty cool. also liked the compost option and the square bowls.

definitely a hidden gem in the city. and only a quick walk to the ballpark! will def be here again.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
If you're like me and you like cheese and anything fried this is a good place to go. Stopped here for lunch one afternoon when I was in the area and got there around 1:15, I thought this would be a better time to miss the lines that I had heard about. Well i was wrong, darn! But surprisingly the out the door line moved pretty quickly. It actually got even longer around 1:30. 

It was one of those rare beautiful days in San Fran. which would have been perfect because they have outside sitting, but unfortunately the seats where harder to get then the nice day. Oh well can't always get lucky. 

After checking out the menu that I think could have been a bit bigger I went with the Mushroom Gruyère which had fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms, gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter . At first i wasn't too sure about the potatoes, thought they might be too heavy. But to my surprise they worked well and the leeks were just enough added flavour. I wished it had been cheesier, but I love cheese so that is probably more of a me thing. I washed it all down with a pink lemonade, which was so refreshing and sweet. 

Over all I enjoyed this place. If I could though I would probably give 3.5, but I'll be generous today. It's in a great area could be larger though considering the amount of people that come here for lunch. I could easily come back when I'm in the area again.
author: Corynne O.

description:
My boyfriend decided to take me to SF for a day of shopping and eating as a part of my Christmas gift.

After much yelping, I decided to come here for breakfast. It was a breakfast of champions. I ordered the breakfast piglet without the mustard and my boyfriend ordered the mousetrap with bacon. We also shared the tomato soup with creme fraiche. I thought the meal was excellent, and grilled cheese for breakfast?! Why not? I love myself a good grilled cheese sandwich and I found it here. It's not the one you find yourselves making at home so it makes it more special. Will surely come back!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Preface: I heard the workers talking about how it was an off-day, so hopefully the experience is usually better than this...

Came at lunch from work to grab a salad. The wait was terribly long;  for a to-go salad, waiting in line, ordering, and getting my food took about a half hour.   Went with the Quinoa with added chicken breast. $10 total. Its flavorful but very wet, I don't think I would get it again. The woman who took my order was awesome: friendly, helpful, overall awesome. I was sad that the lady who gave me my food because she didn't give me the fruit side "because they were out" although I could see plums being put on plates behind her. Why lie?!? 

I don't think I would return, unless I wanted a grilled cheese.
author: Heidi J.

description: 3 stars for the biscuits!  Missing southern comfort food?  Then stop by for the biscuits and eggs - awesome breakfast.  In fact, all of their biscuits are top notch.  I was able to sample some others too.  Since I work nearby, I have been here for lunch a few times.  Seems very overpriced for what it is.  I know it's San Fran, but I'd rather grab an $8 sandwich from a place with a bit more substance...the BBQ sandwich at Anderson Bread up the street is also $8 and you will actually be full.
author: Brad A.

description:
They now have gluten free bread that they make themselves!  It's the best gluten free bread I've had. This definitely rivals Udi's, my favorite store brand.

I have been diagnosed with a gluten allergy but I can still consume small amounts.  If you are gluten sensitive or allergic, this is a great option.  If you have celiac disease best to avoid this place as they don't have a separate station or utensils for preparing their food so there will be enough cross contamination to trigger a reaction. Also their tomato soup has a small amount of flour for thickening so you may want to avoid it if you're sensitive to gluten.  I'm hoping they will explore potato starch and xanthan gum as a replacement thickener so I can have their smoky tomato soup regularly again.

Personally I'm really happy with their gluten free bread option.  My favorite is their jalapeño popper on gluten free bread.  Yum!
author: Theron L.

description:
AGCK was easily one of my favorite places to escape to for lunch this summer. The kitcsch-y and sweet interior provides the perfect place to dine, whether with a friend or solo. Additionally, south park is located a few steps away if you're in the mood for a picnic. 

I'm usually a little skeptical about paying for food that I know I can do a damn good job on at home for less money. However, AGCK serves up a deliciously unique variety of grilled cheeses, soups, and salads (with a seasonal fruit on the side). The combo option of half a grilled cheese and a salad or a small soup is the perfect lunch. All in all, absolutely worth checking out.
author: Eliza D.

description:
This place goes to show the extent of what people will do to follow a fad. Given the insane lines despite minimal interior seating and chilly outside seating , I thought, this HAS to be good right? I can't cook for the life of me but even I can make a good grilled cheese, and put stuff in it, so they must do it better. But no.

While the bread is decent, the cheese in both the Jalapeno popper and Piglet were not melted, the ham was too salty and chewy, and the Popper was much too sweet. And the tomato soup, while smokey and peppery went half uneaten. Sad to say but it makes me consider going back to my panini press, Kraft, and Campbells.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
The Foghorn Leghorn ($9) was awesome. I mean, anything with blue cheese is awesome, but it was top-notch. Included chicken and havarti as well.

The apples they throw in are a nice touch too.
author: Evan G.

description: Yummy grilled cheese sandwiches in your neighborhood!!! Bliss.
author: Kaushik S.

description:
I'd say this is about a three point fiver type of joint.  I'm glad to have tried it at least once.  It's a great concept, I mean who doesn't love grilled cheese sandwiches?!  

Pros: 
- 30 feet away from Jeremy's!! 
- Smokey tomato soup paired very well with the sandwiches
- Pretty fancy take on the good ol' grilled cheese
- With every sandwich, they give you a juicy orange for dessert
- If you can snag a seat on the patio, it's a nice place to hang out
- Staff was very friendly

Cons:
- Long line/long wait on a Saturday around 1pm
- Not nearly enough seating for the amount of patrons
- Toasted bread for sandwiches was so hard.  Cut the roof of your mouth hard.
- Parking can be a hassle
- A little pricey for what it really is
author: Miyako L.

description: Ok so I do not understand the hype of this place. I am a fan of the grilled cheese but to stand in line with all the rest of the people just to get a grilled cheese sandwich well I do not understand it. I could make this at home and put a tomato in my grilled cheese and have it cost barely to anything. I am a gluttonous eater though and maybe my stars are a bit harsh but I am still hungry.
author: Patrick W.

description:
I came here for brunch a number of times. Their smoky tomato soup is great and the sandwiches as well, except I did find the mushroom one a little boring/unseasoned. 

The staff is always friendly, the place looks nice, and the outdoor seating is definitely a plus.
author: Stef L.

description:
I got NUTS for this spot! 
Ape.
Crazy.
Insane.

It's right by my work and if it wasn't socially awkward to frequent everyday, I would eat here for lunch everyday.

I've tried three varieties of sandwiches, a few mixed drinks (juniper berry lemonade is awesome) and love that you can sit outside. They give you an apple as a side with the calorie infested yet absolutely delicious sandwiches to balance out the meal. And the staff has always been super friendly.

Highly recommend! 

Enjoy!
author: Karen M.

description:
Cheezus, this place was so edam gouda, I couldn't brielieve it!

I thought about writing an entire review that was full of cheesy puns, but I think that will take way too much effort.  However, this place is ALL SORTS OF AMAZING.  If you're a fan of cheese... and bread [and WHY WOULDN'T YOU BE??] you must DEFINITELY go here.  Don't bother getting food at the ballpark, come here and be satisfied by a rich and savory meal!

I got the grilled cheese with the jalapenos... and though I should have told them to hold off on the goat cheese [not a fan, sigh, i know- what a travesty!] it was really amazing.  You can't go wrong with cheese, jalapenos, AND bacon.  The grilled cheese with the mushrooms was also really fabulous.

$3/ beer or homemade sodas, the prices are actually really reasonable.  What isn't reasonable is the WAIT.  I was in good company, so I didn't mind the wait, but it took quite a long while before we ended up with our food.  I also had to use my mad ninja skills to snag a table as a party was leaving because I didn't want to have to sit on the cold ground.

All in all, if they could get the wait situation optimized, I think this place will be my new favorite spot in SF.

PS. Their mac n cheese are also bomb.  If it's in stock, you should order one.
author: Karen T.

description:
hmmmm, where to start?
well i found this place via foursquare, cause its near my new office location.  And the fact that i am disappointed that the melt closed their nearest location, i decided to give it a try.
i can order online, awesome!!  a little pricer than its counterpart, but i will still try.  when ordering i decided to keep it basic (if you screw up basic, how do i know you can do something more challenging?) start the process online picked my sandwich, plus my jalepenos (.50) and than $4.50 for a cup of soup? really?  better be really good.  a pickle is $1.25 and than the kicker.... $1.05 is a mandatory gratuity? really?  i am picking it up, i am do the walking there is no reason to charge me.  I am very disappointed in this.  when i decide not to order online, and just go there.  i tell the cashier, and he is so not concerned, and even says that it not in his job description.  really?  all this place leaves me with is the thought "how are you still in business?"

food was just "okay"  i will continue going to the melt instead.
author: China B.

description:
Good! I had the breakfast, which is served before 11, and the price is ok. I think it's just the right portion, and the sandwich is made perfectly :)  My only complaint is that it was hellaaa oily.  I ate mine sandwiched between paper napkins hahaha.  But it was really really delicious and well made. Coffee was average, service is nice, and the people are friendly.  

I'd come here again! :)
author: Yifen J.

description:
Think really gooey, creamy sharp flavored cheese sandwich and bloated with extra ingredients!!! No joke, this joint lives up to its Grilled Cheese Kitchen name!

Here's the scoop my Yelp food-partner in crime and I were looking for a place for lunch, we made a sharp turn off the street as a firetruck went speeding by, and we found this place.  

We were lucky, we FOUND parking in San Francisco. Sounds like a miracle huh? Looking at the menu, we noticed they used Tillamook Sharp Cheddar cheese for making their famed grilled cheese sandwiches. Tillamook Cheese is definitely American, it comes from Portland, OR. Tillamook Cheese is delicious and great for any kind of entree! 

This past week, I've been eating a lot of Beef, so the "Club Turkey" with a side of Mac'n'Cheese. Does it sound appealing to you? You won't know what you're really ordering until you see the patrons around you scarfing down gooey cheese sandwiches and small leafy greeny salads. My buddy went Vegan recently, and ordered the "Mushroom Gruyère" with gluten free bread. Yep, this place even has gluten free bread. You can request it when you make your order!

They also have homemade soda here. I went with an Arnold Palmer (half lemonade, half iced tea), great for a warm day like today!


Service: Decent.
Food: Delicious! Worth coming back to if I'm in the area.
General tab: $12 w/ beverages.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I ate here a few weeks ago with my husband. We must have missed the lunch rush, because the place was empty. The female cashier who greeted us and took our order was very friendly and courteous. I ordered the mac n cheese grilled cheese with the soup of the day (potato leek) and he ordered the mushroom gruyère grilled cheese.  To drink, I had the raspberry lemonade and my husband ordered a local craft beer - both were great.

The food took a little while to come out (considering we were the only customers there) but it was worth the wait. Our sandwiches were delicious. I think I preferred the mushroom gruyère over the mac n cheese, but both were excellent. The potato leek soup was puréed, which I was not expecting. Although I generally prefer soups with a chunkier consistency, this one was very tasty. I liked that they include a few ripe strawberries with the sandwiches. We will definitely be back.
author: Janna T.

description:
I just ate the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had.  Veggie sandwich with cheese, egg, roasted tomato, and caramelized onions. It took all my self control to not also get a fresh cheddar biscuit; they looked awesome.

Service was good, too.  It took a little while for them to make the sandwich, but the guy behind the counter was super upbeat.

Highly recommend for breakfast!  Line was minimal at ~8:20 am; it took me less than 10 minutes to wait on line and wait for them to make the sandwich.
author: Erin K.

description:
Overall comments:
While the address is on S Park St, the actual entrance faces 2nd street, making it a little difficult to find.  One of the few places open Sundays.  They include an orange with your sandwich.  Note: by default there is mustard in the sandwich...

Dishes:
the sandwich with turkey good

Service:
self seating
food speed relatively fast
servers seemed nice

Venue:
parking may be difficult
the entrance faces 2nd st, not park st.
looked clean
lighting was sufficient during the daytime at least

Notes:
2
lunch 
no
10$
author: A M.

description: Obviously you have to want a grilled cheese sandwich to go here but they have a large variety of options to choose from. We ordered the Mac N Cheese Grilled Cheese, the Mushroom and Gruyere, the Jalapeño Popper and the Smoky Tomato Soup. I did not get to try the Jalapeño Popper but it looked awesome. The Mac and Cheese was divine and the Mushroom was good but it needed something additional on it. It was a little bland. I definitely would go here again.
author: Risha S.

description:
Do yourself a favor and show up before noon--otherwise you're not getting a seat outside.  I managed to snag a spot in the sun and thoroughly enjoyed my "jalapeño popper" sandwich.  Cheese, bacon and peppers?  Those are the three best things on the planet.  Whomever though to put them between grilled bread is a genius.  They've got a few beers on tap but I washed mine down with a refreshing Arnold Palmer (perfect on a hot day).

Why only four stars and not five?  It's a judgement call.  It did seem a little pricey to me and there were only a few sandwiches to choose from--Portland's Grilled Cheese Grill has dozens.  Still, I know I will be back next time I'm in SF--they're only a short walk from my office and they have several other sandwiches I need to try.
author: Nick H.

description:
Sandwich needs to be eaten on site to obtain maximum taste value. 

Mousetrap with Jalapenos = an A , but  a pitcher of beer takes the meal to an A+.

Worth the 10 minute wait in line. This is the perfect pre-game spot!
author: Cord N.

description:
Such a cute spot in SOMA, loved the menu and it's location. 

Came on a Saturday afternoon and to our surprise, parking was fairly convenient. (Considering there as a Giants game) Over the conversation about the Rapture, we gorged ourselves with the cheesy goodies.

The orders:
-Mousetrap: Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough 
-Mushroom Gruyere: fontina, gruyere, roasted wild mushrooms & potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions and thyme butter 
-Club Turkey: Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos and arugula 
-Smoky tomato soup
-4 pomergrante lemonade

What a feast to have before the rapture. Though I was still alive and well the next couple hours later,  it was still worth pulling myself off my butt to work off the excessive cals I've ingested. I already have my eye on the sandwich I'll be ordering the next time I return: the Jalapeno popper. 

This is the place to be for cheese lovers.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I just love this place. I recently went there and had Mushroom Grill Cheese Sandwich and what made me happy that it came with a fresh fruit (plum). I loved the flavor of there cheese and veggie together! A must place to go in SF!

Sometimes, they have long lines but its totally worth the wait!
author: Prateek G.

description:
I love this place. It was love at first sight. Bordering the outside seating is a chain of spatulas. Cute! 

And the menu was easy to read, layout was clear and simple. Its definitely a friendly customer experience.

But above all, SANDWICHES ARE BLISSFUL. The Hawaiian sandwich was mouth watering. Oh gosh, it was the best grill cheese sandwich I've had!!! With a strawberry on top! ;-)
author: Catherine N.

description: I am upgrading my rating because the regional manager of the restaurant reached out to me for details about my experience.This is proof of great management and I appreciate that. Also I would like to make clear that I liked a lot about The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen beside what I mentioned earlier. I liked  the funky, modern decor, the great menu, the recycling bins, the outdoor patio, and the relaxed atmosphere.
author: Viorela N.

description: Simplicity of cheese, butter and bread.  Yes, a deadly combo, but can be made in so many creative ways.  Why add an apple, jalapeno, or even a squirrel.  I mean ham.  So I've seen this place many times and there is always a line outside the door.  I enter and its packed.  No where to sit, so best you can do is order to go.  I saw they had a mac n' cheese sandwich, but darn, after an hour it was already sold out.  So I went with the classic with a salad.  And it wasn't bad, but it wasn't extraordinary.  I mean, its cheese, butter and bread.  Fast, easy, comfort food. . . .so if you want to wait, pay roughly $10 - $15 for a meal, then go for it.  To me, I can say, I tried it. . .and will I go again.  Maybe if its out of convenience for me, but I wont go out of my way just to go there again.
author: Janice F.

description:
We stumbled upon this little joint on our way to AT&T park before a game and it definitely hit the spot. I had the Mousetrap and he had the Club Turkey. Both were delicious! Also, it was a nice surprise that our sandwiches came with a ripe apple on the side. 

Staff members were nice and friendly and our sandwiches came out very fast even though they were busy. I'd definitely go back for another grilled cheese before a game!
author: Katie D.

description:
I went with my wife and we got a piglet and a mouse trap.  Both are excellent.  We sat at the counter and watch them made the sandwiches. They make batches of sandwiches at a time.  I think that secret is the cheese and eat-it-when-it-is-hot.  We loved the place and fully enjoyed the experience.

Beware.  The restaurant is totally packed during lunch.  Expect a long line but it is worth it !!!
author: Mike Y.

description:
3.5 for American Grilled Cheese Kitchen; 4 for the food, 2.5 for the service (Yes, I know this doesn't average out to a 3.5).

One of my closest friends was in town and we were excited to make a morning of Jeremy's deal hunting and delicious grilled cheese at AGCK, a place that we have both been dying to try for some time.

SERVICE:
We arrived at 11:55 am and things were a little strange with the service right off the bat.  When we got to the front of the line, the guy at the cash register rudely told us that the guy behind us was there first.  We were all confused.  The guy behind us told the cashier that we were there first, to which the cashier looked annoyed.  When we went up to order items off the lunch menu, the cashier told us that we had to wait another 5 minutes since lunch was not served until noon.  Seriously?  Yes.  We had to step out of line and wait until it was noon, then step back in line to order.  How weird and annoying.

FOOD:
The food was pretty good!  We ordered the mushroom and gruyere and the jalapeno popper sandwiches with the side salad on one plate and the tomato soup on the other.  

Sandwiches:  My friend preferred the mushroom and gruyere and I preferred the jalapeno popper.  Both were tasty!  I loved how the apricot jelly in the jalapeno popper complemented the saltiness of the bacon and the salty sharpness of the cheddar.  Mmmm...  I would definitely get both sandwiches again!

Soup: Mediocre tomato soup.  I looove tomato soup and thought that AGCK's was nothing special and that it could use more flavor.

Side salad:  Yum!  Love the vinaigrette.  I would get this as my side rather than the soup next time.
author: Julie S.

description:
So, this review may be a bit skewed due to the fact that I had my first ever grilled cheese sandwich here but hear me out:

Came here before a Giants game with my boyfriend who almost died when he found out I've never had a grilled cheese before. Cheese and bread just never sounded appetizing to me,  but anyway...

We ordered the Mushroom Gruyère sandwich (fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, & thyme butter on levain), the Jalapeno Popper (chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish on levain) and the Smoky tomato soup. FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC. The bread on both sandwiches were toasted to perfection, the different cheeses blended and complemented each other well, and the variable other ingredients offset the cheesiness. SO glad this was my first grilled cheese experience but then again, it all goes downhill from here...

They also have a great selection of local and bottled beers.
author: Jane P.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally made my way over to this place with my friend the other day. 

My friend and I both love grilled cheese sandwiches so we were pretty excited about trying this place. I ordered the red, white, and blue plate special which comes with a sandwich and soup or house green salad. I ordered the Moscone (fresh mozzarella, fontina, roasted tomatoes, basil-lavender pesto, kalamata olive tapenade) with the salad and my friend ordered the Mushroom Gruyere (fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter ) with tomato soup. We gave each other one half of our sandwiches so we could try both. 

I was a bit disappointed that my sandwich was hella small (the end piece of bread) compared to my friend's which was way bigger. I felt a little ripped off but luckily I thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich. I loved the basil-lavender pesto. It was like a breath of fresh air and I loved how light my sandiwch tasted compared to the mushroom gruyere which was much richer with the potatos and gruyere, which was still good as well. 

I also ordered a housemade blackberry cherry soda which tasted kind of watered down. I do agree that the bread is a bit hard around the edges, but I don't have any complaints about it. I would defintely come back and try their other sandwiches.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
"In queso emergency, I pray to cheeses."


That's actually posted on the wall here. And it's just a sample of the irreverence that comes with your sandwich. I highly recommend both the Mousetrap and the Mushroom Gruyere. Both are outstanding.

Expect a line if you come here at a time when other people would typically come here. (Words of wisdom like these are provided by this reviewer at no additional charge).

They don't take AMEX, but they do offer a piece of seasonal fruit with your sandwich.They occasionally close early if there is a 49ers game on tv. And they occasionally stay open late if the Giants are playing. I recommend visiting them while they are actually open. You're more likely to get a sandwich that way.
author: TJ P.

description: Sooooooo delicious!!!!! Mushroom gruyere grilled cheese is yummy! Passion tea lemonade is good too although had to add lots of water bc of how sweet, but rather it be too sweet then not live up to its name.
author: Mercedes E.

description: I recommend the Mushroom gruyere plus tomato soup. Perfect pre game meal! Service was quick and the food was delightful. Stopped here on or way to the baseball game. Seems they are open later when there are giants games! Seating inside and out in the patio.
author: Paulina L.

description: Overpriced grilled cheese. It's alright, but if I can make the same or better at home, I will.
author: Miffy Y.

description:
3.5  When you eat bread and cheese every day of your life at home, this place doesn't seem that special.

I wanted to test ride a bike at Public ,which is right down the street, so this seemed like a good choice for lunch. We grabbed a table outside (it was a gorgeous day) and the guy went in and ordered while I held on to the table. Very short wait for our order even though the place was packed. We had the mushroom gruyère 
fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter grilled sandwich and it was incredibly rich and oily. Ate half and took the rest home.  It does not reheat well so I wouldn't recommend doing this. Loved the Dad's root beer in a bottle.
author: Bleep S.

description:
If you do go to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, be prepared to wait for your food! You would think you could grill up cheese sandwiches faster... After we placed our order, it seriously took like 20-25 minutes to get our sandwiches. Clearly, this is NOT fast food. I will say that the servers were extremely nice. They served us our smoky, tomato soup first. When they saw that we were splitting the soup, they happily split it into two bowls and added extra crème fraîche. When our sandwiches finally came half an hour later, they offered to give us a fresh, hot bowl of soup so that we could dip our sandwiches into it (My friend had eaten all of hers; I had saved some soup, but it was cold).

The tomato soup did have a smoky flavor, but the consistency was too thin for my liking. I missed the heartier, thicker consistency and it was not my favorite tomato soup. Out of the two sandwiches, I liked the mushroom gruyère more. It was served on sourdough bread with mushrooms, sliced potatoes, caramelized onions and fontina and gruyère cheese. My friend wasn't a big fan of the potatoes in the sandwich, but I liked the extra "meat-like" feeling of the sandwich. My only complaint was that I couldn't taste the gruyère cheese and I was missing that sharp, swiss cheese flavor. Friend got the mousetrap, which was sharp cheddar, havarti and monterey jack cheese. That sandwich didn't strike me as anything unique and I felt like I could have made it in my own house. I probably won't be going any time soon, but I'm definitely glad I got to try the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.

More photos on my blog: http://rbjello.wordpress.com/2011/12/28/24-hour-layover-in-san-francisco/
author: Jackie T.

description:
I've wanted to come here for a long long time.  As someone who's been to the grilled cheese competitions, I was really tickled to find myself in the area during an off-hour.

I ordered the breakfast special with bacon and sat down to wait.

It was rather quick service which was nice but that is where it stops:

The grilled cheese sandwich was f***ing HOT that I actually BURNED the tips of my fingers, shouted and dropped it back into the basket.  Apparently it was taken from the grill straight to my chair with NO WARNING at all.  I had to wait a while and dissect the thing in order to eat it.  More than that, given a knife and fork to cut it while its in a narrow basket with paper does not work.

I made the most of it - despite asking for 'light on the butter please' it arrived burning hot, dripping with butter, greasier than hell, and the bacon was overcooked to the point of being old peanut brittle with no flavor.

Sad.  Won't return.
author: Marcy M.

description:
I wanted to love this place because they offer gluten-free bread and a dog-friendly patio.  It was so dog friendly that Joe from Yapsie took Josie poodle's photo during our lunch and posted it online! Cool! http://yapsie.com/photos/biz/the-american-grilled-cheese-kitchen-san-francisco-ca/1syy7y0izfby19g5kgo6

I had the feta sandwich with a side salad. The gluten-free bread was really good and toasted to a golden brown but there was hardly any cheese. It was like two pieces of toast with just a light smear of cheese.  I was expecting an ooey-gooey dripping with melted cheese sandwich.,Hello - the name of the place is Grilled "Cheese", right?!
The accompanying salad was just a handful of mixed field greens from Costco with a very light vinaigrette. So light, I had a hard time telling if there was anything on the lettuce.  The bright spot was getting a small tangerine with my lunch. It was perfect!

If I go back to this place, it would be for the patio, not the food. Eh.
author: Kim W.

description: Very good grilled cheese.  All three of us had versions of the Mousetrap - one with ham, one with bacon and one with the works.  Decent value.  Bread was crispy, but not so much that it tore up the roof of your mouth.  Nice touch to give a nice juicy plum to go along with the sandwich.  Seating is limited.  Still has long lines, so you roll the dice for getting a table, expecially if weather is nice like it was when we went there.  We will definitely be back to try different versions of sandwiches.
author: Lewis C.

description:
2 THUMBS TO YELP!...Another great place found thanks to yelp....

$9 for a grilled cheese sandwich...there are about 6 different kinds (again it's a bit pricey for just a sandwich, so with drinks and/or side your meal will come out to $10-$15.
 
I had the turkey club and it was delish! Each sammy comes with a fresh orange. Probably one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've had a restaurant. Not too filling. Nice crispy crust and melted cheese.

Another cool plus is they have seasonal lemonade. I LOVE ME SOME LEMONADE!...Today was Cranberry Lemonade....delish but a lil' too sweet.

TIP: Get here a bit early to avoid lunch crowd.

LOOKING FORWARD TO TASTING THE OTHER GRILLED CHEEZZZZZZZES,,,
author: Cathy D.

description:
The food here is too gouda to be true!

Don't let the line deceive you, they move fast and grill their sandwiches quickly. I came here on a Saturday afternoon and got sandwiches to go in under 15 minutes. Highly recommend the Jalapeno Popper, a wonderful concoction of chevre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, and apricot-jalapeno relish on levain. It it my goodness delicious. Despite being semi-lactose intolerant and usually one to avoid cheese, I'll make an exception here. It's that good.
author: Reid Y.

description: As someone who doesn't like cheese, I was surprised by how much I liked my meal.  I got the Farmer's Breakfast that included egg, bacon, and potato in addition to the grilled cheese. I don't really know what made it a "grilled cheese" instead of an "egg sandwich" but I'm not gonna pick on the terminology here. It worked for me and I would recommend it to even non-cheese lovers. So why did I come to a grilled cheese place if I don't like cheese? Well, I like trying new things and I was hoping that one day I could start liking cheese...
author: Aron Y.

description: Oooh-ver-raaaated....clap clap clapclapclap!  Don't know if I heard that at the ballpark or the restaurant....(ooooohh low blow to any Giants fan)  Seriously, I know that there's a huge buzz for grilled cheese sammies nowadays but there was nothing I found extraordinary about the mousetrap and jalapeno popper I had.  Between the two, the jalapeno popper was better, it had a nice sweet and spicy kick at the end of every bite.  Damn you Unique Eats for raising my expectations, but the show did get me salivating.  Too bad when I actually had the sammies in front of me I did little of that.
author: Alan B.

description:
I just went to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen today to celebrate national grilled cheese day at lunch and was very impressed by the staff.  

Initially my coworkers and I filled out the group order on their website (using ChowNow) but there was a problem with the system and unbeknownst to us our order was cancelled.  When we arrived they told us they had been having trouble with the program not notifying them.  While this was a disappointment what changed it all was their helpful attitude.  Despite their crazy long line (this was the middle of the lunch hour) they pulled up our order and took care of our transaction right then and there without us having to wait in line again.  They were so helpful and kind!

So moral of the story: not only are their sandwiches (I recommend the mac'n'cheese) and everything they serve AMAZING but they have top notch customer service!
author: Erin R.

description: I've had plenty of grill cheese sandwiches and i have to say this is one of the best I've had. We had the jalapeño popper grill cheese..Mmmm Mmm delicioso! Friendly staff and dog friendly outdoor seating.
author: Martita S.

description: Best Grilled Cheese in SoMa. Good for lunch; great lemonades, very limited indoor seating so make sure it's warm outside!
author: Peter S.

description: Jalapeno Popper. Spicier than The Melt's Jalapeno equivalent. There was more meat in it when compared to The Melt, but it tasted like there was less cheese (or it wasn't as melted when I ate it). I'm still on the fence about which is better.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Cheesy goodness is expected from a place devoted to the art of melted savory sandwiches. Unexpected from the same place- delicious breakfast. 

Stumbled upon The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen one morning while starving and in need of breakfast. Great location near the ball-park and the doors were open at 8am. The breakfast menu is a list of grilled cheese sandwiches (all come with one cage free egg) grilled cheese and various toppings...tomato, caramelized onions, bacon, etc. Greasy? Yes. Healthy? No. Delicious and totally worth it? Absolutely. Sandwiches are $5-6 and ready in about 5mins. 

Bonus: they have delicious large muffins with warm strawberries in the middle. Definitely want to try some of their more famous lunch sandwiches (mushroom and Gruyere) and will def stop by from time to time for breakfast.
author: Theresa T.

description:
This is hands-down the best grilled cheese spot I've ever been to!

If you're in SF, then definitely go to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. Be prepared for a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it - I promise!

I ordered a grilled cheese, tomato soup, and kiwi lemonade. All three were fantastic! I ate inside, but this place is tiny! I imagine good-weather days, the patio is a lovely place to have your lunch.
author: Bryant M.

description:
This review is to comment on 1 thing and 1 thing alone---- MUSHROOM GRUYERE.  SUMMUMMAB*TCH, hello favorite grilled cheese sando.  Hands down, you win.  Haven't had a better combo than perfectly grilled bread using thyme butter, perfect amount of gruyere cheese, perfectly firm yet soft thinly sliced gold potatoes, perfectly carmelized onions and amazing sautéed wild mushrooms.  9 bucks for the most mouth watering sando that defines perfection.

Neighborhood must-gos: nova bar across the street, watermelon beer at 21 Amendment across the street, Zaza Salon if you need shellac/waxing/threading/eyelash extensions (ps dog friendly), and of course Home of the SF Giants.
author: Deanna A.

description: This place was very average, good food but nothing special. He tomato soup was ok, very light, which was ok with the sandwiches. The mushroom grill was tasty. The piglet (ham and cheese) was very average. Overall it was a decent meal but not memorable at all, wouldnt wanna go back anytime soon.
author: Haleh H.

description:
Can you really go wrong with grilled cheese? In the case of American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, you can if it's WAY too oily. The sandwiches here are beyond heavy, which may appeal to some people, but it's definitely too much for my stomach.

Mushroom Gruyere = Tasty, but like I said, extremely oily and buttery. I could only eat half the sandwich before I started feeling the onset of a sudden heart attack.

Tomato Soup = Not very good at all. In fact, the tomato soup here tastes almost exactly like canned Campbell's Tomato Soup, which isn't bad if you're paying 99 cents for a canned soup, but definitely not worth it at a restaurant.

I mean, the flavor of the grilled cheese isn't bad at all -- you can't terribly mess up any dish that uses cheese and butter as the foundation. It's just a little overpriced for $9.00 and way too heavy to finish more than half.
author: Roy C.

description: Great place for a quick sandwich. The daily soup was delicious and prices reasonable.  What I enjoyed mostly is the customer service, friendly staff and the cleanliness of the restaurant.
author: Tulip M.

description:
I love this place. I love that I'm close to it. I love the menu. I love the staff. I love cheese.

It's a tad pricy and I wish they were open later but, really good stuff. Worthy of their South Park spot.
author: Robert M.

description:
The grilled cheese sandwiches at The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is WAY better than a certain Los Angeles food truck's grilled cheese sandwiches. 

Luckily we came just in time before the lunch rush, so we were able to order and grab a seat in no time! Even waiting for the food, I was entertained by reading all the "cheesy puns" above the counter, and took pictures of the vintage inspired wall.

We got the Mousetrap, the mushroom gruyere, and shared a smoky tomato soup. I don't even need to tell you how good these sandwiches are, but I will. They just oozed, and goozed, with cheesy goodness!! It's warm and creamy and then dipping it in the tomato soup elevated each bite to the next level. The soup stays mouth-blowing hot to the very end! And they even give you a handful of red, seedless grapes to cleanse your palette in case it gets too rich.

Absolutely amazing!
author: Angela A.

description: Ummm, oh how I wish we had one of these where I live.  I'm jealous of all you SF folk that work in SOMA, get to have amazing grilled cheeses whenever you want!  I came in before the lunch rush so it was easy to get seats at the bar.  I ordered the mushroom grilled cheese (with leeks, potato slices, fontina and gruyere and mushrooms of course) and it was AWESOME.  I wish I would have gotten two! The second one would have been the mac-n-cheese grilled cheese- I die!  Since I was on vacation I was able to partake in the $4 mimosas, and they were filled to the top in a pretty big glass (thumbs up).  I like the fact that you get a small apple with your order; it soaks up the greasy goodness.  If you want to check this place out, be conscious of the lunch rush, and you can always order in advance.  The only thing I didn't like about this place is the lack of seating; there is more seating outside than inside, and SF weather is usually chilly.  Next time I am SF, I will conquer the mac-n-cheese grilled cheese fo sho!
author: Melissa L.

description:
Ok, I'm a fan because how can you go wrong in making a grilled cheese sandwich.  Well, yes it is possible. Having two little toddlers I've tasted many grilled cheese sandwiches out and about...and yes sometimes it is not very good at all - either too dry, to crusty, not warm, bland, etc.

This place is pricey but they make up for it in the taste.  Hot, moist, and totally flavorful.  Also, you can get some really good ideas for making a unique grilled cheese at home.  My favorite was the mushroom grilled cheese and am going to try and make it at home.  The tomatoe soup was good, but nothing too special.  You really come here for a grilled cheese.

Would definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Gina C.

description: I love cheese, but I did not love the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. Long wait for our sandwiches. Too much butter smeared on bread. My mushroom gruyere was okay. My friends were struggling a little with the heat of their jalapeno poppers.
author: Sophia B.

description:
This is one of those places that make me think (palm to forehead), "Dang, why didn't I think of that?"  How can you go wrong with the idea of classic grilled cheese sandwiches?

Well, AGCK doesn't just serve up any ordinary grilled cheese (unless you want them to, of course).  They serve up their own cheesy concoctions!

The restaurant itself is small and can comfortably seat about 10-15 folks inside and 28 folks outside.  So you can imagine how busy this place gets on a regular weekday.  We headed here on Sunday, pre-noon time and got pahr-KING, right on South Park.

I walked in with my mind dead-set on ordering just cheese and bread.  But, after viewing their "mini" menu, I settled for the Moscone.  The Moscone consists of melted havarti cheese, kalamata olive paste, pesto and a grilled tomato all sandwiched between 2 slices of crusty bread.  The first bite made my knees buckle.  The second bite...well I don't remember my second bite because before I knew it I'd inhaled the entire sandwich.  They give you a Cutie (tangerine) as a side, to help you reminisce of the cheesy goodness that you just devoured.

AGCK, please open up a location in the Marina...I'm sure there are a lot of folks that would love to have you here!
author: Rochelle D.

description:
Trekked over to South Park for lunch. You could get more for your money elsewhere. I don't think I need a fancy grilled cheese. I understand the concept of using quality ingredients for grilled cheese, but if I wanted one I would make one at home. It's just one of those things for me. 

I tried the mushroom one. It was a-okay. But really, it felt like a ln incomplete sandwich. What else was I expecting?

It's not you, AGCK; I'm just not fully on board with fancy grilled cheese.
author: Erika C.

description:
There was no line and we got a table outside on a gorgeous day.  What's not to like?  I had the mushroom gruyere with tomatoes, and one of their pickles.  It was delicious and way too filling.  I need more pickles.  

Tintin had the mousetrap with tomatoes, and that was good too, but mine was better.  The peach lemonade was excellent.  

I can't eat that much cheese on a regular basis but I'm a fan.
author: Seong P.

description:
Um, yes please! This place is as good as the rumors and I finally made the mile walk from my office for lunch. The interior reminds me of a cute old fashioned diner and the staff is really friendly, despite how swamped they are. 

Yes, its a long line and yes its a grilled cheese sandwich, but YES it is worth it. Like, really worth it! First of all, don't let the line intimidate you - its not as long as it looks. Because they're super fast and efficient, its a-ok!

I had a long debate between a few of the sandwiches, there were so many that looked so good. I finally settled on the Jalapeno Popper - chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish on levain and it was amazing. 

I sat at the bar and especially enjoyed the cheesy puns they had written up. I will be back. Possibly next week.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Grilled cheese and smokey tomato soup really hit the spot as you're making your way from your parking spot to the ballpark. Nice that they also have a combo option of sandwich + soup/salad, perfect for individuals ordering and not having to share (mmmmm). 

Cobb salad was remarkably good. I usually don't make comments about salads, but they do load it pretty well, and they put a little spin on the dressing, making it milder on the palate and letting you taste the other ingredients. Good textures of crunch throughout from the bacon, croutons.

Big plus for opening through first pitch with evening games (although I am confused sometimes on how late they will actually stay open).
author: Ray C.

description:
My bf and I arrived around 11:45am. He wanted the jalepeno popper, but the lady insisted that they don't serve that until noon and asked him to order from the breakfast menu. She said that was the same thing, but had an egg on it. Not that he minded the egg or not, but why didn't she give him a choice? Weird. Next, we asked for utensils, but they wouldn't give it to us until the food was ready. Double weird. 

After we sat down, the couple next to us were complaining also. They were saying how anal the staff was being. Apparently they didn't let her order a tomato soup until noon, exactly. Whether it's now of five minutes from now, I bet it's that same pot of soup that is sitting pretty.

The staff here should definitely spend more time accommodating their customers instead of worrying over what time it is.
author: Cindy T.

description: The gluten free bread offering is deceiving - it is not at all a gluten free kitchen.
author: Jessica K.

description:
More fancified comfort food, which is OK with me. I'm less OK with mile-long lines (apparently only at lunch) for the stuff. But surprisingly, early evening on a Tuesday before a Giants game came hassle-free.

$9 got me a gruyere and mushroom sandwich with potatoes. Gruyere is my favorite cheese, especially when it's melted all over other food. It's not an enormous sandwich, but it's not a wimpy one, either. Price wasn't bad, considering how much a bratwurst would cost me at the stadium. Me and my guy ended up with the ass-end of a keg, so we got two-for-one pints of beer. Small selection of beer, but it works with a fairly simple menu.

Given its tendency for eleventy-billion-person crowds, I doubt I'll visit at lunch on a weekday. But yes to dinner, especially before a game.
author: Tara R.

description:
Grilled cheese AND gluten-free?!  Just like Mac-N-Cheese and gluten-free, these words aren't usually found together, but the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is all that it is hyped up to be.  Awesome location in San Francisco's South Park neighborhood; near Jeremy's (grilled cheese + shopping, can't go wrong) and the Ballpark.

I ordered a classic: "Piglet:" Tillamook sharp cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter.  The gluten-free bread was amazing.  AMAZING. And they make the bread there; it isn't ported in from some other bakery or mass manufactured.  I love that they cut the bread super thick like Texas Toast, before grilling it to perfection (with the cheese grilled into crispy bits on the outside).

It was the end of a busy Sunday when we stopped in, so they were starting to close up. I can't wait to come back again soon and try all the other sandwiches!
author: Karen N.

description:
The sandwiches here are downright amazing. I LOVE a great grilled cheese sandwich and this one did not disappoint. I had the Club Turkey which has Willie Bird smoked turkey. I didn't even know that people outside of Sonoma County knew that Willie Birds existed, but it's amazing turkey. I've never seen it at another restaurant outside of their own namesake restaurant in Santa Rosa. 

My 6 year old has a love affair with mac and cheese so it didn't surprise me when she wanted the grilled cheese mac and cheese. I was skeptical, but of course I had to try it. The mac and cheese in and of itself had great flavor and it totally worked in the sandwich. Carb overload as far as I'm concerned, but she's a jumping bean so who's counting. 

My husband had the Cobb Salad. Everything was very fresh and delicious. He was drooling over our sandwiches though so I don't think he'll make the same mistake next time.
author: Kim H.

description:
I normally would not pay $8 for a grilled cheese sandwich...but at American Grilled Cheese Kitchen...IT IS WORTH IT. They do not serve up the typical wonder bread and american sliced cheese sandwiches you are used to. Fancy sandwiches (like the jalepeno popper with chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish) come so huge it is almost too large to handle. Lip smacking melty cheese goodness du jour!

PS: they  also serve breakfast sandwiches for only $5!
author: Sue L.

description: This place was the hop. Great location, simple but tasty menu.  They could use a few more tables outside, but whatever.  They offer gluten free bread which was very tasty.  The sandwich had great overall flavor but for a grilled cheese place I just was expecting the cheese to seriously ooze out of my bread, but overall two thumbs up and I would go back.
author: Debbie P.

description:
A while back I was craving a grilled cheese sandwich watching one of the Food network shows, and decided to come here. I had the mushroom gruyere, and it was ok.  It wasn't so memorable and a little too woodsy for me.  My brother had the mouse trap and it tasted way better... salty and a bit savory.  

The service wasn't bad and the food came out fairly quick for 6 people.  It was a bit busy, but within 5 min. we were able to find seats for all of us.  Staff is friendly and kind, which would make me come back again if I am ever in the neighborhood.
author: Jenny M.

description: This place has been on my bookmarks pages for awhile now and I finally got the chance to come and try it yesterday! Came during lunch time at around 1245 p.m. with no wait!! My sister and I got two sammies and split them. We got the Mushroom Gruyere and the Cubano. The Mushroom Gruyere was pretty bland and was not my favorite. However, the Cubano was pretty good and flavorful. The tomato soup was also good and the house made pickles were spicy, but good. I would come back here to try some of the other grilled cheese sammies.  Decent prices and plenty of seating. I would recommend coming here if you're ever in the area and craving a grilled cheese sandwich!
author: Cat L.

description:
I wanted to LOVE this place.  Really I did.  I have an unhealthy obsession with all foods derivative from children's menus (actually I'm not kidding; also I don't eat vegetables ... so kid's meal anything is normally right up my alley) and a close friend who lives above AGCK who loves to get hangover brunch here and rub it in my face.  

So, on one rare occasion when I was working from my company's office by the Embarcadero (I normally work out of the south bay) I decided to check it out.  I met a friend here around 1:15 PM, but even then, the line was about 10-15 minutes long just to order.  The food was relatively fast to arrive, but I wouldn't say it was categorically speedy.  My friend & I were lucky to get a table; there is limited seating but supply probably always exceeds demand.

I'm not going to go so far as to say I didn't like the food -- it's honestly difficult to ruin something as magical as a grilled cheese and tomato soup -- but for the price & wait I didn't think it nearly lived up to the hype.  I paid probably close to $15 including tax for a soup + sandwich, which is actually kind of outrageous given how simple it all was.  

In my humble opinion basically the rating boils down to how long we waited even after what I'd consider peak lunch hour and the fact that a sandwich place without waiter service really just should not have 2 $$s on yelp. Unpopular opinion here, perhaps, but save yourself the trip to South Park -- hit up somewhere else closer / cheaper & break out the skillet or toaster to make your own GC at home instead.
author: Molly B.

description:
nummers,

who doesn't love grilled cheese?! I would say it's a little pricey, but if you want a solid yummy grilled cheese and are lazy to bring lunch to work, american grilled cheese is the place. If anything, just go to the grocery 
store and make it yourself.

done and done
author: Nina M.

description: Not like The Melt..Although similar in concept this place mashes lots of yummy ingredients then grills it. I guess similar to a panini but without the grill stripes.
author: Jessica M.

description:
SO GOOD.

The gluten-free bread was amazing.
author: Jessie W.

description:
Uhh.. I think this will be my shortest review, ever.

Tried the Jalepeno Popper and although it was good, there was no way it was worth $9. The Monterey Jack cheese wasn't overpowering. Nice kick with the jalepeno relish and bacon is always good.

The strawberry lemonade was way too sweet. You might as welle at sugar cubes. 

I wouldn't come back especially seeing reviews of a long wait too? Craziness.
author: Ken N.

description:
It tastes about as good as you'd expect for a $9 grilled cheese sandwich, but the service is so consistently slow that I don't go there for lunch if I have anything to do in the next 2 1/2 hours. While I know the wait is due to the fact that thy are a South Park lunch hot spot and they try and serve as many people as possible, part of me can't help but wonder "it's only a grilled cheese sandwich! What's the hold up?" as I wait and wait and wait. Once you finally get your sandwich however, you forget the suffering you've been through as your teeth sink into buttery, toasted bread and gooey cheese.

I personally am a fan of The Piglet, although I hate ordering it by name because it sounds like an acknowledgement that I know what I'm about to eat borders on gluttonous. Instead I ask for a ham and cheese and act like I forgot the name of it. I've done this at least four times, and I'm pretty sure they are on to me by now.
author: Mark A.

description:
One of my absolute favorite places in SF!

If you dont already love grilled cheese sandwiches, you will after you try this place! TRUST ME! 

I loveeee the mushroom grilled cheese with the rich creamy smokey tomato soup. MUST TRY!!! Crispy buttery toasted sandwich with melted cheese. You really cant go wrong with any of the other sandwiches...Cheese is wonderful!

::::drools::::
author: M C.

description:
You really can't go wrong with a solid grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup. Bonus points for carrying Cheerwine (my favorite soda from North Carolina). 

I'm going to have to come here more often for lunch although the amount of calories I'd consume would be crazy sooo what to do?
author: Katie W.

description:
Grilled cheese brings back some really bad memories for me.  American sliced cheese over wonder bread... anyhoo..

[Mushroom Gruyère
fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter ]

As I mentioned in a couple of my other reviews, a sandwich really has to stand out with their bread.  And good bread make a sandwich.  The mushroom grueyere is paired very nicely.  First off you have fontina, which is a great melting cheese, with gruyere which gives it kinda that pungency.

I asked where they get their bread and they said they got it from Pink's bakery (?) down the street.  When you bite into a bread, take a look at the cross section and try to examine the air bubbles and gluten development.  When you see it with bubbles, you know the yeast has had time to develop, making bread with more character (which is what I feel they had).

I had the half soup and half sandwich, which was plenty of food, but their tomato soup was good, but just ok.

[overall]
To me, these guys know what their doing.  They are pairing the right cheeses and flavors with some really great bread.  Overall the food is done very well, but doesn't push the palette of amazing flavor compositions.  Still worth checking out though.
author: Dan Q.

description:
Lurrv that this place is literally 'round the corner from B's new apartment. The inside is really tinny, so most patrons end up sitting outside (as our party of 10 did). And since it's chilly in SF's building shadows, make sure you're dressed for the weather. Lots of Giant's color clad fans (who knows if they're true Giants fans??) since it's super close to AT&T park. 

They serve mimosas here, although most unfortunately they are not bottomless. Though by B's calculation, the cost of 3 mimosas here roughly equates to the price the bottomless kind, so if you're a one-mimosa wonder, it might be worth it. 

Let me preface my yelp of their food with a disclaimer: I LOVE GRILLED CHEESE SAMMICHES. That being said, their mushroom & gruyere sandwich is bomb. com (thanks Duke C.!) + to die for + happiness in every bite. I was generous enough to share half of my M&G with B. He got the jalepeno popper grilled cheese, with ham and bacon, but the flavoring was a little overwhelming for the subtlety of cheese (it MUST'VE contained some sort of grilled cheese, but all I could taste was jalepeno). And we shared the smoky tomato soup, which was aptly named because the smoky flavor was present and delicious. 

A tad pricey for grilled cheese and tomato soup, but it's SOMA.
author: Julia C.

description:
This is a great lunch place, especially when it's raining. You can choose from all different kinds of grilled cheese and great tomato soup. 

I was disappointment by the long line when I went, but it was raining so I guess everyone wanted comfort food. Still a good place for lunch if you're working.
author: Lacey B.

description: I've tried every one of their sandwiches now and continue to come here all the time. So glad they're in the hood!
author: S C.

description:
I no longer work in this neighborhood, but I do go to a fair amount of Giants games. So I'm glad that AGCK is open beforehand.

I haven't tried all sandwiches, but the ones I have tried have all been amazing. They all had bacon on them, which might have a littlesomething to do with that.

Mousetrap with bacon
Jalepeño popper (bacon)
Club Turkey 
Mushroom Gruyère

All amazing. They serve a couple of draft beers, local, usually at least one IPA. Good prices. Sometimes long wait, but never "too" long.

Overall, I'm very glad this delicious, affordable option exists where it does.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I had the Jalapeño Popper with smoky tomato soup, some homemade pickles and a huge can of coconut water.  The lady had the Mouse Trap with thai carrot ginger soup and an Izze Sparkling Blackberry soda.  

0) Seating was a bit cut throat with veterans scooping up outside tables as fast as they came up.   Inside was too hot to sit.   -1 star, though we just took our food to go and hit up the park part of South Park.
1) The lady and I disagreed on the smoky tomato soup.  I loved it and she disliked the smoky element.  We both loved the thai carrot ginger soup, the soup of the day that day.
2) We both wished there was more sandwich.   It's not that we didn't eat enough calorically mind you.  We're American damn it and patriotism DEMANDS MORE NOMS.
author: Bob T.

description:
Not anything like grilled cheese sandwiches I had before! 
I had the mushroom Gruyere, and it was excellent! 
Not sure how many cal I consumed :) but it was worth it 

The sandwiches are pretty heavy so I got a small one and still was full for hours
author: Shabnam K.

description: Great spot! The mushroom grill was good the jalapeño popper is a little sweet not quite what I had in mind but it was still good! The mushroom grilled cheese was mind blowing I highly recommend it!! Stop by had a great bite before a game. It's right across from 21st amendment as well.
author: Shannon C.

description: This was the best grilled cheese I have ever had. The Mushroom Gruyere was top notch and exploding with flavor. The only downside of AGCK is that the portions are kind of small for the price, and that it gets really busy during lunch time. Other than that, it is a pretty good restaurant with a nice and open environment.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Can't help but reminisce now I'm no longer in San Francisco about the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.  The place is located conveniently next to a small park with plenty of benches to sit and enjoy breakfast or lunch with some friends and coworkers.

American Grilled Cheese Kitchen would be a candidate for a 5 star place if you didn't have to wait so long for your sandwich.  I must mention if you have the time, it's worth the wait.

My favorite sandwich there is by far the piglet (add an egg to it for breakfast bliss).  The bread is thick cut and covered in its fair share of greasy goodness and you'll never have to worry about having partially melted cheese at this joint, as they make sure the goods are delivered pippin hot.  The cuts of pork are flavorful and complement the melted cheese oh so well.

I highly recommend going at breakfast time as the sandwiches are more pocket friendly and come served with an egg on them, yum!

2 years later and I'm back in SF, AGCK is just where I left it and even more delicious than I remember. Bumping this place to five stars for still serving the delicious sandwiches I had dreams about while I was in Texas.
author: Jasper S.

description:
Gluten Free Grilled cheese sandwich!!!  Hell Yeah!!!!

Went up to the counter told him I was gluten free - asked him if I could have the piglet - he said yes but no mustard, because the mustard was made with stout! How awesome that he knew all of that!!!!!  

Then to top it all off - it was really good!!!  Highly recommend for silly yaks and regular bread eaters!!! 

High Five it out - American Grilled Cheese Kitchen!!!
author: Toni H.

description:
It was a beautiul day that called for patio seating so we headed here to start our trip.

I had a glass of wine with the Jalapeño Popper - chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish on levain ($9), and it was the perfect first SF meal... especially after a long night of heavy drinking. My husband had the Mushroom Gruyère - fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter on levain ($9), and I think I even preferred it to mine. No complaints!
author: Cassandra B.

description: good food but not worth all the hype.  The mushroom one was good, the pull pork one was the best, the mac and cheese one was good too.
author: Jacqueline D.

description: There is something sexy about cheese oozing out between two pieces of buttery, crispy bread.  There's a whole lot of that action happening at The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.
