I tried the red, white and blue plate special, which is a half grilled cheese of your choice and a cup of soup. They have amazing homemade sodas--today I tried the pineapple coconut and I also tasted the blackberry lemonade.  The piglet grilled cheese was solid, but I have a feeling some of the other choices are even more mind blowing. Didn't get much flavor out of the apple mustard.  I felt like I had to walk a few miles after lunch to burn it all off but was happy to do so.
author: Brittany F.

description:
I was in the city with a couple of friends and was assigned the task of finding a place to eat.  I stumbled across The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen on Yelp, so you guessed it, we stopped by for some grilled cheese sandwiches!  I know, I know, grilled cheese sandwiches may not be the healthiest choice, but you only live once and might as well indulge. :)

I couldn't help but get the mushroom Gruyere sandwich because I LOVE mushrooms!  This sandwich includes a wild mushroom mix, Gruyere, fontina, gold potatoes, leeks, caramelized onions, and thyme butter.  Man!  This grilled cheese sandwich was delicious!  The bread was perfectly fried, it was crunchy on the edges, soft in the middle, and it wasn't drenched with grease.  It was a very rich sandwich, but so worth it.  There is something about grilled cheese sandwiches that have the capability of making the kid in everyone sooo happy.  It even inspires me to make my own creative and delicious grilled cheese sandwiches at home!

I also tried one of their house sodas, coconut pineapple.  Lately, I've been in the mood for anything with coconut.  It was a great thirst quencher and I thought it went beautifully with the grilled cheese.  I also love pineapple, so really it was the perfect drink for me.  And I didn't think it was too sweet either, which made it even better because I hate going from something really sweet to something really salty.

I can't wait to go to my next Giants game because I will definitely be stopping here before I head to AT&T park to try another sandwich!  And another house soda!
author: Samantha S.

description: Honestly, it's just another restaurant. Nothing spectacular about it. It's just overpriced grilled sandwiches.
author: Jorge N.

description:
Me thinks not.  I too was psyched to try this place, even went early (before 11:30 am) to beat the crowds.  I forgot it was game day, so the wait was kinda long (15 minutes).

Ordered the red, white and blue special with a little mushroom Gruyere with potatoes and tomato soup.  Although it tasted great, the sandwich was too greasy for my tastes.  I like toasted bread lightly with butter, not drenched in the stuff.  Combined with the cheese, it  was too rich.  And the soup was alright; nothing to write home about.

Will ask for extra napkins if I order again.  Watch out on game days/nights; it's packed though I don't know why.

Someone at work dubbed this place Cardiac Kitchen.  Interesting.
author: Jen L.

description:
Gotta admit, though this place is just a block from my office I refrained from going because the lines when they opened were lousy and eventually I started hearing complaints about the price.

So, flash forward to a few months ago and my girl and I are in the area on the weekend and it's dead. She is a fan of grilled cheese in general and wants to go so I give in. I am glad I did.

The grilled cheese they serve up is by no means the semi burned yet still delicious gc your mom use to make with kraft cheese and way too much butter. What makes this place a new favorite of mine is a combination of the ingredients used and the preparation (Crispy, though not burned and the cheese is oh so perfectly melty).

So, yeah, this is not your moms grilled cheese and if you haven't tried it, do so. You may find yourself questioning why your mom didn't try harder. Ha ha, just kidding, love you mom!
author: Michael M.

description:
Came here last Saturday on an impromptu trip to San Francisco.

The order (description from the site)
--
Mushroom Gruyère
fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter - $9

Jalapeño Popper
chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish - $9

Smoky Tomato Soup
house made with crème fraîche, crouton - $4
--

The Mushroom Gruyèree is a hearty grilled cheese, pulling out the flavors of the ingredients. 
The Jalapeño Popper is packed with flavors, with the bacon, apricot, and monterey jack cheese throwing in conflicting but amazing flavors that will blow your tongue profile out of the water. 
The Smoky Tomato soup is comforting, though it wasn't as hearty as desired.

I must come back here again soon. Very soon.
author: Jason S.

description: Pretty decent selection of sandwiches, salads and soup with some interesting ideas.  I tried the Jalapeno Grilled Cheese sandwich and the cauliflower curried soup which were both tasty and flavorful.  There sandwiches seemed to have the right amount of cheese and didn't feel or taste greasy.  Their strawberry lemonade was just delicious.
author: R C.

description:
My wife and I walked to this place expecting the greatest grilled cheese sandwiches of our lives. (After all, look at the name ...) Fortunately, our expectations were met -- and then some.

The quirky shop, complete with a unique food delivery system, serves a number of creative grilled cheese sandwiches at about 6-10 bucks a pop. We both went basic, grabbing the Mousetrap with some bacon, and Good God, it was delicious. The high-quality bread was both tasty and sturdy, and the cheeses managed to combine superb taste, a comforting melt, and some serious stretchiness. So. damn. good. 

The sandwich came with a fresh strawberry on the side, which was perfect to cleanse the palette after the meal. 

I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in San Francisco! If you live there and get to visit this place weekly, I'm jealous.
author: Mike B.

description:
I'm going to give this a BREAKFAST review.

I'm a sort-of fan for their lunch, but a big-time fan of their breakfast sandwiches.  Yum. It is a great deal - wonderful, full of morning deliciousness.  Eggs, cheese, bacon on yummy crusty bread. There isn't the normal lunchtime line. Seriously, I watch the people walk out of the little local delis with an average looking breakfast sandwich for about the same price and just shake my head.  

The service is kind and authentic.  It is lovely to be served by people who care about the place they work.

I have yet to hit this place for hangover recovery, but I've got a feeling it will handle that role in rockstar fashion.
author: Cameron M.

description:
I got the $9 lunch menu with their mushroom grueyere and tomato soup which came with a side of croutons. The soup was too salty for my taste but the sandwich was okay. the lunch combo comes with a "small sandwich" which was plenty because it was so rich that I started getting tired of the taste towards the end anyways. I wish it wasn't so oily so I wouldnt feel so bad about eating it. The side of fruit was cute and helpful in taking down all that oil from the cheese. This place only inspired me to make my own grilled cheese but I dont see myself craving it. 

The servers were really friendly. There was limited seating indoors but since it was a nice day out, my friends and I ate outside on the patio. However, if it was a typical SF afternoon the patio may not have been very attractive. 

Overall, a little hyped up from reading all these yelp reviews and a little pricey for the type of food you're paying for.
author: Elaine L.

description: We recently visited this spot. Very good sandwiches. I loved the Cubano and the Turkey. We also ordered the jalapeño popper but it was a little too hot for my liking. If you want a quick bite , this place is affordable and pretty tasty.
author: Esmeralda 1.

description:
these grilled cheeses are intense and are made with lovin. they are satisfying and beautiful. 
however...i cannot say the same for certain miscellaneous side dishes.

essential - bread is thick, fresh, crusty, buttery, and perfectly toasted. i was ultra happy with the jalapeno popper sandwich...each bite was oozing cheese...i could mainly taste the goat cheese and the sweet apricot relish flavor...which was all complemented perfectly by the bacon (even though i usually hate bacon). the mushroom gruyere sandwich is completely packed with mushrooms and smoky mushroom flavor. it goes very well with the fontina and caramelized onions but i kind of wish the mushrooms were in a non-pureed form. the piglet just tastes like a very cheesy melted ham sandwich. the moscone is a nice mixture of pesto, mozzarella, tomato slice, and olive tapenade. 

i loved the apple mustard and i think it's cute (and yummy) that they add extra touches to their sandwiches like basil-lavender pesto, thyme butter, and rosemary butter.

HOWEVER -- mac and cheese was decent. it was pretty cold, and pretty soggy.  the pickles...are a major, major, major disappointment. they are blander than cucumbers!!! how? why??? i have never experienced such lame pickles. i felt so...betrayed.
author: Jessica C.

description: Fun spot to grab a delicious and filling brunch/lunch! Stopped in here before a Giant's game and left satisfied. We tried the Cobb Salad which was huge and very fresh. We also had the Piglet sandwich and a cup of the tomato soup.  Very homey and flavorful, couldn't have asked for anything more!
author: Brianna M.

description:
So glad my friend and I were able to come last week when we were off from work.

Had the mousetrap and tomato soup -- delicious. 

Lunch time is extremely busy. Of course! We were here at 11am and found metered parking; however, by 12pm there was huge line out the door! 

Service = awesome. Food = exceptional. I'll be back with my husband in tow!
author: Averil W.

description: After a second and third try... YUP! The Jalapeno Popper is still the best grilled cheese sammich there is. END OF STORY.
author: Susy C.

description: We found this place just a short walk from where we were staying. My kids were able to get wheat free bread with their sandwich which was very tasty. I got the jalapeño popper which was pretty good, a little too spicy as I did not get the full taste of the yummy cheese. Cute low key atmosphere but a bit pricey.
author: Kris T.

description:
After having wanting to check this place out since it opened, at long last after 14 months I was able to visit!

To say I'm a fan of cheese is an understatement. I LOVE LOVE LOVE cheese. I actually have nightmares about becoming lactose intolerant, that's how much I love cheese. So needless to say, a visit to this place was long overdue.

I had a chance to come here for lunch which seems to be the busiest time. Sing they don't have a huge indoor/outdoor seating area, I suggest you try to arrive before 11:45. Worst case scenario tho, South Park is just around the corner and you can always eat there.

Now to the food!

Their menu consists of various types of grilled cheese sandwiches. Different toppings and cheese on each one. They've got the obligatory tomato soup to go with the grilled cheese (because that is CLASSIC!) but also things like the Jalapeno Popper Grilled Cheese which has bacon and a jalapeno relish on it. I went with this one and was encouraged to try their pickles. I also got a side salad.

Their sandwiches are pretty big. I went rather hungry and after eating half (and some of my pickles) I was getting full. The sandwich was very good with a nice sweet hotness that you expect with jalapenos. My only complaint was that not all the cheese was melted. Granted, it was their busiest time (lunch) and there were a lot of people there. But I was slightly disappointed only because this was a grilled cheese kitchen after all, was it not?! They should have this down to a science.

So overall I'd give it 3.5 stars. I'm definitely interested in going back and trying their other choices. And will be hopeful that the cheese is the melt-y goodness I expect with a grilled cheese sandwich!
author: Melanie N.

description:
Love love LOVE their sandwiches.  It gets busy during lunch (on the dot 12pm).  My fave is the mushroom gruyere sandwich, big crispty toasted sandwich, execellent melted flavors.  It comes with a side of fruit.  And depending on the season, it can be a few grapes to a whole mandarin orange. 

There are also selections of half soup / half sandwich which seems quite popular.  On occasion, they will have a mac&cheese sandwhich (check out their specials on the A-frame) which tends to sellout fast.  Price ranges about $8-$10.
author: Ju D.

description:
They sure know how to elevate grilled cheese. The Moscone is wonderful, a perfect combo of cheesy, crusty and pestoy. The tomato soup is pretty incredible too, rich and smoky.

Their breakfast sammiches are unreal, really one of the best things I've ever put in my face. Bacon and a fried egg on a grilled cheese? HEAVEN.
author: Christine K.

description: I love a good grilled cheese. The lady and I stumbled upon this place not knowing its popularity. It was pretty quiet at 2pm on a Sunday, but it's nice seeing people come out with their dogs and chatting over a grilled cheese. The nice woman at the counter suggested a few options for me, but I ended up getting a mac and cheese grilled cheese. It was tasty, but was it worth $8? I'm not sure. It depends of their other options stack up. But they do whip up a good grilled cheese. The busboys were really nice as well. Definitely making a trip back here if I get a chance!
author: David O.

description: We have eaten here many times. I think it's very good. I ordered the popper today and didn't like it. Everything else on the menu has been great.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Nom noms. This place is amazing, and I'm so glad to have found it.

So I ordered a Jalapeno Popper with a blackberry lemonade, and D got an orange soda pop with BBQ Turkey Mac and Cheese. The Mac and Cheese was delicious. I loved the BBQ Turkey in it. THe Jalapeno Popper was a bit more spicy than I would have liked, but good nonetheless. The soda pop was super sweet and super yummy. The Blackberry definitely tasted like blackberry, but a lot more sour than I would have liked.

But everything was good. Plus! Your grilled cheese comes with grapes. Not to mention the service was super sweet and the tables outside are perfect for a nice summer lunch! Five stars for you!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Fabulous grill cheese sandwiches.  

Loved the mouse trap and tomato bisque soup with croutons.  It's the perfect meal when you are not feeling well.  

There is a line so try and get there early!
author: Sofia H.

description:
Cerise had this on our list of places to stop in on our NYE week trip to San Francisco so off we went  this past Saturday. The grilled cheese options are creative and delicious the restaurant itself has very limited seating inside counter seating and some bench counter tables as well bulk of seating outside. They offer beer, wine, Mimosa (freshly squeeze) and a variety of sodas too.

They were out of the daily Mac n' Cheese to the dissapointment of Cerise so she settled for the Mac n' Cheese sandwich (which does not have all the artisan cheeses as the original dish) I ordered the "Foghorn Leghorn" Chicken, Havarti, Blue Cheese, Arugula and Dijon Mustard it was yummy-licious. Joyce ordered the other that I was looking at the Mushroom Gruyere so we actually split both! OMG Mushrooms were earthy, rich, savory a definate winner I also had my customary Mimosa it was good too. Next time I think I will have a pint of Beer since I saw a few customers who had the beer in large Pilsners that really tasty. Diane liked her Mac n' Cheese just fine but agreed that the Mac n' Cheese over at "the Grove" on Fillmore http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-grove-fillmore-san-francisco is the better Mac n' Cheese. Honorable mention to the spicy Tomato Soup that is served with fresh homemade croutons.

Parking is street parking and can be hard to find but I would suggest trying this place out for sure it was very good.  Small Kitchen so YES it may take a minute or two for your meal... so don't come here if you are in a rush (or call ahead not sure if they do take-out) despite the wait it is WORTH THE WAIT!



Respectfully Reviewed
author: Pam S.

description:
YUM! I came here recently for lunch with a friend on a Friday. The line was pretty damn long and the wait for our food was even longer, but the food made up for it. I ordered the Mousetrap and smoky tomato soup (because let's face it, tomato soup and grilled cheese go together like PB&J). The sandwich was delicious -- cheese was nice and gooey and the bread was nice and buttery. The soup was the perfect complement; just the right amount of spice and acidity to cut through the creaminess of the grilled cheese. I recommend this place, but I would say try to come during non-peak hours to avoid the long wait.

-L.
author: Leeann C.

description:
Their tomato soup is kind of bland and the raspberry lemonade is definitely too sweet.

Now that that's out of the way: this place is excellent! I love having a good casual weekend lunch spot with inventive sandwiches. Also, I was skeptical about the included "seasonal fruit" when I first saw it, but those little apples are really flavorful.

A lot of places in South Beach cater to the Giants crowd, but languish in the off-season. In contrast, the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen feels like it's here to stay.
author: Sharon W.

description:
This place proves that there's an art to making awesome grilled cheese sandwiches. A fantastic lunch spot whether you're in the mood for indulging or if you'd like a lighter salad. 

The only downer is that there's always a long line out the door, but it's only cuz of how awesome the food is! 

If you're trying to decide where to have lunch, don't flip a coin - just go here!!
author: Sahana U.

description: They have MAC n Cheese grilled cheese sammys here! Loved it! I also got the mushroom and grueyre mac n cheese.. which was just ok.. had better.. but i thoroughly loved this spot!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
My wife and I just came back from a trip to Napa Valley and thus had a craving for more cheese. We decided to check out the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen and we were delighted by the sandwiches.  

I love spicy food so I went with the Jalapeño Popper. The spiciness of the jalapeños was perfectly balanced with the sweetness of the apricot relish. 

Service was fast and portion sizes of the sandwiches were quite generous and all orders come with red grapes. If you love cheese, cheesy puns and are looking for a solid semi-casual dining experience you've come to the right place!
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
I had the fortune of trying TAGCK recently. Located close to the ballpark, TAGCK has an outdoor patio area which is nice to sit on during a game day. You can people watch and enjoy a fancy grilled cheese sandwich with a beer -- yep, all at once. "A-maY-zinggggg."

Food: It's rare to ever consume a bad grilled cheese sandwich. They simply don't exist; unless you are reminiscing about the horrid, charred, grilled cheese sandwiches from elementary school. TAGCK (getting tired of typing this acronym already) has a perfectly sized menu for grilled cheese options -- not too many options to overwhelm you, but certainly enough to make you feel good about "trading" your money for their "goods." You can get grilled cheese sandwiches with or without meat. Portions are good, the bread is fairly thick, various options for cheese and fillings -- solid edibles.

Bonus: complimentary tangerine/orange to cleanse your palate.

Try: the tomato (bisque?) soup. It's heavenly. Thick in consistency and full of flavor. You will unlikely finish both the sandwich and soup together unless you are one of those skinny people who burn calories simply by existing.

Service: INCREDIBLE. Guy at the counter was very personable and offered up some good suggestions regarding the menu. My order was slightly off. After I mentioned it when my food arrived, the female server went OUT of her way to fix my order and then gave us a complimentary dessert for the trouble. In no way did I expect them to fix the order without raising a fuss, but they did just that. And then some.

By the way, pay attention to restaurant hours.

The cookie (and sandwich and soup) were delicious. I'll be back.
author: Raj V.

description:
Out of this world!

I live on Grilled Cheese sandwiches.  I eat about 5 a week.  This place knocks it out of the park.  Great bread, awesome meats, cute location, fantastic cheese, wonderful service.

I would score them a 4.75, ONLY because of my love for unlimited diet coke, and they do not have it.  They are a little on the beverages (they make their own soda), but I will forgive them on that.

I cannot speak to the lines people talk about, because I came at 2:30.  But come on people, its SF and if you come at lunch time, be prepared to wait.
author: David P.

description:
Cheeky and charming, the AGCK combines 70's charm with simple, well executed comfort food (what's more comforting than a warm, gooey grilled cheese sandwich with a cup of soup?)  

Get your grilled cheese sandwich with applewood-smoked bacon, artisan cured ham, goat cheese, chutney, roasted tomatoes, etc.  They also have breakfast sandwiches, granola, lemonade, beer, and wine.

* Grilled cheese sandwich with wild mushrooms & gruyere ($9): a savory, well seasoned blend of sautéed wild mushrooms and leeks, sweet caramelized onions, thyme butter, and gruyere in between two thick slices of delicious buttery levain toast.  The toast was chewy with crunchy edges and more crust than usual (not that I minded, it gave it a rustic appeal).  I'm happy they included a generous amount of mushrooms.
* Side salad of greens with big, crunchy croutons - simple, plain but good, wouldn't hurt if they added a little more to it, e.g., red onions 

The wall has many interesting artifacts, including family pictures, old Valentine's, and cheesy puns.  And the string of spatulas outside is adorable.
author: Lolia S.

description:
The Mousetrap sandwich is delicious! Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough.  And it was served with a cute little apple.

Their rotating line-up of locally bottled sodas are wonderful.  Especially vanilla cream, or go with a ginger ale if you want to cut the richness of your sandwich.
author: Denise K.

description:
Wow!!! I heard about this place but never actually had tried it out until recently. Great place to come to eat before a Giants game. We got to beat the lunch rush and so then we got to order relatively okay. 

I ordered the mac and cheese sandwich. I wish I knew that I could have ordered certain dishes minus some stuff, but it's all cool. I had their ice tea and I just love the overall vibe and atmosphere of this place. It's so unique in what it offers and how it operates. We ate outside-beautiful day in S.F. It took probably 10-15 min. to get our food (considering there were at least six of us). Good thing we came early too because around lunch time, the line was out the door. 

The sandwich was amazing. I didn't know how I would feel about carbs on carbs, but somehow, it works. The bread was so beautifully buttered and toasted, the mac and cheese was great!

Highly recommend, probably spent about $12 on it, roughly. Nice place to treat yourself every now and then. :)
author: Lola H.

description:
This place is phenomenal!.  There is nothing better on a chilly day than a great bowl of soup and a  grilled cheese sandwich.  We ordered the breakfast piglet, oozing with cheddar, ham, a fried egg, apple mustard, and rosemary butter, a piping hot bowl of tomato soup, and a cobb salad.  They were all delicious! 

I will definitely be coming back the next time I am in SF!
author: Erica L.

description:
Another neighborhood gem (good value at a decent price).

I am usually there in the mornings eating the Piglet or Farmer.

Look forward to trying the Jalapeño Popper and Mushroom Gruyère.
author: Francis M.

description:
Went back and tried the club and tomato soup.  Club- completely tasty. Soup- really good, but out of this world if you add some tobasco.  I like things spicy so that really set it off for me. 

Frankly, I'm baffled at the complaints I see here:

"It's greasy!!!" Two of the three primary ingredients are butter and cheese, dipshit. 

"It's pricey!!" Oh, so you wanted a $6 toasted sandwich? Take your chintzy butt to Subway/Quiznos.  Want good ingredients from an eco-conscious local business? Cough up the extra $2-3. 

"Long lines!" Good food=popularity. 

Sheesh.
author: Rob G.

description:
I've been dying to try the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen for quite some time now. I love grilled cheese sandwiches and could literally eat one for lunch every day--and promptly die of congestive heart failure, but who's counting?

Needless to say, I was thrilled to see the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen had a booth at the Treasure Island Music Festival. Score!

The menu was limited to one grilled cheese sandwich, with a mix of add-in's: bacon, jalapeños, tomatoes.

I ordered mine with bacon and jalapeño--two of my favorite foods! I figured this grilled cheese would be delicious, but a couple bites in, I was sorely disappointed. 

The bacon was tough and overcooked. The jalapeños were fresh--always preferable to the vinegar-y canned jalapeños--but not nearly spicy enough. The cheese was gooey, but greasy. The bread was very greasy and pretty tough. This sandwich had all the fixin's for greatness, but it fell flat. I suspect it was the pressure of cooking orders for hordes of hungry hipsters outdoors that kept my sandwich from greatness. 

On the plus side, the peach lemonade they were serving was fantastic. It was appropriately sweet and sour--the tart lemons got a good boost from the sweet peaches.

I'm still curious to try the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen's actual shop in the city, but I'm not sure I'll be as eager to queue up for their booth at festivals any more.
author: Raul N.

description:
Seriously I want to know why I didn't think of opening a place like this! It's genius!!! Especially when you have items on the menu such as the mushroom gruyere and the piglet! I was in grilled cheese heaven. The tomato soup was a little off in my opinion, but the free mini orange made up for it. Overall the whole meal was just way too cute! Will I be back?? HELLL YAHHHHH. If only they were open for dinner :(

TIP: Don't let their hours of business defer you from trying this place!!
author: Kristen C.

description:
Came here for lunch before the Giants game and ordered the Jalapeño Popper Grilled Cheese Sandwich.  Although it sounds good, the apricots just did not go.  Also, there was barely any bacon. Four of us ordered this sandwich and three of us were disappointed. I am curious to try the Piglet though...might give it one more chance.

Each sandwich came with a small orange. I wonder how many people actually eat the orange it comes with. Saw a bunch of them rolling around on the floor. I'd say only 1 out of 5 people....max
author: Gary K.

description: Who doesn't love a great grilled cheese sandwich? I've gone here a few times since it's near work. And they have a lot of different options with fancy cheeses. The only downside was that all their sandwiches are already premade, so If i wanted a specific sandwich without bacon, I couldn't get it. Other than that its a nice place and can get packed during the lunch hour.
author: Rehana K.

description:
3.5 stars.

I had the mushroom gruyere blue plate with the side salad and it was solid!  I cannot imagine what the 'real' sized sandwiches are because I couldn't even finish the mini version!  It was served with an underripe tangerine which I didn't eat.

The staff was super friendly and service was slow as molasses.  Not a lot of places to sit and the line was long the entire time we were there.  We got a table outside and froze our patooties off, but it was the perfect meal for a cold day.  

If you like grilled cheese and don't mind paying a premium for it, you'll dig this place.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Place was fantastic! Ordered the Mac and cheese grilled cheese and the piglet and both were fantastic! Quick and worth the price! Good beer selection and great people watching especially of those making their way to the game as it's right around corner from ATT park! Can't wait to come back
author: Morgan S.

description:
I came here on a Sunday afternoon and the place was packed!! There isn't a lot of indoor seating but there are a couple of tables outside! If you can't find a place to eat, you can walk to the nearby park that's down the street. 

The Mousetrap grilled cheese sandwich was so good that I scarfed down the whole sandwich before remembering what was in it! It has Tillamook Sharp Cheddar, Creamy Havarti, and Monterey Jack. All between 2 slices of sourdough. I think next time I will have to try adding the bacon or the artisan ham!

I really wanted to try the Smokey Tomato Soup and I'm really glad I did :) I actually hate tomatoes... specifically raw tomatoes and chunks of tomatoes, but I loved the soup! I especially loved dipping the Mousetrap sandwich into the soup!

We also got Stella's Cobb Salad, which I thought was also very yummy. I would suggest that you don't use too much of the dressing because the chèvre was pretty much enough additional flavor to the salad. The pickled red onions are a nice touch on the salad!

Their seasonal lemonade right now is the Blackberry Lemonade. It was a little too sweet, but still a good drink. 

I will definitely come here again! So many other things to try... I'm very curious about their breakfast too!
author: Yumi H.

description:
I come here a lot, since it's close to one of my school campuses. 

The decoration inside was nice and cute, and it's a relatively small space. If you want to eat in there, by all means do, but it can get pretty crowded and busy when there's a huge rush of people. (There was a time I waited twenty minutes for my sandwich and had to scarf it down in five minutes before class started.)

Their sandwiches are very delicious, and it is worth the wait! They have a good sandwich and soup/salad special that is around $8-9. Very filling, and very much worth the price. 

The service is good, people are friendly and they put a lot of effort into making the food. If there's a long line, don't be surprised that you will have to wait a while for your food to come.
author: Bianca W.

description:
The most amazing grilled cheese ever made to man - I honestly have no idea how they make something as simple as grilled cheese THIS good. And here I was thinking that a good grilled cheese was simply taking two pieces of white wonder bread and putting some kraft singles in between and cooking it with butter. This place just takes whatever you thought grilled cheese tasted like to a whole new LEVEL. 

As skeptical as I was when I came here - not to mention the $9 for a grilled cheese (9 dollars for grilled cheese?) I thought - what a rip! 10 minutes later when my food arrived with a tangerine with its vine still attached, I had my first bite... WHAT THE - How do they do it? How does one make grilled cheese something so delicious? I pondered this thought for minutes until I realized my grilled cheese was finished. Maybe it was the crispy bread - or the different cheeses - or the crispy succulent bacon with each bite. I have NO idea how they pull it off but this place makes the most amazing grilled cheese - came back and brought a few of my friends and they whole heartedly agreed with me. Make sure you order the Foghorn or Jalepeno popper - Those I think are the best tasting ones but the rest are amazing as well.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Overall good times but not rediculously amazing.  Two grilled sandwiches, a bowl of soup and a cup of coffee... $30.  Of our two we loved the gryere and mushroom sandwich... Bread was fab,nthe thinly sliced potatos we almost fought over... Much better than our ham and cheese... Which just needed more ham and fell a little flat, not bad at all, but not awesome either hust kinda average even with pickels and a couple extras in there.  The tomato soup was fun, simple.. But it Came out kind of cold, and felt as though they were running out and it had just been made... The description on the board read that it was "smoky"... Just Felt like it needed another 4-6 hrs to simmer and develop its flavors... The soup was also rather watery.   

Bottom libe the food was yummy... Nice bread and grilled very well... But we kept saying to ourselves that its missing something... We just couldnt figure out what... A small side salad, a couple herbs, something else in the sandwich, a real pickel, Something was missing... Probably a couple of pints would fix it, but thst doesnt count!
author: Ali A.

description:
I came here for the first time this past Wednesday with my bf and his friends before we all went to the Giants game. I had been wanting to check this place out so I'm glad that I had the opportunity to do so! It's located near the ballpark so that's a plus (especially if you don't want to spend money on over-priced foods inside the ballpark). There are tables outside which you can use for your dining pleasures. 

The place itself is a small eatery, but it's well acquainted with a nice, size kitchen and dining area inside. The AGCK offers a limited menu of different types of grilled cheese that range from your average grilled cheese to a turkey club grilled cheese sandwich. From what I can remember, there's about 7-8 items to choose from, more or less. All the menu items look so appetizing so it's hard to choose one. I ordered the turkey club grilled cheese which was about $8. To me, I thought that was a little too overpriced for such a simple sandwich. But I guess the sandwiches have to be priced that way because of the limited space the restaurant has and/or the gourmet ingredients the chefs use. 

So all of us ordered our food and sat outside the restaurant at one of their outside tables. We waited for about 15-20 minutes for our food to come out. I don't know why it took so long for our sandwiches to come out but it's okay (the place was busy in the first place). So we finally got our sandwiches and I noticed that all of the grilled cheeses come with a nectarine! I have never seen that before! I was a little surprised, but happy :) My turkey club grilled cheese looked very delicious. The chefs used sourdough bread for my sandwich (which I love) and the bread had the right amount of carmelization to give a nice, crusty look. My grilled cheese was a pretty, good size sandwich; if it wasn't a nice size sandwich, I would of wasted $8.00! :-/ 

My first bite of my sandwich was pretty good. I was thoroughly impressed with the crunchiness of the bacon, the moistness of the turkey meat, and the gooy-ness of the sharp Cheddar cheese. All of the flavors of this hearty sandwich was everything that I had hoped for in a sandwich. This sandwich was worth every penny and it definitely filled me up. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite before heading off to the ballpark. Oh! The restaurant even has a few beers on tap! As well as various beverages to choose from. 

I'm so glad that I came here with my bf and his friends :) I just wish there was a place like this in San Jose!!!
author: Francesca H.

description:
My friend and I split a mac & cheese and the mushroom... they were "okay" - on par with your average fast food. To be honest, for grilled cheeses - they weren't that "cheesy" and were kind of small for the price (like, regular slice of bread size).  I was pretty disappointed with the bread. For $8-9, I'd rather go get a fancy panini.

Would not return.
author: Hannah T.

description:
I was super hyped about coming to eat here. I LOVE grilled cheese sandwiches. I was even going to eat regular bread and suffer through my gluten intolerant-ness..

It was a cold day so my friend suggested that we get grilled cheese and hot tomato soup. Sounded amazing... we pulled up to the place and it was super crowded and I got more and more excited. Then I read the menu and I was giggling and clapping with joy  like a teenaged girl. At the very end of the menu it said you could get any sandwich gluten free, I was ecstatic at this point. 

Ordered my tomato soup, gluten free Club Turkey, cranberry lemonade and then sat down and waited...

The cranberry juice was nice and tart (the guy didn't give me a straw :( but my friend got one from the other cashier)

Tomato soup was nothing special, and really not that hot. They also gave it to me WAY before my sandwich so it was a bit tepid by the time I got my sandwich. (I like to dip my sandwich into the soup).

Club Turkey, I found it a bit bland... maybe it's because I didn't get mustard (but I don't like mustard) or maybe it just needed more bacon..I also think that the gluten free bread is a little too thick and doesn't get as crunchy as a good grilled cheese does... you can rarely substitute out for a gluten free product  and get the same results as the regular stuff... and this is definitely one of those situations. My friend also got the club turkey but a regular one and he loved his, he actually wanted to order another...

maybe i'll try it again, probably not since there are so many tastier restaurants in sf
author: Bon N.

description:
The Mushroom Gruyère will blow your [F-Bomb] mind.

Seriously.
author: Dik W.

description: This is a narrow and interesting space. There are plenty of tables outside if the weather is nice. If not, be prepared to huddle with people next to and behind you. They are very artistic here. There is always something written in your soup and there are some really neat menu options. The grilled cheese sandwiches were good, but not out of this world. I love grilled cheese but I was looking for something a step up from what I make at home.
author: Kari G.

description:
We were down near AT&T park for the Giants/Dodgers game and wondering what to do about dinner. We drove by this place while looking for a parking space. 

So there we were thinking - do we want to plunk down $8 for some crappy canned cheese nachos at the ballpark or for a gourmet sandwich that all my fellow yelpers were raving about. Hands down - let's go gourmet! 

We ordered the piglet and the mushroom grilled cheese sandwich and took it with us to the game. Not cheap sandwiches folks. At almost $7 to $9 a sandwich these things better be good. 

Popped open the containers while waiting for the game to start and was blown away by the first bite of the mushroom sandwich. Damn good stuff there. It reminded me biting into a mushroom pizza for some reason. Reality hit me only when I tasted the thin sliver of potato that this was a grilled cheese sandwich. The bread was buttered just right to get that perfect crunch. How good was this sandwich? Good enough to make me feel justified paying $9 for a meatless sandwich - that's how good...=0) 

The piglet was good but not as good as the mushroom in my opinion.  We needed a sandwich with meat to satisfy my meat craving.  Either way, I was happy that night - nothing like munching on two tasty gourmet sandwiches while watching a Giants/Dodgers game at the ballpark. Will definitely stop by here when in the area to grab some good gourmet sammies!
author: Cris H.

description:
So I have been here a few times now. I am still not wowed but at the same time not unhappy. I love grilled cheese. I am not sure if it is the toasted bread, the sweet butter or just plain old cheese, but I can't say no to it. However, I can make it at home relatively easy and I don't even cook that well.

This place does make a pretty good grill cheese. The bread is crispy the cheese is melted (if you get a breakfast one it comes with egg ... super good). I think my biggest complaint is still the price. I just can't rationalize it. I mean even after having a sandwich here, I walk away happy, but hungry because let's face it, grill cheese isn't necessarily that filling.

I did like their tomato soup the one time I had it. I can't say no to that stuff. I know I will be back but hopefully they can adjust the value aspect of this place a little more.
author: Greg G.

description:
I went to AGCK right before noon and just missed the LONG ass line that came at 12.  Heww!

I got the "piglet" which is a glorified ham and cheese sandwich.  It was super good though!  If you don't mind paying 7-9 dollars for a sandwich and a tiny apple- it's worth stopping by.

I also tried a few other of their sandwiches including a jalapeño one and the mushroom one.  I really liked the jalapeño sandwich and would definitely get that next time.  There seemed to me a consensus among our group that the guerrier cheese smelled like sneeze.
author: Cersei T.

description:
Awesomeness.

If the count holds, I'll be the 499th review of this place (trend setter me).

Kudos to my sister who suggested the 11:15 meeting time (she had been shut out on multiple occasions by the long line).  I went for the jalapeno popper and smoked tomato soup.  Sandwich was killer, ooey gooey cheese and sweet bacon.  Tomato soup wasn't out of this world but it was very tasty (good croutons). 

Not that I needed the soup but I just wanted to try as many things on this inaugural trip as I could.   Again thanks to my sister's paranoia, we got a nice table in the sun. Then enjoyed a nice after-lunch stroll through South Park (I remember when this area was a dump....so nice to see it spruced up).  May have to try that Butler (French) place next...

Two cheesy thumbs up for da Kitchen!
author: John K.

description:
Good, real good.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while.  I had the Piglet sandwich and my boyfriend had the Mousetrap with bacon.  Both were delicious.  Excellent Arnold Palmer and chocolate chip cookie too.  I'm impressed with their attention to detail (e.g. each sandwich comes on its own type of bread, and they use different flavored butter depending on the other ingredients in the sandwich).

The only reason why AGCK didn't receive 5 stars was because the inside of the store is tiny, so we had to sit outside and it was freezing.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Kinda pricey

The piglet is $9.50 way to pricey for a medium sized grilled cheese. The flavor was dull and a bit salty. Parking is horrible we circled like 10 times getting stuck in Sf's dead ends and weird streets. The only good thing was that it got a food safety score of 100 which is quite rare. Service is a bit slow. The have a complimentary apple, which is nice bit it was quite pithy.
author: Karen S.

description:
Grilled cheese is not something I think of for a meal, but thanks to a friend who suggested this place for a meal before a Giants game I felt it was a very good experience.  The smoky tomato soup I ordered on the side hit the spot on that unusually drizzly June evening which came the day before the even-more-unusual June rainstorm in SF.  On cool (or not cold) evenings like that the outside seating is a great plus.

Also, just to comment it's nice how they turned part of a former warehouse (a clothing company, I believed it was) into a nice food establishment.
author: H K.

description:
Got the "Jalapeño Popper"
GREAT! Really nice employees, nice location. And the sandwich was great. Got side of mayo and some hot sauce which in my opinion makes it. Definitely worth a try. Great quality ingredients delicious balance of flavors.
author: Moshe B.

description:
If your thing is grilled cheese, this is your spot.  The sandwiches here are a smidge expensive for grilled cheese, but the staff and selection make up for it.  Come up with your best cheese quote and you'll make their weekly quote board.  

The breakfast sandwiches were more impressive to me than the lunch fare.  

If you go during lunch hour or before a giants game, be prepared to wait!

Word on the street is that Gaga dines here when she's in town!
author: Bryson S.

description:
A bit pricy but oh-so-good! Whose genius was it to open a cafe strictly dedicated to grilled cheese sandwiches and why wasn't it my idea?

In addition to tasty cheese sandwiches, they have delicious brownies. They put a strawberry to go with your sandwich instead of a pickle (awesome) and there is a park nearby if you wish to eat your lunch in the "wilderness"

One con: the line at lunch is suuuuuuuper long!
author: Tatyana K.

description:
Nothing better than a good grilled cheese.  The thing is, it was just o.k.  Nothing to write home about or direct friends there.  I was really expecting to be pleased given this is their specialty.  
The real bummer was the mass of bridge and tunnel wanna-be's packing the joint on weekends.  I've been here 4 times now, and unfortunately, nothing was good enough to make it worth returning.
author: Jay B.

description:
I was walking to BART from work and I happened to pass by this place. I LOVE grilled cheese, and made a mental note (and yelp bookmark, lol) to try this place out.

I was not disappointed. I ordered a Mousetrap with bacon, and it was absolutely delicious! Very cheesy!!! It is rather busy during lunch though. So, if I were you I'd get there around when lunch starts (11a M-F; 12n-Sa/Su).

I haven't tried their breakfast offerings yet, but will try them soon. Stay tuned for the update.
author: James V.

description:
You're probably thinking a grilled cheese sandwich, uh, I can make one myself  but TAGCK puts a little more effort in perfecting the grilled cheese sandwich.

Some tips:
1. Lunch menu is served at 12 pm on weekends; 11 on weekdays
2. There's outdoor seating but limited indoor seating. So avoid coming on a chilly or rainy day.

We ordered from the breakfast menu because we didn't want to wait till lunch. It's basically a breakfast sandwich. 

Farmer's Breakfast - caramelized apple bacon, slices of roasted potato, cage free egg and sharp cheddar

The fresh levain, a country-style wheat bread is probably the highlight of the meal and reminds me of the grilled cheese sandwich i had when i was a kid. Buttery and Crunchy. Overall, it's a good sandwich and who knows, maybe it'll make you crave for a good ol' fashion grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Christina W.

description:
A restaurant specializing in grilled cheese sandwiches...heck yeah...I'm all over it! I went here because it was ranked as one of the top five grilled cheese sandwiches in the U.S.

Service:
Uber friendly and helpful staff.  The person taking my order let me sample the kiwi lemonade (Yum) and helped me with my sandwich order. At one point, after getting my food, I must have looked lost.  The chef/cook from the kitchen was going in and out of the kitchen and asked if he could assist me with anything. Everyone was friendly, smiley, and helpful.

Food:
I ordered the Mousetrap Sandwich $6 + Zoe's applewood-smoked bacon $1.50 + Jalapenos $.50 I wanted to try them all.  I wish they had a sampler. :) It was good.  I don't know that I would rank it the top 5 in the U.S.  I feel I had a comparable one at Mity Nice in Chicago.  

My buddy ordered a different sandwich.  He had some more flavorful cheeses and added all I did plus sweet pickles.  He said it was tasty!  *(He also eats frozen dinners though.  LOL!)  

Gluten Free Friends:
They have Gluten Free breads for you to enjoy all the sandwiches as well!  Kudos to them for allowing my GF friends to partake.  

I'm still looking for the best grilled cheese sandwich in Chicago!  Help a brotha out, fellow Yelpers!
author: Josh G.

description:
Oh my goudness cheeses, this place rocks my world with a party of flavors in my mouth. Line or no line, I quickly discovered this place is well worth the 15 minute walk from Yelp HQ for lunch.

I guess we got lucky because not only were there less than 5 people in line in front of us, but we also scored a kickass table for 5 on the patio.

I chose the Gruyére Mushroom without potatoes. I was surprised to see it didn't come with chips so I got a bag as extra, but I clearly did not need them. The sandwich was way more worth the calories and space in my stomach.

The mushrooms are more of a tapenade style which filled every single delicious bite with salty goodness. The cheese oozed and stretched as I gobbled up the crunchy calories like a 5 year old. Surprisingly, it wasn't too greasy or messy; and those are things you appreciate when you're recycling jeans over and over while on a trip.

Grilled Cheese Kitchen, you're a gold star on my book report. I'm jealous but also glad this place doesn't exist in Dallas... because I would certainly gain 15 pounds in a month.
author: Nikki B.

description: The food was good, but I didn`t really feel like it was that special. Definitely something you could make at home in a few minutes. Also, the cashier could have been a little nicer, food took longer than I`d expect, and they never gave me my drink. ): But the ingredients were fresh, place was clean, and the hot sauce was really nice. I love hot sauce.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: good food, good customer service, but come on guys, it was just grilled cheese, it wasn't that amazing.
author: Michael C.

description:
SO GOOD.

The tomato soup? Amazing.

The grilled cheese? So good that I crave it every time I crave grilled cheese.

The restaurant? So awesome that I recommend it to anyone heading into the city.

The dill pickles? MOST AMAZING PICKLES EVER.

I loved it :) Can you tell?
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Dropped in yesterday afternoon to be disappointed.  Ordered the jalepeno popper and the piglet sandwiches plus the tomato soup.  The jalepeno sand. was so-so nothing to run back for and the other sandwhich the meat tasted old.  The soup was so watery and boring, tasted like Campbell's out of a can.  Don't think we'll swing back by.....Oh yeah and the gringa cashier lady had a wack attitude... should deduct another star for her.
author: Monica M.

description:
I'm so confused.  Has anyone ever had grilled cheese before?  Its as if it was a new exotic food that no one has ever tasted in San Francisco.  

The idea is cute.  Fun spot for lunch.  But its nothing special.  If your in the area and want something quick to eat for lunch, its a great spot.  But not sure what all the hype is about.
author: Sun M.

description:
Who doesn't love a grilled cheese sandwich, seriously?

Dropped by around 1pm on a Saturday - outdoor seating all gone even on a cold gloomy day.  We got two of the window counter seats - I think they are the best for people watching...   Biodegradable flatware and napkins are available along the counter.  

While everything looked great, we decided on:

Smoky tomato soup - served with creame fraiche w/ a bag of croutons - $4 - a bit tart but it was piping hot, perfect for a cool SF day.  Dunk the croutons in early, it is so much better when the croutons soaked up some of the soup.

Mushroom Gruyere - fontina, gruyere, roasted wild mushrooms & gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter - $9 - delicious!  Cheese was pulling, the mushroom flavor explodes in your mouth, the thin slice of gold potato adds an interesting texture to this buttery and filling sandwich.

Don Gondola - aged provolone, sopressatta salami, roasted tomato, pesto, garlic butter - $8 - very tasty.  

Seasonal lemonade is raspberry - $3 - tart but very flavorful.  

It's a small place with limited seating - couple round tables near the front and rest are counter seats.  Outside has about 6 round tables.  They chain metal spatulas together to fence off the outdoor space - very cute.

Staff was super friendly.

We could have easily shared one sandwich.  All sandwiches come with a small green apple, cute.

Will definitely return - hopefully early enough to try their breakfast.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Toasted bread, tender inside, buttery-crisp outside.  Melting cheese, oozing down the sides.  Who knew that your childhood favorite would turn into adult food porn of the most luscious nature?

The grilled cheese sandwich is about as American as it gets, and AGCK does this classic great homage.  You can choose from the classic cheese and bread combo (Mousetrap), add some meat (Piglet), or fancy it up (Gruyere Mushroom).  If you want to get your heat on, they have one for that too (Jalapeno Popper).  My personal favorite was the Gruyere Mushroom - full of earthy flavor and oh so satisfying.

Not only open for lunch, they are open for that oft-overlooked greatest meal of the day, breakfast.  And this is the time to go if you want to avoid a line.  In addition to baked goods and coffee, you can treat yourself to a breakfast Piglet, complete with a fried egg added.  imho, this is the way to have it every time.

On the day we went, they were offering their version of another kid classic, the PB & J, made with INNA Jam strawberry jam.  My friend's one year old had a marvelous time eating his first ever PB & J - I'm only afraid that he is now spoiled for the Jif/Smuckers variety!  And truth be told, if I were not already so full from the 3 sandwiches we shared, I would have snuck a taste from the baby.  Yes, I have neither pride nor scruples when it comes to food.

Do check out the daily drink specials - I had a Tart Cherry soda that was fantastic.

There is seating, which I was not expecting - a little bit inside, and some nice tables outside.  The staff is very friendly and helpful, and obviously proud to be a part of the team.

Can't wait to go back and get up in their grill...ed cheese!
author: Liz S.

description:
The sandwiches are good, but jeez is this place slow. Unless you work nearby, you can only go here on a lunch break if you don't really care about your job security. Plus, the outdoor tables are usually all taken, which can be lame after you wait for 30 minutes for your order. Your best bet is to grab the food and take it to the nearby park. Just bring napkins - grilled cheese sandwiches are pretty freaking greasy.

Prices are not great - as one reviewer says, it's pretty hard to justify $9 for a grilled cheese.
author: Laralynne B.

description:
Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place!  

This is my go-to in SOMA when I want something quick, delicious, and relatively cheap (compared to the rest of SOMA).  I love the Mousetrap, Piglet (this is quite heavy though), and of course the mac and cheese is amazing!  It's nice and creamy with crunchy breadcrumb topping.

I also love the fact that they serve their own handmade sodas and flavored lemonades.  The flavors change very often.

This place can get crowded during lunch hour and seating can be difficult.
author: Melissa W.

description:
The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is a haven for comfort-food lovers. They cook up the most delicious grilled cheeses I have ever tasted, and I am a connoisseur of this particular dish. Their prices are reasonable ($6 for a basic sandwich), plus they give you a clementine orange with your sandwich. Their little green organic salad is huge for only $3, not to mention they come with the best croutons in San Francisco.

They have outdoor seating so you can bring your dog with you to enjoy the nice SOMA weather. Just FYI - they tend to have long lines so avoid going here during the lunch rush or just before Giants games, unless you're willing to put in a substantial wait time. 

Their cheesey-pun board is pretty fun to read while standing in line. Overall a nice restaurant with a fun attitude that serves up great food!
author: Ali W.

description: I think I just found out what OMG means. I stopped in for a breakfast sandwich (did I mention how thrilled I am they are open on weekends?) and thought I would get one of those tutti-fruiti blueberry muffins to take home for later. I made the mistake of taking one little bite while waiting on my sandwich .... and ate the whole effing thing. The amazing situation with The American is that they do really basic stuff so amazingly well. This is one of those firsts that gets better and better each time. I am love, love, loving The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen right now.
author: Robert M.

description:
How has it taken me this long to eat here?!?!?!

We attended the grilled cheese and beer pairing event (part of SF Beer Week) last night -- and before it was over, I was ready to come back for another meal. Nate was a super sweet host and Heidi was a magical grilling and flavor-creating machine in the kitchen. I really like that they both want to stay actively involved in the restaurant and keep things relatively small and local. I'd love to see another restaurant pop up along the Divisadero corridor...

Food highlights for me were the breakfast sandwich on a home-made biscuit (and after having it on the pairing menu, I now want to drink porter with breakfast always...) and a sandwich with roast beef, cheddar, havarti, and roasted potatoes (!!!!) served with a horseradish cream sauce. Reeee-diculous.

I will definitely be back during normal hours to try the grilled cheese with mushrooms and a full-sized breakfast sandwich!!
author: Megan D.

description: I've been here a half a dozen times and my intent is always to try something new but I can't resist the jalapeño popper or mushroom gruyere sandwich. Someday I will find the willpower to break tradition but until then I'll stick to my 2 favorite items.
author: Maria C.

description:
Oh grilled cheese, I dream about you when we are apart, but when we are together... I'm frankly not always that impressed. For awhile I worked just down the block from this place, and came in for lunch more often that I'd like to admit to. They had me hooked on that roasted tomato soup. For awhile over the summer they also had really delicious sourdough bread, the kind with real crusts. Maybe that's what I miss. Either way, after revisiting them now that they are not one of my staple lunch venues, I have to say they are not worth all the hype. 

Sure, it's all grilled cheese goodness, but I see no reason why I should have to wait 25 minutes in an over crowded restaurant to eat it. Asside from the grilled cheese they also make a wonderful selection of cookies, muffins, sodas, lemonades. All around, I would like to see more places like the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. They seem to honestly care about making good food. (I spied the Tartine recipe book in their kitchen). Also, if you have not done so yet, you must try the bourbon bread pudding, it is to die for.
author: Allyson S.

description:
I've long been a fan of AGCK, since they opened. This review is a little late as I'm just back from my Honeymoon. In short, what I wanted to say was that we had AGCK cater our Wedding Reception. Nate & crew were a joy to work with on setup, contract creation, and most importantly, day-of execution.

Every single person at our reception remarked how awesome the food was. The handmade sodas (Meyer Lemon Lavender) were a huge hit.

The entire crew was super cool, and made our special day even that much more amazing. They rock. They deserve your business. They deserve your support. And they deserve every star that Yelp will allow me to give them.

Nate & the AGCK crew; you have the heartfelt gratitude of L & B.
author: B S.

description: They have the best grilled cheese sandwiches. The mac and cheese one is the best.  I had the jalapeno/bacon one and it was too spicy for me.  They have a pretty good beer selection and it's super close to AT&T park which is nice.
author: Maureen B.

description:
It's ok, for a place that charges $9 for a grilled cheese sandwich. It's a fancy San Francisco grilled cheese sandwich... but it's still $9 for a grilled cheese sandwich.

However, they do have a 'cheesy joke' board, here's mine: 

What do you get if you combine a block of Cheddar, a horse and two predatory birds?
 
Cheese-neigh Hawks.
 
CHESNEY HAWKES!! GET IN!!!
author: Spencer H.

description: Nice little terrace allowing you to enjoy the sun in the morning, delicious biscuits (if you go early) both sweet and savory, great grilled cheese sandwiches with a broad variety of cheese. Now add to that good salads if you feel in a healthy mood and a nice staff and you understand why the place is packed.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description:
I really really wanted this place to be fabulous but instead it was pretty average.

-the prices are financial district prices. 9 dollars for sandwich. If you'd use to paying 9 dollars for a sandwich then this wouldn't be shook for you. If you think sandwiches should be under 7 dollars then don't go here.

-the menu is small. It's not called the grilled cheese kitchen for nothing. besides the sandwiches there is also soup.

-the counter people were very friendly and they were able to make one sandwich gluten free and add meat to mine so that was nice. service is 5 stars.

-the sandwiches were ok. I got the mushroom sandwich with ham and it was ok but not that large or didn't have a lot mushrooms on it. my friend's sandwich was also good but not great.

would I go here again, probably not, 9 dollars for a grilled cheese sandwich is not just something i would pay for especially when I can make one just as good at home but I can see going here if I was an office worker in the soma area.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
So, although I live/work only a couple of blocks away from The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, I've hesitated to visit based on lines (and perceived wait) and lack of inside seating.  My concerns - and more - were realized when I made the maiden voyage on Friday 2/25.

Although the line moved swiftly (10 minutes to order), I was shocked to have the person at the register reject my simple request of swtiching the bread on my selection.  I was told the sandwiches are all premade so this request could not be accomodated.  A couple of questions immediately came to mind: 1) I asked for bread to be replaced, not an intricate surgery session of removing several items within the sandwich itself; and, 2) am I the only person in San Francisco that doesn't like sourdough?  

Following this initial disappointment, we then were relegated to outdoor seating since TAGCR can only seat about 15 people in their space.  Mind you, last week was not the week to be sitting ourdoors in San Francisco (sadly, my blood has thinned since moving to the City).  The good news was that we had heavy coats, but was extremely disappointing was that my fiancee and I then waited 25 minutes to have our grilled cheese sandwiches delivered.  25 minutes for grilled cheese?  Even better, 25 minutes for pre-made grilled cheese sandwiches?  You cannot have it both ways - argue that sandwiches need to be pre-made to handle the lunch crowd, then have a miserable turnaround time.

The server apologized and offered us a free cookie.  Sadly (for the restaurant), we were not the only ones who waited for lunch on Friday - it seemed to be a very consistent theme as we watched other patrons become increasingly frustrated by the turnaround time.

The sandwiches themselves?  Not bad.  Not bad at all.   But for a $9 grilled cheese, you're better off making something in your office's toaster oven for about $3 and having it on a plate in 5 minutes.
author: Brian G.

description:
Yum. Went here recently for lunch. The food deserves a 4. but the space was not so great. It was super crowded and we ended up sitting outside in the cold :( brr.

I had the Jalapeno popper and that was extremely yum! but I do wish there was more cheese, I felt like I was eating a bacon panini with some pepperjack. All in all, it was tastey but i don't feel like it was grilled cheesy.

I also had the half soup and it was delicious! The grilled cheese went really well with the soup. 

quick tip: I didn't want it to be too greasy so I asked for it to be made w/o butter. ended up crunchy and yummy :)
author: Angela H.

description:
Grilled Cheese week with Louie and Elisa (fellow cheese heads) and Joe B, along with Kevin J, we had to hit this up. This was about a month ago during Tillamook week.

Mac and Cheese grilled cheese - bacon mac with granny smith apples, the granny smith added a nice contrast to the overall cheesey-ness.  This was actually pretty damn good, but the pasta did dilute the cheese taste. However, the vision of this sandwich was great.

Mouse Trap - a standard grilled cheese... very well done, with multiple cheeses. It was good, but something I felt I could make if given the same ingredients. 

Hard to really talk about grilled cheeses without a spread, though the prices at American Grilled Cheese Kitchen are extremely fair, especially considering the location. I feel like I need to try some of the other grilled cheeses to give this a more accurate assessment. It just feels like I could make some of these sandwiches. Sauce and bread are extremely important... I really need to try some of their other sandwiches.

Joe ordered a Turkey melt... but come on... were at a grilled cheese place! This was more like a grilled panini... good but not what I'm there for.

The Jalapeno popper was something I am looking forward to ordering next time... or something with a specialty spread, as these are what sets apart one sandwich to another.
author: Marc T.

description:
this place is delicious. I went on a Friday afternoon, around 1-2ish, and we didnt wait long in line. there was just 1 person ahead of us, and there were 2 cashiers. I ordered the Red, White, and Blue special with the Jalapeno Popper.

We sat outside. It looked like tables were at a premium but we got lucky and found someone leaving right when we place. Our food came out quickly, and I was surprised how big the bowl of tomato soup was! I remembered the other reviews saying how little the half sandwhich it comes with is, but I thought it was a good size. The sandwich was incredible. It was spicy, bursting with goat cheese flavor. It wasnt a strong goat cheese, but it was there. I forgot that it also came with bacon so that was a nice surprise in the bite as well. I finished my sandwich before I finished the soup. i wasnt able to finish the soup because I was so full. It also included garlicy croutons for the soup too. All the bread was good, apparently its made in the restaurant.
author: Mary K.

description:
I don't think I have anything to say that hasn't been said. We went at an off time (2:30ish) so there was no line. I had the jalapeno popper, which was great. Girl had mushroom something or other, which she liked as well. 

If I lived or worked nearby, i'd be there all the time. And I'd be a big fat fatty.
author: mark s.

description:
Mushroom Gruyere and the Turkey Club were fantastic. A good deal for the indecisive is the Red, White & Blue Plate Special that comes with a slightly smaller grilled cheese of your choice and a side of tomato soup. It also comes with a bit of fruit - nice touch. The soup was delicious!

Sandwiches are a bit on the expensive side...especially for grilled cheeses but I think it's definitely worth a try. $8-$10 range.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: Cool tall space with lots of sun on the corner of South Park Avenue. Hip, friendly staff, kitschy knickknacks, nice selection of drinks and sodas, and delicious tomato soup, but at our table at least nobody's sandwich was that amazing. Just okay. I'm not even sure anyone finished theirs. My sandwich advertised "sharp cheddar," for example, but there was nothing sharp about it and the sandwich, perhaps as a result, fell flat. Kind of pedestrian. Not bad dipped in the soup but nothing to write home about. They get an extra star for the space and for being such nice people, but if you are looking for grilled cheese nirvana you might want to ascend to another heaven.
author: Paul S.

description: The best grilled cheese sandwich ever.  I tried the mousetrap.  It was cooked perfectly - buttery, toasted bread between perfectly melted cheese.  It was small in there and can be difficult finding a table.  They also have limited hours during the day (and open a bit later for Giants games).
author: Paul S.

description: Really impressed with this place.  Stopped by for a UCSD-sponsored dinner before a Giants game.  Forgot what mine was called, but it was something along the lines of a club (had bacon, etc).  It was tasty, and a solid size.  Happy with this place.  Could be back.
author: Brian B.

description: I stopped by with the kids to grab a quick bite and my son decided on the chicken pot pie soup. Grabbed an extra spoon and helped him dig in.  The flavors were all there of a great fall tme classic, but the note of ginger was a great touch.  Will certainly circle back and try a sandy soon.
author: Dude D.

description:
As soon as my friend forwarded me the article on a new grilled cheese kitchen coming to town, I couldn't wait to try it.  Unfortunately for me, it's far away from my office, so I saved it for a sick day, when I actually was sick and was craving a hot grilled cheese sando alongside a cup of creamy tomato soup.  

After standing in line on a chilly day for a good 20 minutes or so, it was FINALLY my turn to tell the uber-friendly cashier my order.  He immediately thanked me for standing in line and told me that in the next couple of weeks, they were getting another cashier, which should cut the wait time in half! After asking his opinion on a few of the different sandwiches, I decided on the Jalapeno Popper and a cup of the tomato soup.  I also had one of the house made sodas (for $3, way too expensive).

The verdict?  The grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup was AWESOME, though a bit pricey (I paid $15 for my lunch??) for what it is, so maybe they'll figure that out and change the prices (hopeful, but doubtful).  The housemade soda from the vintage soda machine was nasty and a weird flavor combination and it was $3!! What? I can make a mean grilled cheese sandwich, but AGCK's sandwiches are creative AND delicious.  Will I be back? Probably not, I just can't get over the $9 grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Jenny W.

description: Had a $20 gift certificate and finally came in here on Saturday afternoon.  My wife had the cobb salad which she said was huge.  It looked like a lot of food and she said it taste good.  I had the Turkey club grilled cheese for $9 which has bacon.  I don't really like bacon, so I ordered it crispy and they made it pretty good.  I am really stuffed now.  I think I might try this place again.
author: James H.

description:
These things will make me drop our friendship in a drop of a hat.

Say anything remotely racist, bigoted, homophobic or abuse an animal. 

Toss your litter or trash out of a moving vehicle

Doubt my loyalty.

Do any of the above and you will probably lose my attention for good.

The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen has earned my loyalty and you had me at "Mushroom Gruyere". 

Who would have thought that a place devoted to just making grilled cheese sandwiches would be so awesome? I must admit, I only have visited twice but my love for you is true.
author: V B.

description: First, the Mac and Cheese cannot be beat. They post the daily (homemade) Mac n Cheese of the day on Facebook. The grilled cheese is mind blowing; I'll take friends or company executives here. The classic Mousetrap is mind blowing. If you visit San Fran, make this place a must-visit.
author: Kirsten B.

description:
I ordered the Club turkey.
BEST GRILLED CHEESE IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.
absolutely no exaggeration.
this is absolutely as good as it gets.
author: Yadira M.

description:
AKA, the grill cheese place. 

Not only are the grill cheese sandwiches tasty, the customer service is the best I've ever experienced. The people are incredibly kind, they welcome you with a smile and give you cookies while you look over the large menu. 

The only downside are the hours, but maybe it's just me, somehow I find it hard to get there before 4:00 pm on the weekends.
author: Lorna L.

description:
Looking for good comfort food. Come here! 
Comfort food with a gourmet twist. Come here! 

When the weather is cool like today, I want to snuggle up in bed. I also want some grilled cheese sandwiches!! 

You can't have grilled cheese sandwich alone. You need tomato soup. I love to dip my sandwich in the soup. Ahhh...brings back childhood memories. 

I ordered the Red, White, and Blue plate special which comes with a small sandwich and tomato soup or salad. I had the 'Piglet' which was nicely toasted. Love how it was grilled with rosemary butter. However, I didn't get the apple mustard taste. The tomato soup was creamy and went well with the crunchy croutons. The meal was completed with a few grapes on the side. My friend ordered the 'Wild Turkey' and loved it!! I heard a crunch every time she took a bite. That's a good sandwich! 
The line never seemed to die down. It was busy when we got there and busy when we left. It is definitely not a place to get a quick bite. Even to-go orders took awhile. 
Parking around lunch time can be somewhat difficult even in the normally quiet South Park area. 2 hour max. 
Overall I thought the prices were a bit high for the above average food. It is still worth a try.
author: Molly T.

description:
"BUTTER grilled cheese than this? For-GOUDA-bout it!" - Ligaya & Connie

Har, har. Punny, right? Well, expect to see it on the blackboard of quotes inside!

Gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches is just genius. And clearly, half of SoMa thinks so too, because there seems to be a line out the door from the moment they open to when they close. We arrived at 1:30 and waited about 20 minutes to order. Fortunately, we passed the time by having a mini photoshoot in front of the awesome mural inside, made of vintage wallpaper, old photos and paint that looks like cheese oozing down it.

While all the sandwiches sounded fantastic, I was set on getting the Jalapeno Popper, a delicious combination of chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon and housemade apricot-jalapeño relish. I got the red, white and blue special which is 1/2 a sandwich and a choice of either soup or salad. I got the tomato soup, which was mm'mm good! It also came with a juicy plum. Having just come back from New Orleans, I was excited to see that they served Abita root beer, so I also got a bottle of that. 

I had a bite of the Mushroom Gruyère (fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, thyme butter), and that was delish. I'll probably get that next time, along with the sweet bread pudding that they had run out of when we were there.

We sat at the counter and chatted it up with the owners, who are clearly passionate about their food. They treated us to some housemade pickles, which were very good. And I'm typically not a fan of pickles! I look forward to coming back, and trying out their breakfast sandwiches when they roll them out. Look out for our cheesy quote!
author: Connie C.

description:
I love grilled cheese. When I heard about this place opening I could not wait to go. This is place is basically all my dreams about grilled cheese personified into a gooey, melty, delicious sandwich. We run past here for United Barbell sometimes and it is pretty much the worst part of any workout. 

My friends and I embarked here on a long lunch on a Friday afternoon. The wait in line was probably around 20 minutes and another 10 or so minutes to get our food. I ordered the mushroom gruyere and a cherry lemonade while all of us shared the savory bread pudding special. I don't like mushrooms very much, but I gobbled up my sandwich in an instant. It was pretty much everything I have been dreaming about and more. Crispy bread on the outside and ooey-gooey goodness in the middle. The savory bread pudding was a special for the day and it was also very delicious. Honestly, how could anyone not like bread baked with cheese and butter? Exactly. 

Overall, a wonderful way to spend a Friday afternoon. The meal was around $15. My one gripe is that there is definitely not enough seating in the immediate area. However, you could chance it and order to-go to take it over to South Park to find additional seating.
author: Angela L.

description:
Where you at on the 6th star, Yelp?! Okay fine, at least give us the 1/2 stars so I can do this review some justice!

This place is OFF THE HOOK! I NEVER would've thought of putting a smoky factor to my tomato soup, but it is a perfect complement to any sandwich. You've got the tanginess of the tomato, the smoky undertones, the creaminess of the creme fraiche, and the crunchiness of those bomb homemade croutons.... hungry yet?!?!

Girl ordered the mousetrap: Sharp cheddar, havarti, and monterey jack ($6) 
Guy ordered the jalepeno popper: the tangy goat cheese and the jalepeno-apricot jam ($9) makes this wonderful combination of tangy, sweet, and spicy!

Like any loyal Yelper, I was contemplating how many stars to give this place while I was eating my food. Before I sank in on this piece of heaven, I was thinking of subtracting some stars because of the price. Little did I know that: 2 grilled cheeses + 1 tomato soup + 2 complimentary tangerines / 2 hungry lovebirds = 2 VERY satisfying full customers!
author: Ronald T.

description:
I can handle the lines and lack of seating, but hygiene is where I draw the line. Finding a long human hair poking out of my grilled cheese is a deal breaker.

It was lunch time, on a Friday and before a Giants game, so it was packed.  We beat the rush, so there was probably 25-30 people in line by the time we left.  I'm figuring at least 3-4 out of that 25 were probably served, and ingested, hair...but that's a guesstimate.

Bottom line: Invest in some hair nets.
author: Alex S.

description:
3.5 stars.

First off, if you show up from 12 - 1 on a week day, expect a line out the door. The place isn't extremely large, and I've never had to wait over 10 minutes as the line does move quickly. You have to find your own seating, so if going in a group, it's very helpful if at least one person is hunting down a table while the others order.

It's a grilled cheese kitchen, so yes, the grilled cheese is great. I've tried the mushroom gruyere, the piglet, and the mousetrap with bacon. I enjoyed them all, but the mousetrap with bacon was definitely one of the better grilled cheese sandwiches I've had in recent memory. It's worth making at least one visit just for that.

What I wasn't a fan of, though, was their smoky tomato soup. It wasn't too smoky, and I didn't get much of the natural sweetness from the tomatoes, either. It wasn't savory, either, so the flavors were just muddled. Definitely won't be ordering that again.

Still, this is about the sandwiches, so I'd still recommend the place for that. Also a nice touch: on their menu board, they have some cheese-based puns written from time to time. They're corny and silly, but definitely a fun bonus. It'll at least tide you over when you're in that order line.
author: Brandon T.

description: Friend and I stopped by for lunch before a Giants game....the aromas drew us in. Friend grabbed a table outside while I went in line to order.  We got the foghorn leghorn, club turkey and 2 bowls of tomato soup.  The cashier asked me if we wanted full or half orders. Since we were both hungry, I figured we'd just get the whole sandwiches. After tax, $32 for for lunch....a bit pricey for what it turned out to be. In retrospect, probably should have gotten the halves bc it was grilled cheese overload.
