They are definitely not afraid of giving the good old grilled cheese sandwich a new twist with big flavor and enormous satisfaction. If you have a sweet tooth, they offer a few kinds of cookies too like the ginger and molasses cookies or the brownies. 

Now I know where to go when I'm craving for grilled cheese and tomatoes soup. I wish I thought of opening a restaurant that sells something so obvious and simple, but yet so good.
author: Gourmet Princessa L.

description:
1 - the lines are insane, you really need to wait until after 2 if you don't want to wait 45 mins for a sandwich. 

2- the sandwiches are $7-$9 and are TINY! I'm more than happy to spend that on the best grilled cheese, but this place was an insult to grilled cheese. 

3 - NOT ENOUGH CHEESE!!!

I ordered the Mousetrap and a salad and was grossly disappointed. The bread is a decent start, it's actually really well grilled, but that's the only positive thing I have to say about it. It's mostly bread and virtually NO CHEESE! If you're going to specialize in grilled cheese, put cheese on your sandwiches. I get that it's fancy Tillamook cheddar, but that in no way means you can get away with putting less on it. I need to actually know I'm eating cheddar cheese, how else can I appreciate it?
Next the salad...if you can call it a salad. It's seriously just 10-15 pieces of some variety of green and then you get to pour a ridiculously salty dressing all over it. 

My favorite part of the meal was the tangerine they gave me. I wish I was kidding. My hunt for the best grilled cheese continues, because sadly, this place does not deliver.
author: Tori M.

description:
First impression... impossible to say.  Why?  We walked in on a bachelorette party with about 70 people (men and women) dressed in what looked like a nightmare rainbow of the worst of the worst bridesmaid dresses.  I'm not kidding.  All this with matching accessories and wigs.  

If you've been to this location, you know that 70 people fills up both the inside and outside easily. 

No brainer, we made our order To-Go.  A little disappointed that even at 11:30am we couldn't order from the lunch menu yet.  They only start serving lunch at noon on the weekends.  That was OK though - I ordered the classic breakfast sandwich.  Cheddar and Jack cheeses, egg, and added on bacon (gotta have bacon).  Hubby ordered the piglet - ham, cheddar, egg and apple mustard.

We waited for about 15 minutes before we got our order... again, hard to judge because of that additional crowd of people today.

Sandwiches were yummy!   I wouldn't mind going back at all.  Still want to try some of their lunch sandwiches and that tomato soup.  Next time, let's hope there's not another large party going on.
author: Denise M.

description:
Disclaimer: I am a huge fan grilled cheese

We stopped by on their second day open (Memorial day) and managed to arrive at just the right time with a smallish line and an open table outside.

Had the most basic grilled cheese, want to start with a reference point before jumping off to options with something other than bread, butter and cheese. It was great. If our schedules would align, I would be here every day. Can't wait to try some of the more creative sandwiches.

Looking forward to the upcoming weekend hours. I'm sure that given a few weeks they will get the kinks worked out with the service (a bit slow, but uber-friendly) and things will really hang together.
author: Ben K.

description:
God bless the American:
- for the Jalapeno Popper sandwich, which may be the best sandwich-named-after-a-deep-fried-snack-item ever.
- for their house made sodas. Seriously, the housemade sodas are very very delicious. I'd given up on the entire genre of liquid, but it's hard to deny vanilla ginger mint soda made from scratch. 
- for their housemade pickles. Last time I was there they gave me a bagful. A bagful of delicious, crunchy pickles. 

You'll probably have to wait a little bit, but I've never been disappointed. I've even made excuses to bike out of my way to grab a quick sandwich from these folks. Fantastic.
author: ezghan p.

description:
With all the rave about this place, I had to check it out. American Grilled Cheese Kitchen deserves a 3.5 Stars. 

The grill cheese alone is $9 which is pricey since it doesn't come with anything else cept grapes. If it came with a small soup or salad, then it's a great value. With Darwin Cafe only down the street which provides you with an exceptional Sandwich and Salad for $9, American Grill Cheese needs to change their game plan. 

I've so far tried:

Club Turkey: with Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos, arugula

and

Feta Fetish: Crumbled feta, fontina, roasted eggplant, zucchini, and red bell peppers, italian spices, garlic butter.

The Club Turkey is pretty decent in it's blend of ingredients...however the Smoked applewood bacon was not crisp whatsoever. If the bacon was crisp, it would provide a much better contrast in texture. It was simply soggy tasting. I would NOT get this again.


The Feta Fetish has a better flavoring than the Club Turkey. The Roasted Eggplant and Zucchini is nice and thick. I'd recommend this one. 

I haven't had a chance to try the Mushroom Gruyere OR Jalapeño Popper but it seems to be popular. I'm not sure if I'd go back to American Grilled Cheese again since it's approx. 5 blocks away from my work and there's many other places in the area that provides a greater value. If a friend were to visit from out of town and asked for a recommendation, American Grilled Cheese would not even come to mind.
author: David N.

description:
The situation: this charming yet hardcore eatery toes the line between at-home comfort food and the rich, strong tastes only high-quality food can lend. What does this mean? It means that The AMERICAN has reinvented your favorites with the high-quality ingredients the mature palate craves. 

If you crave bold, try the Mushroom Greyere. Very shroomy and cheesy. Eric had the Veggie sandwich, which featured a mild salsa that added a lot to the egg. This was definitely a milder choice...perfect for a hungover morning. And large! What is with these folks who think the sandwiches are small? The sourdough they use is the oversize-loaf kind. Pretty good-sized, I think.

I also had the oatmeal with currants. Yes I know, it wasn't grilled cheese. But can I just point out I appreciate the little details...like where else can i get currents for my oatmeal, or simple syrup for my coffee? The coffee bar was also spotless. Thanks!

In a nutshell, if you are looking for Velveeta and Campbell's, you won't find it here. And if you are over 9, why would you?
author: Suzanne R.

description:
The Piglet - Tillamook aged white cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter.  Very good sandwich.  Well cooked and not greasy.  Apple mustard on this one brings it all together.  Tomato soup, hearty, very tasty comes with house made croutons.  The apricot wasn't so great, ate half of it and threw it out.  Also had an Abita Root Beer that I will not do again, it was thick, almost syrupy.  

Prices were definitely on the high side, but that seems to be the trend in the neighborhood.  Sando's at Iron Horse down the street are in a similar price range.  Rents in these places can't be cheap.  

The service was very good aside from the wait.  Nothing they can really do about that, every new place near the ballpark has long waits initially.  They were also very cognizant of the wait complaints, serving drinks to folks in line (not free) and apologetic about the wait.  

All in all good and I will return.
author: Steve S.

description:
Stopped in here while I was visiting from out of town and had a really great experience.  I am familiar with Heidi, a co-owner and multiple Grilled Cheese Invitational (in my hometown of LA) winner, and wanted to see what she was cooking up.  She exceeded and surpassed my expectations.
In response to some of the other reviews I read: there was practically no wait, and in my humble opinion the serving sizes are just right for the amount of money, and by just right I mean a healthy and satisfying portion.  If you are used to getting 3 meals out of your Cheesecake Factory lunch, you may be disappointed by the portion.
The impression I took away from this place is that the people who started it and the people who work there actually care about creating delicious food and making their customer's taste buds and tummies happy.
author: Ruth-Ful L.

description:
Yup, I'm a fan.

I went halvesies on a mushroom gruyere and a feta tomato. Both delicious. 

Try the side salad along with your grilled cheese. The dressing is yummy and it's good for you (let's forget for a second that your main dish is butter, bread and cheese). 

Oh, and if you're the type that gets excited about wine, Robin K is a tasty small production red. 

And if you happen to be the kind of person that writes a review about grilled cheese being greasy, here's a tip: instead of hating on TAGCK, don't eat grilled cheese.
author: who k.

description:
In a nice, new development area right by AT&T park (and across from Jeremy's). This place has about 10 seats inside, and 6-7 small tables outside (dog friendly water pail available too). 

We waited an extra 10 mins to order from their lunch menu, which has a nice options of getting a small sandwhich with soup or salad (still very filling...dont know how big the regular sandwiches are...). 

We tried the Piglet + Green Salad, Mascone+Potatoe/Cabbage/Bacon Soup and another sandwich with the Tomatoe Soup. ALL of them were very good. And I thought it was so cute/healthy for them to include a small mandarin orange with the meal :-)

They don't have an extensive drink menu (no espresso drinks), but I would like to try their home made soda's next time. Oh, and their baked goods up front looked really yummy too (bacon & cheese biscuits?!)
author: Radha X.

description:
I've sure being doing a lot of pizza, pasta, and coffee joint reviews for someone who doesn't eat bad carbs or drink *much* caffeine. I thought I'd add another review of something I don't eat--grilled cheese. C'mon, can you think of something less healthy? Maybe not, but everything here is delicious and perfectly executed and is local-fresh-organic and all of that. I decided if I'm going for it, to really go for it, so had the breakfast grilled cheese with bacon (and yummay-ass much-needed coffee). So even if you are like me and wouldn't touch a grilled cheese sandwich in real life, you should just make believe and sit your butt down and enjoy the SOMA sunshine and good friends and every bite of the sanny of your choosing. 

Old friends are doing a double take of my profile pic right now--"Who kidnapped Gretchen T. and put her in a basement and started writing her reviews?" Really, I don't even recognize myself anymore. Being a mom has made me sit still and fully enjoy moments like perfect grilled cheese with dear friends. Because 15 minutes later, I will be wiping my baby's cute little nose and butt and retrieving a park-load of litter out of his mouth and rocking and bathing and feeding-feeding-feeding. Speaking of feeding, he is all about sharing his meals with me lately, but some days those offered bites of mushed banana, chicken bits, and soggy raisins seem like the only food I get. At least now I can relive my American grilled cheese brunch. 

PS for other parents, an online newsletter, Red Tricyle, wrote up The American as a great place to take kids. I'm sure that's true, but for now I will come sans kiddo to truly enjoy it!
author: Gretchen T.

description: I get why they are so notable...the niche-y-ness of the grilled cheese, they even offer gluten free bread for those who may be allergic to wheat/gluten, and I did like the industrial design (they had the cutest spatulas outside as decoration -- you really have to see it to understand).  I went for breakfast, had their farmer's breakfast which is basically a standard American breakfast but in grilled cheese format: potatoes, eggs, bacon, cheese and on grilled bread.  It was very good.  However, my question is -- why not open an hour or so earlier on the weekends?  I wouldn't think they WOULDN'T have business.  I am an East Coaster, I was starving at like their 6 am, and had to wait till 10 am on a Sunday.  BOO!  I'd like to say it was worth my wait, but I may wait till dinner time next time around when I am there to get the full grilled cheese experience...
author: Taryn C.

description:
That satisfied feeling one gets when going gaga over goey gobs of cheese with soup? Yeah...it's traveled the time to adulthood too.

AGCH is a great place- if you have patience and an amusing iPhone/BlackBerry app or a motormouth friend to keep you entertained.
You're not likely to get your order placed for about 15 minutes due to a long out-the-door line unless you go before/after lunching crowd peak: before 11:30am or after 1:30pm.

Food: Hi, my name is X and I'm addicted to the Mushroom Gruyere sandwich. Potatoes, leeks, cheese (oh the CHEESE!!!) and perfectly crunchy baked bread. It's not a low-calorie meal, ladies and gents.

 The other selections look lovely, howvever it would be nice to get a decent meat sandwich that is half veggie/half meat. Just a thought for future menu.

The tomato soup was a tad disappointing in flavor, but not quantity. It's much more salty than savory. Do NOT expect a sweet tang to the soup as one does when prepping tomato soup at home. It's good, just not expected. I would suggest adding some cane juice to it for a sweeter edge.

Bread pudding: Anyone order decadence? They have savory and sweet versions, the savory including bacon. The sweet is better, but rich enough to order on its own without sandwich (carb overload).

ATMOSPHERE: There are countertops along the walls with metal barstools, as well as outdoor seating. However, it's full, especially during the warmer days.

Oh, and the good-looking blond worker-man with the great arms? You really should be the face of the place. Nicest guy there, efficient, and ARTICULATE.
author: C. P.

description:
Pros: Delicious, service with a smile and who the hell doesn't love grilled cheese. I had their breakfast sandwich on the way back from a job interview. Now that I have the job, it's all I can do not to go over there and die happily of a heart attack.

Cons: $9 for a grilled cheese????????!!!!
author: Erica Z.

description:
With all the hype about comfort sandwiches, I couldn't resist the opportunity to try it for myself, on a perfect rainy day fit for buttery cheesy toast and hot tomato soup.

I went for the Red, White and Blue Plate Special ($8). Your choice of half sandwich + tomato soup or salad. I picked the Mouse Trap Sandwich made with Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on sourdough. I threw in some bacon (+$1.5) and tomato (+$0.50) for extra flavor. Overall the sandwich was good - warm pressed breads and cheeses with bacon. Really can't go wrong. But they did goof my order. I had asked for a half and they charged me for a whole, which meant that I also didn't get the country wheat bread I wanted in place of the sourdough. But they kindly refunded me some dollars for the mistake.

Tomato Soup - I was expecting a creamier thicker consistency than what I was served. This version was more tangy and thin. Obvious tomato but a lighter kind. I think if you're going to be eating heavy cheeses and buttered breads, might as well balance with some thick tomato soup too so you don't lose the flavor. The buttered croutons that come with the soup was a nice touch though.

I also had a bite of the Don Gondola ($8), made with aged provolone, sopressatta salami, roasted tomato, pesto, garlic butter. This had nice Italian flavor.

For dessert, we tried the Bread Pudding. It tasted like thick French Toast with bourbon-sugar sauce. Flavorful from the bourbon but less like the traditional bread puddings I'm used to that have some raisins and fruit.

The housemade Tart Black Cherry Soda ($3) was tasty though. Liked the option of these fresh sodas.

Overall, I enjoyed the food though I find that it could be better. Finding a table is a challenge due to limited seating outside. Expect long lines at lunch. Probably a good idea to pick up to go.  Service was friendly and very approachable. Probably the best part of the meal.
author: Cindy W.

description:
The food here is awesome. I love grilled cheese and they take it to another level with things like jalapeno relish and bacon. 

I think my only question is, "do I like grilled cheese when it's $9 per sandwich?" 

I think the answer is something along the lines of, 'yeah, once in a while."

It's definitely worth checking out. Plus, on a nice day you can eat in South Park.
author: Ben B.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile now, and today I finally did. I ordered the Black and Blue (gorgonzola dolce, monterey jack, roast beef, arugula, balsamic onion marmalade, sage butter), and boy was it delicious! Just make sure you like bleu cheese before ordering it.

I'm also giving props for the service. We ordered a double chocolate cookie. When we tried to break a piece off of it, it was *really* hard. I took the cookie back to who I think was the manager or owner, and he apologized for the hardness. He said it just happened to be from one bad batch of cookies. He replaced that with a softer cookie, and for the trouble he also threw in a blondie brownie for free. I must say I was pretty impressed at how well he handled the cookie incident.

Lastly, this place is a very "green" establishment, as all their utensils, plates, cups, etc. are environmentally friendly.

I'll be back to this place for sure; I really enjoyed it!
author: John C.

description:
I think it's a given that this is a great concept. I make grilled cheese for lunch nearly every day, and when one of my closest friends told me this place was next door to my old office, I couldn't believe it!

Like many have stated, the bread is tough. I think it's just their choice of bread. The cut of the bread is very thick, and I believe that's the cause. The sandwiches are good though, and the add-ons make it even better. They carry some of my favorite beverages, your sandwich is garnished with little strawberries on the side, and their chocolate chip cookies are so amazingly good!

I found the staff to be very very friendly. Which can be rare in this town. I also love the design of the place. Seating is a bit limited, it's strictly bar style indoors, and cafe tables out doors. I love the steal and old wood look to the interior. They also have a very graphic gooey cheese dripping down one wall when you walk in. Over-all I think it's a perfectly cheesy lunch spot ;)
author: Vara P.

description:
It is truly imperative that they call themselves the "American" Grilled Cheese Kitchen, because surely no other civilized country would stake claim to this highly sophisticated dish. Bread, cheese, and butter-only a master chef could pull this one off. Rest assured my friends, the AGCK knows that they must be over the top with such a simplified meal and pulled it off quite well.

I ordered the Mushroom Gruyere (supposed to be some symbol above the e to make it authentic European). The sandwich, itself, was killer, but the size and price weren't to my liking. The ingredients were as follows:
-Fontina
-Gruyere
-Mushrooms
-Golden Potatoes
-Leeks

Crunchy and greasy are the best way to describe it, with heavy emphasis on the CRUNCH. They serve it with a small orange/tangerine/neon golf ball, but regardless I'd rather have chips or slaw to complement the grease fest. I know I'm not eating healthy today so let's not ruin it some measly fruit to send me a condescending reminder that I ate like a pig today 

Yes, the line was long, as everyone has written. However, it is all part of the experience and Nate (spiky blond hair, real energetic) was cool enough to offfer us free sodas and pickles on crack. All in all, the $9.86 bill was a little on the steep end, but to take me back to the days when Mom would serve grilled cheese and tomato soup on snow days definitely warranted the above average prices.
author: Chas W.

description:
Grilled cheese sandwiches!  What a simple concept.
We came across this spot while walking around San Francisco.  I went with the Mushroom Gruyere.  Delish!  Creamy, rich and perfectly paired with the mushroom.  I also tried the Club Turkey...probably one of the best turkey sandwiches I've had.  The entire combination of cheeses, smoked bacon, turkey and tomato was a treat for the senses.  

I'm not sure how often I'd come back with a sandwich costing $7-9, no sides.  Service was great, no lines, and plenty of seating outside.  Fortunately, the weather was warm, as seating inside was very limited.
author: Maryrose S.

description: The grilled cheese (the Mousetrap) was quite good.  Very good cheese on thoroughly grilled levin.  I had it with bacon that was good and crispy.  I  give it an A.  The accompanying tomato soup was only a B, which was disappointing because it's the perfect compliment to a grilled cheese.  The soup was overly acidic and they really skimped on the cream.  It looks much larger from the outside than it is, so my recommendation would be on a nice day get your sandwich to go and enjoy it in South Park.
author: Leigh F.

description:
I love grilled cheese sandwiches so was VERY excited to try this place.  The first time I went they sold out early, which I'm told happens often.  When I finally got to try it, it was well worth the wait.  The sourdough bread was toasted with butter and the cheeses were ample and overflowing.  The sandwiches even come with an apple-- makes you feel better about eating a not so healthy meal. The Mouse Trap was AMAZING!  

I can't wait to go back and try all the other sandwiches!
author: K V.

description:
AWESOME!!!!!!!! Cheese lovers galore!
(disclaimer: DO NOT come here at peak lunch hours, the line is out the door, even though the restaurant has been for a while)

I wound up coming here with a friend on one of the fricken cold SF days, and to my delight, they had just whipped up a batch of fresh tomato soup! boy, did this hit the spot. So creamy and rich, it went along great as a dipping companion to my cheese sandwiches. 
Out of the two sammies I had: 
the Piglet and the Mushroom Gruyere, The piglet won my heart. 
The apple mustard added a little sweetness to an otherwise salty sammie. And the mushroom was good but a little on the dusky side.

But in the end, how can you go wrong with anything on this menu.? Grilled cheese and tomato soup brings you back to latchkey days of old. Cheesy, ooey, gooey madness. What a damn good concept.!
author: Jenn H.

description:
So I work a few doors down from this place and I've been walking by it every morning and every evening on my from the train. My excitement hit a high point this morning when my co-worker told me that *gasp* it would be open today!

So we walk out at 12:15 determined to be appropriately grilled and cheesed all at the same time. I waited 1 hour and 50 minutes to order my sandwich only to find out that the one I wanted they are out of. Ok, keep your head in the game, "uh, I'll have the mushroom one! yea!" So I start waiting for my sandwich (and one of my co-worker) They screw up my order, then they forget something and then I have to wait, 

That being said, a very lovely blonde woman who was putting together the bags gave me a $10 voucher to come back sometime and her generally disposition was comforting. 

The mushroom sandwich seriously lacks pizazz. It was also pretty greasy. 

My co-worker just told me that (tomato) soup was really only so-so and she is always begging me to go to places around this area to try different tomato soups. 

All in all, I think I'll only go back to use the voucher and I'll wait a few weeks. It's too bad, I was really hoping for another solid eatery in my 'hood.
author: Samee M.

description:
When I first heard this was opening I was excited to try something different with an SF spin on it, had high expectations coming for lunch the other week, and everything lived up to what i had pictured in my head.

After drooling over all the options i landed on the  tomato soup and tired the moscone with basil pesto and kalamata olive tapenade and was AMAZING! The soup was a perfect compliment to the classic cheese and bread combo and the mozz and the fontina went perfect with the tomatoes and grilled bread, made my afternoon happy. Will definitely be back. Awesome location, great food, cool people behind the counter. Lots of people talk of the wait, mine was only about 15 min at the time, but if i had to wait longer i would without hesitation, worth the time. I'm excited to try everything on the menu. Next up is the homemade sodas they have, or a late day snack and a beer, can't go wrong.
author: matt c.

description:
My Sunday couldn't have gone any better thanks to this new gem. 

5 star grilled cheese- CHECK (i had the breakfast basic er something, with bacon! 
5 star customer service- CHECK
5 Star beverages -CHECK

Can't wait to see these guys spread out across the city! COME TO HAYES VALLEY NEXT!!!

[thanks for the hospitality Nate! Hope you had a great birthday! Cheers! nicky, carter, aaron]
author: SF Blondie B.

description:
You wouldn't think that Grilled Cheese sandwiches could be so delicious but this place will definitely change your opinion of the traditional homemade snack. 

The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen doesn't serve the typical American cheese slices melted between two butter-soaked bread loafs. Instead they serve what I would consider a gourmet grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Garran C.

description:
Love that something so simple really hit it off.

The new feta sandwich is a must try if you like things a little lighter. 

If it's too crowded and it's a nice day, walk over to the little park next door and have a picnic!
author: Esty B.

description: After the Giants race, we were on our way to another restaurant for brunch and the wait was so long we decided to eat somewhere else. We walked by this place and looked at the menu and said why not? There was a line so thought it had to be good, right? I looked up the reviews and since it had a high rating, we were definitely in! All of our sandwiches that we ordered were amazing. We also ordered the Mac & Cheese and it was sooo delicious! The tomato soup was just okay... I would absolutely recommend this place! It's a keeper and we will be back for sure!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Pricey but good stuff. I don't know if I would wait in the ridiculous line that seems to snake out of there around the lunch hour, but after 1pm it's ok. I'm pretty easy when it comes to grilled cheese though. Just give me cheese and tomato. But they do use really good ingredients and the owner is super cool (and cute!)

My favorite is the cheese puns (Havarti going to feed all these people?!?)
author: Alexis B.

description:
Being vegetarian, I ordered the Moscone (mozzarella, tomato and pesto) on their gluten free bread.   I guess I should have thought about this before I ordered it... it's essentially a panini.  I just didn't feel like I was having a "grilled cheese".  

My sandwich was ok.  The gluten free bread was actually very good, but the ingredients were just ok.  There was no love put into my sandwich... it was slapped together.  For $8 I expected more.  Oh, and it came with ONE strawberry.  That was almost comical. 

If I go back, I'll try the Mousetrap to see if that tastes more like a grilled cheese.
author: Elena I.

description: I almost gave this place a 4. Well I ordered the jalapeno popper grilled cheese sammy and it was all good except this creamy texture cheese in it was too pungent for my friend and I. And it was a bit pricey for a grilled cheese, $9! dang.
author: Karen T.

description:
Absolutely delicious! First visit to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen and I was not disappointed. Ordered the Mousetrap and added bacon. Cheese was meltly and gooey (even after a short walk) while the bacon was thick cut and perfect. A little bit greasy, but nothing that isn't expected of a grilled cheese. The added strawberry on the side was also a nice touch! 

Highly recommended!
author: Brian C.

description: OMG the grilled cheese sandwiches are so yummy. They're greasy but so gooood! The staff is friendly. It's just a small shop but there's outside seating. The bathroom was ok. Only one though.
author: Katja J.

description:
Stay away from the Mushroom Gruyère. The mushrooms on mine were diced up like a bad tapenade and spread onto unmelted cheese. The so called "melted leeks, caramelized onions, [and] thyme butter" were non-existent. It was like a sliced potato and cheese deli sandwich.

My boyfriend's Mousetrap was decent, as good as any other grilled cheese my Korean grandmother made for me with Kraft singles when I was little. The tomato soup was too smoky and one-dimensional. And the free little apples that came with our food? Mealy rotten and way past their prime. I took one bite and spit it out onto my plate. The Empire soda they sell tastes like flat Pepsi.

I have no desire to try their other offerings and will not be going back here. Save $25 by making your grilled cheese at home and heating up some Campbell's tomato soup.
author: Annie C.

description: Absolutely heavenly. So hard to choose ... entire menu looked amazing! They happily accommdated my alterations to a grilled cheese. The line doesn't move very quickly but totally worth the wait!
author: Julie A.

description:
Setting: Lunch for two on a Sunday. Went around 1:30pm so there was very little wait in line. 

Order: The piggy sandwich (thought it was ok), the turkey club (I thought this was much better flavorwise), a bowl of tomato soup (which unfortunately was cold, but did come with some crunchy croutons), and a pomegranate lemonade (cold and refreshing, although I didn't taste much pomegranate). 

Service: Good service with a cheery attitude. The waitress brought out my drink after I ordered it and forgot to take it with me. 

Cost: $29. A bit pricey for a grilled cheese sandwich lunch. The breakfast sandwiches were cheaper and I like eggs, so I'm probably going to come back to give that a try.
author: Janet Z.

description: Very good grilled cheese. Had the turkey club & Mousetrap and both were extremely well flavored. Check em out on facebook for different daily specials
author: Dee L.

description:
YUM. 

Sanwiches:
-Mushroom Gruyère- Delicious! I'll definitely get it again when we go back!
-Jalapeño Popper- A great combo with the jalapeno and apricot. Very rich though, so I really couldnt eat more than half. 

Soup:
-Tomato soup- just ok, nothing special. 

Other:
We went on a rainy Saturday afternoon. The line was pretty far out the door.... it took about 35 min from when we got in line to when we ate. But definitely worth the wait!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Working in SOMA this place was hyped for months and months. I was even a fan of them on facebook before they opened.

I have to say it was a big disappointment. We and 6 other friends went the weekend they opened. We stood in line, no big deal.

I ordered the piglet sandwich, tomato soup and a lemonade. It was greasy, I mean it is grilled cheese, but it was also pretty small and boring. I think grilled cheese chef's who compete like TAGCK one's do, miss the entire point of a classic american grilled cheese sandwich. They overcomplicate to differentiate and forget about the customers who have to eat it.

The sandwiches are too expensive for the portion and for the so-so flavor.

The tomato soup is a joke. I actually laughed, as someone who's be religiously eating tomato soup since they were a child, I'd like to think I know a thing or two about consistency, flavor and texture. Don't order the tomato soup here, go to The Grove or Axis Cafe (Axis is likely the best in the city).

The piglet was 'meh', and I may squeal if I have to eat it again.

Grilled cheese is grilled cheese, plain and simple. And I'd invest a little more energy into your tomato soup recipe, I felt like I was eating at the soup kitchen at Glide.

-1 star for price, -1 star for missing the point of serving classic american dish, -1 start for forgetting what tomato soup is, -1 star for missing on the hype and expectations
author: Bruce A.

description:
I ate half the mousetrap sandwich and wanted to pass out from the creamy, rich, cheese overdose. Too bad, because I had to go back to work. But man, did that hit the spot. 

The strawberry they put in my takeout box cut the grease perfectly, and was a nice palate refresher.

My coworkers rave about the muffins they have in the morning, and the mac and cheese they'll occasionally serve. Can't wait to give those a try.
author: Lucia C.

description: This is not your ordinary grilled cheese sandwich... Was just traveling on business in San Francisco and my San Francisco colleagues suggested "grilled cheese" for lunch.  I love grilled cheese... just the basic bread butter and cheese.  But this place is your basic grilled cheese on steroids! It was amazing!!!  I tried the Jalapeno popper.... at first I was a little hesitant about the Apricot in it... not a apricot fan but I tried it!  It was sooooo good!!   Prices are good too!   It was pretty crowded at lunch time but the lines move pretty fast!   Definitely a must try if in SOMA!  I wish there were more of these around!
author: Lora H.

description:
I love the smoky tomato soup here. It costs $4.99.

But, I give them 1 star because they are fraudsters. Yesterday, on 01/21/2014, I paid them $4.99 for the soup and left no tip as it was a take-away order. I was very careful not to leave a tip and fill in an amount of $4.99 on the credit card slip. It appeared as $5.99 on my card statement.

That could be an error, except I get a soup from them 2-3 times a week. I went back to my credit card statement and I was billed $5.99 every single time, sans a couple of times.

An extra $1.00 charge per transaction? Sweet. Do that for the hundreds of customers there everyday who don't notice that. Fraudsters!
author: Nitin G.

description:
Was in town visiting some friends last week, and stopped by for lunch.  The food is fantastic, and there are so many interesting options to choose from.  It's definitely worth the wait, it's in a great location, and a there's a lot of good people watching there too.

Being from Chicago, I tried the Windy City and it was excellent.  I hear they're starting a breakfast menu soon too, so I'll be sure to stop by next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jarret T.

description:
omg im in love. The grilled cheese sandwich here is
amazing and pairs perfectly with their creamy tomato soup. I ordered the red white and blue, which is a perfect sized combo for lunch. You get your choice of a mini sandwich, (which is a half)and your choice
or either a soup or salad. The mouse trap sandwich is so good, lots of ooey gooey melted cheese and just enough ham in it to not over power the cheese. Great place in the city and I would definitely come again
author: Evelyn S.

description:
Once or twice a month, on the way to work in the morning, I stop at this place to indulge in one of their cheese and ham biscuits. Hands down! Bar none! The Best! Facking! Biscuit in San Francisco! Their sandwiches are pretty damn good too, but the peace de la resistance is the biscuit in the morning. 

Did I mention their biscuits are really good?
author: Chris G.

description:
3.5 stars for American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. 

Came here on Monday at 10:45am thinking that there'd be a huge line already but nope, no one was there. we sat down outside and more people came as it got closer to 11am. we decided what we wanted as we waited for them to open.  once they open, we were the first one to order. 

- Piglet: Tillamook aged white cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter
- Mushroom Gruyère: fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, thyme butter
- passionfruit lemonade
- tomato soup

my favorite was the mushroom gruyere.  the tomato soup was a little on the sour side, not really my kind of tomato soup.  Also I prefer a creamier tomato soup.  The passionfruit lemonade was too sweet.  I was actually able to grab another cup and dilute it with water.  The Piglet was a little disappointed.  I guess I expected more meat in the sandwich.  The mushroom gruyere was my favorite.  The balance between mushroom and cheese was just right. 

Not sure if I want to come here while there's a long line but this place A-OK!
author: Kapo T.

description:
How could I not like this place?  Aside from my unnatural obsession with cheese, I like the neighborhood and inside/outside seating.  The spatula "rope" is also a cute touch.  

The staff was very welcoming and helpful when I was there.  I had the Classic (fried egg on grilled cheese) and it was quite tasty.  I've only been this once (so far!), but I am definitely curious to try more.

Overall, good first impression and worth a trip if you enjoy the bliss that is grilled cheese.
author: Mack S.

description:
- turkey club was fairly decent, a bit pricey for $9, and the portion was a little small.

-  nothing too special about the bread, just seemed like regular toast.  

- lines are shorter when they open, they start to get long by noon
author: Jerry W.

description:
Designer grilled cheese sandwiches at its very best!

I love grilled cheese sandwiches... I like making them, and I like eating them. I'm excited that there is an actual restaurant dedicated to grilled cheese sandwiches, a food as American as our national bird (it's the Bald Eagle, isn't it?). I don't really know who these people are, but they have quite a place on their hands. 

Walking in for the first time was pretty cool... little things on the wall were arranged in a nostalgic way. I saw a picture of some kid on the wall only to realize that it was the guy behind the counter. It reminded me of a home... a kitchen! Everyone working there looked like they were having fun. The woman who took my order was very nice, and after every sandwich I ordered said that they were her favorite ones. I got the mushroom gruyere, and my friend got the jalapeno popper. The mushroom gruyere was everything I dreamed of (and more! I love mushrooms! And cheese!). I was bummed that it didn't have carmelized onions as it said it did on the website, but I did find out they changed it to have potatoes instead (and it was also listed on the website later when I checked).. and it was still delicious! The thyme butter? Ahh, to die for. The jalapeno popper was also delicious... once you bit into it, it was sweet, and then it had a bit of a spice to it. It had bacon in it, too! Divine!

As for drinks, they have your usual fare, but they also have house made sodas and passionfruit lemonade. That day their special soda was a grapefruit pink peppercorn flavor. Interested, I tried it... and I have to say it was good for the first two sips, but after that I was over it. Sorry to say! I really wanted to like it! 

Sitting at the counter was absolute torture... not only to watch other people get their food, but also to see the food come out of the kitchen. I also sat nearby the pot of tomato soup and it smelled so good that I wished I got a half soup/sandwich deal. I will definitely try it again!

That's right... I'm coming back. There's a lot of things there I want to try. And I don't care if I have to wait in a long line to get anything. This place is well worth it. Although, you should probably try to come before the rush because it does get busy. But they move really quickly there. Got here a little bit before 11:30 and the wait wasn't so bad.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Got grilled cheese on the brain? Cruz by AGCK for a solid sandwich that won't disappoint. I love the Club Turkey. All the ingredients are fresh and I've yet to try a sandwich that I don't like. They serve breakfast too!

The staff is friendly and courteous. The lunch line can definitely get bogged down on a busy day, but it's worth the wait in my opinion. 

Oh, how I love a good grilled cheese! AGCK, I'll be seeing ya real soon.
author: Andrew T.

description:
I was intrigued when I saw this place mentioned in an article about places to eat under $10. I was excited to try this place because I love grilled cheese sandwiches.

South Park Street has several other very small restaurants near by, that smelled good and I would be very excited to try. However, the streets were packed and I had to park a block or two away.

The restaurant seemed crowded, but that is mostly because it is small and dense. I arrived around 2:00 and waited only about 10 minutes for my sandwich.

The variety of sandwiches are pretty basic. They don't seem to have many frills added to them or on the side but you can buy kettle chips. They also don't carry mainstream beverages or a soda fountain. I had a Mouse Trap. It was crispy, and had lots and lots of cheese oozing out of it. It was delicious if maybe a tad more expensive than a grilled cheese sandwich should be. I also enjoyed the mini apple that came with the meal. It was surprisingly sweet and delicious.
author: Amanda H.

description:
If there is anything in life I knew well it is a grilled cheese sandwich. My all time favorite thing to eat is grilled cheese and when I happened upon this place I was in heaven. I had the Jalapeno Popper and it was delicious. I almost wished I would have also got the mushroom one when I saw the guy next to me having his, but that would have been so much food I would have exploded. 

Me and my friend were very happy to have found this place and I know I will visit the next time I am in SF.
author: Star L.

description:
A review from yesterday:

Had the mushroom gruyere with tomato soup.  So delicious!  
However, I wonder if it was worth the thirty minute wait and the $10 price tag?

Well, I went at 11:01 and missed the cutoff time for breakfast by 1 minute. So instead of a $5 sandwich, I was forced to pay $10. There was no wait at all. I didn't get a cup of soup, just a small over-ripe Strawberry. The sandwich was great but but wasn't worth $10. Brickhouse is round the corner and I often go there for lunch - $10 there gets me a larger sandwich WITH a decent salad. So I won't be going back to AGCK
author: Glenda F.

description: Great mushroom gruyere! I appreciate the artistry of the tomato cream soup. My friends really liked the jalapeño pepper. Pricey for the portions though.
author: Caroline Y.

description:
Yum. I call this my new hangover spot. 

To me, the best cure for late nights is grease and bread. Top that off with a ginger soda from the "soda bar" and I am a happy girl. 

I enjoyed the most classic of the grilled cheeses - the mousetrap. Its a combo of three cheeses on crisp bread. Only $6 for this sandwich, unlike some of the pricier ones. I added tomato and was good to go. However, it was a little greasy and left me feeling like it afterwards.

Yes the line sucks, and yes it would serve them well to have someone taking orders outside on a handheld machine of some sort. The settled the hungry crowds with pickles while I was there which I thought was delicious. 

Love the metal spatula fence. I'll be back for more cheesy goodness.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Grilled Cheese is one of my all-time favorite foods.  I think I like it so much because I hated it as a kid.  All of those missed grilled cheeses are making their way into my life.  I was really excited about this trendy little restaurant; it made my SF to-do list... and that is a big deal because my California trip was primarily made up of restaurants.

The food was pretty good, but I had much higher expectations.  If you're going to charge me $9 for a pressed spoiled milk and refined flour product, it better be dang good.

I was worried because I was not that hungry, but I wanted a sandwich and the special mac-n-cheese.  It is kind of annoying that they do not do half sandwiches, but it does not matter because a whole is really small anyway.  $9 will not completely fill you up; it comes with an apple... a small apple.

The Jalapeno Popper had slightly soggy bacon, mediocre apricot-jalapeno relish, and not enough cheese!  The goat flavor stood out, and the sandwich had a prominent kick, but if you are going to call yourself The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, there better be cheese on my chin.  There was not.  The bread was good and crusty, though.

The gluten-free mac-n-cheese was solid.  It was flavorful, creamy, and rich.  I prefer my gluten, but in this case, eating without the risk of gluten intolerance made my meal even better... I guess.

Though the mac-n-cheese here is Grade-A, the sandwich was slightly disappointing.  AGCK is a trendy little joint, but did not particularly blow me away.  A great option other than a normal sandwich shop, nonetheless.
author: Solomon W.

description:
If you're looking for a cheap sandwich, go somewhere else.
If you're looking for a quick sandwich, go somewhere else.

For the rest of you, this place has exceptionally delicious food. I've tried: Mousetrap with tomato, Mushroom Gruyere, Jalapeño Popper, American Dip, and the Piglet. All top-notch lunches. I think my favorites are the American Dip and Jalapeño Popper since I like things on the spicy side.

It's going to be just under $10 for the best grilled cheese I've ever had. Personally, I'd like to see the prices all raised by a dollar or two to cut down the line.
author: Brad D.

description:
Simple advice... get the piglet, as part of the red, white, and blue plate special, with the tomato soup.  Pair it with a carton of milk.... mmmm

Great location next to South Park.  The sandwiches are quality.  The sturdy bread has the perfect combination of crunch but still soft enough to enjoy.  Nice buttery flavor.  The piglet is combo of cheddar, a rich ham, apple mustard and some other surprises.  You can tell that the people working here CARE about the food they are serving you.  Delish!
author: Bo J.

description:
It was ok. It was cheese and decent bread and made to order. I'm not sure the quality of the ingredients justified the price tag of $25 for lunch (two sandwiches, a side pickle, two sodas), but it was ok.

Pickles should be a given with a sandwich, that's all I'm sayin'.
author: Jess F.

description:
Never coming back and highly discouraging friends to go. After waiting over 30 mins for soup and grilled cheese, we asked for our order an they said they wanted to "make it fresh" for us. Were they making the bread or churning the butter back there!?? They didn't own up to the fact they probably forgot our order. 

I choose Mousetrap since it had 3 cheeses, yet there was little cheese in it! The bread was awfully dry and holey. The tomato soup was really sour and thin. This was the first time in my life I didn't finish a grilled cheese sandwich.

Honestly, I've made way better grilled cheeses from Trader Joe's ingredients and their roasted tomato soup in 5 mins. I'm really upset right now. I almost want to go back in and ask for a refund. I'm not complaining of the price, simply the quality and poor service. At least offer me to comp me for SOMETHING for waiting half an hour.

BOOO!
author: Rina C.

description:
This is the place to go for your grilled cheese sammich cravings!!! Hoo boy...

I thought I can make a perty damn good grilled cheese at home, but I'm sold this is, hands down, the best.  I had the mousetrap: sharp cheddar with two other types of cheese on a perfectly grilled sliced bread. They add an apple on the side.

Definitely coming back to try their variations (mushroom & cheese, ham & cheese...) and their tomato soup.  They also have a breakfast menu.

The line is long, but the wait is worth it.
author: Liz A.

description: Great place to stop before a Giants game.  Fun outdoor dining.  Only problem - they ran out bacon.  Lentil soup very nice - warm and filling.
author: Mark S.

description:
Could easily go up to 4 stars if they improve the service.  Thought waiting in the line for 30 minutes was going to be the worst of it, but then having to wait another 30 minutes after ordering is just too much.  Sandwich was solid and I definitely like the variety of options (though more than half of the sandwiches were sold out at 1:45 when I went).

Overall, good idea and will be a nice spot for lunch soon hopefully, but I'm not going back until they figure things out a bit more.
author: Jacob W.

description:
Wow - in heaven.  The jalapeno popper is spicy and sweet cheesy goodness.  And the Mac & Cheese is some of the best I've had.  Not the most healthy of lunch options though they were serving some great looking salads (which goat cheese of course).

Great seating outside in SOMA.
author: Joshua W.

description:
What if I was allergic to bacon or something....

So after patiently waiting 30 mins in line, then an addiitional 20 mins to actually get my grilled cheese sandwiches, as soon as I heard my name called I quickly grabbed my sandwiches and ran back to the office to devour my Piglet (Ham & Cheese),  Mousetrap (Cheese Only), and tomato soup.

As I was walking back, my co-worker tells me "I think they messed up your order ---- looks like they saw your order, took another sandwich, removed the extra stuff, left the cheese, wrapped it, and gave it to you." Just great....it's like one of those scenes from the movies when the server takes back the dish and re-serves the same dish, but with the olives picked out or something. Hoping that she was wrong, I took a bite out of my Mousetrap (which again was supposed to only be bread & cheese) and guess what I found....1/4 of a bacon strip and small pieces of bacon all wedged in between my melty cheeses. C'mon guys, I ordered my Mousetrap plain w/out any extras...it's just supposed to be CHEESE & BREAD. Not that difficult folks...

I understand it was their opening week, so I don't mind the waiting. But at least give me a product that makes the wait worth it and don't just give me someone else's sandwich w/ the extras removed.  Overall, I was deeply disappointed w/ what I got. My sandwiches were overly toasted and I felt like something was missing. Also, my tomato soup was pretty much just red sauce. 

Like I always say though, give them a try and I hope you have a better experience. My only recommendation is that you go when the hype dies down. Maybe then, your sandwich will be worth a 10 min wait. For now, I'll stick to home-made grilled cheese. Sorry guys!
author: Lisa T.

description:
I went out of my way today to go to this place b/c I was craving a grilled cheese sandwich. PERFECT place for that, and I came starving - again, a great idea. Mistake - there was a Giant's game today, so the line was longer than usual, and the seating was minimal. I tried the Jalapeño Popper with a tomato soup. I was hungry so I got the full sandwich, but you can do a half sandwich with soup for $8 which sounds like a good deal. Usually when I pay $9 for a sandwich I'm disappointed...however, this was the best sandwich I have had for years! And definitely the best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had. In the sandwich wasteland of the Financial District, it was well worth it to go out of my way to grab lunch. I'm used to paying a lot for bland stuff, and it bugs the hell out of me, so when I pay a lot for something that tastes amazing and fills me up...it's worth it 100%

The staff is very nice, I like the grapes they put with your sandwich...it helps because the Jalapeño Popper has a spicy kick to it, and it cools off your tongue. The tomato soup is quite small, and on the tangy side, but I prefer it that way. 

I will definitely be back again.
author: Erin G.

description: This place is good. Real good. I love the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese, and probably like it too much since I haven't ventured out and tried anything else on the menu since I've been here. Oh well, it's good. And they have beer here!  And a great outdoor patio!
author: R.A. H.

description:
Really???? 

The concept is cute but their food will not bring me back. I think even my husband makes better grilled cheese sandwich. 

Their Tomato soup was disappointing too. It really made me want to fly to Seattle to just get Dahlia Bakery 's tomato soup. I miss that tomato soup...
author: Wakaknee J.

description:
We stopped here for breakfast on a Saturday and it was busy. The outdoor seating was full as was the indoor but we ended up finding seating. We ordered the veggie breakfast and the breakfast piglet, both were only $5 and a couple of OJs.

The food took a while but I heard the manager talking about how new the restaurant was and that they weren't properly staffed yet which I totally understand. (When we left we asked him how long they had been there and he said 6 weeks. Good for them for being so busy already).

The sandwiches themselves were absolutely delicious. They specialize in grilled cheese and it was one of the best I have ever had. The bread was toasted perfectly and tasted yummy. 

One word of advice: it can be really messy, especially if you get a sandwich with egg. I got a bunch of egg on my pants. But in the long run it was worth it.
author: Alie C.

description:
Man I LOVE grilled cheese sammiches and have been dying to come here since it opened. They're only open for lunch though and the trek from the office is a bit far, so I had to wait until one of those Friday-before-the-holiday half-days at work. 

I got the mushroom gruyere and hubby got the club turkey. Both were delicious with gooey cheese and bread grilled to just the perfect crustiness. I especially liked the thinly sliced potatoes and caramelized onions in my mushroom sandwich - what an awesome combination. Hubby seemed to really like the tomato soup but I thought it was just okay. We both really loved the pickles. Fat and chunky, cool and crunchy, with a bit of spicy zest without being too salty, they were a perfect accompaniment to our cheese sammiches. Definitely get the pickles.

Yes, it's a little pricey for what is essentially cheese and bread grilled together and we could probably make it ourselves at home with the same ingredients. But the ingredients are local and organic and what else would you expect in SOMA. It definitely puts 'wichcraft to shame and I'd rather pay $9 for a sandwich here than make it myself at home.
author: Amy H.

description:
Decent sandwich but not that impressive.  I spent $10 on my sandwich compared to Butler and the Chef at $8 and much better.   I can say I will not be going back.  

On the plus side, the outside seating is nice.
author: Moe J.

description: I'm a HUGE fan of grilled cheese, and this place is totally up to par. I had the classic grilled cheese with nothing else and it was yum. It comes with strawberries too which is so cute. Great beer selection, and I had the lemonade which is made fresh and very good. Great outdoor seating as well, good place to go after a Giants game. Must eat with their hot sauce!
author: Anthea L.

description:
Very good mushroom grilled cheese! Tons of flavor and just the right amount of cheese.
 Wish I'd tried the blackberry lemonade but the line was too long to go through again.
Very popular spot! Allow extra time for the line.
author: Heather D.

description:
Be prepared for a wait. This place has perfected the grilled part to the sandwich, but for the price and flavor... the hype did not live up to reality. 

The Piglet was good, but not great. The house made grapefruit soda was not memorable. I prefer a creamier tomato soup. The bread was nice and greasy, well toasted just the way I love it. MUST get the butterscotch pecan brownies.
author: Judy L.

description:
Soooolid! And uber jealous of the companies flocking to the south beach area that can make this their [insert company name here] "cafetaria". I listened to the reviews and got the tomato soup and small mushroom gruyere. Wow, way too much food for this little one! The small grilled cheese by itself would have been plenty but with the soup and croutons to boot - I was in food coma pain for hours later. 

Be sure to ask about their daily soda flavors. I wasn't keen on yesterday's selection but opted for their daily arnold palmer. Not sure what kind of lemonade they threw in there but it was tart and tasty!
author: Susan L.

description:
100 stars.

This is our go-to, super-indulgent choice at work. (It's literally 20 feet from our office, across second street.)

Sandwich of choice: Jalapeño Popper, hands-down, no question.

Mind-shatteringly awesome.

Secret tip for the heads: the Piglet sandwich before lunch is a crazy deal. Also, you'll be fat as a Christmas hog if you eat it.
author: John M.

description: YUM. I've had the mousetrap sandwich just as is, as well as adding bacon and tomatoes and jalapenos to one. I'm obsessed with this sandwich! Perfect grilled cheese sandwich, in my opinion, and I actually prefer the plain mousetrap with zero additions. It's perfect the way it is, and with a little smoky tomato soup it's even better. It's a comforting sandwich for sure.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
We used American Grilled Cheese Kitchen to cater our wedding reception and be featured as the surprise late night snack. 

The sandwiches were a HUGE hit and to make it even cooler, they used this space age massive grilled cheese press to make them on-site. It was very cool to see and the sandwiches came out delicious, hot and cheesy. 

Included were the mousetrap sandwiches with all the fixins - bacon, pickles and roasted tomatoes. Yummy! They even accommodated my difficult sister who doesn't eat cheese (i know, crazy) and made her a fixins-only sandwich.

It was the perfect end to an amazing night and fueled everyone at our reception to keep dancing the night away. Nate was a pleasure to work with and incredibly nice - we want to have another party just so we can work with him again and eat lots of mousetraps!
author: Lizzie B.

description:
I work upstairs from these guys, and man is it good.

Frequently end up with one of their fine biscuits with a coffee in the morning, and a huge fan of the club turkey for lunch. The soup is great too.

Only complaint would be that they often run out of the biscuits in the morning.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Had a great lunch -- One Blue Plate Piglet (ham & cheese) with tomato soup and One Club Turkey sandwich (turkey, bacon, cheese & tomato).

Both sandwiches were divine -- great ingredients make great sandwiches.  The breads were well toasted -- nice crust, crisp but not too hard.  The ham was thickly sliced -- you could tell it was not shaved processed deli ham, but more grain in the meat (more toothsome), and the gruyere was deliciously melted.  Tomato soup was delicious & the toasted croutons are nicely seasoned & add a crunch and some texture to the soup.  The club turkey was even better -- Yummo.

Note -- the Black Cherry Soda was the best!  Now serving breakfast too!
author: Star M.

description: I had the mushroom grueyere and tomato soup - both were unique and good, but I still like old fashioned grilled cheese and creamy tomato soup way better (like the one at Paragon).
author: Wakako U.

description:
It lives up to the hype. 

Having high expectations, as I've seen this on the front page of yelp for a few weeks, I came here and enjoyed every bite of my sandwich. I only tried two sandwiches, the Mousetrap and the Jalepeno Popper, and I have to say, the apricot relish in the Popper is delicious. I spent the first few bites trying to figure out what that extra flavor was, and upon the discovery of apricot, I was hooked. Surprisingly, it meshes very nicely with grilled cheese and bacon. The Mousetrap was good for a classic grilled cheese. Another highlight is the tomato soup which comes with crunchy-ass croutons. BOMB!

Tip:  I'd definitely go with the smaller sandwich and half soup/salad instead of ordering a full sandwich and a side soup/salad. Even for a small, they give you generous portions.
author: Patrick P.

description: Great place to grab a bite before a Giants game. You MUST have the tomato soup to dip one of their grilled cheese sandwiches in.
author: todd s.

description:
You can hardly ever go wrong with grilled cheese sandwiches and hot tomato soup! They had a variety of grilled cheese sandwiches but I opted for the regular cheddar with the soup. It comes with a cute little apple and croutons for your soup!

Minus one star for the warm soup. i really wished it was piping hot for a cold San Francisco day.
author: Joy C.

description:
Minimal seating compared to the amount of people there.

Line was long, but it moved well.

Sandwich was small, but fine. Kinda hard to fuck up grilled cheese, right?

A bit pricey for the size of the sandwich and all it came with was some grapes.

I'd go back, but not often.
author: Patricia E.

description:
Best damned grilled cheese in SF, made by the best damned people in SF!

You won't be disappointed, unless it's a "sell out" day, which just goes to show you how good their food is. 

Can't believe some of the whiners on here! Jeez. Really?
author: Russell V.

description: The sandwiches are all really good. The tomato soup that they are famous for is a bit tart/sour for me. We were there the other week and had this amazing potato cheese soup. It doesn't sound that appetizing, but it is pretty darn good. The pineapple soda quenches your thirst and is so good. The strawberry lemonade was good but a bit sour for my taste. I love that they put two fresh (very sweet) strawberries by my sandwich - a really nice touch. The staff there is friendly and helpful!
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Ooh the 'mousetrap' w/ roasted tomatoes was a dream come true! The cheese melted so beautifully. perfect. And i thought i make the best grilled cheese sandwich...i was wrong!=)... (2nd best?=))..
I also had the raspberry lemonade; too sour for my taste.
I am not sure why my sandwich came w/ a yellow apple on the side. i would have preferred an orange.=)

Anyways, I enjoyed this place and would love to go back for breakfast sandwiches.
They start serving lunch at 11:30 on the weekends,so, go accordingly whether you wanted lunch or breakfast..

oh i love grilled cheese sammiches!=)
author: C A.

description:
I went here for breakfast the other day and I thought it was really good.  You can't really mess up a grilled cheese...

The location is great and I like that you can sit outside.  The only thing is their hours; I wish they were open later!
author: Lily M.

description:
Normally I'd shy away from anything with "The American" in the name (have you ever been to an airport in a fly-over state?) However, this place is well worth the adventure. While pricey, the food is delicious.

I recommend the Jalapeno Popper Sandwich, Pickle, and Tomato Soup.

Oh, and don't forget one of their house-made (notice how I didn't say 'home' made?) sodas, hibiscus-orange, black-cherry, the choice changes weekly.
author: Greg A.

description:
OMG! No line! Thank goodness...think the gods were with us today.  Maybe coming after 1pm on a weekday is the trick.
Ordered the Mousetrap which is their most basic with sharp cheddar, havarti and monterey jack and it was excellent. It had just the right amount of oozy cheesy goodness with the perfect texture of sourdough bread.
I was also curious about the gf (gluten-free) bread so we got the Mushroom Gruyère with it. Both sandwiches were really good. The gf one just tasted a lot lighter. 
The sandwiches came with seasonal  fruit (today was a small green apple) which was a nice touch. 
Definitely coming back to try others...their special of the day sounded really good too. Next time, next time...
author: Heidi L.

description: The grilled cheese was decent. I ordered the Turkey Club and it was good but nothing to different from what I've made at home. Also, the price of $9 doesn't seem reasonable. Maybe I need to try something else.. but my first expereince was just below average.
author: Jo P.

description:
Tried the Jalapeno Popper breakfast sandwich. It was delicious, fresh, and very inexpensive. It's also really easy to park on South Park or Stillwell, so that makes this place even more attractive. 

The only downside is that the cashier seemed really out of it and messed up our order. First she only rung up one of our orders. Then when she rang up the second order, she just duplicated the first order. This meant that my friend had to eat the same order I had. 

Oh well, it was still good and tasty!
author: Katherine F.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this place.  Lines are not as insane anymore, we came here before noon on a Tuesday.  Tried the mushroom gruyere grilled cheese sandwich, not too bad.  Greasy bread sandwiched with finely chopped mushrooms and leeks.  The flavor was ok nothing too wowing, I liked the taste of the bread, very fresh and was grilled to a nice crunch.  It is a little on the pricey side for just a grilled cheese sandwich though, about $10.  For $10, it would be nice if the sandwich comes with a little side salad.

Staff is friendly and I like the creative variety of grilled cheese sandwiches on the menu.  My friend tried the Moscone and she was very happy with her sandwich.  I will come back and would try another sandwich.
author: Yun W.

description:
First time going and i fell in love. Its right by the AT&T park so walk over and grab a bite here!

Ordered a Mushroom guyere, feta fetish and their pomegranate lemonade. 

Both sandwiches tasted fresh and delicious...but the mushroom guyere is my favorite!
author: Ray H.

description: If you're looking for a place to grab a bite before a Giant's game...so that you don't have to spend $$$ in the ballpark...this is the spot.  But even if you aren't watching a Giants game...it's a great spot to drop by for some delish grilled cheese sandwiches.  The BF tried the mousetrap which is their basic but had the extra stuff added on.  Applewood smoked Bacon, roasted tomato, and the bread n' butter pickles.  The pickles really gave it that sweet and tangy taste.  Super yum!  I had the club turkey one of the best I've tasted anywhere. We also ordered a salad...which I didn't get to finish because they serve such a big bowl of it.  I wish I had more room in my tummy to finish it though because it was great cobb salad.  Gonna be back...one of my new favorites.
author: Dimps I.

description:
had the Jalapeño Popper and some Mortadella 'wich they deleted from the menu.

I realized i can make these at home (cept their champaigne vinaigrette on the side salad).
author: Lady K.

description: Awesome grilled cheese, though it was the non-grilled cheese items that wowed me.  I was lucky enough to be there on a day when they had Strawberry Bread Pudding, which is soupier than I expected, but was freaking delicious with a nice maple taste. They were also very generous with the champagne in the Mimosa's, fresh and delicious.  Definitely a must!
author: Rob M.

description: I got the mac and cheese grilled cheese. Apparently if you dip it in tomato soup, you get foodgasm! Amazing food!
author: Franz C.

description:
I had the Black & Blue which has gorgonzola dolce, monterey jack, roast beef, arugula, balsamic onion marmalade and sage butter. 

The first couple of bites were delicious but to have the entire sandwich was too much for me.  I ate half and picked apart the other half. Part of me wanted to wrap up the rest and take it home but then it's a grilled sandwich, you have to eat it right then and there.  

All of the ingredients were fantastic but my the Black and Blue had too many strong flavors fighting for my attention. The sage butter was great and the bread was nice and crusty. Gorgonzola has a very rich and bold flavor so to couple that with Monterey Jack, it was cheese overkill. The balsamic onion was a nice compliment but there was too much of it.

When I found out about this place I definitely wanted to try it.  Will I salivate at the thought of a grilled cheese from the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen? Probably not. I can get something more satisfying for my $9.

In the case of my sandwich, the whole is NOT greater than the sum of its parts. 

3 stars...
author: Cyndi G.

description:
It's cheese and bread! How could it go wrong?! CHEEEEEESE! Gooey, greasy! BREAD! Crusty and...full of carbohydrates! Two more perfect ingredients can't be found. Also a combination that's pretty hard to eff up.

I thought the tomato soup was a little too sweet and the layout of the restaurant is a little confounding.

Lastly, I attributed a rumbly stomach to my otherwise ironclad constitution after this bifecta of deliciousness. Sad day.
author: Eli B.

description:
If you are in the mood for the grilled cheese sandwich, this is your place. Just like your memory makes the grilled cheese nostalgic, the AGCK will take you back in time - only better. 2 out of my 3 family members thinks the fries are better than In N Out. We tried the Piggy, Foghorn Leghorn and Mouse Trap and we sat quietly as we enjoyed every bite. The people who work here are very friendly and its close to ODC if you want to catch a quick bite before the show. 

We will be back...hungry!
author: Deanna K.

description:
I guess the best hints I can give an individual who tries this is.....

go early or go before they close.

The foods OK, yeah the breads hard, little pricey especially since they don't give you that much meat (like one paper thin slice) but the overall taste is good. I wanted to get a salad but I saw at least 10 people waiting outside in line. The sodas are ok too, nothing really pops out even though the flavors they have you'd think it would taste better.

Oh well I work across the street and I'm lazy to explore..I'll be back.
author: phil c.

description:
Grilled Cheese: $1
Artisan farm fresh applewood smoked cured levain rosemary grilled cheese: $9

Also, the sandwiches are saltier than Chili's and Applebee's combined. Enjoy!
author: anthony t.

description:
A little pricey for what are basically grilled cheese sandwiches, but the quality is there. It gets busy during the early afternoon hours, so don't plan on stopping by for a 'quick' lunch.

And another thing, I ordered a breakfast sandwich and I asked for 'tomato,' they give me 'potato.' But whatever. It was still pretty good.
author: Joe A.

description:
Not bad. I had the little piggy.  It was buttery and cheesy and came with two little strawberries.  The sandwich was a good size but could have used a little something, mustard maybe or onion.  Given the price it would also be nice to have a side like coleslaw or potato salad but the two strawberries did give me just a little after lunch sweet.  

All that being said this is a welcome edition to the neighborhood and I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Garrett D.

description: A little slow for a quick lunch (if you're in a hurry) but expected given how busy it was! I wish there were more tables, we ended up standing to eat our food (which I partially attribute to the fact that one set of people were camping out doing work after they ate while people were obviously waiting for tables). The mac n cheese with chicken was very good and filling. I like that they have seasonal lemonades!
author: Amber M.

description: Hands down the BEST grilled cheese sandwiches in the city!!! It's always busy so if you're going for lunch be prepared to wait a little bit for your food (and a table.) The wait is definitely worth it though. The menu updates periodically. I believe it's based on seasonal produce but I haven't confirmed that yet. Your sandwiches are hot when they come to you and you always get fruit (either strawberries, apple or grapes.) I have tried several sandwiches so far and never had a bad experience. They also have soups, salads and a mac 'n cheese dish. I also enjoy their selection of lemonades and iced teas. The flavors also change here and they're so refreshing! Everything is delicious and a definite MUST TRY!
author: Elle V.

description:
My boyfriend and I shared the Piglet and the Jalopeno Popper. Both were good and unique. I could really taste the apple mustard in the Piglet and the Jalopeno Popper had just enough spice without overdoing it.

I tried the tomato soup and could do without it. Honestly, it was kind of bland and watery. I like my tomato soup rich and creamy.

While the food was delicious, the wait was kind of ridiculous. I had no problem ordering because I beat the crowd and did not have to wait in line but it took forever for me to get the food. (Around half hour!).I don't think they had a proper structure on making food in the order it was made in. People who ordered after me received their sammies before I did. I watched the entire process while waiting and a mass of sammies were made at once and then sorted and bagged but no proper order at all on who received their food first. 

Next time, I think I will call in my order.
author: A. Z.

description:
Lots of cheesy goodness with roasted tomato and bacon on a crunchy levain bread. The smoked tomato soup was pretty tasty too. If you love grilled cheese, you gotta check this place out.  

My one beef - I ordered the red/white/blue plate special which is $8 for a sammy (reg. price under $8) plus a bowl of soup. The Mousetrap is ordinarily $6. I added bacon/tomato which is $2 extra. Since the sandwich plus extras was still $8, why did they charge me $10 for my meal? I didn't catch this until later but seems to me they owe me $2. That's double dipping where I come from!
author: Lena W.

description: My husband and I have a love for a good grilled cheese with delicious tomato soup. This place was good with creative options. Their traditional grilled cheese with cheddar was the best of the two we sampled, but the tomato soup was lacking a bit. It didn't have a lot of depth to it, but it served its purpose as an accompinament to the sandwich. I'm told my grilled cheese is hard to beat, so I have to give it a 4 star rating for now.
author: Dia Z.

description: Taste breakfast sandwiches and tasty soups.  Very comforting food.  Not sure if its worth a long line wait kind of place, but I still recommend it checking it out if you're in the area.
author: Dan K.

description:
Very simple and good comfort food: I went there for breakfast and it was great, they add an egg to every grilled cheese they have. The bread was fresh and tasty and the cheese was much better than regular processed cheese

I would say they don't have a wide variety of sides to accompany the grilled cheese but otherwise everything is good.
author: Simon C.

description: I'm glad we went to the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen not right when it opened as the lines seemed very long.  We went this past Saturday and only a few people were in line before us and we got our meal rather quickly.  We ordered different sandwiches and both were really tasty.  I got the Pepperjack sandwich and it had a nice spice to it but not too overpowering.  My wife had the new Don something and with the meats it was really good as well.  I'd definitely head back here as long as the line isn't out to the street.
author: Blake B.

description:
I had the mushroom gruyere with tomato soup.  So delicious!  

However, I wonder if it was worth the thirty minute wait and the $10 price tag?
author: Carol L.

description:
2 Stars for now; I want to give it the benefit of the doubt and try something else next time.

I just finished eating the Mouse Trap w/Tomato Soup and I was a bit disappointed after waiting for 30 minutes; though it was nice to get in the sunshine so I'm not too upset about waiting...plus I knew what I was getting myself into based on earlier reviews.

One side of the sandwich was kind of black and the burnt ness of it over powered the taste of the cheese. The soup was good - but expected it to be heartier...you know like the TJ's one? Yeah.

Want to try the Musroom Gruyere next time.
author: Krystha B.

description: Yum.  I love a good grilled cheese and this place makes the best! Pair it with a soup and you get a little taste of heaven. I can't wait to come back!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Let it be known: the jalapeño popper sandwich (minus the bacon) is a game-changer. Melty chèvre, monterey jack, and sweet and spicy apricot-jalapeño relish come together in the perfect "adultified" snack food turned lunch. That is all.
author: Amber K.

description: Solid, interesting grilled cheese sandwiches. Wish there was more seating. Their tomato soup leaves a lot to be desired - maybe some carrots, onion, some basil or garlic could improve it. I have to resort to hot sauce since that's what they have to offer. Good enough spot to come back for lunch in SoMa (where I currently work), but I never crave it.
author: Vamsi T.

description:
So happy to finally make it in, and happier still to take my first bite of toasty, cheesy heaven!

Stopping in on the way to a noon meeting, we skated in before the mad lunch rush.  Just one couple ahead of us, and the only delay in our order was our own indecisiveness.  I tossed a coin between the Piglet and the Jalapeno Popper, ending up with the latter, and non-pork-eating sweetie chose the Mushroom Gruyere.  A soup to share and one of each housemade soda varieties rounded out our meal.

The sodas:  delish.  Loved the Grapefruit - Pink Peppercorn (damn you Heidi & Nate...you've stolen the secret to one of my favorite flavor combinations!), and Cherry was also quite nice.  Flavorful, not too sweet - perfect accompaniment to grilled cheese.

I love smoked paprika, and the Tomato Soup made me smile - its unique, bold, and about as far as you can get from Campbell's.  This fact, which pervades both the menu and the restaurant's overall vibe, is what makes AGCK special:  it has succeeded at imbuing a sense of handcrafted quality to foods (and beverages) which, let's face it, we hold dear for mostly sentimental reasons.  AGCK wouldn't have lines down the street if they were serving grandma's Kraft singles on Wonder bread and a can of Coke, and critics miss the point when that becomes their basis for comparison.

I loved my Jalapeno Popper - chevre is a perfect compliment to the sweet/spicy relish and savory bacon, and the proportions of ingredients were just right.  Sweetie's Mushroom Gruyere was rich, complex, and hearty...he actually said there was maybe "too much filling".  I disagreed as I leaned over to nibble the melty goodness oozing out the sides.  Neither of us found our sandwiches too greasy or buttery.  

Oh and the Butterscotch Brownie, which we gleefully tucked away for later?  Delightful. 

Regarding the price: we felt it was fair when you consider, as another reviewer did, the quality of ingredients, location, totally compostable servingware, cost of doing business in San Francisco, and the fact that this operation is 100% local.  Quality and handcrafted care simply don't come at Subway prices. 

There was a small line forming as we left around noon, but it moved quickly and efficiently, and the people in it were all smiles.  

Now, when will I be able to make it to breakfast...
author: Cynthia W.

description:
