I loved cheese and grilled cheese sandwiches. So when I heard about this place it was definitely a must go!! My friend and I got there just in time as we didn't have to wait in as long of a line as those that came after us. 

The grilled cheese was phenomenal!!! I got the combo and got a salad on the side which was also very tasty. It's cute that they give everyone a cutie orange as well.  Since we went at the end of the night, and they bake all their cookies and goodies fresh ever morning, we were able go snag some cookies complimentary. 

I'm sad that now that I've become gluten sensitive I van no linger have Grilled cheese... Unless they have some gluten-free bread to offer!!
author: Bettina L.

description: I really like this place.  I got coffee here, a muffin, as well as tomato soup and the mushroom grilled cheese.  I thought the service to the food was great, and I liked how they gave you strawberries to go with your food.  It's not cheap, but I felt compared to the Melt I was actually eating a good quality sandwich.  Will definitely come back for more.
author: Sophia D.

description:
I love cheese.  I can eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner - and snacks in between.  So, when you create a restaurant surrounding one of my favorite comfort foods - grilled cheese sandwich..it had better be good!  It lived up to my expectations as well as the other items I tried.

I got the sandwich that had mushroom, gruyere cheese, gold potatoes, leeks and carmelized onions...I was in grilled cheese heaven!  The fillings were of the right proportion to the bread (which was pretty good as well) and not greasy!!  The problem with some grilled cheese sandwiches is that they can be overfilled and greasy - this sandwich was perfect.

Since I was having such a heavy sandwich (as they all are - it is a cheese sandwich after all) I opted to get a salad.  The vinaigrette was one of the the best I've ever had...a good complement to the sandwich I consumed.

My friend got a small sandwich with Mozzarella, pesto and tomato along with the minestrone.  She enjoyed her sandwich and she was nice enough to let me try some of the minestrone- which was fresh, filling and very flavorful!

One cute addition was the clementine that they include - I overheard that they sometimes give apples.  The fruit is a nice way to round out the meal.

If you are looking for a nice spot on a sunny beautiful day or in need of some comfort food with a twist - head to this restaurant to get your grilled cheese on!
author: Jen P.

description:
Best grilled cheese sandwiches in town. Hands down.

I've come here twice, being an art student for the summer at the academy of art university which is right across the street. I am definitely coming back. 
When it comes to comfort foods, I like to stick to the simple stuff, so naturally my first choice for my cheesy treat was the "mousetrap" (their regular grilled cheese). It comes with a choice of adding bacon, roasted tomatoes (yum!!) or pickles (don't ask, i guess people like it). I chose the roasted tomatoes.
I can not tell you how much this place made my day. The warm, perfectly toasted bread topped with 3 different kinds of cheeses in perfect harmony with one another and a side of purple grapes. I felt like a little kid again! It was an absolutely amazing meal and I will be coming back here again and again!
DELISH.
author: Deana T.

description:
There have been many complaints about the prices at The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen at South Park, but given the cost of doing business for a non corporate mom and pop shop in San Francisco, in South Park, which also provides compostable forks, knives and spoons as well as compostable takeaway containers, I think it's clear that most are missing the point when they pay $8 - $9 for a sandwich.  

If one only looks at the cost of the sandwich, which on my visit came with a side of grapes, yes, it may appear to be costly, but also add the many San Francisco taxes, such as healthcare and sick time requirements as well as what is certainly high rent in the recently remodeled building at the corner of the somewhat trendy South Park area, and you have, well, a $8 -$9 sandwich.

Taking this into account, I felt that my sandwich, was ok, but certainly not worth the wait that so many others have commented about, I was lucky, I walked in and ordered without any ordeal.

TAGCK is certainly well presented, however, my sandwich, something called "The Porker" or some such pig thing, needs to be infused with more cheese.
author: Rafael R.

description:
So I would give this place 4 stars on food alone but add in price and slow service and this gets moved down to 3 stars.  

I've been walking by this place multiple times a day since it's right between my home and work but every time I did, it was either closed or had ridiculous lines down the block.  I happened to walk by on Friday night and found out that they had started to open at nights that had baseball games so I stopped in to try it.

Even though there was no line when I went in to order, I can see why they usually have long times.  The service is incredibly slow!  The sandwiches are pretty much pre-made.  I saw them making them and storing them for the next day and just to grill it took almost 20 minutes!  I guess they are new but also they also don't have the most efficient operations.  There was confusion over who would get the soup.  I got two and had to give one back.  There was also some friction between the workers on who should do what.  

Overall the food was pretty good.  I had spicy jalapeno one, a tomato soup and the pickles.  Don't get the pickles.  I've lived in NYC for several years.  Definitely needs to be way saltier.  Had friends over this morning where we shared the Mousetrap with bacon, the Windy City, the mushroom one and another one of the jalapeno ones and the general consensus was pretty good but completely not worth the price.  My understanding is that the ingredients are all organic and top notch but this won't be a place that I go to on a regular basis.  Nice addition to the neighborhood though!
author: Susan L.

description:
The best grilled cheese and tomato soup I have ever had away from home. 

Usually places that specialize in grilled cheese only have super fancy options. There are a few places in SF and LA which I have tried and been let down that I could not just get some good cheese melted in-between some good bread with heaps of butter. It is not so hard is it?

When I walked in, I was having a hard time deciding and a very nice employee offered to help me decide. She had a very Mia Wallace from Pulp Fiction type personality (if that makes sense). She asked me if I wanted something fancy or something reminiscent of grilled cheese from childhood. I smiled and said "the second option" and I want tomato soup. She also recommended that I have a hand-made grapefruit and peppercorn soda. I really enjoyed this all. I sat on the patio, in the sun enjoying every bit.

They will give you a bag of croutons with your soup. As your atturney, I advise you to dump them all in the tomato soup and eat it. Trust me.
author: Eric G.

description: My second time here for lunch today and I still brie-lieve it is still gouda!  Should've tried something new, but the Jalapeno Popper was just calling my name all over again.. and oh that tomato soup is so smokey. Yum
author: Ty T.

description:
Gluten free grilled cheese - Yumm:)

All I can say is that I am happy they exist.
Grilled cheese is definitely a guilty pleasure and having the possibility of having it out is great for someone who cannot have gluten.

Its yummy and filling.
Wish they gave something more on the side besides just an apple.

The GF bread is really good.
author: Maya z.

description:
Went to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen for the first time. It's really close to my work, but the long lines have deterred my visit till now. I line was manageable the day I went. 

I food is good, bordering on very good. I had the Mousetrap with the smoked bacon (gotta have the bacon). 

I found the food to be tasty, but ,maybe lacking in the amount of cheese I was expecting. The bacon was delicious but the bread could have stood to be a bit less "grilled". it seemed a bit to crunchy and bordered on almost burnt. 

This restaurant has only been open for about a month and I think the owners may have underestimated the popularity of their shop. I can see how, with time, they will improve on things (like the done-ness of the bread). 

i will most likely go back and try the other sandwiches they offer. I recommend you wait a month or two to try (till late summer 2010) and I bet they have all things down perfect.
author: Kenny W.

description:
Hmm, I like my grilled cheese like I like my mac and cheese...simple, yummy and tasting just like my mama made.  Now, my mama was no chef...so we are talking a slice of american between two pieces of white...the end and oh so awesome.  My palatte has evolved in such a way that I will take that slice of American and put it between rye...gasp! I know...fancy.  

Now, The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen disappointed me for two reasons.  There was actually just one grilled cheese sandwhich option.  The mousetrap.  But it had three cheeses...strike one.  It was sooooo oily I felt like I couldn't eat for the rest of the day afterwards...strike two...

But the bread was amazing, with little holes all crispy...the croutons on my smoked tomatoe soup awesome...and the side apple...woo hoo...plus the ambiance was kind of cool...the location is great-walkable from work and it even has out door seating.  

I will be back, but not by myself.  Probably with a friend, where we can both enjoy the soup and split the mousetrap...
author: Kierstan G.

description: I need to start writing these reviews as soon as I'm done eating. I remember enjoying my grilled cheese and tomato soup. It wasn't the Kraft and Campbells you make at home for sure. The dude there was cool about letting me borrow their bottle opener since I ordered so many beers. Trust.
author: Ronnie E.

description:
I was very excited about this place when I heard of it.  A place that specializes in gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches?  Delicious.  Unhealthy, but delicious.  I don't know if it completely lived up to my expectations considering the price of the sandwiches, but the sandwich I had was pretty good.  

I got the Feta Tomato.  It sounded delicious and I was so excited about it that I neglected to catch the tapenade part.  While I can enjoy a small amount of olives in my food and love olive oil, I don't particularly care for them. All I could taste in the sandwich were olives. Blech.  Once I got past that, the sandwich was pretty good.  A little small, though (for the price, I was expecting something a little more monstrous maybe).  

I do need to come back here for several reasons.  First, they have this housemade gluten bread that looked tastier than the regular bread. Second, they do their own house sodas and that intrigues me.  Third, I want to try a sandwich that does not taste like olives.  

There's a long line.  I don't know if that's just because it's new or because it's SF, but it took a while.  Moved slowly too.  

Service is good though. They're very friendly in there.  Also, they have cheese puns on display.  I have a thing for cheesy puns.
author: Alea G.

description:
It was fine.  But way overpriced.  And they add money to put a pickle, onion, or tomato on it.  Seriously, no side salad, no chips, no nothing.    Maybe the easiest thing in the world to make at home, purely ingredient driven, and the prices are really just silly.  Go to Little Skillet instead, and actually get some food for your $12.  
Actually no, stay in line here.  LS is busy enough.
author: Kean S.

description:
Grilled cheese for people who don't like grilled cheese:

This should be their slogan.  It's very rare that I go to a restaurant where my cooking is SIGNIFICANTLY better than what I've ordered.

I am a veteran maker of grilled cheese, and trust me, this is not how it is made.  If you like this swill, I am certain that no one has ever made you a good grilled cheese.  I'll be specific here:

(-) The bread was kind of crunchy and strange tasting.  Worst of all, it really seemed to     lack that vital grilled butter flavor.  This is crucial in a good grilled cheese.

(-) The cheese itself was kind of minimal and not melted, lacking that oozy goodness that is the essence of grilled cheese.

(-) Worst of all this crap was expensive!!!  10 bucks for a grilled cheese sandwich, are you kidding me?  A crappy grilled cheese sandwich to boot.

(+) They sell beer (not much of a positive)

THE BOTTOM LINE:

(-) DON'T BELEIVE THE HYPE, save your money and make your own.  If you want to give away your money, donate to charity or something.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Pretty much totally down with this concept, ya know. Sure, the line can be long, but well, like Tiffany C said, that's for a reason. We went there a month or so back (and I'm slackin') and got a lot of talking done in the queue. Because of the fare, the turnaround on tables was quick, except for the chatters and the Gabbersons who resolutely endured the glares of the hungry, wretched masses. 

But finally:
Mousetrap = cheeses, butter grilled sourdough. Perfectamundo. 
Jalapeño Popper = jack jeese and such. Nice.

Milk and cookie happy hour? Sure, why not? 

I heard their offerings won them the Grilled Cheese Invitational 7 years in a row. Is that correct? Could be. Could be that these ingredients came together when the universe began gathering mass upon itself and these are but the accumulations of numminess. What was that? Yes, since the dawn of eternity, Mr Freeman.
author: Roy M.

description:
Finally got over here during lunch...
I checked out the menu beforehand because I am the most indecisive person ever and decided to get the tomato soup & piglet.
Overall it was good. The bread was a little greasy, more than a grilled cheese should be. The sandwich was perfect sized, I couldn't have eaten more. For something I could make at home just as easily I was expecting a WOW factor. The bread pudding was the best part of the meal!
author: Sara P.

description: Whaaaaattt??? I know I've reviewed this place before. Donde esta mi review? Oh well...this place is the bomb. Stoner and workin' gal's lunchtime paradise. I could have that red white and blue place special everyday swapping out all the different sandos but always getting that hearty tomato soup. TOO GOOD!!!
author: Nicole O.

description:
The much hyped new(ish) place to eat lunch in South Park. Long lines, alright fare. Some of the grilled cheeses with moist fillings (the olive tapenade in the Moscone, or the paste in the Mushroom Gruyere) are disappointingly soggy since they've been partially assembled in advance. I understand the need, since the wait would otherwise be unbearable, but there's definitely room for improvement. Also, the grapefruit peppercorn soda is just not working. I wanted it to be good too, but give it up guys.

That said, come early or late to avoid the crowd somewhat, and try the Piglet with a tomato soup. It'll hit the spot.
author: Peter B.

description: Jalapeno popper sandwich was delicious. Got the lunch special with a tomato soup and just pinch of salt and pepper made it amazing.
author: Michael W.

description:
After driving into San Fran from Long Beach, we were ready for lunch! We heard great things about the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen (South Park) and thought we'd give it a try! And as expected, we had a good experience.

Highlights:
1) The Cheesy PUNS on the wall
2) The outdoor seating area (specifically when the weather is beautiful as it was today)
3) The use of Spatula's for door handles 
4) The Grilled Cheese sandwiches (The Mousetrap and the Piglet)

I ordered the half sandwich and soup/salad deal. The half sandwich actually came as a whole sandwich on small size pieces of bread (but it was enough to feel me up). I should have ordered the tomato bisque soup. I went with the small salad which wasn't that interesting (that's what I get for trying to cut down on the calories). Should have gone with my gut...who doesn't love grilled cheese and tomato soup. Great childhood memories!

Thankfully we got a late lunch and the crowd had already been through. 

I'd come back to eat!
author: Kimberly G.

description: Great grilled cheeses. I just wish they had more than 2 vegetarian options. The seating here is casual & limited. The menu is basic. The service is quick.
author: Mihir M.

description:
If you are going to open a place that serves grilled cheese in SF you've got two options: (1) Make a classic grilled cheese so good that it makes me want to call my mother and ask her why the grilled cheese she made me as a child were so bland or (2) make a plethora of unique grilled cheese sandwiches that make think that the person that realized that calamari in a grilled cheese sandwich tasted amazing should be given a Nobel prize.

This place went with option #1, but missed the mark.  I ordered the Moscone and a butternut squash soup.  The soup was so salty I couldn't finish it.  The sandwich was greasy and gooey, but again way too salty. If you mix olive tapenade (salty) with pesto (salty) with cheese (salty) and buttered bread (salty) all you can taste is salt. 

I'm giving this place three stars for now because they were super fast producing my sandwich (with Unique Eats from the cooking channel filming them no less), everyone there was super nice and I've heard some of their other sandwiches are tastier.  I'll probably be back to try another sandwich, since I'm in the area on the weekends.  Hopefully the mushroom or jalapeno grilled cheese won't let me down.
author: Lara O.

description: Great lunch spot, I just wished they had more space inside to sit. We ate on the patio and it was a wee bit chilly since they had no area heaters. Lunch was very good.
author: Barbara G.

description: Yes, Its always crowded. It has got a variety of cheese sandwiches, soups and Lemonades. My favorite here is the Mushroom gruyere. This place comes as my first option, whenever I think of going out for Lunch! Some days you find a seat to sit and eat here, other days you won't. Whenever you go, you have to wait for few minutes while you order and get your food.  I have heard that this place is good for breakfast too. Haven't tried it yet! Don't miss to read the board that is full of cheese puns on the top of the kitchen :)
author: Pradheap B.

description: So a few of my friends took me here yesterday after a long long out :)     You can not go wrong with grilled cheese and a hang over.  I am kind of a grilled cheese freak coming from Germany,  we love our cheese!   The food was nice, served hot!  I liiked that they had outside seating,   Soma always seems to be warm enough,  plus the walking street and park are very cute if you want to take a stroll.  Will def be coming back for lunch.
author: Henritte H.

description:
I had been waiting for a long time for TAGCK to finally be open on the weekends so I could stop by, and now they are!!

My friends and I shared our sandwiches so we could get a taste of everything. They all were great. The cheese was melty, the meats were salty, and the mushrooms were earthy. I wish there was a place like TAGCK down the Peninsula!
author: Emily M.

description:
Went here for lunch today on a recommendation. This is a place with a lot of potential given its somewhat unique premise, but questionable execution.

Obviously it's in a cool neighborhood, but that means parking is non-existent. The design of the shop is extremely hip which means that it was full of hipsters, who can be entertaining to people-watch in their near uniformity of fashion, but are also slightly annoying. And finally, the prices: $9 for a glorified grilled cheese sandwich?

Well, the sandwiches aren't bad. I had the Jalapeno Popper (really? that's the best name they could come up with?) because it combined several ingredients I love: bacon, cheese, peppers, and bread. Oddly though, they've also included peaches to the mix, which as far as I can tell, take the flavor in a bizarre direction. I was able to get a bite without any peach, and it was fantastic! Salty, cheesy, spiciness!

I'll probably give this place one more try and check out the Jalapeno Popper sans peaches.

In any case, it's at least worth a look.
author: Stephen R.

description: Their mushroom gruyere sandwich...wow! Delicious! The wild mushroom in there represents a meaty texture, so it is good for vegetarians! We also ordered their seasonal soup which was Jamaican Spicy Spinach. It is so good! This was the BEST grilled cheese sandwich I've had and it comes with a cute small apple! :)
author: Lizzie C.

description: Finally got a chance to visit this lil restaurant that packs a lot of cheese! The fiancee and I shared a foghorn leghorn and the Mushroom gruyere....both fantastic and they were perfect gourmet grilled cheese! A bit on the pricier side but not too bad for such yummy cheese and ingredients. Two strawberries were put into my lil sandwich basket and they were so sweet. I enjoyed that. Also 10% off for Academy of Art students and staff! yay!
author: Lynn C.

description: Mac and cheese, jalapenos, bacon? Oh, and add a tomato soup with homemade croutons? YES PLEASE! D-LISH!!!!
author: Jorge H.

description: Great place to get a non-traditional grilled cheese sammie. We came here after we did a JP Morgan run. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was perfect, nice and relaxing, and homey.
author: Leslie B.

description: Came up from the peninsula to meet a friend from Sonoma for lunch and wanted to try this place out. It was fabulous! Rainy day but I got there early enough to get a couple of the 20 or so available indoor stools and we were there for almost two hours.  Staff was so friendly and accommodating - they seemed happy to be working! And the food was outstanding. So much fun to have all kinds of choices for a sandwich.  Soup was delicious and I took home some of their Mac n cheese for my teenage boys at home- delicious. Will definitely go back to try more grilled cheeses and will recommend to anyone looking for a great casual and fun lunch spot !
author: Carolyn M.

description: WAY BETTER THAN THE GRILL! In almost every way. But, again with my biggest complaint about food in SoMa, it is so damned expensive! A cup of soup and a sandwich is $14?! Are you kidding me?! Who can afford this?  Not me, at least not every day. That said, the food was super good. The sandwich was decently big and cooked perfectly. The ham was moist and not overcooked and the cheese was melted, but not drippy. The tomato soup was also very flavorful and perfect for dipping. If you're able to blow $15 on lunch, you won't be disappointed here.
author: Lance H.

description:
What happened?! I have a theory, and it's the new store opening in the Mission.

Went today, per the us., and took a coworker from out-of-state who now craves this place when he knows he's coming to the SF office. 'Cause it's where I take people, guys. I have standards. Butttt...

First off, I didn't recognize half the people working... then it took not the usual 10-15 minutes to get your food after ordering, but 30 full minutes. I swear I counted down every one after 20 minutes, in my head...

THEN when we finally got our food, my usual blue and red plate special of sandwich and salad sucked in comparison. They've changed the bread! The good bread--- gone! Mine was weird and flat and bland and heyyy, made the whole thing taste like something I could have made at home. Which is not why I come here.

I asked the skinny bearded guy who is always there about the bread and I got this very apathetic: "Yeah, sometimes we swap that out for that sandwich... if you tell them when ordering they'll make sure you get the other kind..." No apologies. Nada. Yet, I've never seen it before.

Meanwhile, the guy to the right of us had complained about how long he waited for his sandwich and he got an offer of free stuff and a rushed sandwich. We didn't complain and still get bad service. Not a free offer of a refill for lemonade, for our long wait, then subpar bread experience, nothing.

Grilled Cheese Kitchen, I've been loving you for one and half glorious years. But I think I'm going to stay away while you get your sh*t worked out. 

Keep subbing in crap bread, and I probably won't be back. Had no idea how much I loved the regular stuff 'til it was gone. It was Melt quality. (ie: not much 'quality' at all)

Please get it together! Love, someone who loves the old you.
author: Kerry D.

description:
crazy friendly staff and fast service! i recommend splitting up your party - one or two people go grab a table outside while the others wait in line and just order for you. i was lucky and didn't have to deal with a crowd because i came here around 10:45, but by 11:30 it was getting to be quite busy. 

i recommend the mouse trap (i added some roasted tomato to mine) or the mushroom gruyere (but only if you like mushrooms, because the flavor hits you even before you take a bite). the bread they make their sandwiches on is amazing and i wouldnt mind just having a slice on its own to dip into some tomato soup. speaking of, if you're really looking to heighten your grilled cheese experience, get the tomato soup for some serious dipping/dunking! i wouldnt recommend the soup on its own though.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Skip the lines and save some cash by going in early for one of their yummy breakfast grilled cheese sandwiches (each around 5 bucks). My favorite is the breakfast veggie sandwich which includes cheddar, jack, egg, roasted tomatoes, caramelized onions, and bell peppers. If you're in the mood for something a bit lighter, try one of their fresh baked muffins or a delicious cup of oatmeal. Pair that with a cup of De La Paz coffee and you're set for the day!
author: Amanda D.

description: Ehh, the sandwiches were just ok. I wouldn't say they're so amazing as others have said. Maybe I don't like grilled cheese sandwiches as much as I thought. I may give it another shot the next time I visit SF.
author: Ron B.

description:
Ok, so...if you're looking for "the best" grilled cheese you'll ever eat, then you probably won't flip your lid over this spot. But if you're one of the many worker bees in the SoMa/South Park area, and you like a reasonably priced, decently sized, and very palatable grilled cheese - then you're in luck. 

For the volume of business these folks do, they kick the crap out of other local eateries (like the Creamery - YUCK!). The quality of food is overall pretty good, and the sammitches, are quite tasty overall. 

Yes, as others have mentioned...they're a little on the salty side, but HELLO - any time you butter up bread to grill it, that's gonna happen...especially when you add cheese(s) to the mix. 

And yes, sometimes the sammies are on the crispy side, but, some of us really LIKE a crispy grilled cheese sammitch, so it works. Oh yes, it works. 

On top of that, the staff is pretty friendly and helpful, and they get your order out to you pretty damn fast considering the length of the typical line there. 

Bonus points to the cashier Jen (or was that Gen?) who engaged me in conversation about my favorite punk band, Bad Brains. that just may have helped sway my review from a 3 star to a 4 star.  ;)
author: Marco M.

description:
When I heard that there was an entire restaurant dedicated to gourmet grilled cheese, I literally changed my lunch plans and made a beeline to their door. On my walk, I was already planning my *cheesy* puns that might make it into my Yelp review, only to find while reading the Yelp review that everyone else had that idea before me and the place itself has a very entertaining board of customer submitted jokes reading things like, "Havarti going to feed all these people?!" A place with a pun board is likely a place for me...

The line was intensely long but moved pretty fast. Once we made our way to the register, I jumped on the jalapeño popper bandwagon, much to the pleasure of my taste buds. Chèvre and monterey jack cheeses melt together in perfect harmony around thick, juicy slices of applewood-smoked bacon topped with a gooey, deliciously tangy-but-not-overly-spicy, apricot-jalapeño relish, all squished delightfully between two slices of buttery toast. Everything about that sandwich was a win.

My three guests and I received our orders in about 10 minutes but decided to enjoy it picnic-style on the playground of a nearby park since literally every table in the place was full. As I have said before, I take every seat being full as a sign of good things to come which was absolutely the case here. Plus, it was a gorgeous day full of sun and warmth and who wants to stay inside for that?

OH! And I almost forgot. They make delicious sodas! I enjoyed a hibiscus flavor to the fullest!
author: Kay T.

description: Once you get over you are paying this much for a grilled cheese, you realize it's great.  Always sasified after a session here!
author: Robin S.

description:
Just had lunch with my boyfriend here for the first time- It was Amazing!!! loved the jalapeno popper sandwhich-
Can't wait to go back !!!
author: ryan H.

description:
I like this place for lunch, though it's a little hipstery and expensive.  

But it's good.
author: G.E. R.

description: I came here around 11:30am right before the lunch rush. I ordered the Jalapeno Popper grilled cheese sandwich. The total came out to be $9 and some change. It took about 10 minutes for my meal to come out. The sandwich came with a fresh red apple. The sandwich was not as spicy as I thought it would be...the crust was a bit hard..
author: Christopher L.

description: Not your grilled cheese from your childhood. This place serves up a grilled cheese for adults!  You can get the regular american grilled cheese, but one of my favorites is the jalopeno popper - it's got a kick and some bacon too. If you're not feeling the traditional grilled cheese - you can get a turkey club which is just as good too. I'd recommend grabbing half a sandwich, small salad and soda and just sitting outside on a sunny day to enjoy the weather.
author: Christine B.

description:
One star for decent service on Memorial Day
One star for gluten free bread (Be still, my auto-immune diseased heart!)
One star for giving me a mandarin with my sammy
 
Full disclosure- I'm a spoiled brat. The Midwest has tainted my tastes in regards to grilled cheese. I want to give the American another star, I really do! But as a born and bred Clevelander who witnessed the rise of Melt Bar and Grilled from fledgling local hangout to Food Network fame, my expectations for a grilled cheese restaurant are just too high.

I love that American GC Kitchen has gluten free bread and the Popper was yummy, no real complaints. Would I wait two hours for it though? No. Hell, the twenty five minute wait was barely worth it. But I would wait two hours for a sandwich from the Midwest's Sandwich Mecca and I would laugh in the face of Celiac disease to grab a spot in line and eat a sandwich at Melt any day- that's how good they are. 

Unfortunately I can't say the same for American... yet. I will be back in a few months though to see what they've come up with.
author: Debbie B.

description:
A place that serves primarily grilled cheese....AND offers gluten free bread - sign me up! 

I had the Piglet...and was on the phone with a friend when I ordered it, interesting conversation - you're having something for lunch named the Piglet? Ok. The ham was amazing - and the flavor mix was quite tasty, an apple mustard and something with rosemary. 

The GF bread was tasty - I was impressed that they could make it taste that good. Normally it tastes like paper. :)
author: Lauren F.

description:
Got here around 11:30 a.m. after voting and there were no lines so I decided to take advantage.  I had the Red White and Blue plate special with the smoky tomato soup and Mousetrap sandwich.  They were both very good, although I'll admit I thought the soup would be thicker.  It did taste very "fresh" - as though they had made it from fresh tomatoes that morning.

I thought the sandwich was decadent enough so I didn't try the sodas or dessert.
author: B. Y.

description: used to be a 3 star place, then i came back recently so it gets upgraded by 1. I remember when i used to work nearby and had to wait for days. i'm like, c'mon it's grilled cheese how long should it take. so on a weekend, i decided to swing by since i knew the south park area would be dead, i gave it another go. i got a breakfast sandwich and side of a cheese biscuit. the service was quick and the cashier was cool.
author: John B.

description:
Let me just say that the food here is really good. I really enjoyed the  Jalapeño Popper which was delicious. The Mushroom Gruyère was pretty good and the moustrap was just okay. At a place like this you want to try the more flavorful sandwiches. I know it's just a grilled cheese, but the mixture of higher-end ingredients was a delightful carousel of flavor.  The down side is that they are a bit on the greasy side.  

My other main issue with this place is the long line and lack of space. If you were to come here at lunch, the line is a bit long. You may not be able to get back in time for the end of your lunch break or may not find a place to sit. If you can't find a place to sit, there is a park around the corner with a bench.
author: Vincent R.

description:
Came here on my day off with Tracy Y. We both LOVEEEEEE grilled cheese sandwich, so decided to drive out here for some grilled cheese. 

I decided on the red, white, and blue plate special and I had the soup  instead of the salad as my side. 

I wanted to try the Jalapeno Popper but was a bit worried it would be too spicy for me even though I can eat spicy. Didn't want to risk, so settled with the Mushroom Gruyere - very good but I do wish it was a bit bigger, just a bit. I felt like I could had ate another sandwich =/. 

My friend, Tracy ordered the Moscone and wow the basil-lavender pesto was sooooo good. I wonder if they made that themselves or they got the spread somewhere because I would want that in my fridge!
author: Willa L.

description: Amazing! Being a lactard, I felt  about as sacrilegious walking in here like a Methodist in a synagogue, but I ordered the turkey sans cheese and tomato soup on a rainy and blah day. Everyone was super nice, I didn't wait in line longer than 10 minutes even on a busy lunch hour rush, and it was one of the best turkey sandwiches I've ever had.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Oh man,  I'm in between three and four, and opted for three for now.  That said, I've only been here once, and I'm really interested to go again, but it hasn't happened so that's another sign for me.

That said, the bacon and jalapeno grilled cheese was delicious.  It really just melted in my mouth like a stick of butter, which is probably close to what I consumed.  I'm dying to try something else, but that sandwich was quite satisfying that I would be happy to have it again.

The idea is amazing, why hasn't anyone opened a grilled cheese restaurant?  Who doesn't like grilled cheese?  AND, the place is adorable, love the wall decorations.

So why three?  For what it is, I think it's overpriced.  I got a sandwich and iced tea for lunch which came to $13-14.  A little steep, especially since it's a walk up counter and a nestablishment that leans towards take out.
author: Laura H.

description: We work down the street. We chow down here every morning as we think the breakfast grilled cheese, biscuits, and muffins are the most superior food you can get for the money in the area.
author: Brandon P.

description:
A WHOLE restaurant dedicated to grilled cheese?! Hell yeah! I read about this place months ago, but wasn't able to try it out until today. 

First off, this isn't your ordinary homemade grilled cheese sandwich...oh no, this is gourmet with a capital G!  I tried their red, white and blue (half a sammy with soup or tomato salad) with the mushroom gruyere sandwich and it was a lot more food than I expected. It was extremely tasty and satisfying.

So here's what to expect: This is an order first, and sit down after kind of place that's pretty casual. You can't go wrong with the red white and blue - it's plenty of food. You get a good size sandwich and an ample serving of soup in a square bowl with homemade croutons on the side for the prize of one large sandwich. The tomato soup is a little smoky and served at a great warm (not scalding hot) temperature so you can dig right in. The location is a little out of the way, but FYI - the number 10 line does pass right by.

I'm looking forward to going back and trying the rest of the menu, though it will be hard not to order the mushroom gruyere again...
author: Ixchel F.

description: Let me start off by saying that the sandwiches and other food is very good. However, I have never experienced such unprofessionalism in a restaurant setting like I did at this place. When I approached the register to order, I began to ask the "hostess" or "waitress" what she would recommend and if she could tell me what her favorite item on the menu is. She explained to me that their sandwiches are too cheesy and that their macaroni and cheese has too much fat. Not only was I shocked to hear her comments, but I was so turned off that I simply ordered the most basic item on the menu: a grilled cheese. Nothing more. Nothing less. I would only recommend this place if you are in the area for a baseball game or something, don't go out of your way like I did.
author: Brandon R.

description: all i can say is that this was the best grilled cheese  i have ever tasted. the tomato soup is very delicious as well. it comes with an apple and the grill cheese.
author: Charlie M.

description:
What can I say, this place is pretty much straight forward.
I got the mushroom gruyere sandwich. Oh my god! This thing was amazing!!! Gruyere and fontina cheese, mushrooms, and roasted garlic on sourdough. I also got the tomato soup with cream fraiche and croutons. This on the other hand was mediocre, the soup wasn't creamy and not very well seasoned. The sandwich though was so good I am willing to over look this! Overall this place is good! Will for sure go back!
author: Jeremy M.

description:
I remember the days when a grilled cheese sandwich was defined as a Kraft single sandwiched toasted between two pieces of bread.  The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen takes grilled cheese sandwiches up to the next level.  I ordered the Jalapeno Popper and the Club Turkey last week and while i enjoyed the spicy one, I felt the club turkey fell a little short of my expectations.  Starting with the Jalapeno Popper, if you like a bit of heat in your sandwich, this is an excellent choice as the relish spread gives it just enough fire without causing you to search for a bottle of water.  Jalapeno spread + bacon + cheese = happy customer.  The Club Turkey, on the other hand, while it sounds delicious from the ingredients, was ultimately not that much impressive from any other club turkey at any other sandwich shop.  Sure, it has better cheese, but in my opinion, the rest of the sandwich just fell short of pedestal level recognition.

That being said, I would definitely come back here for lunch as this is true comfort food with a gourmet twist at about $9 bucks a sandwich.
author: Jason M.

description:
I didn't mind the portion, or even the price. But my "grilled cheese" Wild Turkey sandwich fell short of expectations. 

Let me start by saying, the most important element of a grilled cheese sandwich is the cheese. Unfortunately, there was hardly any cheese on my sandwich and it didn't even get cooked all the way through. The bread seemed to be grilled a little too quickly (or maybe its just the type of bread) and was very tough to bite through. The chili jam and arugula were nice touches -- but I just didn't feel like I was eating a grilled cheese sandwich because I was missing the oozing, melted cheese!

So why even give this place 3 stars? Because I'd come back to get the mousetrap simply adorned with fresh tomato (summer only, I guess). Those sandwiches looked like cheesy goodness. 3 stars isn't bad -- just shows there is room for improvement!
author: Katelyn M.

description:
This place gets two thumbs up for serving up gooey cheese between yummy slices of bread slathered in butter on a grill....drool!  Yes, the sandwich may be kinda pricey, but really...how often do I make grilled cheeses at home?  Nearly never.  And surely not with the array of cheeses and toppings available here, and not with the crispy goodness that is characteristic of generous buttering.

butter...cheese...butter...cheese...yum!~

so anyhoo...grilled cheese turn out to be awesome with other toppings, including olive tapenade, mushrooms and the like.

the smoky tomato soup was okay, but the sandwiches are really the centerpiece!
author: Fontane L.

description:
I finally made it to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen and must say, there is nothing like a buttery ooey gooey grilled cheese sandwich to improve your day! Unless you can add bacon....but you can here! 

I ordered the mousetrap with bacon and the tomato soup....the sandwich is what their named for and the sandwich was the star of this Red, White, and Blue plate special. 

I took away one star because there was a little bit of a mix-up in bringing out our food and we had to wait longer....the upside? I got a bigger sandwich full of cheesy goodness! 

I was hoping for a more extensive menu, but I think that in time that will come....or at least more options for build your own!

Definitely worth the speed walk from my Fi-Di office!
author: Alisa S.

description:
We got here around 1:30ish, so there wasn't really much of a wait at all. Very friendly and helpful staff.

I opted for the mushroom guyere, a bit heavy, but still tasty, but not something I would tell my friends about. I liked how the mushrooms were chopped to small pieces. The cheese was good and I enjoyed the crispy, buttered bread. Next time I will try something with meat and get the soup instead. I feel it'll make the meal a bit lighter.
author: Beverly T.

description: It was pointed out to me by a friend that in fact, there is a combo soup + sandwich item on the menu. I simply didn't read far enough down to see it. Oops! The five star review stands, in any case.
author: Clark M.

description: Very very good cheese melt. They always give fruits. And did I mention the staffs are awesome? I love this place
author: Suabot J.

description: I admit- I was a skeptic.  A place that only does grill cheese sandwiches.  Hasn't the fancifying of comfort foods gone too far already?  Apparently not, as I love this place.  Great bread.  The combinations of veggies/meats/cheeses are great.  And everything is grilled to perfection.  Their tomato soup makes me melt.  And if you are able to get their in the morning you can order a grilled cheese sandwich with an egg on it, and as far as I am concerned breakfast cannot get much better than cheesy, grilled, egg goodness.
author: Tia B.

description: I have always been skeptical of grilled cheese sandwiches especially when they are expensive and they don't have meat in them.  But I was definitely surprised at the quality and the flavor combos here.  The sandwiches were perfectly grilled and the meats were good!
author: Marie S.

description:
It really depresses me to give The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen only 3 stars. I was really expecting better. I mean -- a kitchen that serves grilled cheese sand-ys like the Moscone, Piglet, and Mushroom Gruyère? Maybe my expectations were just too high.

I've been here twice -- first time I ordered the Mushroom Gruyère and unfortunately had to get the Red White & Blue Plate Special since the full sandwich was sold out. The flavors were so-so -- not a stand out, and the sandwich was pretty much burnt to a crisp.

Second time, I ordered the Jalapeno Popper. This one was much better and I loved the addition of the sweet/spicy apricot-jalapeño relish. This time around the sandwich was much better than the first. In all honesty, both times didn't really blow my skirt up. I'm definitely glad I tried it, but will I go back? Probably not.
author: Ashley H.

description: It was good I loved the look and feel. My sandwhich was awsome but my wifes didn't taste as good
author: Thomas P.

description:
It's true - the sandwiches are pretty darn tasty.  The sweet relish they added to my turkey w/havarti basically made the sandwich and added the right level of sweetness to really balance out the sandwich.  And the sweet bread pudding is nothing to joke about - it comes out steamin' and is good hot or cold.

I'm only giving this three stars because although the food was good, I don't know if this is a "must-do", especially if the line is long.  We couldn't make it in an inch on our first try and only got through a second time by heading over pretty early.  I think the lines have overall died down a bit but I'm still reticent to make this a must-visit.
author: Melinda C.

description:
I met a former collegue for lunch here and left very unimpressed.  The grilled cheese was almost inedible: "creamy" doesn't describe the cheese, it was more like a liquidy goo, the bread was way too thick and made it difficult to eat the sandwich, and worst of all, the bread was somehow made into an abrasive substance that left the roof of my mouth feeling like I had just eaten a too-hot pizza.

The seating situation was also not great, but I wouldn't even come here for a to-go order.

I don't get how you could mess up something so simple and good, but I guess it appeals to the twenty-somethings that work nearby.

And thus continues the trend that almost any trendy SF restaurant can get 4 stars on Yelp.
author: Daniel Q.

description: Made the trip to SF soo worth it!! I am usually not a fan of tomatoe soup but that was even just above expectations. I had the Mac&Cheese grilled cheese sandwhich, there is nothing in this world like it. I would drive 5 hours just to go back for lunch at this place, love the sourdough bread:)
author: Loriana S.

description: This place is still awesome a year later. It does get busy but if you order online ahead of time you can walk straight up to the counter and pick up. Extra points for never getting our order wrong once in the last year (ordering for an office of 8 probably at least 10 times). Just tried the tomato soup for the first time and I am a fan (though not a fan of classic tomato soup so take that as you will).
author: Kiely H.

description: This is right on my way to work so I stop by here at least a couple times a week to grab a delicious cup of coffee and a muffin or oatmeal. I've tried their grilled cheese once for lunch. I believe it was a pesto grilled cheese sandwich special the day I went. It was unbelievable! They take a simple  grilled cheese to another level. The people here are really friendly too. Love coming here.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Went here recently and loved it! Got the Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese which was delicious, the mac n cheese was the perfect texture and the bread was grilled and buttery.  I also had the tomato soup which was a perfect compliment. The staff was great and friendly, didn't get mad when I changed my order last minute. I will definitely be going back!
author: Margit H.

description:
I keep forgetting to review this place! I finally made it here in September and it was fantastic! Thick, crunchy bread and the whole thing actually filled me up! Super greasy, but what else do you expect from grilled cheese? It was a warm day (typical SF summer) so I didn't get any soup, but can't wait to return next time I am in the city and it's cold!

A bit pricey, but totally worth it.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Pros of going at 10AM on a Sunday:
1) Plenty of free parking - no looking behind your shoulder for those nasty meter maids busting you for being 2 minutes over the time limit.  Hell, if you like your car that much and want to look at it while you enjoy your breakfast sandwich, there are a few spots on S Park that are never occupied on Sunday
2) No line - you walk right in, place your order with the slightly emo girl at the cash register and wait another 10 minutes for the sandwich to be ready
3) Tons of outdoor seating - take your pick as you don't have to sit on "that table" that nobody wants because it's the spot with the most concentrated UV rays
4) Farmers' Breakfast was the AGCK's cheeky take of breakfast burrito: applewood-smoked bacon, egg, roasted potatoes and cheddar between two slices of toasted wheat bread 

Cons of going at 10AM on a Sunday:
1) No Jalapeno Popper cheese melts and smoky tomato soup - or as the slightly emo girl at the cash register pointed out, nothing else but the breakfast menu until noon... b o o . . . . .
2) Coffee was slightly weak and lukewarm.  But I need my coffee if I were to function before noon on a Sunday.

Service was prompt, albeit slightly unfriendly.
author: Ange L.

description:
YUM! I am not normally an eater of bread or cheese, but we wanted to see what the buzz was all about. I had the red white and blue plate, with the gluten free bread on the Mushroom Gruyère and smoky tomato soup (I suggest they make the soup gluten-free, too - or at least the croutons.). My husband had the Jalapeño Popper. We both devoured our pickles, which are handmade on site. I also had a black coffee, which was good, and I liked the easily identifiable cream or soy containers. Lunch was delicious and satisfying.

The place was very busy 15 minutes before closing on a beautiful Saturday afternoon, but we found seats at the counter and chatted up the Facebook employees next to us. Our food arrived timely. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Absinthia V.

description: I really enjoyed this joint although it was pretty busy during the lunch hour and limited seating.  Not much to say except that they really know how to make a grilled cheese sandwich.  You wouldn't think there is much an art to this, but they figured it out and made it happen.  I would go again.
author: Matt J.

description:
I had a hard time believing there was a restaurant dedicated to something as simple as grilled cheese sandwiches. The only thing more ridiculous would be a macaroni-and-cheese-only restaurant.

Actually, that would be a really GREAT idea. Hmm.... *strokes evil kitty thoughtfully*

But before I proceed with my plan to take over the world with MacAndCheeseByTimmay restaurants, I'll talk about this place.

I wasn't sure whether to get the jalapeno popper or the club turkey. I went with the club one. Not a bad sandwich. Good flavor and pretty good size. And of course, an abundance of cheese. Mmm...but that's good. Oh, and they use compostable utensils and cups. That's always a good thing.

The problem? Well, there isn't a one, per se. But when you have a restaurant with such a very specialized menu, I think that you have to sample 3 or 4 items from their menu in order to know for sure whether it's really good, or just OK. For now, it gets 3 stars. After I hit up the jalapeno popper thing, that mushroom gruyere, and perhaps the mousetrap, I might bump this place up a star. I'd rather increase a rating than have to knock a place down a notch.

Note: seating is extremely limited. Either get there before 11:40, or plan on getting your order to go. 

Unless, of course, you want to be one of those people who glares at everyone currently seated, screaming "LEAVE!!!" with your eyes. But if you do that to me, I'll eat really. really. REALLY. slowly.
author: Tim B.

description:
Call me plain Jane but I was looking forward to having a regular grilled cheese sandwich when I went to TAGCK. Unfortunately, they didn't have a simple Grilled Cheese 'wich on their menu. The choices, IMO, was elaborate and too fancy for my plane Jane taste but being that I was already there, I ordered a Grilled Cheese w/ham (fancy ham).

I found the sandwich to be really too greasy. It's a pretty good portion and so I was only able to finish 1/2 of my sandwich but I think the greasiness was also the cause of my not wanting to finish it. Would I go back? Maybe....
author: Soozie H.

description: Above average basic grill cheese. Pretty tasty. I'd definitely recommend dropping by and trying out a sandwich to any friend (real or yelp) of mine.
author: Isaac R.

description: We went there for breakfast and I had a classic breakfast, sharp cheddar, jack, with a cage-free egg. I was really wanting to try their Mac and Cheese Grilled Cheese but they weren't serving lunch yet. I loved their OJ there, I think it might of been fresh squeezed.. It tasted that way. Great place to get a bite before the game. I will definitely be back.. for lunch next time.
author: Jackie Z.

description: The Mushroom Gruyere was absolutely outstanding.  The Jalepenos Mac and Cheese was average.  Too much Jalepenos and not enough cheese.  The best part was that I won a cookie for coming up with a cheese pun for their chalk board that they hadn't heard before: "Reading these cheese puns is de-grating." Win!
author: Eric L.

description:
All I have to say is DAAAAAAMN!!!

Who thought a grilled cheese sandwich could be so good? Maybe it's like in the movie Ratatoulle, where it's some sort of food that reminds you of your childhood, but made in a new way, and just brings pleasure to your tastebuds.

I've been here a few times, and my favorite is the jalapeno popper sandwich. It's nice that they give you a piece of fruit instead of chips. I've gotten strawberries and a clementine. The soda here was good too...the lemonade was too sour for me.

What I really like to do here is to order the tomato soup and dip my sandwich into it!

You have to get here before noon in order to escape the long line. Or you can come really late, after the lunch hour. This place is pricey for grilled sandwiches, but these sandwiches are soooo damnnnnn goooood!
author: Louis N.

description:
I was not blown away but it was tasty.

I ordered the Mouse Trap with tomato and the Tomato Soup. Everything tasted great and I did not have any issues with the service. The prices are quite high for what you are getting, $12.50 for the soup and sandwich combo and an orange juice. I personally am a HUGE fan of cheese and was expecting the sandwich to be much cheesier. 

Lunch time brings in a long line so make sure you are prepared to wait, you wont be disappointed!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Even before this place officially opened, it was setup for success. Why? Because of the name. 

See, if I opened a place called "Bacon Bar", the line would be full of folks waiting to try my Double BLT, my Bacon Donuts, etc. (If I see someone open this place up I WILL sue... or just request a lifetime of free meals.)

Dreams aside, I finally tried this place on a quite chilly and cloudy day. Comfort food, yum. 

I ordered the Red, White and Blue Plate special to get an overall sampling - Piglet Sandwich with a cup of tomato soup. Overall, it was pretty satisfying, but maybe I'm just a purist for the cheap stuff. The tomato soup was a bit watery and the sandwich was good, but it did not bring back any warm childhood memories(it's the only way to judge comfort food). Probably because it was a bit greasy with not much flavor.

By the way, if the line is too long and you want a simple grilled cheese and tomato soup combo, check out Paragon down the street. Very delicious and more bang for your buck in my opinion.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Wanted to amend this review because I tried their breakfast sandwiches and they are awesome.  Simple, delicious, the perfect start to a day.  Also went back for lunch and they may have improved their sandwiches, which I found tastier than the first time around.  Still won't wait in a 30 minute line to go here what with all of the other great options in the 'hood, but I will go back (mostly for breakfast).
author: Saloni D.

description:
So I have to give this place props, because the owner Nate P. sent me a message and apologized for my previous experience.  Now mind you I swear I wasn't trying to be overly negative in my last one.  However for the actual owner to reach out is a pretty cool gesture in my book.

So here I was again today, alone during my lunch hour and wanting to get something to bring back to my office and munch on.  So I thought, hey why not try another grilled cheese?  First of all the line issue is all but gone thanks to a second register now open.  Then I decided on the Mushroom Gruyere this time and man was it good!  The smell hits you first thanks to the melted leeks.  And the white fontina/gruyere melts just as good as the Mousetrap I had the first time, if not better (melted cheddar can tend to get oily but not so with these cheeses).

The other issue I had at first was the overly grilled/crusty bread but this time it was softer....just the way I make at home.  Call me crazy but I'd like not to get bleeding gums from a sandwich.  Nice work cooks!

I just wish I had gotten some of the savory bread pudding on the side (with bacon, mmmmm bacon).
author: Kevin B.

description: Still really good, but when I first went and rated it 5 stars the hype was getting to me. I am still in love with a good grilled cheese, but do I need to pay so much for it? Not really. I do understand why though- there are delicious high quality ingredients used, but still only for special occasions. This time I ordered the Turkey Club w/ their Gluten Free bread. The bread was so rich itself, it took up some room in my tummy. They should maybe consider using a tastier/lighter GF bread like Udis since their ingredients are so rich. I also enjoyed the orange they served my sandwich with! Oddly enough they don't serve both ppl's dishes at the same time, so I got mine quickly and my friend didn't get his for awhile, which can make  it a little awkward. Still love this place and want to try more of their food...oh and their breakfast- need to try that soon!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I visited this restaurant few months ago and tried:
Mac n Cheese Grilled Cheese - a little too cheesy for me, but still enjoyed it quite a bit
Jalapeño Popper - heavenly delicious
author: Payal P.

description:
I love a place with nice details: I had the 'mousetrap' with tomato soup. IT came with a little strawberry on my plate, and the soup was presented tastefully with that artistic sploosh of garnish on top. The pink lemonade was out of this world, and it came in a 100% compostable cup. Neat! 

My only complaint is that it was pricey. I don't understand why a soup-and-sandwich lunch with a cup of lemonade was $14 plus tip. Ouch, my wallet :'(
author: stephanie v.

description:
i'm "in like" with their grilled cheese sandwiches.

i have a mini-crush on how they serve a little piece of fruit with each sandwich.

i want to give their tomato soup a friendly fist bump.

and i am definitely comforted by all of their renditions of a cozy grilled cheese. 

the moscone is my favorite so far - pesto, fresh mozzarella, fontina, and fresh tomatoes make for a light, but satisfying sandwich. the mushroom gruyere was also delicious, but left me feeling like i had a giant lump in my belly. 

it's familiar, yet intriguing. i would definitely stop by for a hug and a hello. but i don't know if it'll ever change my life.

(side note: ladies, if you sit inside, prepare to walk out smelling like toasted butter on bread for the rest of the day)
author: Diana L.

description:
Go here for breakfast. You get the same size sandwich, no line and a fried egg in for half the price! $4! 

Service is great, and definitely worth a splurge on your diet for the week.
author: San D.

description:
I had a client meeting in San Francisco and my hosts took us here for a quick, casual lunch. It was raining on and off all morning so it was a nice relief to step into the toasty confines of The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. Seating inside is limited so you have to grab a bar or window seat as soon as they open up.

The woman taking orders was friendly and even offered me the combination, which I declined because I was starving and wanted a full size sandwich and soup order of a Don Gondola and Smoky Tomato Soup. Your food is brought to you with a small paper bag of croutons and a small apple. On cold days, a toasty grilled cheese sandwich with hot soup REALLY hits the spot! I agree with the others that the food here is salty, but I can't blame the sandwich since I did order the Don Gondola. The tomato soup would have been just as delicious in a low sodium version, though :).

I also tried their house-made blueberry soda. Next time, I am asking for less ice because it was freezing out and the default amount of ice in all of our cups seemed to be at least half a cup of large ice cubes. Likely nice for a muggy summer day but not during an early winter rainy day.

As a random note, the couple next to us left a messenger bag under their bar stool. We gave it to one of the servers and he told us the person was likely in the restroom. When we explained that the couple had actually left, his reply was, "Oh." Not quite the response we were looking for, but we left the bag with him anyhow. I hope the couple got their messenger bag back!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Ate lunch a few weeks ago with really high hopes, especially considering the 25 minute wait and publicity they've received. Unfortunately all but 3 of their sandwiches had sold out (as well as the brownies) by the time we made it to the front of the line.   It was during their first week of operating though, and I hear this happens less frequently now.  It was helpful that the staff were really friendly; so much so I feel a bit bad giving only 2 stars.

Had the Mushroom Gruyere and Wild Turkey, tomato soup, and the homemade soda.  The Wild Turkey and soda were the highlights.  I also liked that we got clementines with the meal.

Overall, fairly tasty, but ultimately not worth the wait (although I hear the wait is less now as they've improved their operations) and pushing the limit for what I'm willing to pay for a grilled cheese sandwich. However, I drove there specifically to check out the food; it seemed like the other folks there who were there on their lunch break were quite happy with the new addition to the area.
author: John H.

description: Urban fun and design with great grilled cheese sandwiches. If you are looking for a simple and quick meal, this is your place to go. The all cheese sandwich and the ham and cheese are delicious. The tomato soup is amazing, finally a real tomato soup which is not sweet or creamy. All meals come with an apple which is a cute touch to their friendly vibe. I would definitely  eat breakfast here every day if I lived in the city.
author: Anita D.

description: Great place, friendly staff, and great breakfast sandwich. My brother and I stumbled across it last Thursday looking for a breakfast place. We both had the Breakfast Piglet sandwich (sharp cheddar, egg, ham, and apple mustard on sourdough grilled on rosemary butter). Man, it was ridiculously good.  It's a must try. Next time I'm in town for another Giants game, I'll certainly be stopping in again for another meal.
author: Andres E.

description:
This place is Super Delish!

Someone who is Lactose, I have to say, this place is pretty worth it!  A little pricey, but this place is pretty gourmet.  I really do like the way they make the sandwiches, nice + crispy!

It's bad that I work 3 blocks away, but my temptations are strong, or I would be there more often and 15lbs heavier.......

:)
author: Alvin M.

description:
Walked here for lunch today with a friend and thankfully, it was warmer in SF than anticipated.  Got there at 12:30 to find that we didn't have to wait in these crazy lines people have been yelping about!  Ordered and got our food within 5 min.

We split the mushroom Gruyere and Mousetrap with tomato.  We ate these outside so by the time we bit into the second half of our sandwiches, the cheese had already lost it's gooey goodness.
Both were great but I am a traditionalist so the mousetrap gets my vote.  Best of all was the giant blondie that we split for dessert.  YUMMERS.
author: Kim K.

description:
No, it's not cheap for grilled cheese, it's not exactly healthy and maybe you could try to make it at home--but really, would you? 

We ate what I can only describe as a Tasty Lunch Time Treat. I felt like a big kid. AGCK makes it okay to have grilled cheese for lunch. After all, it's gourmet and there are a ton of other professionals eating there, damn it. And really, this ain't your mama's grilled cheese. To top it off, among a super bustling lunch hour crowd, one of the prep people (an owner?) took the time to visit tables and actually tell us, "Welcome, we're glad you stopped in." Small town charm, big town taste.

We ordered and adored the. . . 
* Mushroom Gruyère: fontina, gruyère, roasted wild mushrooms + gold potatoes, melted leeks, caramelized onions, thyme butter $9
* Jalapeño Popper: chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish $9

*Small note: At the risk of sounding super-picky, I would've appreciated a crustless version of the sandwiches. The bread can get a bit sharp when toasted. . .
author: Savannah L.

description: I love the idea of a restaurant built around such a simple idea. They definitely have some fun, interesting versions of grilled cheese, but we kept it pretty simple- the mousetrap and the piglet with tomato soup. Food was excellent, great location very close to the ball park.
author: Ashley F.

description:
we came here on a cold saturday afternoon and sat out on the patio for a quick lunch.  they forgot our soup but brought it out after.  the smoky tomato soup isnt really smoky.  so not sure why they call it smoky.  the consistency is thin and not as creamy as other tomato bisques but it seems healthier?  the flavor just tastes like watered down tomato paste though  hahah so i guess its actually not that good at all now that i think about it.  it comes with croutons.

the grilled cheese sandwiches come with apples not sure why.  i had the mushroom gruyere and it was good.  the mushrooms always surprise me with how meaty they can taste.  bf had the turkey blt.  i think it had a bit too much going on but at the same time lacking something.  i guess it was a lackluster sandwich.
author: claudia y.

description:
I was initially skeptical about this place. While I love grilled cheese sandwiches, I didn't know if a restaurant could serve one worth paying $8 for since homemade ones are so good and easy to make. And second, the whole concept of taking fast food items and calling it "creative" by adding gourmet ingredients has been way overdone. The food scene in San Francisco has been too much about taco stands, food trucks, burger joints, and pizza places for far too long. I'm ready for something new and innovative to excite me again and show what a great culinary city this is!! Come on, people!

Anyways, I digress...back to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen. There was a long and very slow moving line in front of the restaurant (they only have one register and are working on getting another one). At least the staff was friendly and apologetic about the wait.

I ordered their special which included a small Mousetrap Sandwich (Tillamook sharp cheddar, havarti, and monterey jack cheeses) and a cup of Smoky Tomato Soup with crème fraîche. Simple yet tasty. I thought the tomato soup was actually better than their grilled cheese sandwich. The soup was layered with nice flavors, comforting, and relatively light. And in my opinion, a necessary complement to the thick, crusty bread. 

My hubby and I also split the Jalapeño Popper Sandwich. It was interesting with the bacon, goat cheese, and apricot-jalapeño chutney, but I preferred the simple grilled cheese with the tomato soup.

Since it had taken so long to get through the line, I figured I also might as well try one of their desserts while I'm here. And as a gal from the South, I always get excited when I see bread pudding on a menu. Their Sweet Buttermilk Bread Pudding with bourbon-butter sauce was delicious. What I enjoyed most was how moist the bread pudding was and how the buttermilk formed these delicate flan-like pieces on top. Makes my mouthwater just thinking about it! 

 - So was the grilled cheese sandwich worth the 8 bucks? Only of it's served with the tomato soup.
 - Was it worth the 45 minute wait? No, very few things are with so many options in SF.
 - Will I come back? Maybe, but only after they get another register.
author: Karin V.

description:
Two things occurred to me during my experience: 1. YUM! 2. Why didn't I think of this?

It's a truth universally acknowledged that grilled cheese is delicious. It is also exceedingly easy to make. You start with bread and cheese, two things I'm pretty sure no one hates. Then you go from there adding anything your hungry heart desires. 

The AGCK has mastered this simple classic by concocting unique combinations using high quality ingredients and serving them in a cool spot. The menu is small but there is something for everyone. I grabbed the Mousetrap (added all the extras) and Cubano so my hubs and I could try half of each. Greasy heaven in a biodegradable to-go container. 

I took off a star for how long I had to wait. This isn't really their fault, they are the victim of their own success. But it's a small space with little to no indoor seating/room to stand and the line of young profs was out the door and then some.  My sense was that this is the norm. Also the prices feel steep for something I can sort of replicate in my panini maker but you pay for good ingredients, convenience and being trendy.
author: Rebecca T.

description: I am lactose intolerant and even though my grilled cheese caused me a world of pain, it was worth it.  I dream of these sandwiches every day.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Lived in SF for years and never made it here until my last visit! REGRET! There smoky tomato soup (served with homemade croutons) is not only delicious, but seriously necessary when gorging on grilled cheese! I had the Piglet which has ham, and gourmet mustard with oodles of Tillamook cheese. Fact - Tillamook Cheese shows that you care about your grilled cheese. Yes, I'm a biased Oregonian but you know I'm right! My friend ordered her grilled cheese with Gruyere and Mushrooms! Not for me but she thought it was delicious! I think I may have to come visit during every return trip to SF! Besides I haven't tackled that Mac & Cheese sandwich yet!
author: Marissa P.

description: I do love this place and apologize to AGCK for not writing this review sooner.  Yeah, if you're looking for comfort food served between two pieces of bread and accompanied by amazing tomato soup, this is a spot I highly recommend you try.  Bring the significant other, kids, friends, family pet.  It's all good here at AGCK.
author: Jay D.

description:
Overrated.

The cheese was greasy and heavy. The bread was too hard to bite into at the corners. Most disappointing was the lack of seating for the popularity of AGCK - I had to hover over a table and then leap to the seat as soon as it emptied. It seems like there is plenty more space on their patio to add additional tables.

I definitely won't go again. I prefer my kraft singles melted between two slices of wonderbread.
author: Rachel Q.

description: a south beach saturday morning...parking along south park...across from familiar 21st amendment...american grilled cheese kitchen...outdoor patio or indoor bar seating..breakfast and lunch only...slightly wet and gloomy morning...two farmer's breakfast sandwiches at $five.fifty each...two coffee and a fresh squeezed orange juice...a total of $twenty.twenty-six...a table sign and drinks given first...steel basket containing the sandwich delivered to table next....hearty large bread slicings perfectly greased and toasty...breakfast sandwiches having a perfectly medium cooked fried egg..yolk slightly cooked and slightly runny....seated by the window bar sipping coffee and biting into a cheesy american grilled cheese kitchen sandwich...does a san francisco morning get any better?
author: Hen A.

description: A coworker dragged a few of us here today.  I really enjoyed the food, but I didn't think it was anything super special, especially for $9.  I got the mushroom/gruyere, and it felt like something was missing.  I have no idea what it would be that was missing, though, so I can't really fault them.  It was tasty, just nothing to blow my socks off.  I'll definitely be going back at some point, though.
author: Wacey T.

description: I had their basic grilled cheese breakfast and it was yummy.  Sourdough bread, cheese, egg and ham.  I wish I was there when they were serving lunch!
author: Geoff C.

description:
best place for grilled cheese in the city? maybe.

the turkey club was excellent. it was more like a panini with extra cheese. crunchy artisan bread, tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, willie bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, sierra nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatos, arugula. the side of grapes was a nice touch.

having only been to 2 other places for grilled cheese (the melt, hog oyster), the american was my favorite. i'll definitely try the mac n cheese next time!
author: B Y.

description:
An open letter to The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen,

My opinion probably doesn't matter but I really do want to like you and I think you have the potential to be a four or five star shop, but here's my honest gripes.

- your hours are not convenient.  it's your business, your decision, but you're just not open often enough.  Stay open to 6 or 7 on weekdays.  I walk past you every night on the way home and would love to be able to walk in and grab a delicious dinner.  on weekends, start making the lunch items before 12.

- lines are good, it means your food is good (and I think it is).  lines can also be bad, say, if i have to wait 25 minutes for a grilled cheese, all the while watching the options on the menu board get covered with little signs reading "sold out".  This leads me to my next suggestion gripe:

- I know y'all are new to running a restaurant and I'm totally with you that there might be a learning curve but there just needs to be a little teeny bit better planning, preventing items from running out, and then you're golden.

I had the Piglet and a friend had the Mousetrap.  Both were delicious.  I do look forward to visiting again once things settle a bit, hours improve, etc.  

Thanks for coming to the neighborhood,
H. H
author: H H.

description: Ordered the "Foghorn Leghorn" and a cup of their seasonal soup of the day (It was called jumpin' john? something)  Whatever it was, call it DELICIOUS! They offer a piece of seasonal fruit with your order which was nice, it made the car smell like a naval orange. The drive home was made easy with that wonderful snack surprise. Go early, as the line tends to get long during lunch hour and they will run out of their "specials"
author: Maria M.

description: Went here for the second time today. Ordered the "piglet". Took about 20 minutes to come out...way too long in my opinion for a grilled cheese. The quality was low and the sandwich felt like it had butter all over it. The bread was pretty sick. Also, why dont they have whole wheat options? Not going back here. Excited for "the Melt" to open nearby.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
The food here is pretty good.  The tomato soup and grilled cheese sandos are unique and pretty tasty.  I especially like getting the apple witih my sando.  

Here is my gripe...there are so many people here for lunch, that I just can't go there unless it's when they first open or at the 2pm lunch hour.  With the line to the edge of the door, I timed waiting just under 20 mins to circulate through line, order, and get my food.  I realize this is not all their problem, as it's typically caused by people asking a billion questions and being indecisive.
author: Simon Y.

description:
My sandwich was greasy.  The bread was hard and cut my mouth up.  There was one slice of anemic turkey on my turkey sandwich. 

The tomato soup was bland. 

The salad was limp and lacked any imagination

The guy behind the counter was punchy and strange like he thought he was the coolest person in the room

I will say.... great marketing...

lots of sizzle no steak

complete waste of a lunch
author: Sam S.

description: Love this place!! I always get the mouse trap with turkey. Yummmm :-)  I have also had the mac n cheese, which is super good- but watch out cause it does have a kick to it!  I also like how they serve whole fruit with their food instead of french fries or chips. There usually is a line but worth the wait and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. A+
author: Luke O.

description: Got the mushroom sandwich to go. Quite tasty, included a free stone fruit, and introduced me to a delicious brand of potato chips. I imagine their salads, soups, and housemade sodas are also excellent, but I was already out $12 by this point, and most of my lunch hour had disappeared in the line.
author: Brian W.

description:
Grilled cheese--you have come a long way. From a lazy person's meal of stale toast and craft cheese to this. 

I dont even like mushrooms but I loved the gruyere and mushrooms! Its just the perfect amount of cheese, potato, and mushrooms. 

Its served with an apple. A nice touch but I would have preferred fries. And a bit expensive, at $9, but worthwhile. I also had the kiwi lemonade which was good but def not great.
author: George J.

description: Delicious. Pack Lactaid or fart discreetly in your cubicle.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Used to eat here about 3x/week when I worked in the area.

I never knew there was an art to making a grilled cheese sandwich, but this place proved me wrong.

One of the best sandwiches I've had and I only ate the Breakfast Piglet 95% of the time.

The staff here is also very polite and remember your name after the first couple of visits which adds a nice touch.

I now work in the financial district near another grilled cheese place which can't begin to compare.

I'm still having serious withdrawals from these sandwiches, hopefully this review helps.
author: James M.

description: tasty and dependable. espesially nice since it is on my way to the caltrain station.
author: F. M.

description:
Great idea! but not executed so well. Bread toasted way too hard scraping up the roof of your mouth. not cool. Jalapeno Popper? where is the Jalapeno? taste more like a PB&J. I so wanted to love this place. My home made grilled cheese sandwich clowns this place. the Staff is very friendly though. and the Tomato soup is good but I will not go back for a $10 bite of extremely hard toast & cheese. no thanks! 


oh and i gave this place three chances to make good... wasn't like i went there once and then came running to write this review.
author: Calama T.

description:
I want to eat every single item on this menu. Dare I say this is the best grilled cheese I've ever had? I do dare. It's so delicious!
