Warning: The line is long! I know they are working their fingers to the bone, feverishly making grilled cheese as fast as they can, and the staff seems well organized, but don't expect to get in and out of there in 10 minutes. 

Seating is limited. I recommend getting your sandwich to go and eating around the corner in South Park.

Staff is super friendly. I'm so glad I work nearby.
author: Mariah N.

description:
After weeks of hearing about the best grilled cheese ever I finally got here. It was 11:am and there was a line - encouraging. 

Mousetrap: the cheese was not melted and the added grilled tomato was barely warm. Not great.

Popper: my friend had the same experience...cheese was hard in some spots and barely warm. He would not go there again.

Bread pudding with a daily featured fruit is a killer and worth going just for that. Even the guy I was with can't stand bread pudding, but he ate all of mine and agreed that it was killin'.

The service is GREAT and I agree with the reviewer who mentioned the cashier - she is so cute and really sweet.
author: Sandy R.

description: Love grilled cheese and tomato soup so the grilled smoked mozzarella and smoked tomato soup were my choices. I was more than satisfied with the taste, presentation, and quantity. We sat outside and enjoyed the company of locals and their cool dogs. Parking was easier than expected. This would be a great place to grab a picnic lunch and head to Twin Peaks or Dolores park. A lot of fun choices. We will definitely be back soon.
author: April M.

description: This place is amazing; I always try to stop here when I visit SF.  Constantly changing variations of the grilled cheese, with awesome side dishes to add like soup (duh), salad, and even mac n' cheese.  Usually very busy, but they do a good job of getting people through the line.  But seriously.  The grilled cheese is amazing.  Gourmet cheeses, smoked meats, unique spreads...and the cheese is grilled to perfection.  I "like" them on FB and it makes my heart cry when they post pictures of their new specials and I know that I can't go because I'm not in SF.  Just stop asking questions and GO.
author: Emily S.

description: The place was not what i expected, it is even more awesome! I love grilled cheese and anything with mushrooms in it. I went there for lunch with a classmate of mine and ordered the Gruyere and mushroom (It was delicious)! Of course they had more healthier ones and apparently an delicious tomato soup, I will definitely be back and try everything else they have on their menu :D
author: Vickie Z.

description: Great food, I got the Mac n cheese grilled cheese sandwich and it was amazing. I want to try the others. It's a must if you're in the area.
author: Michael K.

description: Good sandwiches, but the wait is crazy long.  We arrived on a Sunday afternoon, and there was no line at all.  It still took 25 minutes for sandwiches to arrive.  Unacceptable.
author: David H.

description: This place has good food. But, the staff are AWESOME and super kind. The other day I was having a stressful morning and they gave me a free blackberry lemonade. Such a cool place. Go here!
author: Heather J.

description: This place does a great job of paying homage to the great American classic, the grilled cheese. Had an office event here for lunch and the crew took care of us, providing excellent service and, most importantly, quality grilled cheese sandwiches.  In the end, it is only a grilled cheese, and the prices are a bit high, but if you are into this american classic then you should enjoy.
author: Gregory C.

description:
OK I'm in the Elite Squad so I'm finally going to weigh in on this place (and I can do that quite literally after eating a few Piglets here at the AGCK).
I've carefully checked myself here each time I've been (about 7 times) to make sure I wasn't imagining things or being overly enthusiastic about my stunned reaction each time. After today I can say with utmost certainty that consistency has hit the mark each time, and this place has shot up to nearly the top of my list. It's that awesome.
Everything fellow Yelpers are saying (at least the ones raving) is true. Butter? Check. Cheese? Check. Grease? Check. But it's so much more than that. Everything they put out of their tiny kitchen tastes perfect every time. 
I usually go for the Piglet and tomato soup, which as others have said is a touch smoky and spicy and the creme fraich tempers the tanginess with a streak of creaminess. I highly recommend dunking each bite of your grilled cheese of choice. This slightly softens the crunchiness of the bread which is cooked to perfection and as one guy said (and fitting given the proximity of the place) "knocks it out of the park." 
To assuage the guilt I usually share a small house salad, which is perfectly dressed and totally delicious. 
Honestly we all have our own opinions and like different things, but I can't see how anyone can't love this place. To me it has become my favorite lunch spot in the city, hands down and leaves me in a smug after glow each time. RUN, don't walk to the AGCK. You'll need to, after all, to burn off the calories, but if any place is worth it, this is it. 
P.S. - Tried the mac and cheese today and it was the best I've ever had. Perfect creaminess int he cheese, mac was not overly cooked as someone else said, the cheese of course was perfect, and it had the perfect amount of black pepper to give it an extra kick. I guess I'm all about "comfort food" these days. Whatever you want to call it to me it is just plain delish.
author: Matt H.

description: We were visiting SF as a mini-vacation when we came here for lunch. The product was absolutely delicious. I wish there were an American Grilled Cheese Kitchen in Los Angeles. Or maybe I don't, because I'd eat here all the time and get so fat!! I ate the mushroom gruyere) and my best friend had some sandwich with ham and cheese(obviously) and other stuff. They were both tasty. They make their own sodas, also tasty. Usually the have some sort of special flavored biscuit,scone or muffin. The wait was long, too long.
author: Jennifer R.

description: great grilled cheese sando's but quite expensive for what it is.  Also, they make a delicious bread pudding if you're one of the lucky ones who gets there in time for 1 of the very few they make (clearly it's popular so advice to cook...maybe make a little more if it sells out every day by 1:00).
author: Joshua J.

description: I like this place.  I really do.  But it's comfort food, albeit really good, gooey, gourmet comfort food.  Still, I'll take it for what it is and give it four stars since I really don't think it's fair to go to a comfort food joint and then ding them for, well, serving comfort food.  The tomato soup was good flavor-wise, but we were expecting more of a creamy, thicker, bisque-style soup instead of the thinner-style soup that was got.  Seating-wise, there are only about 10 seats or so inside, all of which face the wall or window.  I think there might be outdoor seating as well, weather permitting.  Serves beer and wine.  Chips and fruit are included with meal.
author: Tara C.

description: My moscone grilled cheese sandwich was delicious but not quite filling enough for a meal so I would recommend getting a side. My friend got a rather boring looking grilled cheese with cheddar and chicken, so I'd recommend being careful to try the more unusual things on the menu. The house-made peach ginger soda was really really good.
author: Ethan J.

description:
Breakfast sandwiches ( veggie and farmer ) is awesome
I like the setting and the bar inside and I am a regular visitor there but the service is not that great
They also have variety of sandwiches for lunch which they only serve after 12:00

They have seatings outside so you can do a brunch there over the weekend and sit outside with beer or coffee for hours
author: Farshid G.

description: Greasy goodness! First off, I hate cheese. Yes, I hate cheese and I ate here . . . many times as a matter of fact. When I get breakfast here I get their Farmer's Breakfast. Be warned that you will probably be too full to eat lunch. There are way more lunch options, but I've only had the Mousetrap with apple-wood smoked bacon and the Mushroom Gruyère. Both delicious! The best time to hit up this spot for lunch is right at 12 (or earlier) or after 1:30. This place gets packed pretty quickly and the wait can be long. They don't answer their phones, so don't bother with trying to phone in your order.
author: Adelina W.

description: Excellent rich menu and very quick+accurate preparation. Fair prices for good but drinks are a bit too expensive.
author: Matt M.

description: Pretty trendy place. Hip for a lunch spot, complete with a disco bathroom! Good place to take a bunch of folks for a fun lunch
author: Emmanuel C.

description: YUM! While I suppose it is hard to have a bad grilled cheese, this place really "knocks it out of the park!" The cheese is delicious, the bread is just toasted enough with a buttery flavor. Paired with a beer, this place is pretty much amazing.
author: Allison M.

description: Nothing says comfort food like a grilled cheese and soup! All of the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen sandwiches can be made on homemade gluten-free bread. For those of us with Celiac, it is important to know they cook the gluten free bread on separate pans to avoid cross-contamination.
author: GlutenFree G.

description:
I have been trying to go to this place for several months but because they close so early I was never able to, untilll...... yesterday and boy was it worth the wait.

I ordered the jalepeno popper sandwich and the guy threw in an apple and chocolate chip cookie.  :)   That sandwich was so delicious I could not stop making yuummm sounds as I ate it. lol.

The place is cute and small with outdoor seating, which is where I sat.  Very clean and speedy service.  I plan to go again when I am in SF and take friends.

Delicious Sandwich!
author: Lee C.

description: If you go after the lunch crowd the wait isn't all that bad. At least when I went it wasn't. :) I got the Mousetrap which comes with 3 types of cheese. Mmm! My g/f got a turkey sandwich with some yummy bacon. Both sandwiches were very good. Plus, it's not that far from Pacbell park. So I'm thinking about hitting up this place before a Giants game one of these days.
author: Jay E.

description:
So I went there a couple of weeks ago.  I had the Ruben (which doesn't seem to be on the menu anymore) and it was ok...  It was a bit small for the $9 pricetag.

The real gripe I have with the place is that it took over 50 minutes for me to complete my lunch.  That was the wait to order (which I started out on the sidewalk on 2nd street) *they just got a 2nd register which I saw this morning as I walked by* and the time for them to make the order.

I didn't stay there and eat, I took it back to the office because my 1 hour lunch was almost up!!!!!

This is one of those SF "hip" places to be.  I'm not a "hip" person, I'm just a regular Joe so I'm not sure I'll be back.  Maybe if they learn to make a lunch within 20 minutes.
author: Steve I.

description: I wasn't very impressed, despite all the high reviews this place has. The only thing that was good was the grilled cheese. The tomato bisque and quinoa salad were not appetizing at all. If it's only grilled cheese you are looking for, this is your place and yes, they have a number of different options.
author: Anoop C.

description: I have yet to eat something here that I didn't love.  The Feta Fetish is one of my favorites.  And the mushroom with gruyere is my death row last meal kind of sandwich.  The tomato soup is fantastic and a little smoky.  The breakfast muffins are also outstanding: strawberry/blueberry with crumble on top?  Yes, please.  In addition to the great food, everyone who works here is fun and friendly.
author: Kristal D.

description: I had the mushroom Gruyere with smoky tomato soup. It was delicious, but not many seats inside to enjoy the food! Lots of outside seating, but it was too cold to sit outside. The wait was about 15-20 minutes to get the food. I would come back again, but probably get the food to-go. While waiting in line we snagged a few seats, but don't count on it.
author: Shelly W.

description: I have eaten here twice now that I work up the street. The first sandwich I got was a jalopeno grilled cheese which was too spicy and lacked any other flavor, the second was their mac and cheese sandwich which wasn't bad but nothing to write home about. If i wasn't such a fatty I would stop being dragged in by the concept of melted cheese.
author: Roman I.

description: Legit grilled cheese! The club turkey is on point. These guys get super busy but it's a great spot to start your day.
author: Johnny S.

description: It was a really gorgeous day in the city, so I decided to go to South Park to just relax, swing on the swings, and soak in the sun.  As I walked by, I noticed this place, and had heard / read a good deal about it, so my friends and I decided to grab a late lunch here.  It was a great call - the food was great, and we still got to enjoy the sun since we got to eat at the outdoor patio.  We got the jalapeno popper grilled cheese (vegetarian - no bacon) and Tilly's Veggie Salad (no egg).  The grilled cheese was delicious - spiced really really well.  And, the vinaigrette on the salad was super tasty as well.  I definitely want to try their other grilled cheeses now.. and I'm sure I will, given South Park is right there.  I definitely recommend this place... along with a stroll in the park!
author: Rachana S.

description:
There's something about Grilled Cheese Sandwiches that makes my day that much better. I've been to this place a few times over the past year--and every sandwich I have tried has been so damn good. A little pricey, yes (8-9 bucks for a sandwich)--but damn good. Also--there's no need for additional chips or soup with your sandwich. Those suckers are quite the brick in your stomach. 

The Jalapeno Popper Sandwich has such an assortment of flavor--the best thing about this sandwich is that it is not too spicy, so you can actually taste the sweetness of the apricot and the smoked flavor of the bacon. The sandwich also does not put too much bacon in--which is nice for an already heavy grilled cheese. Contrary explosive name of the sandwich, the flavors are not overpowering, but rather very nicely complement each other. Spicy + Sweet = Delish. 

The Moscone was good, I love anything with a lavender taste--it's a great veggie grilled cheese with mozzarella and greek olive spread.  

The Mousetrap Sandwich (classic grilled cheese) is just simple, cheesy and awesome. 

Funny thing, you can get your sandwiches with gluten free bread here (ha, ha, yuppie SOMA). I guess I have a sandwich place I can take my no flour/no sugar friend to, right? 

Don't go during peak lunch hours because you'll have to wait in line forever and a day (duh!). Go at 11:30, or 1:30, etc and bring a newspaper to read while you wait for your sandwich like I do. Last note, I also have a crush on the tangerine cutie too--it's the perfect accessory.
author: Alexandra O.

description: I've been wanting to try this place all year and I finally made it tonight on my last game of the season. On the way to see our Giants play my sister and I stopped in for a quick amazingly yummy dinner! I got the mousetrap with roasted tomatoes and was in absolute heaven. The sandwiches are huge, cooked to perfection and have so much yummy cheese I cannot wait to go back. Great spot to people watch too sitting at the little bar inside facing the crowds heading into the park. Amazing, amazing and amazing! The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen reached far above my expectations. Enjoy!!! PS: the staff here is super nice make sure you tip them well!
author: Sarah R.

description: This place is incredible.  I have tried a couple of their different grilled cheese sandwiches and everyone is delicious.  I absolutely love the mushroom Gruyere.  If you come at lunch, you can get the red white and blue plate special which is around $8 and includes a small sandwich and a side salad or tomato soup.  I suggest the tomato soup with creme fraiche and homemade croutons.  I work about a block from this place so the only warning is not to eat too many!  Why  I must limit myself to no more than one a week - but definitely  worth the splurge!
author: Karen G.

description: Awesome incredible super. I can't NOT stop by here at least once whenever I'm jn the city. You will not be disappointed!!
author: Nate M.

description: They only serve breakfast till noon on weekends is the first thing we found out when we stopped by on a Saturday. After seeing this place on multiple best grilled cheese lists and watched it from across the street at the 21st amendment I finally got around to seeing what the hype is about. We got there at 11:30 and they were still serving breakfast so we just got an egg to go with our grilled cheese. The place is small has counter seating. The egg, bacon grilled cheese that I got was really good. One of the better breakfast sandwiches that I have ever had. The sunny side up egg oozed yolk all over the place and made it really delicious. I would more then come back here if I were in the city for breakfast.
author: Matt C.

description: Best grilled cheese in and around the financial district. Good ingredients, good selection, and good flavors.
author: Scott D.

description:
I'm Sorry, the people who gave this restaurant 5 stars are CRAZY!!!!!!!!
10 bucks for a grill cheese WTF? Okay okay, maybe if you throw in some fries with it, but the 5 grapes I got with my Jalapeno thingy did not suffice. The wait is ridiculous, someone told me San Franciscans love waiting in line, I guess if you wait for a grill cheese for an hour your gonna have hard time admitting it's not great (cognitive dissonance). Oh yeah, I thought they would have some fancy cheese, but it was just regular old Tillamook? Take my advice, take the same amount you were gonna spend at this place, go to Safeway, buy the same ingredients, and make 20 identical sandwiches!!!!!!

p.s. the jalapeno grill cheese made my butt burn really really bad a couple hours later. Not pretty.
author: Maurice S.

description:
pickles are NOT delicious. overly spicy? weird pickling spices, but definitely did not taste like a ny pickle! 

Otherwise, sammies ARE delicious! great and original ideas for grilled cheese sandwiches. You must also get the tomato soup because it's just the perfect match. I do like the piece of fruit they throw in the bag too. Makes me feel like I'm a kid again and off to school with take out. =) 

Sandwiches are slightly on the expensive side for what they are, but they do use high quality cheeses and high quality breads.
author: Joyce T.

description: Great food, great location!  Limited seating - some outdoors.  Often has a line out the door, but goes pretty fast.  Dee-licous sandwiches - LOVE the gruyere and mushroom.  Salads are also first class...and the mac and cheese is wonderful.
author: Jingo R.

description: Totally disappointed in this place. It smelled good inside, but the food was just your generic grilled cheese. I got one with mushrooms, but didn't even feel like finishing it. Won't bother going back. Don't see what all the fuss is about with this.
author: Goldi J.

description:
What a great idea! I have always loved the classic grilled cheese and this idea to take the American classic gourmet is great. My first trip to the American last week was great.  I showed up at around 11:45 to find a pretty big line already but it moved pretty quick. The wait was also made easier when the friendly owners came out and offered some free pickle samples. Man those are some good pickles! Before I knew it I was placing my order for the mushroom gruyere sandwich and tomato soup with home made croutons. I found a table outside and waited about 5 min for my sandwich despite the place being pretty busy. 
Now for the important part. The sandwich was absolutely perfectly delicious. The bread was toasted perfectly and the mushroom and potato mix was soooo good. I want one right now!!! I can't wait to sample more sammys on their menu. Overall this is a great place that's only going to get better over time. Highly recommended!
author: Andrew H.

description:
overpriced bulllllllllshit !!!! and to top that off .. they dont even serve potato chips or french fries !!! WTF ????????

boycott this fucking place please !!!
author: Micah W.

description:
Delish. Grilled cheese sandwiches are my jam.

Visited it just after the opening, and the place was packed. No worry, though, because the line moved pretty quickly and the guy behind the counter was pretty fast and cheerful. 

I kept it simple by ordering the Mousetrap, and will probably work up the menu from that sandwich, which was a classic grilled cheese. It was a perfect mix: crunchy, greasy, and the cheese was perfectly melted. 

Make sure to get a chocolate chip cookie. My coworker and I split one, and we definitely didn't regret it.
author: David V.

description: Man these guys are rollin' in the patrons left and right. Who knew grilled cheese could cause such a ruckus? Well I guess if Ike's is any indication, the desire for sandwiches is at an all time high. Even at 2.40 pm it took us a good 10 min or so to order. Now the people are really friendly and they've got some volunteer help to boot, and still they are swamped. Half way through the line I saw a table open and up and swooped on in. A few minutes later my friend comes out with a couple of passion fruit lemonades. A while after that our sandwiches show up. I got the Windy City which is a play on the Chicago Italian beef sandwich (roast beef, giardinieraa, provolone) while my friend got the Piglet (Tillamook sharp cheddar, artisan cured ham, apple mustard, rosemary butter). Everything was pretty flavorful and to be outside on a perfectly mild sunny day was bonus. I think the only thing holding this place back is it's already too small for the demand. Smart idea to have a person out front selling beverages. However the wait and some mixups due to sheer volumes of people may require them to rethink their staffing and kitchen. However they do make a solid product! 4.25 stars
author: Kim N.

description: I got the Turkey Club Grilled Cheese.  It was really good! I love how they give you a mandarin with your meal too. =) This place is probably not a good place for super picky eaters though.
author: Tiffany R.

description: I will update my review per my hubby's request when I get lunch grilled cheeses...However, we arrived 25 minutes prior to the lunch menu starting, and figured why not order the breakfast grilled cheeses?  I got the classic (egg/cheese) + added bacon and hubby got the Farmer's, with bacon, potatoes, egg, and cheese.  I have to say, the sandwich was more reminiscent of a bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich vs. a grilled cheese with complementary bacon and eggs.  I was hoping for a lot more cheese to ooze out on the side, and also for it to be quite flavorful.  The butter soaked all up on your fingers, and not in a lick them b/c it's delish sorta way, but darn, will my heart survive this?  Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed my breakfast (who can go wrong with bacon, egg, and cheese), but it wasn't what came to mind when I thought grilled cheese heaven.
author: Steph W.

description:
Two months of long lines and today I finally accomplished what I thought would be impossible. 

I got myself the Mushroom Gruyere at the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.

Did it leave me slack-jawed and craving for more or set me off in a chaotic frenzy over a symphony of flavors? No, it didn't. Did I question why the potato and leeks seemed nonexistent? Yes. Would I be a little pissed if I had to wait in line like other people did in the past few months? Probably.  

But it is what it is -- even a fancy $9 grilled cheese is just that -- grilled cheese.

Note: The best tasting sandwich was the mousetrap which is the standard grilled cheese. Go figure. Don't fix it if it ain't broke!
author: Chelle Y.

description:
complete and utter disappointment  =(
and i am sad to be giving a place like this such a low rating - but they deserve it in my opinion and id be happy to change it if they STEP IT UP.

There are two foods in life that make me amazingly happy and warm inside 1) mac n cheese  and 2) grilled cheese. and i consider myself an expert on both. 

So you can only imagine HOW EXCITED I WAS to find a GORMET GRILLED CHEESE SPOT walking distance from my best friends house. 
I was finally able to go in last week after a long work meeting for a late lunch - so flipping excited to have cheese oozing all up in my biznessss. 
but that sir, was not the case...AT ALL. actually my grilled cheese...DIDNT HAVE ANY CHEESE, or a very very very little bit...wtf?????   i was so sad - i shutup and ate it tho, b/c the girl behind the bar serving soup was staring me down. i mean isn't the reason for going to a grilled cheese spot to get cheese that is melting and oozinggggggg on toast that has been grilled??

ok so lets sum it up.
(1). i walked in and got a spot at the counter - just as soon as someone had gotten up, NO ONE offered to pick up, dust off, or wipe the part of the counter in front of me with all the crumbs from the previous customer, even when they saw me grab some napkins and do it myself. 
(2). a grilled cheese shop with very limited options/limited cheeses on the menu? not to mention ONLY ONE - plain grilled cheese option? 
 -given the opportunity i would have been happy to pay extra to 'make my own' grilled cheese and ADD CHEESE TO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!
(3). The soup was alright - nothing exciting or flavorful - i could get the same out of a 'gormet' canned soup.
(4). my half a sandwich was RIDICULOUSLY SMALL for the price - and i MIGHT HAVE BEEN SATISFIED with the size/price  - if my sandwich happened to have some cheese in it.

 i give one star  for adding grapes to the order  it was a nice touch and would have gone well, with a well made grilled cheese.
author: Shadi N.

description: Now this is a grilled cheese I like. I kind of wish they had a great beer selection and fries to really make this place pop - but hey. The soup was great and being so close to south park is nice. For nice days during lunch hour they would totally benefit form having more outdoor tables for sure.
author: Breanne B.

description: Summary (update): Good deal at breakfast on weekday! Not crowded, inexpensive ($4-5 for sandwich). Still not a good deal at lunch though.
author: Gary Y.

description: I was cheesing for the cheese last week when I came here for lunch.  Though the wait was a bit slow, it was worth it.  I had half of the mushroom gruyere with tomato soup, which both met my expectations.  The sandwich was crispy, cheesy, buttery, shroomy goodness, while the tomato soup was just right with taste and consistancy.  I love the outdoor seating and the all American themed decor was very creative- a little bit of country, a little bit of city.  Don't ya walk outta there without tryin' them oatmeal and chocolate chip cookies!  Ya hear?
author: Linda P.

description: I've made tastier grilled cheese sandwiches at home in the comfort of my pajamas. However, I do enjoy their homemade sodas. If you want an amazing grilled cheese sandwich come on over to my place. Otherwise, this is probably your next best option.
author: Jen Y.

description:
CHEESES CHRIST this place is SLOW. The food is ok, but really, a 20 minute wait for a sandwich??????? Who can afford to burn a third of their lunch hour WAITING at a sandwich counter?

I even tried to go after the lunch rush by going at 1:30 and they still can't handle the orders efficiently. Lame-o.

The tomato soup is sour, thin and not really topped with crème fraiche  as stated on the menu. Correct me if I'm wrong, but is "manufacturing cream" the same as crème fraiche ? I didn't think so either, but that is what I've seen them refilling their squeeze bottles with.

On a positive note, the muffins are quite good, especially the pineapple coconut one. You can smell the butter oozing out of that thing.
author: C G.

description:
Probably the best grilled cheese I've ever had.  I didn't get the tomato bisque soup with it like most people but the sandwich was delicious.  The place probably had 20 people waiting for their food but the quality of the food wasn't compromised.  It took long but the sandwich was perfect.

For around $4, it's a great meal.
author: Mack D.

description: Saw this place on yelp and had to try it! I went during the week at lunch time is it was packed! My girlfriend got the tomato soup with a salad and I got the turkey club...it was DELICIOUS!! Probably one of the best turkey clubs I have ever had! Go check this place out ASAP!!
author: nabil s.

description: This place is great and there is always a long line at lunch time! I've had a few of the different sandwiches and always been impressed. Definitely going back a ton!
author: Cheryl M.

description:
ok. i want to give this place 5 stars and i'm sure i eventually will once i've tried a few more of the sandwiches.... 

i had the wild turkey. it was my 3rd choice down the list but they had run out of the piglet (first choice) AND the jalepeno popper (2nd choice) sandwiches. regardless, the wild turkey was delicious, and in the kitchen's defense, it was only their 3rd day in operation. 

i will come back and get that piglet. and then i will come back to yelp and give it 5 stars. we shall meet again!
author: Michelle K.

description: So I'm sure this place is really good. I heard it was on tv, and I heard it was in a magazine. Everyone else got the jalapeno popper. Sounds like I should have gotten that. It had a healthy amount of goat cheese and some bacon. I had the cubano. It had the most meat, but I'm not sure that was the best choice. The sandwich didn't taste all that amazing, but the sliced pickle was actually really good. It was sweet and pleasant. $10 grilled cheese, I may not do this again.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Already love this place. Got the standard grilled cheese "Mousetrap" but I asked for the Apricot-Jalapeno relish (which is amazing!) on the side. Got a side of sweet chili chips and their housemade Vanilla Ginger Mint soda. Yes, the wait was long but their staff was SUPER friendly. Definitely somewhere I'd love to go back to once the hype dies down a bit :)
author: Karishma S.

description: It's getting better!  My sandwich was good and hearty, there wasn't much of a wait, we found seats easily and the staff was friendly and helpful.  The tomato soup was too acidic, and I still feel that it is overpriced, but a much better experience than I had originally.
author: Quinn S.

description: A restaurant that just serves grilled cheeses? yes please. Went there for lunch the other day and after waiting in a 30 minute line I thought to myself this better be worth it. And to answer that question, yes it was very worth it. I ordered the new grilled cheese that they just added to the menu that had tomatoes, olive tapinade and a couple different types of cheeses. Delicious. Combine that with a fresh squeezed, ice cold lemonade and there is nothing better for lunch. I will definitely be going back.
author: Gillian M.

description:
I was excited to give this place a shot and heard a lot about its opening. Waited in line for over 30 minutes (it could have been much worse) and by the time we got to the counter, they were out of all sandwiches except two; the jalapeno popper and the tomato feta. I wasn't too bothered by the running out of food part as I thought it was a testament to the popularity of the place and hence, the food.  I went with the half sandwich and half spicy tomato soup combo. 
I was underwhelmed with both items. The soup lacked the thick and creamy consistency that makes a tomato soup good. The Jalapeno Popper was a disappointment. For this particular item, the apricot preserve within the sandwich was overbearing. I did not taste a hint of jalapeno in the sandwich. Did they just forget about it? Perhaps apricot, bacon and jack would have been more apt of a name. My thinking is that If you are going to take an unconventional approach to grilled cheese, it should at least taste good. The only consistent thing about the sandwich is that it was greasy. 

I hate to give this place two stars. Trust me! I live in SOMA and the opening of more small eateries like this can only be a good thing. I am all for the success of new restaurants in the area. That being said, grilled cheese has a certain nostalgia in our culture. It is reminiscent of simple comfort food and instant gratification. We take it seriously. I can't help but think the success here will be short-lived (if the food doesn't get better) riding off social networking and worse, the exploitation of this nostalgia.
author: Annie Y.

description:
stay home.  you can make better grilled cheese in your microwave. 

i was really excited about this place after reading the reviews on the sfgate.  grilled cheese is just one of those things i get nostalgic about, like mac n cheese or tater tots, and it's not something i have that often anymore, so when i do give it a go, i want it to be worth the long wait.  

well, AGCK probably did the impossible.  Seriously.  How do you make a bad grilled cheese?  I got their basic sandwich, the mousetrap, which is basically just three different types of cheeses and some bread.  No distractions.  I was super excited after I ordered.  But what I got was beyond disappointing.  

Despite having three different cheeses, I couldn't really taste any.  I did, however, taste the heavily buttered and slightly burnt bread, which wasn't particularly good bread either.  Come on guys, it's a cheese sandwich, not a butter sandwich, which would have been a better name.  I did, however, make myself butter sandwiches when I was like 5, but I've moved on from that, and I certainly don't want to pay $6 for someone to make me a version that I, at 5 years old, made better using Wonder bread.  Or maybe it was Roman Meal.  I dunno.  Bottom line.  I ate half of the sandwich and gave the other half to a homeless man nearby.  I wonder if he even ate it all .
author: Ash T.

description: I went back this weekend - I unfortunately was there for breakfast - s much as i love a good breakfast Sandwich, I told them to drop the egg, I want the real thing - magical sando! How can a grilled cheese taste so good? They are the type of restaurant I argue can never fail - do something simple, and do it better than anyone else, and you'll be a stand out! This has become one of my go to stops before a Giants game now!
author: Sam A.

description: While the fact that the owner is my friend's brother got me in the door, the amazing lunch I got will make me want to return (at least when I'm here on business) and certainly tell my local colleagues and friends to check it out.   I had the Mousetrap sandwich with a side of tomato soup and both were incredible!  Very flavorful and just the right amount of food!  Line was out the door!
author: Molly R.

description: An MIT trained engineer and a Economics Professional make one hell of a damn good sandwich!  Try the jalapeno popper.  The apricot and jalapeno relish make flavors that should be outlawed.... or taxed.
author: Mark B.

description:
On my way to the Giants game, I passed by The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen, a new restaurant on 2nd Street and South Park.  Not wanting to pay $12 for a hot dog and $9.50 for a beer at PacBell Park, I decided to go in and give these guys a try.  It was quite busy, and I found out that it was actually only their second day open.

I ordered the Feta Tomato sandwich (feta, monterey jack, roasted tomatoes, tapenade, and garlic butter), and my friend ordered the Jalapeno Popper (goat cheese, monterey jack, applewood smoked bacon, and apricot-jalapeno relish).  Both sandwiches were fantastic.  The feta tomato had a perfect balance between ingredients, with no single one overwhelming the others, and was almost like a foccacia.  The jalapeno popper was also great - the apricot-jalapeno spread was sweet and tangy, with a little bit of a kick to it.  Each sandwich also came with a cutie orange, which I thought was a nice touch, and a refreshing contrast to the sort of inherent 'unhealthiness' of the grilled cheese.  I noticed that a few reviewers have complained of 'greasiness,' which I think is an absurd criticism of a grilled cheese sandwich; they're supposed to be a bit greasy - that's what makes them so tasty.

The price/portion ratio was fair - they used very high quality ingredients and that area of town is generally going to be a bit pricier than say, the Richmond or Sunset districts.  Sandwiches were priced in the $6-9 range.  The sandwich portions were such that I wasn't hungry afterwards, but also wasn't so full that I entered into the dreaded food coma which pretty much sabotages any chance of productivity I would have in the hour after lunch.  If you are looking for a gigantic sandwich that will force you to unbutton your pants, this place is probably not for you.

They also had a nice variety of very original handcrafted sodas, which were very refreshing on what was a nice warm day (they have outside seating in addition to seating at the bar inside).

All in all, I will definitely be going back to try some of their other sandwiches, and I live halfway across the city!
author: Jeffrey K.

description: I had the classic breakfast with bacon. Yummy! I went there on a cold, rainy Saturday morning and the grilled cheese was perfect. I did not like the tomato soup as much. Never been here for lunch but one of my favorite parts of this sandwich was the egg so I recommend going there for breakfast. Not much to say about this place. It's simple food, fast service, tasty, I'm definitely going back.
author: Sasha K.

description:
I work across the street from The American, and it has been PACKED since its opening-for good reason.  The food is good (not excellent, more on that later) the servers are peppy and engaged, and the ambience is phenomenal.  

Fair warning: this is not a cheap lunch joint.  Expect to at least spend 10 dollars, unless you're feeling super-stingy.  Another word of caution: after around 11:30, this place is PACKED.  Be sure you can devote at least a half hour of wait time if you don't get there right when they open.    The staff does their best to keep things moving, but with a tiny restaurant, a tiny kitchen, and only one cash register, I can understand why it takes so long.  

Alright, on to the food.  The most important thing to order is a drink.  I know this may sound ridiculous, but all of the house-made non-alcoholic offerings (I haven't tried any of the alcoholic ones, or the bottled ones) I've had at the American have been phenomenal.  As far as I'm concerned, the Vanilla Gingermint Soda is really the star of the show.  That may sound like a weird combination, but trust me, it works extremely well.  I hope they can find a way to bottle that stuff-it's liquid joy.

The sandwiches are a bit less impressive than the drinks, though not by much.  In my two visits, I've had a Jalepeño Popper, and a Wild Turkey.  In both cases, the sandwiches sounded spicier than they actually were.  The dominant flavor in the popper switches between the cheese and the apricot (in the Apricot-Jalepeño spread), though it completely sidesteps the bacon.  Was it good?  Absolutely.  But in order to really knock my socks off, I'd prefer a more subtle blend of flavors, rather than a ping-pong match between cheese and apricot.

The Wild Turkey is definitely more well-rounded.  While it seems that the smoked turkey, like the bacon in the Popper, gets lost in the shuffle, the entire flavor profile of the sandwich is far broader and more subtle.  None of the ingredients seem out to wrangle your tastebuds in one direction or another.  When I come back, this'll definitely be my go-to sandwich.

A quick word about bread: Their crusty bread tastes great, and they've finally perfected cooking it just right, with a semi-chewy middle, and a hard crust.  That said, if you eat the crust, prepare for the roof of your mouth to hate you for it.  (Protip: If you've already abused the roof of your mouth the previous night, pass on the crust.  It'll just add pain to more pain.  I learned from experience.)

Something that nobody seems to mention is the free fruit with every sandwich.  It's easy to overlook as a garnish, but I've enjoyed the clementines (strike that, tangerines) that came with my sandwiches, albeit with a side of pain after I've finished my sandwich.

All in all, The American is worth a trip.  Get there early, order a drink, make sure you have room in your budget, and enjoy.
author: Blair F.

description:
Love at first bite. The tomato soup is delicious and the Piglet (Cheddar, ham and green apple) transported me straight back to childhood when my mom packed me ham & cheese 'wiches for school. Only these aren't your mom's grilled cheeses. It's everything I want in a comfort food, with a twist of sophistication that makes every bite interesting. 

I also loooooooved the homemade grapefruit and cracked pepper soda I ordered...they keep rotating flavors so be sure to try what's on the menu. 

The decor is peaceful and beautiful. For my next trip I'd go for a late lunch and a glass of wine.
author: Liz S.

description: May be the best sandwich I have ever had!  Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, Willie Bird smoked turkey, applewood-smoked bacon, Sierra Nevada stout mustard, roasted tomatoes, arugula on artisan sourdough =  Absolutely unbelievable.  Throw in an Arnold Palmer and I'm in heaven.  The problem is that I live in Boston.  So you all need to open one in Boston ASAP.  Thank you.
author: Jeremy D.

description: Great idea and the grilled cheeses are amazing. It can get really busy at lunch time but the line is processed really fast. They also serve beer and wine too! Could be a little pricey if you add on to your sandwich but totally worth it. Love that you get oranges with your sandwich too!
author: Christie M.

description: I felt like being patient so I decided to fall in line at the american grilled cheese kitchen. I'm happy I did!! I ordered the soup and half sandwich which just totally blew my mind. It's like the Rolls Royce of grilled cheese-amazingness... that's it ... there u go.. go try it
author: Christopher J.

description: This place is just plain awesome! A bit on the greasy side, but damn tasty. Get the blue plate special. Soup & sandwich hit the spot.  Watch out for peak times (I.e noon) as there are a ton of startups within blocks. #thxbubble
author: Brian L.

description: Who knew a grilled cheese sandwich could taste SO GOOD!?? We came here before a Giants game. Luckily they have extended hours during games so they were still open. Thang T. and I ordered the jalapeno popper. And boy, let me tell you .. it was delightful. Served with some grapes, it came to a total of $9 but it was worth every penny!! It had the perfect balance of spicy and sweet. It was so good I savored every bite in silence and I simply couldn't get over how good it was! Grilled cheese sandwiches will never be the same again! We immediately came to a mutual agreement to make this place a regular stop before games (: I will be back for you soon jalapeno popper sandwich .. very soon!
author: Malyssa C.

description:
My husband and I went to the Grilled Cheese Kitchen yesterday, which was only their 2nd day being open. We got there around 1:30pm and the line was pretty long (we waited 45 minutes to order). 

While waiting in line they ran out of almost all the sandwiches and all the salads as well as one of the bread puddings. This was kind of a bummer because each time I chose something it would get sold out and I'd have to pick another thing on the menu... 

So I ended up with the Feta & Tomato sandwich and my husband had the Jalapeno Popper. And while Feta may not have been my first choice I was blown away after the first bite! My husband finished his sandwich in no less than 2 minutes and dove into the savory bread pudding which was also amazing. So basically we ordered 3 things, all of which were not our first choices on the menu and we were still blown away. 

The wait is long (I'm assuming this will die down) and I do think they need to plan a bit better so that the people waiting in line for 45 minutes don't get left with 1 or 2 choices off the menu, but hey - maybe this just means you have to get there early. 

We will definitely be going again (and again). Though maybe not too often otherwise I might have to buy a new wardrobe as my belly will definitely grow with each sandwich.
author: M W.

description: "CHEESES that's a good sandwich!" It nearly killed me to wait 20 minutes for a grilled cheese and I thought, this better be good. It sure was! I had the jalepeno popper (chevre, jack, applewood bacon, apricot relish), on a buttery, crispy bread. Not low cal by any means, but, man, so good.
author: Jessica G.

description: Whatever they use to fill the sandwiches is awesome, fatty, and delicious, but the fillings were almost overshadowed by the bread itself, which was to die for. I can't remember the last time I was so happy about CRUST! Phenomenal.
author: Jen Y.

description: Maybe I'm missing something, but I do not understand the hype about this place. They serve different variations of grilled cheese...but honestly, how many variations can there be? With this place, you can come here everyday for a week and you have exhausted the menu. Now what do you do? You could try the tomato soup...but I don't recommend it! It tastes more like water with a little tomato flavoring. And why is it SO HARD to get a seat there? Did anyone ever think about expanding seating? First of all, nobody wants to sit outside on a freezing, cloudy SF day so outside seating is essentially useless for 360 of the 365 days of the year here. Inside, my clothes end up smelling like fried food and my head is about 3 inches from hitting a low-lying rafter beam. Making my own grilled cheese sandwich would have been a more satisfactory experience.
author: Alisa A.

description:
LOVED my mushroom gruyere sandwich.  The thinly sliced yukon gold potatoes were a pleasant surprise and the whole sandwich just blended together nicely.  

So why only 3 stars?  In my mind, grilled cheeses, no matter how fancy, shouldn't take that long to make.  Not to mention, take out shouldn't take that long.  But I had to wait 35 minutes for my sandwich today.  My friend and I were back-to-back orders and yet there was a good 7-10 minutes between when our orders came out.  The group next to us got two people's sandwiches, but was still waiting on their third.  I think the restaurant may have an issue with how the tickets are being fired.
author: Olivia T.

description: What can I say, it's a grilled cheese sandwich, oh but it's a really good grilled cheese.  A really good grilled cheese.  Skip the soups, especially the tomato - they pretty much really suck.
author: Tim M.

description: What can I say... I'm a sucker for a good grilled chese sandwich. What did it for me was the Red, White and Blue plate special option and the ginger molases cookie. Yum! Yum! However, the 45 min wait really, really sucks and should be managed better. It does appear that they do plan to have a second register, but in the interim someone should really take the orders while people wait in line so the cash register process is faster. Overall, I'm a fan!
author: Kimberly G.

description: OMG!  Have to try the Killer Butterscotch Pecan Brownie.  The girl behind the counter said, 'big enough to share'.  Obviously, she doesn't know me.  I also love the Arnold Palmer (half iced tea and half their passionfruit lemonade).  And milk and cookies happy hour?  Even a lactose intolerant like me is happy about that.
author: Genevieve W.

description:
Great sandwiches!
Sounds like there were a bunch of bitter people with mile high expectations in line on Day One. 

In any case, the sandwiches are good, the folks who run it are great. There's a variety of sandwiches - with and without meat.

It's not the cheapest place in town, but they use high quality ingredients and it's in South Park - not the cheapest part of town.

I'll be back, and I wish it was closer to my work neighborhood.
author: Tackett A.

description: Mushroom gruyere sammie... WOW. And a side of red grapes. And a bottle of Bubble Up. And... happiness.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Went again at noon on a wednesday.  Line was only 10min.  My new favorite sandwich is the Moscone - Feta, Tomato, Olive Tapenade & Pesto.  Perfect flavor pairing.  I still love the mushroom gruyere and jalapeno popper.  Don't be afraid it's not really spicy, just a nice warmth & flavor with your bacon & cheese.
author: Janet S.

description:
The long line as we approached was a bit daunting but actually moved along rather quickly. 
The order taker was unpretentious , friendly , informative and in no hurry to move us along. There were two of us shared a mushroom sandwich and a 'pork' sandwich as well as two of their distinctive homemade sodas. Everything was exceptional, delivered to our window seats quickly and courteously.The flavors of both sandwiches were simple and certainly not muddled even with all of the well proportioned melted cheeses.Bread was both flavorful as well as perfectly toasted.
My only mistake was not ordering the tomato soup which I observed numerous people dipping their 'little' sandwiches into.
What a great addition to this seemingly burgeoning neighborhood.
author: Lou S.

description: This place never disappoints. I've been here a couple times for breakfast, and it was delicious. Came for lunch on a Saturday and it was packed! Luckily the weather was nice, because the patio seating was full. I had the jalapeno popper and it was sooo good. Can't wait to come back again and try something else, or maybe just have the jalapeno popper again!
author: Jenny X.

description: I have not tried a sandwich yet because at 11:20am they would not let me order even though it's 10 mins away from 11:30 for the lunch menu. I don't understand why they won't let us order first and just bring out the food when the kitchen is ready. Is their register wack? They can't just put in the order till it hits 11:30? So far 1 star from me because they are idiots from the way they are handling the order. Remember to show up after 11:30 if you want lunch.
author: Kitty Y.

description: Who knew a grilled cheese sandwich could taste so good! The Piglet was awesome! But I was more surprised at how good the Smoky Tomato Soup tasted. A good gauge of how good this place is could be the line going out the door. I'd definitely go back.
author: Mark V.

description: Really good! I would recommend the farmers breakfast sandwich! They are right down the street from the Courtyard on 2nd St. They are also eco-friendly. I'm definitely going to eat there again when I'm back in San Fran
author: Tyana G.

description: It is greet!   I enjoyed this place so much! I ordered the basic mousetrap, but added bacon. Definite plus.
author: John N.

description: Mushroom and gruyere grilled cheese was to die for. It was the tastiest grilled cheese I have ever eaten. It was also the fanciest.
author: kira d.

description: Visited here today with a big group before heading to AT&T Park. They have a great selection of mouth watering grilled cheese creations. All reasonably priced (~8-9) and plenty to leave you satisfied. We had the Mushroom Gruyere and Turkey Club with a side of soup. Its mandatory to have soup to dip your grilled cheese.  My only complaint is they need more seating on the patio. Like many places they are a victim of their own popularity.
author: Joe V.

description:
I don't usually write reviews, but on their opening day, I was the guy sitting at the counter with a huge smile on my face making the nom nom nom noises. The Jalepeno Popper sandwich was one of the best things I've tasted in a long time. Bacon and goat cheese?! HFS who knew that those two things would go so well together. Well, they did obviously.
The bread was perfectly toasted, and the cheese and bacon were piping hot. The free satsuma orange was a tasty addition to the meal. 
I'm a pretty big guy and I thought the portion size was just right, meaning I didn't go back to my desk and immediately fall into a cheesy coma.

The staff were very friendly, and I watched the two owners as they were chatting with everyone, which is always nice to see.
Even though the line was already around the block before they opened the doors, it seemed like everyone waiting was friendly and patient as they waited for their orders. It reminded me of waiting in line for Bake Sale Betty's in Oakland. 

The restaurant itself is very attractive. The dark wood counters and blue tile are cool. The spatula motif is perfect. The large Americana Cheese artwork on the wall was unexpected and interesting. It made me think back to my grandma who always made me grilled cheese (with a sweet pickle on the side) when I was a kid.

This place will definitely be a part of my lunch rotation, and I'm looking forward to trying the other sandwiches. I'll also be excited to see what they do for breakfast as it could be a great alternative to grabbing a muffin or a bagel.
author: Scout A.

description: The very best grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had. The  Jalepeno cheese sandwich, doesn't get any better than that on a Sunday morning in San Francisco in the South of Market!  Be sure to order the lavender lemonade, you will not be disappointed.
author: lisa g.

description:
I got the red, white, blue plate special with a mini mushroom gruyere sandwich and tomato soup.  The sandwich was yummy (and really filling with the potatoes in it), the soup was alright.

I was the first to order lunch and still waited about 15 minutes for my food.  I can't figure out why a sandwich place would take that long to make a sandwich, even at peak lunch hour.. oh well.

$10+ is still too much for grilled cheese, but it's better food for the same price I'd pay at Panera.
author: S L.

description: So I know everyone looooves the mushroom gruyere but it was a little too mushroomy for me. I'm a simple girl. I just want a simple grilled cheese. What saved the experience was that my friend ordered the mousetrap which was DELICIOUS. That paired with the tomato soup is worth a trip across town (although the tomato soup is a liiitttle smoky for my taste). They make a good fresh soda too. Tart blackberry rocked the house.
author: Natasha P.

description: The turkey club was delicious! i really enjoy the bread and cheese they use it always makes for a first class grilled cheese. Not having fries as an option was a little surprising to me but i should probably eat a salad anyway. lol. good spot. definitely on my regulars list.
author: Daniel W.

description:
great niche idea for a restaurant and they execute it well!

when i first heard of this place, i thought cool idea but how good can it be.  my wife and i decided that we should drop to try it out.  my wife being a self-proclaimed grilled cheese aficionado was skeptical.

the line was pretty long when we got there but moved pretty quickly.  the staff was really friendly and helpful when it came to choosing the right sandwich.  seating can be a bit hard especially if it's busy but we were able to get a seat indoors.

i got the jalapeno popper and she got the mousetrap.  the jalapeno popper was pretty darn good.  the only 2 things i would say against it would be that the cheese could've been a bit more melted and that the accompanying bacon wasn't as pronounced as i would've liked.  otherwise the flavors were great.  the richness of the cheese worked wonderfully apricot-jalapeno relish.  the mousetrap was a classic grilled cheese sandwich executed very well.  she added roasted tomatoes to it as well and wasn't disappointed.  my one bite left me very happy.

this was our first time in the south park area and we liked it.  we'd come back for the breakfast sandwiches as some of our friends had been there that day too and were raving about them.  the mousetrap will bring us back as well.
author: Swarup B.

description: A great little gem! Best lunch I've had in quite some time! The sandwiches are off the hook, and their choice of cheeses is second-to-none!
author: Zak T.

description: Finally, a place that treats the grilled cheese sandwich with all the respect and gravitas it deserves. They've made it an art and it's delicious. Kudos for being incredibly tasty and original. I love this place.
author: Woodondrums J.

description: I checked this spot out for lunch on Wednesday.  I got the Red, White, and Blue special with tomato soup and jalapeno popper grilled cheese.  Let's just say the tomato soup tasted like it was canned.  I really was expecting better soup from a spot that only specializes in grilled cheese.  Also, I wasn't a fan of my grilled cheese.  The cheese in it tasted like goat cheese which I'm not a fan of.  But, the jalapeno relish tasted gross as I thought it would be more like minced jalapeno but it tasted like JAM.  It comes with a mini apple as well.  Overall, I would not come back - one time is enough!
author: Vicky C.

description: I'd say this is a 3.5 star restaurant but I can't give it that, and I liked it more than 3. My boyfriend and I shared the mousetrap and the mushroom. Both delicious but not the best grilled cheese I've ever eaten. Really liked the homemade sodas, lemonade, and cookies! Also enjoyed the outdoor seating.
author: Amy F.

description: Mushroom gruyere grilled cheese sandwich and smokey tomato soup... it doesn't get more comforting than that on a chilly San Francisco day. The croutons that come with the soup are amazing. Extra point for the clementine. I gotta admit, I was a little hesitant when my girlfriend suggested this place... I told her, "I'm going to need a lot of grilled cheese sandwiches to fill up!" but everything ended working out better than I hoped. I will be back for more...
author: Brian L.

description: Classic Breakfast Sandwich is to die for.  Lunch is great when you need some comfort food on a cold day.
author: Thomas A.

description: A tasty sandwich that comes in a pretty big portion . The service was fast but I wouldn't wait in a long line though.
author: Roger H.

description: Really quick, cuz I have to go to work... this was a really cute, chill place with nice, helpful staff.  While my grilled cheese was very yummy I think the value for the dollar wasn't great.  Also, the tomato soup was "smoky" as advertised but it would have been so much better without the smoke!  I'll definitely be back, but sparingly as the place is a little pricey for what you actually get.  Cheers!
author: Jen J.

description: I think the sandwich that I ordered was good, but it wasn't anything out of this world where I would have to go out of my way to stop at again. I had a regular grilled cheese with bacon and I think it may have had tomato in it but I can't remember. Anyway, it's a small place and if you go on a cold drizzly day then most likely you'll have to fight a crowd to sit down or even stand in an area that doesn't block the staff from busing out the food.
author: V J.

description:
I wrestled over whether to give this place 5 stars because it's been a month now and I want the long lines to finally go away. But its definitely earned its popularity and every last star.  

I'm trying to make my way through the menu, but the Mushroom Gruyere has stalled my progress. I think after a dozen or so more I'll be ready to move on.  Also, the tomato soup is excellent. 

so there it is - a grilled cheese and tomato soup. a meal my mom hastily slapped together  hundreds of times in my childhood. and after a month its my new favorite lunch spot
author: Ben P.

description: I went here with a few other people for lunch on a Saturday around 1 pm. I was surprised by how compact the restaurant was. Most seating was outside, and in SF that can be pretty cold and windy. I ordered a pretty basic grilled cheese sandwich and it was really good, although nothing spectacular. I'd recommend trying the fancier ones. Overall it was fun and good, but it wasn't anything to rave about.
author: Paulette F.

description: Omg, I'm in love!  Awesome lunch for less than $10.  Had the Red White and Blue Plate Special with a Jalapeno Popper sandwich and smoky tomato soup.  Flavor orgasm in my mouth!  My sandwich was amazing - so flavorful with good heat, well cooked thick bacon, nicely toasted, and perfect amount of cheese.  Everything is made with great quality ingredients and they even throw in a cute little red apple.  The tomato soup also comes with a bag of large chunky, rustic, freshly-made croutons and garnished with creme fraiche - oh yeah!
author: Vicente G.

description:
I liked this place.

You can get an extra-special grilled cheese sandwich and then sit in that park, which is nearby, to eat it.  A strawberry in the to-go box---nice touch.  It's just a grilled cheese sandwich, but nice if you don't want to make it yourself.
author: Roxie B.

description:
I thought this was place was freaking amazing, and I don't say that too often! 
I invited two of my colleagues to join me on a sunny-day walk last Friday - we work up at 2nd so it wasn't too far. We didn't have to wait long in line, and the guy who rang me up was really nice (and easy on the eyes, too!) but my friends both complained that their cashier was on the bitchy side. Lucky me, I guess - my cashier even let me order some extra roasted potatoes to put on my Piglet. We found a table outside and waited for about 10-15 minutes. It ended up being four of us, so I didn't think it was that long of a wait - I just wish they were on the sunny side of the street ;)
Whatever wait was absolutely worth it. The Piglet is literally one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. It was the perfect ratio of salty ham to melty sharp cheddar; they kept it light on the apple mustard like I specified; the bread was perfectly toasted and brushed with rosemary butter; and the thin layer of potatoes added a great roasted flavor. 
I had a little carton of milk to chase it down, and it was nice and icy cold because my cute cashier let me come back to the fridge and grab it when I got my sandwich - bonus points for him. Altogether, lunch came to $9.87. I certainly can't afford it every day, but for a lunchtime treat I didn't think it was too expensive.
I did taste my friend's Mousetrap and that was pretty good too, albeit a little one-dimensional and gooey for my taste (maybe it was the fact that there were three different cheeses involved and she didn't order any extras like roasted tomato or pickles).

I will return to try the Jalapeno Popper for sure - the combination of flavors sounds really intriguing. I'm just glad I work a few blocks up the street and can avoid temptation!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Yes, $9.00 is worth it. 

Got the Jalapeño Popper, with no regrets. They don't use pepper jack cheese, but instead use plain monterey jack and apricot-jalapeño relish (along with applewood smoked bacon and chèvre). So good. Next time I'm trying the Piglet, or the Wild Turkey. I also ordered the passionfruit lemonade, which was delicious. It was tart and sweet, but not too much of either. They make their own sodas, and one of the flavors I can remember was grapefruit-peppercorn. I'd like to try it someday, but I'm glad I went with the lemonade. 

I work in the Financial Dist, so a coworker and I took Muni over to the ballpark, and walked up a couple blocks to AGCK. We got there by 11:20, and were back in our desks within an hour. If you are planning on doing what we did, I recommend getting there by 11:30 if you want a seat and you don't want to wait in line.
author: erin a.

description: This place is really good! The cheese is exceptional! I highly recommend the piglet and mushroom gruyere. I haven't tried the jalapeño popper yet but I hear people raving about it all the time! The tomato soup is awesome as well. Of you're up to spending 9 dollars on a great sandwich come here!
author: Slo C.

description: I got the Jalapeño Popper. I don't think it's that expensive. I mean the concept of paying 8-9 bucks for grilled cheese is expensive, but this is something that I could not or probably would be too lazy to make on my own. Then again, I didn't have to pay -- so maybe that's why I didn't think it was expensive. I came with a bunch of my co workers, so service took reasonably long. I liked how crispy the bread was. I didn't really like the apricot too much. It made the sandwich on the sweet side. Loved how there was bacon in this one. I think the other sandwich I would have liked to try was the mushroom one. Overall, I thought this was above average.
author: Vera W.

description:
I have now answered the question "Will I stand in a very long line and wait and wait for a grilled cheese sandwich?".  Answer: YES.  And would I do it again? YES, YES, YES.
To call these grilled cheese sandwiches seriously undervalues them  Yes, there's cheese. And bread. And melty-yumminess. But they're far more than that.  Dining companion's Piglet was the closest to a traditional grilled cheese --  with artisanal bread and roasted tomato.  My Jalapeno Popper was exceptional.  Both had the smokey tomato soup with a drop of creme fraiche and yummy home made croutons in a little paper bag. Two happy mouths.
Follow them on Facebook to find out about their special events, menu changes, and yummy cookies-and-milk happy hours.
author: Sarah L.

description: I am a huge grilled cheese fan, so I was definitely excited when this opened in my neighborhood. Love the gourmet/down home spin on a classic. Could use a little more variety of sandwiches, but I love the original mousetrap and amazing bread pudding! This will be one of my regulars.
author: Hilary C.

description: Pretty cool place..but quite a walk from union square in SF.  But well worth the walk as the sandwiches were quite tasty with great cheeses and meat sandwiches...and great drinks too....good food and company will always make a great rating for yelp!
author: Jeremy K.

description: This place gets a solid respectable 3 stars.  The mushroom and gruyere and the Moscone were nice if not a little.... bland.  The bread has a great texture, crispy and buttery and crunchy and oozing with cheese but that's all I can say about it.  It's just pleasant.... and bland.  I was piling on the hot sauce, with salt it would have been perfect.  The two sandwiches and 1 can of coconut juice was $22.
author: Walerz B.

description: Finally got to check this place out for lunch this weekend. I thought it was definitley good and plan on trying the other grilled cheese options on the menu. Cool, chill place where you can order and then eat outside. Nice way of taking a simple sandwich and making it interesting.
author: Raj P.

description: Awesome eatery;place!!  great grilled cheese sandwiches..so many variations on the cheese, it can't get any better than this!!  the Mousetrap sandwich..delicious w/ melt tasting bite of cheddar ..a kitchen delight!!
author: Sarah M.

description:
LOVE this place! Every time I'm in the neighborhood I have to stop in. My favorite is the Jalapeno Popper with the apricot preserves, two types of cheese, jalapenos (duh) and thick bacon. Their homemade drinks are always different and interesting. So far I've tried the anise/ginger soda, pomegranite lemonade, and lemon/lavendar soda. All very refreshing and surprisingly tasty.

Line can be a bit long and yes the prices are sorta silly for grilled cheese...but you can't get this stuff anywhere else so I say it's worth a splurge and a heck of a lot better than fast food or just a club sandwich anywhere else.
author: Ariel G.

description: What can I say, grilled cheese and tomato soup for 8 bucks.  This is the place to go for a comforting lunch.  I got the jalapeno popper grilled cheese.  It was amazing.
author: jessica b.

description:
Is there anything better than a grilled cheese sandwich? Honestly. This place is amazing. 

I had the Don Gondola, and it was simply fantastic. The bread was crispy and great- not greasy or burnt at all. 

Do want again.

I went in the early afternoon, and all the outside seats were taken, but there wasn't much of a line. I can see how the line would get super crazy though. Definitely recommend going before or after the lunch hour.
author: Adam P.

description: The Last thing I ate before I left SF - So this may be slanted - Also, I don't really like melted cheese and in actuality, I hate sandwiches, well, until recently when I saw a Reeve Oliver video...that's besides the point. I guess I am trying to explain why this isn't a 5. the atmosphere is adorable. The staff cool and the food is made and prepared in front of you. I ordered the Jala-Grilled Cheese with Tomato Soup and I was beyond impressed. Going back next time for sure - thanks Angela for a great recommendation.
author: Theresa G.

description: Stopped in for lunch since I was in the neighborhood. Had the mushroom gruyere and it was absolutely divine. I'll definitely have to come back! The mimosas are tasty and relatively inexpensive.
author: William B.

description: HEAVEN not only is the bread gluten free and delicious but the ham and gruyere cheese sandwich is outstanding!  Ham is not to salty or sweet, it's just perfect.  I like to get the creative spreads on the side so that I may enjoy the pure taste of the sandwich and then kick it up a notch on my next bite with the tangy savory spread options they have.  Enjoy Enjoy!!
author: T W.

description: Outstanding sandwiches & not JUST grilled cheese. These guys change up the menu fairly frequently as well, so there opportunities for new favorites all the time.
author: J.P. W.

description: DELICIOUS!! I'm in grilled cheese love. I had to wait a little long for the sandwich, not at all saying they're slow, but that's what you get for going at lunch hour. Love how they give you a little mandarin too :)
author: Ashley A.

description: Who likes grilled cheese and beer in an outside setting? I do!!  Cant wait for this place to come.  Met the owner Heidi and she was so friendly.   Pictures of the grilled cheese look tasty.  This is going to be my new favorite lunch spot!  Updates once they open.
author: dion c.

description: This is a great place. The food is fresh, it tastes great and the atmosphere is tremendous. Fun is the word I would use. I am a world traveler and this is a world class place. In addition to the sandwiches, I suggest you try the sodas and pickles too. Everything has been carefully selected or developed to complete the experience. I like my sandwiches crispy and traditional, and you can get those here, along with a number of gourmet alternatives. Who knew that grilled cheese could be so exciting!
author: ed g.

description: Astounding sandwiches on gluten-free bread. I will be here before every Giants day game to eat a breakfast sandwich and have a beer before batting practice.
author: David T.

description:
pricey but one of the best grilled cheese i ever had.
My colleagues from NYC always make a point to drop by TAGCK whenever they're in the city. 

Turkey sandwich
Mushroom Gruyere
author: S J.

description: The food was good but nothing to write home about.  I got the Red, White & Blue Plate Special, which came with a TINY sandwich, a giant bowl of soup (that was just a step above Campbells) and a strawberry - yes, A SINGLE strawberry.  Add on a Raspberry Lemonade (that was pure sugar) and the bill totals a whopping $13!  Just when I thought there was a place in SF to enjoy a quick, inexpensive lunch, I was wrong.  I'd rather cook my grilled cheese at home!
author: William A.

description: I make a pretty mean grilled cheese sando, but can't compete with the jalapeno popper sand with a side of deep green organic salad with the lightest of oil and vinegar dressings.  The bread is faboo and if you get there early, you can grab an outside table and people watch your lunch hour away.  Fun stuff.  Good grub.
author: Scott W.

description:
the guy behind the corner kept ignoring me. it was weird because he kept talking to the people in front of and behind me but pretended i wasnt there. new restaurant should exude excellent customer service, or how about just being polite?!

almost everything on the menu was sold out - poor management and planning
the place was messy and the staff didnt know left from right - poor training, no organization

only 4 small sandwiches left. the guy i front of me ordered the 2 with meat. he was charged $3.24. i was left with 2 mushroom & cheese sandwiches but was charged $9.86

because they ran out of food, the same rude guy behind the register started to hand out cookies for free. he went to everyone but walked right past me like i wasnt even there.

i paid for and took the sandwich because i walked out of my way to try this place. though after being there for 3 minutes, i knew i would never return.

after waiting for what i thought was too long to make a grilled cheese sandwich, i finally got it and left immediately. get home and it's burnt! the bread is so hard it hurts and scratches the roof of my mouth.

hated this place
i'm really disappointed that i will not be going back

UPDATE:
the owner sent a message apologizing for my experience. i may go back if in the neighborhood.
author: Deka M.

description: Great sandwiches.  Be prepared to wait for a while though especially during the lunch rush but you won't be disappointed.  After lunch and you have time for drinks, just cross the street!
author: C. B.

description: I am a lover of simple things and grilled cheese tops that list. the moscone with pesto and tomato sandwich and tomato soup combo for $8 is amazing. I also love the gruyere with mushrooms and always get my friend to buy it so we can sample. I also order an arnold palmer and mosey on over to a table outside...excellent combo on a beautiful day. It's hard not to love anything this cheesy. Wuhaha...
author: sherrie n.

description: Pretty good selection of sandwiches.  The one I had was very good.  The blondes are also quite tasty.  There is not a lot of outdoor seating, and I wish it was open later, but overall a great place for a quick lunch.
author: Jessica O.

description: I came all the way from chicago to eat Nate and Heidi's Grilled Cheese and it was worth it!  What a great place.
author: Drew D.

description:
Good food.  Excellent.

The Coffee is the TERRIBLE.  The coffee is SO BAD, that I do not eat there if I want coffee.  Can someone clue these folks in that they have the worst coffee in the South Park area?  Great food with the worst coffee in the area
author: Guest a.

description:
all the rave and likes i've been hearing about this place.....finally! i tried it. i would say it was a pleasant first experience, BUT something happened. 

i ordered a MOUSETRAP (with roasted tomatoes) and an ARNOLD PALMER...ok, it was all good. then the bill came up to $16-... i was like WTF?! right? and my food came up, and he hands me two orders. FUCK! i didn't order a jalapeno grilled cheese sammies. NONONO... it was a dumb mistake in two ways: a dumb mistake that i NEVER noticed that the front person punched in another order (UMMM).and a dumb mistake for the front person that punched in another order, since I NEVER SAID I WANTED A JALAPENO GRILLED CHEESE! nononono. it never came out of my mouth. never!

staff were apologetic, regardless, and refunded that mistake. i'm totally a forgiving person, so i'll let it pass by, for now. but hey! come, still. just don't make that dumb mistake, really. oh yea... BUSY AS HELL DURING LUNCH HOURS. please, come before noon.
author: Marc K.

description: Great prices, good sandwiches.  I give it 4/5 because I am a cheese monger and was expecting more upscale cheeses and for staff to know more about the products they were serving.  Great for the price though.
author: lauren s.

description:
i came here the first day it opened.  i had high expectations for one reason.  if your specialty is a grilled cheese sandwich and that's all you basically offer, then it better be damn good! i would say it was just good.   i had the jalapeno popper sandwich ($9).  in my sandwich, there was too much apricot and it overpowered every other flavor.  description said apricot-jalapeno relish - really?!?!?! all i tasted was apricot.  it was sweet and didn't live up to its name.  a friend had the piglet and i liked hers better than mine.  we wanted to get the mousetrap but, of course, they ran out.  by the way, they pre-make the sandwiches so no customizing your orders.  oh - they did give you a clementine with your order which i thought was a nice touch.

so i would say it's a solid 3 stars.  i wouldn't wait in line for it but i would try it again once they are opened for breakfast.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Four star sandwich x 0.5 actual experience = 2 stars.

You should NEVER have to wait 50 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich.  This is not, say, waiting an hour outside Dottie's for a table like everybody else.  This is we waited in line for 10 minutes (reasonable), then sat there for almost an hour while we saw everyone who was in line behind us eat and leave.  By the time we got our sandwiches, we were some of the only people left outside.

My friend's salad came out after 15 minutes (a while for a salad, but fair enough).  Another half hour went by, so I went up to the counter and when the lady (finally) made eye contact with me, I said, "Excuse me, my friend got her salad half an hour ago and we're still waiting on two sandwiches so I was just checking."  Her response, "Well, yeah, salads come out faster than sandwiches."  That's it.  Classy.

They came out 5 or 10 minutes later.  It was good.  I got the Mouse Trap (excellent) and tomato soup (I've had better).  As far as the sandwich, I'm sure enough cheese and butter would make anything taste good.

I wanted to like this place but I can't really recommend the experience I had to anybody.
author: Jeff S.

description: Good crusty crunchy cheesy sandwiches. Good made-on-the-spot sodas. Good menu. Soup, meh.
author: scott w.

description:
came here twice now for lunch. i like having their tomato soup and organic salads. i like their mac and cheese WITH BACON. 

many different parings and i heard the poppers were really good too. I would like to try more from their menu. 

service was great. the ladies and gents that work there care about everyone and try to keep everything in great shape. i wanna try the mouse trap too :D
author: KK M.

description: I had the Farmer's Delight, and it was the most delicious melty food thing that has graced my mouth in a while. I recommend it to the hardy meal lovers, but not the small salad crew.
author: Finn C.

description: Delicious!!  Best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had!  My friend and I shared the Mouse Trap with bacon pieces and the Mushroom Gruyere and it was great!  Arteries were clogged but it was well worth it!  I'm determined to try their entire menu! :)
author: Lu G.

description: Super over priced and super greasy. Get a panini at D'Urso cafe nearby.
author: Joe S.
