description: I don't come here for the sandwiches (although they are delicious).  I come here for the blondies.  My partner brought one home one night, after I had a rough day at work, and I swear my mood went from sour to sweet!!!
author: Kevin W.

description: About a buck too expensive and 5 minutes too long to wait, but who's counting?  I really hope they stick around so go there, quit your complaining and enjoy a tasty grilled cheese sandwich.  Go early, go late, go in a few months from now, just go.
author: Junglist S.

description: The place was "wow"! Excellent cheese on the sandwich and the tomato soup was amazing. I recommend the Mousetrap with the Smokey Tomato Soup for dipping. Plus they encourage cheese puns.
author: Travis C.

description: YUM. Loved this place. My grilled cheese was perfect! Highly recommend. I even found street parking easily around the corner in the little park area.
author: Margot G.

description: Another South Park wonder -The place for sandwiches.  Love the Moscone with Tomato soup.Better arrive early or prepare to wait...
author: michael p.

description: Went here just once on a Saturday.  Long line in front of me but fast service.  If I worker near here I'd go every day.  It delicious, filling, cheap enough, and it was great service too.  Great food, can't stress that enough.
author: Theo T.

description: If you've read my other reviews, I try to eat at celiac friendly restaurants because I date one.  Well, here's a good lunch spot. Their gluten free bread is delicious! I'm not celiac, but this bread has some rosemary or something inside it and it's just better than regular bread.  I also really liked their tomato soup. A must try is the special diet cola they have. Yes, I also only drink diet soda and was excited to try out this non-diet pepsi/coke glass bottle diet cola.  That cola is good! The price is steep for a grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup since you can make that yourself for under $3 so I only recommend this joint if you're a celiac looking for a lunch spot near south beach.
author: Virginia L.

description:
The most BOMB sandwich I can get for lunch at work! I had the Jalapeno Popper and it was tasty with unexpected flavors, and just plain awesome. The staff was friendly and the service was quick. 
I will be back again and the only thing I am not looking forward to is choosing only 1.
author: Katie f.

description:
Dear ACGK,
I wanted to love you. I am a big fan of cheese.  
But the Mushroom & Gruyere was sad.  I combo/flavors could have been great, but the sandwich was NOT made with love.  The potatoes were oily and cold and the mushroom mixture was not evenly applied.  (I know this is persnickety, but if I'm paying $9 fora sandwich, please get it right.)  And the wait took FOREVER even though it was not that crowded.  Probably won't venture back soon - the wait and the prices are major deterants.
author: Jane M.

description: Extremely delicious, what a great find! This is a new restaurant/diner that only serves grilled cheese! And It's really mother-f-ing good, with all sorts of awesome cheeses, and combos with bacon and avocado. You can't really miss with this place. Reasonable prices, great service. I highly recommend it.
author: Gabe T.

description: A good sandwich place for lunch, but then again I love grilled cheese. It's not as ridiculously crowded now as I heard it was when they first opened, so definitely worth checking out.
author: David K.

description: awesome food. tried the jalapeno popper and the mousetrap. both were pretty solid. sat outside (very limited seating indoors), and there were no heaters so it was freezing.
author: Aasim J.

description: Oh how I wanted to like this place....while the sandwiches were rather tasty (4 stars), I have an issue with paying over $9 for a grilled cheese sandwich with some veggies and a layer of thinly sliced chicken breast (minus 1 star).
author: Sandy Y.

description:
i could go for a GC anytime. what's not to like about butter toasted bread, cheese, and meat. great comfort food on a cold day, with nice outdoor seating and beer to enjoy on a sunny day. 

mushroom gruyere is awesome, and the mousetrap is pretty good. don't bother with the tomato soup though - it's watery, salty, and uninteresting. 

will definitely be coming back to try other sandwiches.
author: David C.

description: Ordinary sandwiches, with extraordinary ingredients.  Grilled cheese will never turn its back on you.
author: Paul K.

description:
another fail... how is this place so popular still? $8 for 2 pieces of bread and 2 slices of cheese?

I just don't get it.. I'm willing to revise my reviews if they start putting cheese on their grilled cheese sandwiches.
author: Shawn A.

description: Ok...I enjoy the fact that those among us can drop $8 for a grilled cheese sandwich. I like the mousetrap that I had, but remind to return when the "great recession" ends. This place is pricey! OUCH!
author: h. w.

description: First time here. Five stars for the sandwich and the ginger star anise soda I had. The mushroom gruyere was amazing. It was difficult to choose one sandwich because they all sound amazing. One star off for the bitchy cashier who acted like she was put out to have to take my order. I even paid cash! Whatever. You work at a crazy busy place - be glad you have a job, hater.
author: Natalie T.

description: I got to try the Mushroom Gruyere lately...it's Awesome! Now, i don't know if i like the Jalapeno Popper more or the Mushroom Gruyere! Decisions, Decisions!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I give this place the most props for being original.  Having a good selection of cheese with enough variety for repeat visits and custom daily special soda, really the only downside to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen is the price.  For $14, I got the Mousetrap sandwich with bacon, pickles, and tomatoes, a soda, and chips.  Don't get me wrong, it was all really delicious (though I'm definitely getting the more delicious Mushroom Gruyère next time), but it's just an awful lot of money to spend on a fairly simple grilled cheese sandwich that can be easily replicated at home.
author: Jeff N.

description: I was condo sitting my friend's place in South Beach area and this was within walking distance and I'm all about grilled cheese.  So after trying the simplest of their menu, the Mousetrap, I was hooked and went back almost everyday to try like every other sandwich on their menu. The Jalapeno Popper is hot (I took my friend to try it and he was surprisingly in agreement -he's my gauge for is it really that hot). The tomato soup is great.  They always give you a piece of fruit too so the meal feels rounded and mom would approve...haha.  I have also tried one of their breakfast sandwiches.  But my favorite so far is the Mac and Cheese sandwich, macaroni & cheese stuffed inside grilled bread, pure heaven if you're a mac & cheese lover.  So bottom line is I'm sooo hooked on this place that it's always calling my name.  I don't think I can come to SF and not go there, that's how bad I'm hooked.  Now I just wish they would open one in the South Bay area.
author: Stacey M.

description:
This is the second time getting a grilled cheese from this absolutely amazing place! We were one of the first to have our order delivered to our office via their new pilot bike delivery service : ) Our order was confirmed at 10:40 am and delivered right on time at 11:30am.

Nate was very friendly on the phone and our bike deliver Steve was equally amazing!

I ordered the jalapeno popper which had just enough sweetness to offset the heat. We also ordered the moscone, mousetrap with bacon, mousetrap with ham and side soup and salad.

If you are looking for a delicious treat... go here!
author: Raquel M.

description: The sign on the wall says "Visualize Grilled Cheese" -  and visualize it you will as you stare at the cheesy menu yo-yoing back & forth between sandwich options. I recommend the Mushroom Gruyère or the Mousetrap but all of the sandwhiches are pretty delicious. A few caveats -the house "New York deli-style pickles" aren't as tasty as they look and get there before noon or plan to wait in line for 30 minutes.
author: Allison C.

description: DH decided to treat me to an adventure in San Francisco which included stopping by for a bite at the American Grilled Cheese Kitchen.  I ordered the Mushroom Gruyere grilled cheese sandwich.  They didn't scrimp on the size and the flavor was delicious.  I also ordered a side of the tomato soup which had a little spiciness to it but equally as good.  If I'm ever in the city again I will definitely try it again.  Wish they had something like this in the south bay.
author: Mary Lou L.

description: Never thought you could have gourmet grilled cheese, but I am glad to be wrong on that one.  Had the Jalapeno popper and mac and cheese ones: best grilled cheese sandwiches I've had!
author: Terence L.

description: I've been here many times for lunch and it doesn't disappoint. Their butternut squash soup is creamy & delicious. The Mousetrap grilled cheese is like the classic grilled cheese but better with Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti & Monterey jack. Definitely recommend for a quick lunch spot in SOMA.
author: Keira A.

description: I had the Mushroom Gruyère sandwich for lunch and it was super delicious. The wait wasn't too bad. But I would limit my visit to once a month and you know why!
author: Anbu A.

description: We love neighborhood restaurants, even if they are in someone else's neighborhood, so it's not uncommon for us to cross the bridge and go on a mini adventure.  American Grilled Cheese was worth the gas, the toll, the parking.  Bread is crusty country loaf like I love - and we went for breakfast so our gooey grilled cheese also had the perfect runny over easy egg.  Yum!  Total cost for 2 including one heck of a lot of bacon for Yas was $15...    Owners are friendly and gracious.  And the morning cyclists made the whole adventure a visual delight.  Yummy food, fun people watching, easy access.  Enjoy!
author: Ruth S.

description: Got a facial at SugarCane in SouthPark, and headed over for my second visit to TAGCK and ordered the gruyere and mushroom w tomato soup 1/2 order.  Soup was so yummy that I am not sure what they put in it, like fairy dust or something that made me more that happy.  So, I dunk the grilled cheese into the soup as instructed by Jeneill at Grasshopper and now I am kinda all warm and fuzzy feeling.  Could go a bit lighter on the butter and even a bit crunchier on the bread but I am not complaining by any stretch. This place is perfect for lunch and my new goal is to make it in time for breakfast soon.
author: Sara H.

description: overrated.  $10 grilled cheese, good lunch business concept, but when you get overrun, how can you grill each to perfection?  my jalapeno popper had an awesome apricot jalapeno salsa but the bread was dry -- overgrilled and bacon chewy.  even right after the lunch rush, still can take 20 min.
author: Rob C.

description: I love grilled cheese sandwiches, in all shapes and sizes. So when I heard of this place, my mouth immediately watered. I've only been here once so far and got the turkey sandwich. Man, was that a good sandwich! Hit the spot so good! The bread was toasted well, the cheese melted perfectly, the turkey had the right turkey-ness to it. I loved it. I couldn't concentrate at my desk when I was eating it. (I went their on my lunch break during work one day). I'll definitely go back to try their other sandwiches.
author: Robin I.

description:
Huge fan of grilled cheese, like it would be one of my last meal requests should I find myself on death row (not gonna happen). Anyway, my sister (also a big fan of the stuff) and I were highly intriqued by this restaurant. We lurked the yelp reviews, salivated over the website menu, and made our choices. One Sunday at lunch, we dragged my dear hubby (who hates the stuff, but I married him anyway) and baby over the bridge for a special trip to this place. Oh, but we longed to love it, were really hoping to. Alas, it greatly disappointed on many levels. Here goes-
Sis and I got the tomato soup and basic mousetrap, no extras.
- the grilled was fair, had decent crisp to the bread, but cheese was not completely melted in the middle. Could get this anywhere.
- the soup was terrible! Luke-warm, needed salt, seasoning, something. Campbells is better, how sad.
- grapes are a cute, refreshing albeit unnecessary touch.
Hubby got the turkey club, sans cheese.
- your basic sandwich, nothing earth-shattering but filled the belly.
Also got the piglet to try/split.
- yuck! Maybe it's the rosemary butter, but this tasted really funny, like off. The next day, I threw my leftover half away. 
Parking was limited but we got lucky on the street. Table seating is extremely minimal, so we did the awkward standing around, trying not to stare people down, until a table freed up. 
It really is just a coffee shop that serves grilled cheese. This is definitely NOT a destination place, despite the siren-call of its name. If you happen to be in the area, then by all means go and satisfy your craving. Do not expect greatness. BTW, we heard rumors that Lady Gaga went there. Hmm, wonder if she liked it.
author: Joan C.

description:
An entire restaurant devoted to American grilled cheese sandwiches- oh my taste buds are dancing and heart fluttering! On opening day, I rushed over to South Park to find out what all the buzz was about and please my tummy. I imagined taking one big bite of ooey, gooey cheese bliss with a sip of red wine. It was a perfect Friday afternoon in San Francisco, the wind still, the sun beaming, no clouds in the sky. I thought it would be nice for us to sit on the swings in South Park after lunch and lull.   I did some advanced research and found that they even have house made, gluten-free bread! Just the concept had me going, but then I learned that the restaurant chef/owner is a seven time winner of the Grilled Cheese Invitational. This was like having easy access to an Iron Chef. Oh, I can see Bobby Flay  showing up for a throwdown.  I was only to be disappointed when I finally got there. They were SOLD OUT! Oh, my taste buds cried and I no longer cared about the swings....

A few weeks later, I did go back and waited for 45 minutes before I got my grilled cheese and tomato soup. I was so hungry I couldn't really evaluate the taste, but didn't think it was exceptional. I was forced to get the only vegetarian grilled cheese that they were not sold out of...will have to give them a third chance in a few more months when the hype simmers down.
author: Nimisha G.

description: Can't say I get it. Awful service, mediocre food and high prices. Cute atmosphere and interesting menu but I couldn't taste all the interesting ingredients they supposedly used in my Moscone. Good croutons for the soup but burnt and much too crunchy/hard for the salad. Ran out of soda syrup for the person ordering after me, instead of telling them there wasn't enough, they split my portion in half with theirs so I basically paid $3 for a cup of soda water. Won't be coming back, interesting concept though.
author: Amy C.

description: Went here last Thursday and got a mushroom and gruyere. The sandwich was wonderful, pretty much what you expect from combining really good chopped mushrooms with an equally good cheese. The grilled cheese didn't come with fries or anything like that, but instead with a strawberry. I looked at it at first wondering why they put a single strawberry with it instead of something savory, but the strawberry tasted so sweet and amazing and it felt like he perfect way to end the meal. All around great place.
author: Phillip B.

description: Update: I went back and tried this place again, and I have to say I was much happier the second time around. I got the red, white and blue plate special with the turkey club grilled cheese and the tomato soup and I couldn't put it down It was just so good. Also, ordering the special knocks the price down quite a bit and is still a decent amount of food.
author: Meredith B.

description: Really Yummy, melt in your mouth grill cheese. but I do not do lines, please get another register to love us in out faster
author: P C.

description: Great lunch here today.  A group of eight of us went down at 11:30 (yes, I do recommend being early - this place is still packed, with the line stretching around the corner, by noon).  We all ordered different sandwiches and each and everyone was delicious.  I got the Moscone, which had tomato and pesto on it, so divine. So good. We also all got soup (tomato with creme fraiche!) and blondies.  Everything was buttery and delicious.  Only problem they seem to have is that there is just NO room to sit down anywhere.  We managed to snag a table only through being grossly aggressive, which made me really uncomfortable.  Oh, the joys of comfort food on a beautiful Friday afternoon.
author: Adam T.

description: Cold Summer day in SF, warm grilled cheese, and tomato soup.  it doesn't get any better.  I had the jalapeno popper sandwich with tomato soup.  good flavor, good bread, good cheese... a darn good sandwich that I'd never make at home.  Tomato soup - good solid basic tomato soup with croutons.  Service - quick.  Price - normal for SF.  $9 for a small sandwich and soup may seem high, but it's on par with most SF lunch places.  Seating - limited indoors.
author: Nedra D.

description:
I *just* finished what has to be the best grilled cheese I've ever had.  I ordered the turkey club ($9).  It was really, really scrumdiddies.  

At 11:45, my order was taken immediately.  I did have to wait about 7 minutes for my sandwich (I'll look into phone ordering next time), but it was worth it.

Nice place.  Friendly people :)  I'm going to go broke because I just started working across the street.  Now if I can just come up with a board-worthy "cheezy pun".
author: John S.

description: Yes, these guys are still working out kinks, but they are trying hard and are super nice! The soup and homemade croutons rock. I had the plain grilled cheese, it was good, but nothing to wait on for more than 10 minutes. I think I'll add bacon next time. I was also happy with portions, infact I'll do half sandwich and soup next time.  I'd suggest skipping breakfast or just have a cup of joe, showing up at 10:55 for place to open. I did, was second in line, and appears I had a better experience than many.
author: Kelli G.

description: Not what I had hoped for!  It seemed like someone went to culinary school and tried to make a bunch of great stuff in a hurry.  As a result none of it was really that great but it sure looks and sounds like it would be!  I wouldn't recommend it to someone unless they are really hungry and already standing in front of the restaurant!
author: Daniel V.

description:
i was finally able go here today as i've heard a lot about it.  we were worried that the line would be long since it was right about the time the giants game started, but the line was only about three parties long when we arrived around 1:30 pm.  i ordered the mushroom gruyere and the tomato soup.  overall, the food was good, but not amazing,  i'm not sure how much better a grilled cheese sandwich could get though.

the service was very friendly and good. we got a cookie that was rock hard, and when we asked them if we could exchange it, got an apology along with two other baked goods in exchange.  

there is not much seating, but we snagged a table outside although it was pretty cold and windy.
hopefully, this place expands their seating size along with their menu!
author: Yummy E.

description: If you have a craving for grilled cheese this might be the place.  I have eaten here three times and well its just something you have to be in the mood for. I made the mistake of ordering the Moscone, a fancy grilled cheese, that was actually pretty gross. Stick to the simple Mouse Trap and you can't go wrong.  On the down side this place is VERY slow. They have one thing on the menu yet it takes 22 minutes to get a sandwich at lunch; they need to improve this or they are going to lose customers. Also the price point is a bit high. $13 bucks for soup and a bowl of tomato soup is a bit on the high side. For the money and time you have to invest in this place the grilled cheese at Paragon down the road may be a better bet. All in all would go back, if I had the itch, but for sure not the place to grab a quick bite; you will wait and wait and wait..................
author: Eric R.

description: Three words--Yum, yum and yum!  Friendly and fast service.  No nonesense and easy!
author: g m.

description: WAY overpriced, but I'm hooked - high quality ingredients and delicious combinations. Favorites are the Piglet, Jalapeno Popper, and Mushroom Gruyere. The staff is also impressive - fast and efficient.
author: Jessica T.

description: Melted cheese and mushrooms on nice cruchy buttery bread.  It's good, really good.  Don't expect it to be quick, the lines can be quite long but it's well worth it. The ingredients are top notch and melted cheese is always good in my book...
author: OakMama D.

description:
1 hour in line, 1 hour to get my mediocre sandwich after i placed an order.  plus the orange i got was deformed.   plus they got my friends orders wrong.  

my hint of salt triscuits and gruyere combo tastes better.
author: Bing S.

description: I just finished one of my new favorite sandwiches, the Jalapeño Popper. Spicy, sweet, salty, creamy and crusty all in the same bite! Great re-invention of the classic grilled cheese.
author: Rob W.

description: Okay, so they had me at  "grilled cheese." Why didn't anyone think of this before? Everyone loves grilled cheese! Especially with some leeks and adult favorites thrown in. The sandwiches are simply delicious. We shared the Mushroom Gruyere  and the Moscone. The big, fresh strawberry in the basket was the perfect touch. I am taking one star away for not having enough beverage choices or enough seating.
author: REN S.

description: Grilled cheese sandwiches are one of the ultimate comfort foods and from the first bite of my mushroom gruyere it was like all my problems were solved. Yes, the butter on the bread makes it alll better too. It was so good, I won't ruin it for you. They have homemade sodas, nice dill pickles, funky beers and really good brownies. The grilled cheese sandwiches are the main attraction though. Smarter to go there earlier for brunch. Be prepared to line up for lunch.
author: Amanda C.

description: Working in Oakland makes it difficult to get to these places so when I took a random weekday off, this was the first place I tried.  I got the lunch special with the gruyere and mushroom sandwich with smoked tomato soup and it was TASTY and satisfying.  The bread was toasted perfectly and NOT burnt as described in previous reviews.  Maybe they had a little pow-wow after reading the reviews and made some changes.  Husband had the turkey and cheese and he was pretty happy.  I also enjoyed their homemade lemonade, which wasn't too sweet or tart.  I arrived around 1:00 and didn't have to wait in a line.  However, 15 minutes later, there was a line of 8-9 behind us.  Outdoor seating is limited so getting your order to-go might be helpful.  If there aren't any seats open, you can find a bench at the park around the corner!
author: Nina L.

description: Welcome to South Park! The small but tasty menu makes you want to try just about all of the items on there, and if you were really hungry you probably could since the portions are not huge. The quality is quite superb for a grilled cheese and i don't know who that kind waitress was that gave me a free chocolate cake but she deserves one in return. There seems to always be a line here but just get your food to go and eat at the park around the corner.
author: Jim L.

description: Yummmmm.  Heidi and Nate rock the cheese.  The wild mushroom sandwich is divine, and the turkey with havarti was yummy.  I can't wait to try the other sandwiches.  If I didn't work in north bay I'd be a regular.
author: Sharon H.

description: A little overpriced for a grilled cheese sandwich but pretty tasty.  I had the mushroom gruyere sammy with a small organic salad (with very tasty vinagarette) and some iced tea for $15.  Will probably go back and try a few different types, but it's certainly nothing to wait in line for (i.e., don't go during peak lunch hour because you'll waste half your time looking for parking and getting a sandwich which well be un-melted by the time you get back to your office.)
author: Maxine S.

description:
Picture this: two croutons with melted cheese, sitting in a bath of grease. 

That could be a recipe for deliciousness, but it ended up being just overpriced, poorly executed, too crispy for its own good. The best part of the meal was the little mandarin orange that was added as the side dish.

Granted, I am a bit of a grilled cheese snob, but the bread was fried to a point where any delicious quality had long since departed, the aged cheddar tasted like maybe tillamook at best, and the combination fell far short of what should have been a slam-dunk.

They are still new, so hopefully they will ready all the two and three-star reviews, and make the food something that I can eat a few times a week!

...update: bumping to 4 stars for their awesome breakfast sandwich!
author: Sam H.

description: I had the Piglet here and it was fantastic. There's nothing boring or simple about these grilled cheese sandwiches and it's affordable with each sandwich being less than $10. At first I was hesitant because I figured I could make this stuff at home, but they grill the bread to just the right amount of crispiness. I can't say I could do the same. Definitely stop here for lunch. Each of the sandwiches comes with an apple on the side and they sell the bottled sodas here, which I can appreciate since they are better tasting than the canned ones.
author: Justin Y.

description: Good snack on the way to the ballpark. Friendly service but limited options and high price.
author: Jacqueline F.

description: awesome staff very creative menu and most of all the best grilled cheese i've had
author: Andy T.

description:
My husband and I had wanted to try this place the last time we went to a Giants game and today happened to be the day.  What a splendid and DELICIOUS surprise!  

I had the jalapeno popper and he had the mousetrap (other reviews can tell you exactly what's in them). The mousetrap is a classic, comfort food grilled cheese sandwhich with a more elevated taste due to the right combo of cheeses on buttery toasted bread. The jalapeno popper was a delight (seriously I can't stop thinking about it!) with bacon, cheese, and jalapeno relish - the right amount of kick, sweet, melted cheese, and rustic bread.  My husband and I each sampled from the other's sandwhich and we were both head over heels for the jalapeno popper.  

Yeah the prices are a little high for what it is: grilled cheese.  But I am more than willing to pay a little more for a place that does one thing and does it well.
author: Melissa O.

description: Came before a Giants game on a Sunday.  It wasn't too busy.  We ordered at 11:45, so we were too early to order off the lunch menu.  If you come too late, you run the risk of them running out of certain menu items.  I'm guessing they try to ration out their stock between the breakfast and lunch crowd.  Some of the items are on both menus, so this might not be an issue for you.  The only differences I saw between our breakfast sandwiches and the lunch ones is that they add an apple for the lunch orders and charge you $3 more.  The sandwiches might be bigger, but I couldn't really tell.  I left satisfied but not full.  I still want to come back and try some of the other items off the lunch menu.
author: Denise C.

description:
Went there for lunch and ordered the mousetrap with tomato.  It was good, but not for the price.  The cheeses didn't really complement each other and just melted and glued together into a cheese blob.  It felt like a over-cheesed, under finessed product.

They need to work on getting some unique flavor profiles to really get past an average, over proved grilled cheese.
author: S J.

description: Went there at 2:30 PM. Long line had died down. Only one other person in line. Ordered the Mousetrap with bacon on gluten-free bread. The staff was super friendly, more than I am comfortable with. I'm not into being chatted up, but that's just me. I brought in Cook's Illustrated to read while I waited for my food. The cashier stopped me, and offered me their kitchen's copy of Cook's Illustrated collected recipes. Very nice, thoughtful. The sandwich arrived, and I must say, it was totally worth! However, I don't know if it's worth waiting an hour in line, which I didn't, of course, only a douche bag hipster would do so. My advice, only go there for a late lunch.
author: Jay D.

description: I can't believe some people rated this place 2 stars because of expense. Yes it's pricey. We are in San Francisco, get used to it people. This place rocks, my socks in fact. The flavor combinations that these guys come up with for what is essentially cheese between two slices of bread is inspiring. My favorite is the jalapeno popper but the Black and Blue is also drool worthy. I absolutely adore the champagne vinagrette they use to dress their side salad and their tomato soup is to die for. You can taste the quality of the tomato in each bite; rich, creamy, divine. I go in frequently so I can sample everything on the menu. I can't wait to try The Don. Forget about it...
author: Sam M.

description: Four Stars for the Awesome Kind service. Their offerings are tasty and well crafted. Minus one star because it seemed like they used a tad bit too much butter for my liking.
author: J M.

description: A restaurant with a load of grilled cheese sandwiches.  What more do you need?  Maybe an egg cream, but you're on the wrong coast for that.  A good substitute is the Grilled Cheese Kitchen's homemade soda pop.
author: Lawrence S.

description: fatty ass grilled cheese.  how can you fuck it up?  by giving you an apple with your meal.  wtf?
author: Fatty A.

description: yes. indeed. i believe you can't go wrong with the sandwiches here. i ate a jalepeno popper on which they spread an apricot/jalepeno relish topped with cheese and a couple strips of bacon. it was tasty. i also had a big bite of the mushroom gruyere which had slices of yukon gold potato and was reeeeeally good as well. each sandwich comes with the cutest little baby golden delicious apple.
author: kathryn s.

description:
i work nearby, but there's always a tremendous line--go early. if you go late, they run out of stuff, i'm told. 

we got there at 11:30am on a Tuesday and there was about a 10 minute line. the menu is limited, but everything sounds delicious and it's difficult to choose. i went with the Jalapeno Popper and my lunch date had the Piglet.  both were very good, as was the tomato soup. the side salad and tomato soup both included a little side packet of fresh-toasted croutons, which was a nice touch. the tomato soup was very clearly homemade from real tomatoes. 

however, $9 for a sandwich with no sides is just too much. i know the ingredients are good quality, but that is just ridiculous. the The Red, White and Blue Plate Special (smaller sandwich with a cup of soup or small salad) is $8-9 depending on the sandwich, and is a reasonable value. 

i'd give this 3.5 stars instead of 3 because the tomato soup is really good, but yelp can't do math or something :).
author: dj pie b.

description:
Stopped by this past weekend to check this place out...

Butter up some homemade artisan bread, throw on some good cheese and other ingredients and grill it up...not much can go wrong with that. Unless you burn it, its going to be some kind of delicious.

I'm used to paying San Francisco prices for food. But I guess I was still surprised that two small sandwiches, one small cup of soup and two drinks (one being a $1 bottle of water) was $26. Maybe I shouldn't have been surprised. But it just seemed like a little much for what we got. But whatever...

Hip space. Good location. Friendly service. Solid comfort food. Tons of SOMA residents/workers and Giants fans everywhere. This place should be in business for a while. Worth at least one trip to check it out.
author: Paul P.

description: Very cute outdoor cafe in Soma.  Two great grilled cheese sandwiches for vegetarians and yummy salads too.  Long wait today.
author: Marianne D.

description:
this is my favorite place in the entire world. they have hands down the best grilled cheeses ever. 

i recommend: 
the piglet
the jalapeno popper.

I've actually been here like 3 times, but i'm completely in love. plus they now stay open for giants games :) and they have four dollar beers. who could complain?

also, i know they always post their specials on facebook....including breakfast stuff. i really need to get out to sf in the morning, so i can try some of their delicious looking breakfast biscuits. they look awesome!!!
author: Margaret L.

description: I'm glad I don't work in the area and was just there to catch up with a friend, because otherwise I would gain 20 pounds from eating those delicious, decadent mushroom gruyere sandwiches every day. Soooo good.
author: Ed K.

description: Found this great place on way to Giants game. Had the turkey club and it was awesome. My daughter had Mac and Cheese sandwich which she let me try, but only once. Gets crowded ball game days so allow time. Sandwiches usually come with fresh fruit. Strawberries this time. Cant wait to try the Jalepeno Popper next time.
author: Eric S.

description: Once again, I'd like to reiterate that I dont hand out "5 star reviews" unless they are earned, and trust me, this place earned it. This place has a simple, but good charm to it. The servers, are hipsters, but that just adds to their appeal, as "The New Hipster hangout spot" Every meal comes with a small apple, and a smile, hahaha. But seriously, I order the standard mousetrap with ham and cheese, on artisan bread, a bag of chips, a plum, and a bottle of oso good Squamsco Diet Cola. All together, this food reminds of when Mom would pack a bagged lunch, with everything. They are located in a corner of the city, near the bay bridge. I like to stop here in my way to The Green Door, for lunch, then skate to the club. The food is delicious, the wait staff are always friendly, and open to help you decide meaning that they eat this food as well. They also have a fun delivery service that comes on a fixie, to your office or place of business. I would suggest this place to anyone that likes simple comfort food, and a reasonable price.
author: Matt S.

description: we had our wedding party here a couple weeks ago. we did the city hall thing in the afternoon.  it was FANTASTIC.  they did a buffet of various sandwiches, we had tomato soup shooters and salads.  champagne was flowing all night, as well as a specialty cocktail they made (the chef used to be a bartender) which was amazing (gin, cucumber and mint) and guests could order beer and wine off the menu.  the service was great, we had the place pretty packed but staff was able to get in there and make sure people were fed.  there were always a bunch of full glasses of champagne and gin drinks on the counter, it was easy for people to get a drink, which is key in a large party setting.  we danced till midnight, and had a blast.  many of my guests told me it was the best wedding they'd been to.  mostly because the atmosphere is super fun, and the food is great.  the total price for the event was completely reasonable, for san francisco you can't get a better deal.  nate, who helped coordinate with me was always responsive to emails and really really nice.  it was easy to work with him.  i cannot tell you how awesome the whole experience was!!!!  the AGCK will always hold a special place in my heart.  i feel SO lucky to have found it, and to have spent such a special day in my life celebrating there!!!  i highly recommend it for private parties and hope to hold another one there someday.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Food is good, line is ridiculous along with the price.  Spent $11 on a small grilled cheese, soup, and iced tea.  It's trying to be the next "new thing" with comfort food idea and it's slightly burned croûtons from left over bread.  The tomato soup is very good, but the grilled ham & cheese sandwich was okay.  I would give it a 4th star if it was a better deal and didn't try so hard.
author: Jose R.

description:
The line does not move.

This is inexcusable considering all their sandwiches are prepared in advance (you can see this for yourself, they are stacked up next to the kitchen entrance on the far right, sitting on steel shelves inside an enclosure).

They are either doing this on purpose to make it look like there is a huge demand or they are operationally incompetent.  

Either way, my time is too valuable to stand in a non-moving line for 40+ minutes waiting for a grilled cheese sandwich I could cook at home in 5 minutes.
author: james b.

description: Overall it was a good sandwich but I've had better or equivalent elsewhere for the price of the sandwich.  I ordered the turkey sandwich with no chips or drinks and it was $9.71.  I totally don't think it was worth the money.
author: Mary L.

description: Damn, now that's a grilled cheese! I had the Mouse Trap: Tillamook sharp cheddar, creamy havarti, monterey jack, on artisan sourdough -- I also added bacon. It was perfect. Just freakin' perfect. I also ordered their tomato soup -- ehh, it was alright. A little too ketchup-like for my taste. My friend Ashley P. makes a MUCH more better tomato soup -- trust me. I also had a bite of their Jalapeño Popper grilled cheese: chèvre, monterey jack, applewood-smoked bacon, apricot-jalapeño relish. It was no joke in terms of heat -- BEWARE. It was also a little on the sweet side, obviously due to the apricot in the relish -- something I personally didn't think too much of -- but wow, that heat!! The place was packed but we managed to find a table right away. You order your food, you get a number placard thing (like Carls Jr.) and then they bring the food to you. It took quite a bit of time, but it was worth it (and expected). The price for my sandwich was $7.50 -- not expensive at all. I guess they call it the Mouse Trap for a reason -- 'cause once you have it, YOU'RE STUCK ON IT. HAR HAR GET IT?! No really, go try it. You will moan so loudly, those losers across the street will hear you.
author: Jonny A.

description: Grilled cheese for me is comfort food. I love it so much that at burger joints while my friends are all ordering burgers I'll get myself a grilled cheese sandwich. Came here on a Saturday with a friend and the line was insane due to the fact a Giants game going on. I ordered the mouse trap which consists of cheddar, havarti, monterey jack on sourdough bread. Yum, yum, yum, cripsy yet melty at the same time. It's $6 but trust me this is the kind of grilled cheese sandwich you cannot make at home and expect the same outcome. The only drawback though that it's a bit too greasy. With that said don't feel too guilty all sandwiches come with a side of grapes! The line to order goes by quick but since there were so many people my friend and I waited about 15-20 minutes for our sandwiches. But believe me, it's worth the wait. When you're done with your sandwich you ought to go across the street to 21st Ammendment and grab yo self a watermelon ale!!!!!!! And a word of advice: def come here before any Giants game to grab food; not only will be spending less (cause we all know how much food is at the ballpark) but it'll be delish food as well!
author: selina n.

description: Great service...and even better food!! Congrats Heidi, Nate and the rest of the gang. Best Grilled Cheese EVER!!! The line is worth the wait. =)
author: Sharon M.

description: Had the Turkey Club with Bacon and Tomato Soup. The sandwich was really tasty, but I wish it would have been a bit bigger. Employees were very friendly.
author: Darla D.

description: Cute concept...i love grilled cheese so I had to check this place out.  Went here on a weekday afternoon right before closing so no line (great)! There was also a happy hour cookie special (even better). I loved the menu.  I totally wanted to give this place 4 stars.....however.....I was with my dearest best friend and she is a vegan. And as she usually does she has to get creative with the menu. She ordered the mushroom and cheese and asked if she could add the jalapeño relish (which is what I had on my bacon and cheese).  The cashier asked the kitchen (which right next to the counter - the place is pretty small). And they responded with yes but they wouldn't recommend it because they didn't think it would taste good. They kinda made a big deal about it until they finally agreed to put it on the side.  Thanks for looking out for us but what happened to the customer is always right? I understand if they want to protect the integrity of their sandwich flavor design....if that was the case they should have just said no.  Sandwhiches are pricey for the size but they are tasty.  Need to come back and do an update maybe with some non-veggie, less creative friends :]
author: Lea G.

description: so, i'm updating because i just had to say how amazing the bacon jalapeno mac & cheese was...it just doesn't get any better!
author: Marjie T.

description: love. love. love. i ordered the gruyere grilled cheese with tomato soup, with a glass of dolcetto. love. love. love.  what really makes this place fun is the staff. they were so friendly and charming. i may have been spoiled since i went on a saturday afternoon when the giants were out of town....but cannot wait to get back.
author: Angela N.

description:
walked 20 minutes with a colleague for this. the cheese was perfectly melted and didn't congeal while we ate it and the bread was perfect - perfectly buttery and crispy at the same time, weird to read reviews that it was hard or too buttery, i commented about how perfect it was.  i got the mushroom Gruyere which was perfectly done but next time i'm totally getting the jalapeno popper which is what my friend got. 

the house made soda was perfectly refreshing. 

can't wait to go back.
author: r m.

description: We were excited to find another place in the city that had gluten-free options.  We ordered the mushroom Gruyere since it sounded so appetizing.  After an agonizingly long wait for take out (20 minutes), we received an over-cooked sandwich with barely any filling, and hardly any flavor.  Too bad, as there are so few options for a quick bite, outside of pizza, for the casual gluten-free eating.  May have been a bad day (it certainly was busy on a Sunday afternoon), so may try it again the future, but certainly wouldn't go out of my way for an amazingly over-priced, over-cooked, under filled sandwich and mediocre service.
author: Bob B.

description: Their food is very good, but their prices and particularly their service is pathetic.  25 minutes wait for half a grilled cheese sandwich and a bowl of soup? And for $9.00.  After 15 mins I said I needed it to go, and they said it was on the grill and would be 5 mins.  10 mins later, no sandwich and I had to leave.  Guy said sorry, it's their busiest time of day.  I wanted to say, my friend you serve sandwiches and it's noon, of course it's busy.  It's also busy because everyone's waiting way to long to get their meal.  Sorry guys, but on to the next lunch place.
author: Matt M.

description:
Mushroom Gruyere was so good - hot off the grill, tangy and sweet, and they added sliced golden potatoes and carmelized onions and I think rosemary which tasted complex, yet comforting.  We arrived at 11:45 and were eating by about 12:10, not bad at all for their 4th or 5th day in business.  We took a number, and had our food delivered to us.  The sandwiches were hot when they arrived, which is key.  The pickles were amazing, something very interesting going on with the pickling seasonings which gave them a great spiciness.  
My friend had the jalapeno popper and loved it.  And the clementines on the side are great way to end the somewhat rich meal.  I've read some of the reviews complaining of "greasiness," but this is grilled cheese folks!  Of course it's going to leave your fingers a tad buttery.  Also tasted some baked goods which were being carried around by the staff - special attention paid to the younger kids in line was cute.  I also dig the outdoor seating and the interior decor is awesome.
I'll definitely be back!!
author: Laura H.

description: I first attempted to drop in this past Wednesday.  When I drove by, I noticed that the line was out the door and wrapped down the street, so I kept driving and figured I'd come again another day. So today, I took an early lunch and got in line at around 11:30.  This time there were only about 30 people ahead of me.  The line moved fairly quick in comparison to the amount of people waiting in line.  From the time we got in line till the time we ordered was about 40 min.  Then tack on another 15 min till our order was served.  I had the "piglet" aka grilled ham and cheese. I highly recommend the Passionfruit Lemonade.  Nice and tart.  Too bad they ran out of homemade pickles...was looking forward to that one. Overall the sandwich was tasty but a bit too oily for my taste buds.  Which is interesting because it appears that all of their sandwiches are baked.  Be prepared to order "take-out"  as there's very limited seating available. We lucked out that the bar opened up just as we were walking over.
author: Stacey L.

description: This place is delicious and you can pair your sandwich with a soup to lighten things up if you want. My two favorites are the Mouse Trap and the Mouse Trap with bacon. Little bit of a wait but totally worth it!
author: Leah L.

description: This is the first time that I've paid $8 for a grilled cheese sandwich. It is tasty, but they should throw in a soup for that price.
author: Ben W.

description: It seemed silly to me to go out for grilled cheese, but this place is legit. Lots of great choices, things that you wouldn't have on hand at home. Plus, it's just a block from my house! They use quality ingredients and service is fast. Seating can sometimes be a problem, at least when it's not nice enough to sit outside, but since people eat pretty fast, it's not long before something opens up. I love the fun cheese-inspired puns written on the board as well.
author: Lauren M.

description: Big dense slabs of toasty cheesy deliciousness. Eat half of one sando and take the other half in for dinner at the ballpark. Not the cheapest but the ingredients are high-quality, and my friend liked that they had gluten-free bread too. I had mushroom gruyere and my friends had the japaleno. They included a delicious fresh clementine in the box with our sandwiches.
author: Aileen T.

description: The mushroom-gruyere-potato-thyme grilled sandwich is awesome.  The pickles you can get on the side (house made?) are lovely.  The "little green salad" is great - shouldn't be as hard as it is to get a decent green salad, but for whatever reasons, so many places can't produce.  Theirs was pristine and fresh.  If you're looking for adventure, the Mousetrap probably isn't for you, but for what it is (a slight variation on a simple classic), it's great.
author: Marie M.

description: Loved this little restaurant.  Had to stand in line for awhile but it was a nice day.  My friend and I both got the mousetrap and loved it.  We are already trying to plan another visit.  (It's worth the bus ride)
author: Nancy S.

description: Absolutely the best grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had. We went to San Francisco for the weekend from L.A. and were so pleased to learn that they bake their own gluten free bread. I wish more restaurants took that into consideration when one of your travelling companions has celiac disease. Not only was the basic grilled cheese on sourdough amazing, the gluten free bread grilled cheese sandwich was outstanding as well. Thank you American Grilled Cheese Kitchen for understanding the needs of those GF diners who love grilled cheese. We will be back!
author: Christine R.

description: We were honored to have Nate cater for us all the way down in Santa Cruz.  He was professional, personable and provided fabulous fare single-handedly.  The food was delicious and our guests were impressed with this unique menu of comfort food.
author: Susan K.

description: I had such high expectations for this place, but it fell short on our first visit. My wife got the mousetrap and I got the Jalapeno popper. Mine would have been pretty tasty if it weren't burnt to a crisp and so dry it was practically unedible. You would think the cheddar cheese would have melted cuz it was so overcooked but it didn't, which made the sandwich kinda gross. My wifes mousetrap was cooked perfectly and really good. The soup came out cold so we had to ask them to heat it up. We also ordered 2 ice teas at the register and asked if they had any lemon for the teas and the girl just "no". Okay? It's hard to believe a place that serves food and ice tea doesn't have lemon, and I'm sure we aren't the first ones to ask this (hint). I don't know, maybe this all happened because we came in at 4:30 when they close at 5:00.... But the prices were the final verdict for this 3 star review. We spent $25 on 2 sandwiches soup and drinks. Overall I can tell this place makes good food so I'm sure we'll come back. Maybe next time my experience will be better in which case I would gladly give it 4 stars.
author: Nate G.

description: After my first visit to this place, I was left with a bitter taste in my mouth, and it wasn't the tangerines they tactfully include with every overpriced sando.  I will admit, the sando was tasty, cooked to perfection, and everything I would want in a grilled cheese sandwich.  However, the other amenities of this place made me feel like a stripper in Larry Flints pulled a fast one and swiped that $20 spot right out of my pocket.  From their cost saving beers on tap, to their mindless tomato soup which is likely marked up 300%, to the tacky inclusion of a tangerine to make you feel like you are actually getting more than just a grilled cheese sando, I'm over this place.  It finally all makes sense though. To operate such a place whose kitchen is comprised of 4 guys laboring over a Betty Crocker size oven, which turns out six or seven sandos every 15 minutes, plus the two additional servers/cashiers, requires such markups on staple items such as crappy beer, bread, tomato soup, and cheese.  This place has survived on its prime location, and appeal to SF foodies that want to check off a box from the best of the best list in 7x7.  Can me bitter, negative, but come on people, it's just a grilled cheese sandwich.   I'm over places that try to glorify ingredients as if they are better than they really are.  My buddy Marvin used to make grilled cheese sandos in a toaster in 2 minutes. Let me know when its BYOB and ill come enjoy the patio before a game.
author: Keith B.

description: I luckily headed here on a rainy day so there wasn't much of a line. I thought the staff was friendly. I ordered the Mushroom & Gruyere Grilled Cheese sandwich minus the potato's. I thought the sandwich was good but  a bit greasy. I also was a bit disenchanted with having an apple thrown into my food basket as if I was in elementary school. I think they could have found a better side for the dish. I was although satisfied with my sandwich and loved drinking it down with a root beer.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: Great service. Friendly staff greet me kindly when I arrive. Good food. When I had to step out of the line for a moment after saying my order, the cook remembered my order when I got back in line.
author: Rich S.

description: This place had the SOMA vibe at lunch with lines out the door of coders donning black t-shirts.  If they added an atari out front I'm sure the lines would get longer.  The food delivery is faster than the ordering process - not sure who designed the place, or if they have the right people working the register, but a little design help could improve the speed of getting people through the lunch rush.  I had the Piglet, which is an expensive hot ham and cheese, but there was enough original-ness to make it a delightful sandwich, owning mostly to a rosemary butter covering the delicious bread.  I did notice that they do gluten free bread for 50 cents extra - very cool, but I'm not sure you should charge people extra for having allergies.  Anyway, I also tried the jalapeno popper, which tastes just like the real thing with a creamy chevre on top.  One delight on the menu is the fresh sodas available, that probably change with some frequency.  Today's was a very tasty ginger mint.  I'm dying to try the butterscotch blondie when I can spare a few hundred more calories
author: Michael C.

description: Great food.  Fun atmosphere.  Friendly staff.
author: Deena F.

description: Whenever I'm craving a hot sandwich in the area, I walk here.  True, their prices are a little high for a "grilled cheese", but you have to really get past that and realize these are "gourmet" - top ingredients, hot food, fresh.  It's a great place for to indulge for lunch.
author: Gina R.

description: It was a good grilled cheese sandwich, yes.  But not worth $8. The staff was as unfriendly as they could be--acted like they were really annoyed that we customers were there "bothering" them.
author: el G.

description: Pretty tasty sandwiches, soup, and baked goods, but a bit pricy and sometimes way too long a line for what you get.
author: Albert C.

description: First time trying this place. I often walk by and see a line wrapped around the patio. I love grilled cheese sandwiches and definitely recommend going here. Its small on the inside but if its a nice day, great to eat out on the patio. I ordered the mousetrap with bacon and roasted tomato. It came with a perfectly small apple. Delicious. The daily soup was baked potato and not heavy at all. Very nice. I got a pickle as a side for $1.50 but not worth the value or taste. I highly recommend getting there before noon or it'll be at least a 20 min wait.
author: kelly y.

description: As someone who tries (and often fails) to limit my cheese intake, I can assure this place is totally worth the splurge.  My friend and I split the jalapeno popper and the mushroom gruyere sandwiches and both were amazing.  The mushroom had a delicious but milder flavor with the potatoes adding wonderful texture.  Only complaint is that I couldn't taste the thyme butter it advertised.  The jalapeno popper was incredibly flavorful with the right amount of spice and it was the general consensus of the table that it was the best sandwich.  My other friend enjoyed his piglet sandwich, but I didn't taste it, and my other friend was underwhelmed by the turkey club (also didn't taste for myself).  We all shared a tomato soup, which was delicious and perfect for sandwich dipping--not too creamy or watery with a wonderful roasted tomato flavor.  The lemonade was also amazing--very tart and lemony!  The portion sizes were right on (I couldn't quite finish a full sandwich) and I really liked that it came with an apple on the side instead of fries or chips (an apple totally justifies an indulgent grilled cheese right?).  Only gripes were the limited seating outside (while we got a table, I could see other diners frantically stalking to snag one once it opened up) and they took nearly 20 minutes to deliver one of our friend's sandwiches.  As an out-of-towner, this will be my go-to quick lunch spot for future SF visits.
author: Caitlin T.

description: Love this place. My fave: the cheddar-bacon buiscuit (part of the daily-changing menu of breakfast goods. But if it's in rotation when you go, get it) and the club sandwich.
author: Jaime P.

description: Very delish!  Try the jalapeno popper.  The bread has the right amount of crunchiness and the combination of sweet and spicy is sure to hit the spot.  The inside decor is really cute and there are tables and chairs outside.  There are homemade sodas with interesting flavors like grapefruit and black cherry.  They have specials that aren't on the menu like the Hawaiian with pineapple.  Love this place although $10 is a lot for a grilled cheese sandwich.  I would still go back again to try a different flavor!   Go at 1 or later to avoid the long lines.
author: Hannah L.

description: this place is ok nothing crazy special. and one thing its pretty damn expensive and long wait for some grilled cheese. it is way over hyped. i went once and never went back since its nothing special that i would crave for.
author: Art N.

description:
good stuff. 

jalapeno popper is great, mushroom gruyere is okay. tomato soup was okay. 

vanilla ginger-mint soda was really gross, but i guess i was warned by the dude at the counter - it was cold out, and grapefruit pepper didn't seem appropriate (but sounds a lot tastier)

the line has finally died down a bit since the circus when it opened, and it seems like a happy group of hard working cheese folks.
author: Wangston P.

description: i am obsessed with this place. great quick lunch, cooked perfectly, the best savory meal for lunch. and i don't even usually like grilled cheeses!
author: Jean C.

description: Coming here has given me a new appreciation for cheese.  Whoever invented it should surely be given a Nobel Prize.  Perhaps this has already been done.  The person who came up with the idea of grilled cheese should also get one, and undoubtedly the creators of this restaurant will get theirs in due course.   I came here for a late lunch yesterday and was swept away by the Mousetrap with bacon and grilled tomatoes added.  Served on perfectly grilled and buttered slices of levain, the three cheeses were a luxurious blend, and contrary to expectations the sandwich had a certain lightness to it, not too dense and gooey, especially when washed down with a glass of Reisling. .  To confirm the experience I returned for breakfast today and had the Basic Breakfast sandwich, again with bacon added.  I'm not much of a breakfast fan but this was something that could easily get my day off to a good start.  No Reisling for breakfast, but the coffee was really good.
author: David T.

description: i have been following this place way before they opened. ever since i found out that they'd participated in the grilled cheese contest in LA, i'd been checking up on them to see when i could try the goods. but i didn't make it over to American Grilled Cheese Kitchen until yesterday, the hottest day of the year. and when you have grilled cheese it's pretty customary that you order tomato soup, isn't it? so i idiotically went ahead and did so, not taking into consideration that i was ALREADY sweating up a storm just getting out of my air conditioned car and walking across the street. nonetheless i drank heat.  the tomato soup wasn't anything special, although i like that they give you a little bag of homemade croutons. the "jalapeno popper" sandwich with chevre, monterey jack, applewood smoked bacon and apricot jalapeno relish was inventive but i could have done without the apricots. it was still a great sandwich, but next time i think i'll order the mushroom.
author: Regina C.
